after hearing so much hype about the pink's in la, i could not wait to finally try their famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> when i was in vegas. the line, was what i expected it to be.. long. what made the wait seem 10x longer was the fact that the actual place is so small that once about 5 people are inside, the rest of the line is waiting outside in the scorching heat. in a way i was glad that there was a line so that my party and i would have time to browse the menu. i also noticed their had a few special celebrity <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, which certain celebrities conned, obviously. there were <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> by holly madison and kim kardashian, and a few others too. after a few minutes, i decided on the swiss mushroom <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, which was a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, mayo, and of course, mushrooms. my mom got the chili cheese and <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> while my dad played it safer with just the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. i must say that i was definitely not impressed with any of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> we ordered. i am a fan of mayo but the amount of mayo on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was just way too much for my liking. the mushrooms were almost flavorless and the cheese was not even melted; it was as if it was just placed on top of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for decoration. although my parents' chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were pretty similar, besides the bacon on my mom's, they were nothing special at all. i think i would have enjoyed a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from top dog in berkeley or even a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> from wienerschnitzel.. would have saved us a few dollars, too. i don't know about ya'll but $7-8 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> topped with basic kitchen ingredients just doesn't seem right. maybe the la location is better? but will i ever know? nope, because i doubt i'll go outta my way to try another one of their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

pinks was okay...my cousins and i went during the winter time so you can imagine how cold it was. i did not like the fact that the heater thingy's were not working. 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were okay i ordered the mushroom swiss <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> which was okay, i think if they used fresh mushrooms it would of made it much better, but mushrooms from a can umm i think not. on the bright side it is enough to share since it is a pretty big <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my bf on the other hand ordered the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, he liked it. the prices though are just a little bit overboard, i think costco or sam's club for $1.50 is probably way better and a medium drink is included! you are talking about $7 to $8 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>/ <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. better yet you can actually just buy a good pack of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and make it anyway you want it.

date/time: sunday ~ 1:30pm
occasion: lunch
party of:  taken to-go
ordered: their version of the "mulholland drive" dog - 12" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, and mushrooms
location: super small, outdoor seating only so it's deadly during the summer, very clean
total incl gratuity: ~$8.00 per <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>

omigoodness!  could it get any more unhealthy?  i ate a 12" long sausage with every possible fattening topping but it was so worth it!  to top it off, we had friends pick it up and bring it poolside to us so there we were eating a 12" weener that was probably a day's worth of calories in our bikinis...so sexy huh? ;)  but again...oh so good.  pinks is very good...a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with any which kind of topping you can imagine.  all of the toppings are fresh and make the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> so tasty.  i've heard from quite a few people that the la one is so much better so i'll have to make my way down there and try theirs soon.  but this one did it's job and satisfied our tummies! mmmm....<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>....

i was excited to hear that las vegas was going to have a pink's. i went with my sister to check it out. we are pretty familiar with planet hollywood, but pink's is really hard to find. it's not on any of the signs in the casino. we asked the ph concierge and she informed us that it was outside.

i ordered <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> with a veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i really enjoyed it. it was messy to it but that didn't bother me. it was a little expensive. $24 for two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and one drink. the high prices are expected for the strip.

the seating area is pretty small. i would imagine it to be very hard to find a spot at times. also the only outdoor seating has to be rough with the unpredictable weather here.

overall, its a great place to check out.

if you've ever been to the original pink's in los angeles, ca you'll definitely be let down by this location. while a great substitute for when you're not in la it just isn't the same experience.

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and whatnot are made away from view and there generally aren't any lines for this place.this seems be a more commercialized version of the la location. there aren't random signs displaying crazy variations of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you can get such as "the today show" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

we came here because it was the closest thing resembling food in sight (i'm guessing this is probably the standard place to eat for drunk people walking by).

i ordered <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and it was humongous and loaded with bacon, onions, relish, mustard, and sauerkraut.   i could barely find the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> underneath the mess of condiments, and i had to use a fork to fish for it.  

i definitely wasn't blown away by this place, and i think the idea of having a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with so much crap on it is just a little too much for me.  i prefer the classic chicago <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> myself :9

wanting for many years to visit the hollywood location, i jumped at the chance to finally taste one of these famous dogs albeit in the planet hollywood in las vegas. it probably isn't the same experience, but hey, it was a pretty good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it's located right on the strip, outside of the planet hollywood hotel and casino. there is a gated off area outside to sit and eat that is cooled by mist fans. it was still hot, but i was enjoying my dog too much to care.

i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. it was a mouth watering experience with the popping <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> casing, to the beefy flavor, the addition of chili, and the paramount additive that is crispy bacon. the crusty sweet <mark>Onion Ring</mark> put it all over the top. honestly on this trip, this was probably the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i had. the other being from nathan's in ny ny (http://www.yelp.com/biz/nathans-famous-hot-dogs-las-vegas), but i'm sure it was a result of the fashion in which it was prepared (i.e. griddle which is best vs hot rollers).

yeah, i didn't see any hollywood stars but who cares. i was there for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was really good.

giving this spot 4 stars would only be submitting to the hype. i liked it...don't get me wrong, but it didn't really give me a foodgasm. wifey ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and i ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>. <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> consisted of dos dogs, guac, mustard, cheese, onions, a mound of chili and topped w/ 'penos all stuffed in a single bun. good stuff, but a little over the top. we were both satisfied, but not in a craving way. the thing that stood out the most was the snap and the juiciness as you bite into the "pink" weiner (that doesn't sound right, but oh well... ). 

for the crazy decked out <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> experience alone...it's worth it! good luck figuring out how to eat one of these monstrosities.

i've been here twice now (the second time hoping that it would be better) but of course, it wasn't any better the second time around. firstly, the pink's in la is wayyyyy better. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were semi-cold. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was only decent. i ordered the mushroom swiss and the mushrooms were rubbery and cold. the second time i ordered the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (?) it was much better but still only ok. overall, don't expect la pink's quality and if there is a huge line, it's definitely not worth the wait.

definitely not the same as the original. i knew it wasn't going to be as good since there was hardly a line compared to the one in la which is about a mile long. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> seemed smaller and the buns were hard. the chili was a little bland too. i was a little disappointed.

nothing really to rave about. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are really big, which should be expected with its price tag. seating is pretty limited, which sucks when its crowded or hot. 

if you are trying this place for the first time, don't wait in the long lines. i definitely don't think this place is worth the wait.

i love pink's anywhere it goes! this however felt like a cleaner, less greasy, less 50-plus old <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint. although i do like that feeling, nothing beats the feeling of the original place.

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are the same, except they have some different ones here i don't think i've seen. i stuck to what i know, which was the <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>. it's still delicious. 

this location is definitely vegas-ed up. meaning, it's got those super cool daquiri cups in many large sizes and it has a lot of outdoor seating with water fans going on constantly. the line and wait here isn't as long as it'd be in la, so i'd have to say that is a plus, especially since you're waiting in 100 degree heat for some <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

if you're ever in vegas, i say visit. but if you're looking to experience the original, check out la.
a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place... with no <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>?!?!?!? what a disgrace!

was walking the strip when i saw this place. "ohh pinks! that's that famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> spot in la where all the celebrities go and people line up for 2 hours to get a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!" situated right in front of planet hollywood, i knew i just to get one of those wonderful meats encased in tube form, as anthony bourdain would say...lol. the place itself is really small, you order, slide down to the left to pick up your food, and there's an outdor patio where you can eat. there's a quite extensive menu including not only <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but burgers as well and a myriad of toppings...the most familiar being chili and cheese to the exotic of avocado and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>. i went with the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, onions, cheese, and bacon. it was hearty and delicious. a lil pricey at around $8 but i think it was worth it....will definitely be checking out other menu offerings the next time i'm in vegas!
not as good as the one in hollywood, but it is still good in it's own way! lots of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> choices - you pretty much can't go wrong!

we went to las vegas for my 30th birthday bash and my sister told me they had a pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> there in vegas like da one in hollywood and so i had to try one before i left....my friend, husband and i were on a mission to find it...we asked security at the new york new york hotel where pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was at and he directed us to hard rock hotel...so we take a cab to the hotel we get there...only to find out that its pink's tacos and not <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>...i was soo pissed but i still wanted to get there! we take a cab back n the guy tells us its right on the strip by planet hollywood lol....that made me more mad! so we get to pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> finally at 2am! i order the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which has 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on one bun, chili, cheese, <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, avocado, onions, jalape\u00f1os mustard n keptchup! omg it was delish! i love how da <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a crunch sorta like a hot link....my husbands <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was delish too! 

overall it was delish just like i had imagined! love me some pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i will most def come here again when i am in vegas!

with all the hype back in cali about pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it was sort of weird to see that there is absolutely no ridiculous line to get myself a <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> complete with all the trimmings.  as a fellow chicago-ian, i'd say i've had my fair share of <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> and you know a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> isn't good unless you have the right condiments/toppings to go with your dog. 

 i thought the vegas version of pink's was much more weak than the original location mainly because it feels absolutely cramped inside and you'll probably feel guilty for blocking the entrance trying to decide which <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you want. once my bf finished holding up the line trying to find the right combination for his <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, we placed our order and got it within 5 minutes.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were pretty average and they loaded it up with tons of toppings which is nice, but my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was missing out on a ton of ingredients that defines a chi-town dog. what happened to the onions, tomatoes, and mustard on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pink's!? instead i got lettuce, relish and a pickle. i'm hoping this was some sort of mistake, nonetheless we ate our food and and went on our way.

sooo walking down the strip at 3 in the afternoon drunk off our asses not even 3 hours after landing, 2 friends and myself stumbled across pinks and decided to grab a bite and just sit down for a bit. i had seen and heard of the pinks in la, but never had the chance to wait and stand in the long line. the one in vegas, however, had no line whatsoever, but now i know why. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and when i got the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, the bun was a little too small for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. the bread was already soggy from the chili and it had a little too much oil dripping everywhere. to be honest, i kind of think pinks is overhyped, but maybe the one in la is alot better...i think i'll just stick to costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

you want a review of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? you came to the right girl.

some people grow out of eating <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. not this girl. my love f<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> has grown only stronger with age. i just see <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i'm hungry. i pass by vendors, and i have to stop. doesn't even matter if i've just eaten a three course meal and my jeans are unbuttoned. i will never pass up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. steamed, boiled, fried, or grilled.

so imagine me, in vegas, a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place attached to the front of my hotel! how superfrikkinexciting. i'm all by my lonesome, just the way i like it, and i am starving!

pink's is where my tired feet carry me. i take my place in the ever growing line outside <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. the smell is fantastic. i am like a little kid hopping from foot to foot, trying to look over me and determine my wait time.

evidently, a few people ahead of me a woman is struggling with what kind of dog to order. c'mon, lady! i'm withering away here!

i get close enough to check the menu and now have to decide between a regular dog with some mustard, or a specialty dog. the list is massive. how many ways can you tweak a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. now i am seeing there are many! 

i order a specialty. hell, i am in vegas. go big or go home. a <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>. fries. and a soda.

i wait five minutes and whoot! number 80 is called. that's me! i sit down at the one table that's open, still dirty from the previous diner. i unwrap this massive thing, and take a huge bite. bleh!

it felt like i was biting through a rubber dog drenched in chili. and through the rubber <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> wasn't very tasteful. if you've ever over-boiled a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you know the flavor i speak of. it's like cooking the flavor right out. i choked down half of it. after all, i was starving and needed to eat some of my money's worth. but half is all i got through. and i am a woman who can eat quite a few dogs in one sitting. the rest got tossed.

las vegas needs a few <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> vendors on the street.

strangely enough, i didn't come here for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, as my friend and i were lured by the huge plastic cup that was about a yard long.  we filled it up with some pink lemonade and vodka and proceeded to go to town with it.

i also picked up some chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> which were sufficient enough to hold the vodka we were drinking for the rest of the night.

i should try the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> next time, though.

no big deal is all i can really say. 

pink's looked pretty busy and happening, and its menu sounded mouthwatering. its multiple "celebrity" endorsements and "new" <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> sold me, and $7-something later i was settling down with a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> piled with swiss and sauerkraut. 

it was the perfect <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> - for a 5-year-old. i don't know what i was expecting but it certainly wasn't a rubbery boiled <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stuck in a web of gooey melted processed swiss, sandwiched inside a cloudlike wonderbread style bun. it was all right, but completely lacking in sophistication. generous on the sauerkraut, though, i will give them that. 

i doubt i'll be revisiting pink's anytime soon - not with so many other options for quick bites crowding the strip and vying for my money.

i don't meat, but i still came here. really, i don't miss eating meat, but i do miss a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> + bun combo! so we came here, also because of the cheap prices. 

ended up getting the only veggie option - <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. was cooked to order, but pretty good - got tomatoes, ketchup, mustard, lettuce for my toppings. only downside was that the bread was a bit too flimsy for my liking - when i eat a dog, i want some solid bread that can withstand any amount of toppings! costed about $6 or so. i'd like to know what it was made out of, actually... texture-wise, it was very <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

bummer that <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> don't come with a side... and i wasn't about to spend $4 just to have some <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. but a friend did get the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which they described as covered with "low grade meat" but delicious "once you're drunk enough." speaking of drunk - on the weekends they are open late - about 3 am or so - so a perfect place for the drunk munchies! 

what else? $20 for a bucket of 5 beers, you mix and match.

this place is ridiculous. 

my boyfriend and i usually order this, then take it to the mall or to our hotel room and eat it there, because the outdoor seating is sooooo gross and it tends to be windy. 

i love their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. one order of these, and i'm set for that meal. but i always feel the need to get their dogs too! i feel like i can't win! chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> or a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, oh the dilemma. i get into a mini panic attack because i can't choose. and then i end up getting both, and regret eating whatever i had eaten first, because now i can't eat as much as i could of the second one.

you get to order and receive your order fairly quickly. makes it hard to make a decision, and you end up making really stupid ones like ordering way more than you can eat because you don't want to hold up the line, but you can't decide between <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> or the fries or the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. 

i'm glad i don't live near one of these. i would visit it every day.

as someone who grew up going to the original pinks in la and standing in line for an hr waiting for the most delicious <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> ever i was excited to find out there was a pinks in vegas... i was so excited that it was one of the first stops i made when i visited. then i had the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it was horrible!!! every one who has never had the original please do not think that this is what it is like! the one in vegas seems as if the chili is out of a can and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are not as good and the bun wasnt warmed up and the fries werent seasoned fries and the ranch was very liquidy and the bacon was limp and not crispy at all. i was very disappointed!!!! but as soon as i got back to la i went to pinks and regained my love for their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.... but i will never ever go back to the one in vegas... so not worth the money =/

this place was pretty good.  really expensive for two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, one order or fries and two beers but we were really anxious to try pinks since we had heard so much about it. i would probably go back but there are many other restaurants in vegas i want to try first!

this place is the shizzle!  i was craving a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> especially after drinking a yard stick from fat tuesday.  so my friends and i head over here and to my surprise, there were only 4 people in line!  
my friend tells me the kim kardashian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> looks good and she was right!  the kim kardashian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with cheese, bacon and mushrooms.  ohh my gawd!  it was frickin awesome!   the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was juicy with nice snap.  the bacon was off the hook.  and the cheese just enough to get everything wet.  
now in my drunk state of mind, i'm thinking i can eat like a champ, so i also order a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with no mustard and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>!  what the heck was i thinking!  thank god my friends were there to eat half my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and half the fries.  
either way, everything they had was sooo good!  definitely coming back here next time i'm in vegas.

we stopped at pinks to grab a quick bite and a much needed adult beverage. i got <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a huge margarita in a huge pink <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> cup 42oz i believe. the rings were fab. really big order for a small price. now that margarita was no joke!!! can u say over pour......not that its a bad thing......we sat outside an people watched while we caught a nice lil buzz. good times w the girls!

all i have to say is i would come here for just the bacon. it is so freaking good. i of course got <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> that would come with the most bacon. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good but the bacon was the best part. i think i might have clogged up my arteries just a little bit after eating that <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.
the location is cool because it's right in front of the strip and you can sit and just look at the strip, but it's not fun to be sitting out there when it's super windy and hot. service was good and quick. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were pretty awesome too!

the bf had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and i had <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. both dogs were filled w toppings, which is good but hard to  just pick up and eat. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were good but nothing spectacular. pretty much can make at home w your fav <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and whatever toppings you desire! 

customer service: was ok. the employees weren't very upbeat and while we were eating at the patio, an employee sprayed a cleaner onto a rag right next to us while we were eating and i felt the mist . very unprofessional and gross!

<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> heaven!  

great place to grab a bite to eat and people watch!  they have a ton of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> options and pink's is located at the front of planet hollywood so you can see all the people traffic that walk by. 

a lot of great options on the menu, but make sure you take a look at the specials not on the menu board too.  they have a bunch of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> named after celebrities that are definitely worth a look at.  you can't really go wrong with anything on the menu, all my friends and i ordered something different because all the options sound really good!

note: if you're looking for a none alcoholic slushy beverage similar to fat tuesdays, they have them here!  i went here with a pregnant friend of mine and she was jealous that we all had our slushy fat tuesday and was so happy to find out that this place had virgin slushy drinks!

i've been to the orginal pink's in hollywood and expected the same. the original pink's tasted better but i'd choose this anyday over costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the line is extremely short (5 people) in comparison to hollywood (50 people in line). it did look a lot cleaner and more chain like than other locations. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> came out looking like it should with an overflow of toppings and condiments. however, the quality of the actual food wasn't appetizing as it should have been. the bread was soggy and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wasn't as plump and tasty. the seating area was suffice enough at the time to accomadate everyone there since most people would just come and go. and actually might have tasted really good if you coudn't think of anything else to grab. it just doesn't compare to the original.

i never got to go to the one in la... but anyway, they have <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>!  haha, the pink lemonade slushie was pretty good (a little too sweet though).  they  have a lot of toppings (my boyfriend got sausage with chili and i don't remember what else but it looked insane and insanely good) and they are famous in la... sorry, can't give too much insight because i kind of like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> haha.  3.5!

lame....

as a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> connoisseur, i was pissed that i came here. mainly because it's hyped up so much and did not deliver in the slightest. 

compared to capital dawg in sacramento, i was not impressed. 

i ordered a dog with pastrami and mustard. the mustard was all i tasted and the pastrami was weak and hell. no salty goodness, just sliced meat with no flavor. 

what a bummer. guess i've got to stick to capital dawg and costco to get my fixes!
this place is overrated. service was horrible, food was cold. would rather have boiled <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. stay away!
solid <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! the bacon chili chees dog will satisfy. i should go to the iconic location in la to see what the fuss is about

still not an all-around <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan. still a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> lover. and yes, the chili-<mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are still like heaven to me this last time around.

had heard so much about pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, so decided to get one for lunch today below my hotel at planet hollywood on the las vegas strip.  after eating there, i checked the reviews and was amazed to find some positive statements.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were thin footlong dogs, just boiled to heat them up.  what little flavor it had was quite bad.  the fries didn't have a bad taste, they had no flavor at all-  neither offensive or enjoyable.  prices were typical vegas, which is to say high, the food quality was poor.  i have been struggling to get the flavor, such that it was, out of my mouth for the last 20 mins.  not at all what i expected and an utter disappointment.  i want to be reasonable but just can't find a basis to even give pinks two stars.  stay away and your wallet and stomach won't have to pay as i have.

i gave it four stars because well, i'm not a huge fan of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> anyway. husband however loves them. while i didn't think the actual flavor of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was anything to rave about...but the skin snapping on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, even drenched in the quite tasty chili, that was nice.
the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were well worth the calories (and sadly, stomachache that followed from eating too much!)...and the service was super fast and friendly. i like the outside seating, especially with the big heaters to offset the chilly vegas evening.

let me just start out by saying this... i am not a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> person, in general.  i have to be in the right mood, in the right frame of mind, otherwise i think they taste gross.
i loved my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at pink's and would go back today were in possible.  i got the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark> with <mark>Sour Cream</mark> (it's ok, it was good!) and my husband got the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> which was just about as insane as it sounds, but he loved it.  (what? a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in a tortilla?? they did it!)

i have to give them three stars based on the following:
1. i dont usually like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i enjoyed my experience and would def go back
2. originality in both names, flavors, various types of dogs and condiments

since this place is also pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i believe i have the right to compare it to the original pinks in la, which would probably laugh at this place.

i was so excited when i hear ph was opening a pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i was even more excited when i got to the place and saw that there was almost no line to wait in. in la i had to wait in line for over an hour just to get a delicious dog. however, i was very disappointed when i got to their menu.

this pinks is nothing compared to the la pinks. the selection pretty much sucks. i could make these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at home in my kitchen <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> the street at 7-11 for a lot cheaper. just because everything is piled on high, doesn't mean it's any good. 

there aren't even many side orders or any additional toppings from what i see on the menus. what kind of place is this!? you should be able to create your own monster or pick something incredible off of the menu, but you can't. even the fries are boring. you can get better fries at any mexican fast food joint. 

no wonder this place barely has a line whenever i pass by. the staff at the la pinks should come by and teach them a thing or two before this place goes out of business.

after working up an appetite wandering up and down the strip and in the planet hollywood shops, my friends and i decided pinks would be the perfect place to grab a quick lunch. coincidently, we also happened to each be wearing pink (not planned!) so it seemed even more fitting. 

i ordered the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mushrooms and swiss. my friend ordered a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and another ordered the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. we also ordered a side of fries and rings to share. 

food came out quickly and i thought my dog was delicious. the fries were good but got cold quickly...most likely because it was cold outside where we were sitting, but still. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were ginormous and tasty. 

lunch came out to a bit under $10 per person which i don't think is bad. i would come back.

pink's, i don't know how you seduced me, but you did. 

a small group of us stopped here because we were hungry and have heard people rave about this place. i was feeling brave and got the chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> burrito with two dogs, chili and cheese wrapped in a tortilla. it did the trick for a drunken evening, but man talk about super upset stomach! maybe if i ever ate there again i should just try the basic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

what more could i ask for? <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> mmmm. chili mmmmm. crispy fries mmmmm. and piled high with all its glory oozing out of the now invisible boat it comes in- awesome.  oh i also had a side of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> which was damn good.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are just okay to me.

they have about 20 different <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> combos. i ended up ordering two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and a side of chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. i must say the chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are the best i've ever had. next time i'm visiting vegas, i'm definitely getting their chilli fries. other then that, i wouldn't get all excited over the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. they taste like any other <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with more of a selection of toppings. i don't see anything special with that. their actual shop is tiny and the walk way is very narrow. the seating area has about 15 or less tables, so if you came at a busy time, good luck sitting.

one star for the quick service

two stars for thie great tasting chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.

overpriced for what you get... i don't see what the hype is all about. i've always heard stories about the pink's down in la and how the line is crazy long, but it was pretty empty here.

they were pretty messy to eat, as they had veggies and goodies piled on top of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. i ordered the mushroom swiss <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but was not impressed... the cheese was gross!

i've heard a lot about this place and i think i was expecting too much from the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. honestly, they didn't taste special to me at all. it was a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but definitely not worth the hype. we ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which came with 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, guacamole, jalapenos, chili cheese, mustard and onions. we also got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which was a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> that came with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushroom, bacon and cheese. both tasted decent. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were mediocre. it was worth a shot but i don't plan on visiting this place again.

pink's is nothing special, but they're good. i like the wide variety of toppings. c'mon, it's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! i didn't expect a mind-blowing experience.

it's just a place you have to stop by when you're in vegas, especially when you're drunk and/or wanting a cheap and quick bite.  they're cheap considering the area.

i knew i should've trusted fellow yelpers. even though pink's didn't get very good reviews i still went there and tried one of their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. we tried their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and were very disappointed. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had no flavor at all. it tasted like nothing, if that's even possible. the chili was just okay. nothing that would enhance <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>'s flavor, but it didn't make is taste any worse. not only was it lacking flavor, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was also quite expensive. $8 for one!  wouldn't recommend or visit this place in the future. my advice, just skip this place and go somewhere else.

my house people told me that i gained weight. who's to blame?
i didn't go to many other food places in vegas. who's to blame?

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!

i spent 4 days in vegas, and pinks fed my stomach 3 times in 4 days.
day 1:
chilli <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (me)
mushroom <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 2:
<mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (my friend)
<mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> (me)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 4: 
2 <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (me& my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>
coleslaw

* the coleslaw is a no, but whatever, i love you still, pinks!

i had heard about the pink's in so cal and i had always wanted to try it. when i saw there was one in vegas, i was excited to check it out. i was disappointed, to say the least. i ordered the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>, which costed me $6.50. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> tasted rubbery to me and there wasn't nearly enough <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> on it. the moments where i got <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, mushrooms, and <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were really good but there weren't very many of them. they put way too many mushrooms and not enough cheese. if it had been better proportioned i may have enjoyed it more. i would probably still eat here again, but try something different next time. i heard the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> is to die for.

overrated. i haven't checked out the la pink's because there's always a line. i should have known better that there wasn't a line at the ph pink's.  maybe it's because you have to go outside the casino to actually get into the tiny little space to order - pretty inconvenient since it was 30 degrees and snowing outside.

i was disappointed by my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> - nothing special - i guess all the toppings are what make pink's special. their staff should be a bit more energetic, ask if customers have tried pink's before, and if not, then recommend one of the quintessential pink's dogs.  

none of that here.  just people who looked bored. 

stop by earl's inside the casino and miracle mile mall if you want a delicious, cheap, and quick bite.

hella expensive <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! but it is on the strip so what do you expect. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were okay. i ordered the planet hollywood <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> which was good but it had a lot of cheese. i got it because i like bacon so if you like bacon this is a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for you! just tell them to go light on the cheese unless you like cheese. the chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were also good and big enough for two people.

comparing to the la pink's, this place is only so-so. but, after a long day of walking up and down the strip with no food, this place makes for a decent, quick, & filling dinner. though not necessarily cheap. but if you're comparing to a lot of other places on the strip, with the exception of mcdonalds, you're not going to really find anything cheaper than this place.

my friend got one that had 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with chili, cheese, onions, and guacamole. she loved the topping combinations offered.
i was feeling a little hungrier so i got the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>, which is a gigantic <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, chili, cheese, and 2 pieces of bacon wrapped in a tortilla. it was good, but the sausage casing was kind of chewy. my friend and i both agreed the chili was pretty good as a topping. it's much more about the toppings here than it is about the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, so know that going in.

the seating here is sketchy, since it's all outdoors. so if they're busy, you might be out of luck. try to go when there isn't a line. but even when there is a line, it always moves pretty fast.

pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was pretty good! ive never had it before so i wanted to try out their original best one and according to the staff, the most popular one ended up being their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. the beef was made well and the size was good enough. i didn't like how the bread was ripping apart and the whole dog was unbalanced. 

this place is nice to eat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at especially for west coast dogs. i'd come back to eat more!

extremely mediocre. i went with the 3 <mark>Three Dog Night</mark> which is: 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, wrapped in a giant tortilla, 3 slices of cheese, 3 slices of bacon, chili & onions. with a lineup like that, you'd think it would be earth shattering. it was not. it was actually borderline gross. the chili was very oily, flavorless, but every aromatic.....to the point that i had to wash my hands...... twice. overall, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were good, but i think this place is grossly over hyped and there is a line. i'll try the one in hollywood next time i'm in l.a., but the lv version is not worth your time. meh.

i got their chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  it was huge,s salty, gooey, and a bit overwhelming.  i had to eat mine with a fork, and the actual <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> tasted just like a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i guess the big deal is the extensive menu they have of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> toppings?  it tasted pretty mediocre to me, and totally unhealthy (but i guess that's the point though).

this place gets a lot of hype. it doesn't pay off, but it is a must on the tourist list. the original place is in los angeles, which of course is better. this vegas one has more vegas themed dogs i guess you can say. i like my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> simple with everything on it. if i were to go here i'd say get something with chili on it. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are good. the fries stay crispy even with the chili on it. be prepared to get messy when eating here.

we were at planet hollywood and really wanted to try out pink's.. i decided on a classic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with raw onions, ketchup & mustard. the boyfriend got this crazy concoction of 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in a tortilla, chili, cheese, bacon, onions and we got some <mark>French Fries</mark> to share. the <mark>French Fries</mark> were really good! the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good as well but i think i prefer nathans. the boyfriend really liked his weird meal, i took a bite and thought it was interesting. the chili was really good and i don't really even like chili. 

they only have outdoor seating which was fine since it was cool outside but would probably suck in the summertime. 

if you like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> give it a shot!

after all the hype i've heard about pink's, it does not live up to it's raves. maybe the la joint is better so i may give it a second chance when i'm in la, but don't try pink's in vegas.
i got the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and my friend got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. the chili on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was very questionable, kinda like elementary school lunch chili what the hell kinda meat is in here but i don't care because i'm 7? kinda chili. mushy and questionable. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself? i think i've tasted better microwaving ones from the grocery store. it's bland, and just soft.
didn't try my friend's pastrami <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but he said it just tasted like what it looks like. we also got <mark>Onion Ring</mark>-- after a few of them, you might want to food coma.

i am all for greasy, fat food, but pink's does not do it for me.

i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  that is a fact.  personally one of the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in my opinion is a costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  practically every time i go to costco, on my way out i have to buy a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i've even purchased their refrigerated <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to make at home - not the same as the ones they make there - i think because of the buns.  but i digress...

i was in vegas and having heard of pinks being a southern california favorite, i realized these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> needed to be sampled.  first of all, my challenge was finding the place.  i knew it was inside planet hollywood.  upon walking in, i explored the mall, the food area, and even saw a big sign with an arrow pointing towards the casino/mall exit.  but pinks was nowhere to be found.  well, turns out (after asking someone), it is in the front of the casino.  ahhh.  it was one of those things - most vegas places on the strip, you never really walk out in front of the casinos.  they are always designed to suck you in and never let you leave.  

anyway, after finding pinks i ordered a <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> and their standard footlong dog.  i should note that pinks has a ton of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> - their menu is quite extensive.  the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> was much thicker compared to the long and skinny footlong.  both were ok.  they had been steamed.  toppings were pretty basic.  no sport peppers on the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, which i guess i can't complain about too much because we aren't in chicago.  buns were soft and tasted fresh.  

overall not an amazing <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> like i had hoped for (still like that costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> better), but certainty a very decent dog for vegas.  maybe if i make it down to la someday, i'll try the original.

thoroughly over-rated!

7.50$ for a greasy <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, covered in "chili" that looks like a pile of poo-poo & tastes accordingly (( this stuff looked synthetic - im talking taco bell might be better)

the sausage was okay but it was super salty and greasy, the bun was completely soggy (think wonderbread) & the chilli was honestly repulsive (i scooped as much as possible off before eating)

the relish and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> were the only things that saved the day.

i would seriously pick the  costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>/<mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> over this stuff any day!

never been to the original pink's in socal, but i couldn't imagine waiting 2 hours in line for this.  i mean it ain't no costco dog and portillo's it ain't.  

i've been here a few times for a quick bite since i stay at ph often.  they've got a lot of unique dogs and hefty portions, but most of it is just covered in excessive toppings so i usually just stick to the naked dog or one w/ chili and jalapenos.  they just lack that snap that you look for when you bite into a good dog/sausage.

if you're on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> quest in vegas after some drinking this would definitely hit the spot, but otherwise go inside and grab a sandwich from the earl.

yummy! small little place, needs more seating. 
loved my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, had great snap! my husband had the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> and also really liked it. will go again!

i havent had the opportunity to experience pinks in southern california being as i'm from the sf bay area but this pinks was actually alright in my opinion. 

dude chill...i already said i didnt get a chance to try the original pinks so i'm gonna write about what i know.

i ordered the g...jsdoifahefoiasjfsaoif dog. the one with tomatos onions and relish with <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, cept i cut the onions cause me and onions dont get along.

overall i think this was a bad choice because none of the condiments really complimented each other, the relish was over powering, the tomatoes were tasteless, and the <mark>Sour Cream</mark> was barely noticeable. 

the bun and that long gay looking sausage made it all worth it. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had a crisp bite and bursted with juicy flavor (no homo...) and the bun was soft and not to filling. 

the price is way steep for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but it may be worth it to come back to every one in a while. for all the other times...there be costco dogs!

pink's was one of the cheapest meals we had in vegas! $26 for three people was a nice change of pace from spending triple & quadruple that at other eateries. 

this was my first time eating at this vegas location but i'd been to the original so cal one a few times. i ordered my usual: a veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> covered in chili cheese & onions. completely messy & totally heavy in the stomach; exactly what junk food should be. my companions ordered <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. 

even though i don't eat meat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i like that i don't have to be excluded from dining at pink's with people who do because they serve <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. brownie points for that. pink's food is kind of 'eh' but it's fun to eat outside, under heating lamps & surrounded by lights on the strip.

it was my first time in vegas and after walking around the strip all day long, my friends and i decided to stop by pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i was told this is a well known <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place in la and really good. when i saw the menu, the prices did not impress me, for that it was quite expensive! i guess you can't really complain. it is las vegas after all. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with fries and i have to say it was really good and tasty. the chili had beef chunks in it and complimented the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> really well. every bite was filled with the saucy chili and beef with the delicious <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i am craving this as i write this review. i'm from norcal and there just isn't any good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> places here. i will for sure come back for more next time i'm in town!

overrated!! honestly the (actual) <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> tasted regular, nothing special...the buns were regular, nothing special...they just threw a bunch of sides on top of a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!! at $6-7a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, presentation is only a fraction of what i expected.
don't get me wrong, would i eat here again??...probably...could it be better?? yes
if your jonesin' and your on the strip. hit this place up. great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>'s. 428 in sd need's to take some pointers from pink's.

i wish my friends and i had some self-control when it came to food cause we were not planning on eating when we walked out of the planet hollywood hotel but it smelled sooooooo good outside of  pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that we turned,  looked at each other and walked in! the menu hot a huge selection and i ended up choosing the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which came with cheese, mushrooms, bacon and i forgot what else. it was huge and cost over $9!  there were some you could get for around $5. after i made my decision i noticed that by the register they had a paper that advertised the hot-dogs wanna be celebrities like holly madison and kim kardashian like.  i love reality shows so i would probably have copied  one of their choices, lol. anyways, my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good but not $9 good. i probably would only go back if i was in the area but would not go out of my way to visit the one in la.  it was still cool to hang out there on the strip and people watch while we ate.

i've waited for the pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for more than an hour in la. i saw there wasn't a line here for lunch and decided to give this place another try... it's alright. i mean, i did enjoy the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> more without the 1.5 hours of hype beforehand. 

i don't remember the exact names of all these dogs... but i got a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that was topped with relish, onions & and tomatoes, topped w/<mark>Sour Cream</mark>.  i feel a bit ashamed to say this was pretty good. aside from the fact there was <mark>Sour Cream</mark> which may throw people off, it really put the taste together. my boyfriend had the sausage with pastrami, bacon, and cheese drizzled on top. that was a bit too heavy for him. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are definitely better than the sausages and i really enjoyed the the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.


sadly, i think this is one of those places you will definitely enjoy when you're drunk outta your mind.

i think this place is better than the location in la. yes the food is twice as much but you get a much much better view while dining. two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, two drinks and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> = $35.

*shrug.

i'm from la, but i've actually never had a pink's in la......

had my first one here and really wasn't that impressed.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> has a nice snap to it and flavor but it's not all chocked up to what it is supposed to be "legendary"

omg, this place is <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>!

i mean c'mon, for $8, i thought the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i got was not worth it until it was on my plate.

i can't remember which one, but it was the one with 5 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, chili, cheese, onions all wrapped up. it was really really good. i would eat one right now actually if i could

lines?? nope! not even.. ordered and the food was done pretty quick. got the chili cheese jalape\u00f1o dog and fries. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good and of course messy ! i really like the snap you get from taking a bite of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and for the fries... it was meh. not fresh. definitely not worth it but it's  a good place to get <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> :)

meh is a spot-on description for pink's in las vegas.

i had heard such great things about pink's in la that we decided to try it for lunch one day on our recent vegas trip.  maybe you have to be drunk to really appreciate these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i was less than impressed.  on the plus side, there are some interesting combinations on the menu, but the execution was so average.  my husband had a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> which was mediocre at best- the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a good snap to it, but the taste wasn't anything to write home about and i've had better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (vienna and koegel's in the midwest).  i had about 2 bites of my polish (i can't remember the name of it, but it had guacamole, hot peppers, etc. which was fine) and again, was less than impressed with the meat.  i guess for a truly great <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, i'll stick to ballparks, who seem to get it right.  i'd take a wrigley field polish over a pink's any day of the week.

for a celebrity <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> craze..... it's good! 

their #1 is the bacon chili cheese: topped with onions, tomatoes, chili, cheese and bacon... not really my cup of tea.

their #2 is the planet hollywood (fitting, considering their located @ ph) and it's pretty bomb! <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, cheese and bacon! 

the best compliment they offer i'd have to say is the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>:)

their downfall, hence the 2 stars: their staff and lack of customer service!!!

seriously... 

#1: you sell <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!! not diamonds! i guess a smile and a skosh of patience would be a stretch, no?
#2: you are the cashier!!! if you're gonna have that kind of impatient demeanor, you think it'd be more fitting to stock up inventory in the back or something right???

wow.

i have been wanting to try pinks forever. i never seem to make it to la though so when they opened one in vegas, i was dying to go back to vegas. but then i was dying to go back to vegas anyway as it is my favorite place ever!. so i got <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for everybody. 40 bucks isn't really so bad for 4 people. but then i hope to be getting a spectacular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> out of it. it was good but it wasn't great and far from being awesome. the fries were good. but my mushroom swiss <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was a mess compiled mostly of a sub-par bun and mayonaise. it hasn't escaped my attention that the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i have had is from costco of all places.

sorry disneyland, as a die-hard <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fanatic, pink's is the happiest place on earth for me!  thank god there's a pink's on la brea (although i wouldn't mind busting the mission to vegas for these badboys).

we were on our way back to the hotel to get ready for the night out. we were running short on time and opted for a quick dinner. i've heard of pinks, the one in la, so i suggested to my friends lets try it. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was ok. nothing special other than the different toppings or styles you can have on it. 

now i feel like running to the grocery store to pick up a pack of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. pop it in the microwave like how i would cooked it back in elementary =) and be happy with just ketchup as my topping.

all this fuss for nothing ! this review is strictly based on what my boyfriend at the time told me. after getting the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with chili cheese and fries, he told me it really isnt what its ought to be. it was satisfying, but nothing so special that he'd come back for more.

i heard a lot of hype about pink's so i was expecting some awesome <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i was hugely disappointed.

my sister and i shared the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>, the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a side of <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.  i was surprised that our order came out looking like regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and buns (that you'd buy from any grocery store) slathered in everyday condiments.  i totally agree with the other reviews that there was really nothing special about the food here.

the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> was disgustingly coated in mayo.  i like mayo but not to the point where that's all you taste with every bite.

the bacon chili cheese tasted no better than something i could have ordered at wienerschnitzel...super salty and the chili tasted nasty like it was "fresh" out of the can.

of all the things we ordered, the best thing was probably the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> but there wasn't anything extraordinary about those either.

honestly, this place is no different than any other fast food joint except that it's highly overrated.  we actually came here after several rounds of mojitos and even then it still didn't taste any good.
tastes similar to the original without the wait. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was too much for me to handle. just too big. but a good option on the strip for cheap fast food.

they basically have your average <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stuff with one exception....their chilli is pretty rad so make sure to get it on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> of your choice....i got mine with chilli, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, jalapenos, onions, mustard, and no regrets

i don't even really like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that much! i'm no <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> expert, so here's my take - 

we needed lunch and this place was convenient. like others, i'd seen the pink's in la in tv before, so we stopped. 

i had the mel b dog and my dining companion had the vegas strip. my dog was 1 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> sauce, guac, <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, tomatoes and onions. sounds interesting and not very good, but i was on vacation, i had to try something different. i really enjoyed it! 

my dining companion's was 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with cheese, chili. guac, and onions. he liked as well. in fact, he told me i can't put the picture of him eating it online! 

in addition we shared <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, water and a beer. the bill with everything was $29. 

the food was decent, it was quick and tasty. the only thing i didn't care for was it warm out, not hot and the only seating was outside. it was breezy, but i eat quick so we were in and out. try it for something quick, but don't expect greatness.
one f the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've had. it did not break or spill or get all over places. i dislike the daiquiri though. it was too sweet.
thinking back the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were okay. but eating here drunk, heaven.

i had gone to la last year and was pretty bummed i didnt get to visit the famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  so naturally, i was pretty excited when i realized they had a pink's in planet hollywood, where i was staying.

<mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>: awesome
i had <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and i forgot the name of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> my boyfriend had, but i liked his better even though they were both yummy. his had jalapenos, all i remember. sorry guys! lol. my only complaint is that they put too much of the condiments on to the point where it took me a few minutes to strategize my game plan on how to actually eat the thing :)

i definitely recommend a trip to pink's!

i have long heard about pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> being a go-to hot spot late at night for grub and the chance to run into celebrities out in hollywood but have never had the chance to go.  thus i was really excited when i saw that pink's had opened a storefront right on the strip in vegas.  

after a long night of debauchery, i walked halfway across the strip just so i could eat at pink's.  i have to give them credit, they sure know how to jazz up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i ordered a <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>, which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, guacamole and jalape\u00f1o peppers on it.  i ordered relish on it as well.  

the combination works well in theory as well as in practice.  but in practice all of that stuff on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> makes it damn near impossible to eat as you would normally.  picking it up makes all the toppings fall off, and a sloppy mess gets all over your hands.  so i had to resort to eating <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> with a fork and knife.  i felt pretty stupid, but it was the only way to do it and plenty of people around me were doing the same.  

but eating like that made the bun soggy, which is not good.  i appreciate the effort they put into dressing up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i only give it three stars because i've had amazing "gourmet" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in chicago before, with toppings piled high, but with which i could still eat as <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are intended to be eaten - with your hands.

definitely not as good as the original but i like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! had the polish pastrami and it was delicious! loved eating outdoors under the umbrellas. but otherwise, not that spectacular.

wow! best. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. ever!

i forget the name of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i ordered but it was a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, cheese, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and mushrooms (i think it was the ph <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i could be wrong).. a-freakin'-mazing! toppings over load! there were lots of <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and mushrooms which i much appreciated because most places are so skimpy with the toppings. the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was fat and juicy, just the way i like them ;)
boyfriend got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> with just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrami and mustard - i don't like mustard so i didn't get to try a bite but he said it was good and i'll trust him on that. i can't imagine it being anything amazing like mine though because it just seems so plain!

can't say to much for the service because you wait in line, walk up, order and pick up your food at the next spot so there isn't too much interaction with the employees. but i can say the girl who took my order was very friendly and patience because i still wasn't sure of what i wanted and i didn't feel rushed by her at all.

someone please open a pink's in the bay!!!

i believe i got <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>, which was topped with cheese, salsa, jalapenos, and guacamole. it was heavenly, to put it short. i don't understand why people give it 2-3 stars for being hard to eat without forks and spoons. well, it's topped with goodies, duh!
the reason i gave it a 4-star was bc i ordered a coleslaw. worst slaw i ever had. i think it was b/c they used something other than cabbage. but can't blame it on others, who orders a slaw at a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place? lesson learned!

these are good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but two people can definitely split one dog.  if you get two, you won't be able to finish them.

the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are really good.

there are only ketchup packets and not a pump so make sure you grab a bunch.  also, you have to ask the people behind the counter for a little cup to squeeze all the ketchup packets into.  so weird.

i was looking forward to trying this place out all weekend!

after having drinks all day and night, i really wanted something bad.. real bad for me..

i decided to order a <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>.  this had bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> on top of a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  let me tell ya, it was exactly what i was craving.  it was a bit on the salty side though.  i was already dehydrated enough, the bacon was real salty... and i love salty things ;)  other than that, i've never had a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> so yummy and so big!  i couldn't finish it.

the wait wasn't too bad when we came and actually getting our dogs didn't take long either.  i liked the environment, it was fun and exciting.

i'll probably come back here when i have a huge appetite and i haven't done my make-up.  by the end of eating your dog, you've wiped off all the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> that's gotten on your face and your freshly put on make-up!

this place is all right.
i have never seen such a diverse menu compromised of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.
i got the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> burrito which had three <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and filled with cheese and other stuff. it was pretty yummy.
the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are really good too. i think it's a little pricey for a hot-dog specialty joint, but this place is worth trying once
 in your lifetime.

not much of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan, though their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were in between awesome and a-ok thus three stars. i believe it's more hyped on the celeb advertisement.

overall, the place is cool especially those <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> :)
the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i had <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mustard. enjoyed every bite!

we are a little spoiled living in chicago, because we have every cuisine here!  however, something as simple as a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> should not be that difficult, but i have had some from other places and trust me they were a fail. we tried pinks while in las vegas i had a turkey <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mayo, mustard, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, and cheese. ( i forgive them for asking me if i want ketchup, i live in chicago we dont do ketchup on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>). i have to admit it was a pleasant surprise, and i am kinda bummed out that i didnt make it to pinks one more time before leaving lv but i am definately a fan!

not sure what all the hype is all about. their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were better than the actual <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i'd rather eat a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from costco.

this place is just way to expensive for average <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. yeah okay its nice to say you've been and take pictures blah blah blah but if you want to spend $20 for two dogs, 1 small fries, and two drinks... have fun
i guess being a new yorker i was expecting way more, nathans and street car franks are so much better than this place.

dear pink's,

  i hate you.  i had one in la and it was ok but i was hoping for better...i'm not sure why i thought it would be better.  i think it's similar to when you see a mcd's ad and you hope your burger looks like the ad but it's the same pile of crap every time.

  the chili was bland and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was not as good as nathan's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

  i'm pretty sure the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> meal looked the same entering and exiting my body!

i go here every time we are in vegas.  this time we got a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> (which is my fave), <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>, and the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> with 2 orders of fries and onions rings for 4 people.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were enough for 4 people to share.  i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was pretty big.  they have outside seating.  they probably have like 6 or 7 tables out there.  
i think on fridays and saturdays they close at 0300 which is good for a early morning snack.  each <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is like under $9 which isnt bad.  they accept credit cards and cash.

yum! we hit up pink's on our first night in vegas. sure, it was 30 bucks for a couple of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and some fries but it's vegas. i had a dog smothered in chili, cheese, onions, mustard and jalapenos. boyfriend had the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. coming from central texas, we expect yumminess when it comes to <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausage. pink's did not disappoint. sure the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was topped with all sorts of delicious stuff but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself was also quite tasty. good stuff!

there's a major difference between eating here after a margarita and eating here before a margarita. i can vouch that eating here after a margarita tastes significantly better.

being sheltered for all my life, i never heard of pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wasn't aware of its popularity until i got here. combined with my love for chili, we ended up ordering chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, nacho chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and the mel b <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

the wait time for it is really short too and it's a really good place to sit underneath their vapor after a party marathon on the strip. i think this place has to be visited on your trip to vegas but i might be incredibly biased by the chili aspect. although the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> are their selling point and i could go on and on about my love for chili, i really thought the winners were the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mustard, cheese, and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>.

honestly, a key component to these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is tlc. apparently it doesn't taste the same as it does at the ghetto ass location in la brea.

overall planet hollywood should have hired legit workers from cali who know how to assemble a pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> as oppose to just anyone..

very disappointed.

i feel like a traitor because i have not tried the one in la (and i'm from la!), but decided to try this in vegas.

i had the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. it looked really good after ordering, but i think the taste was lacking for my expectation. everyone always talks about how great pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are in la, butttt i was kind of expecting to be disappointed when i realized that pink's in vegas was not as obvious of a spot, and there were also not many people ordering. i mean, i guess vegas has hundreds of other eateries besides <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i'm guessing the one in la is better, and i think my next try will be home and not vegas. ):

one word: disgraceful. this rendition of pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was nothing comparable to the one in los angeles. i came here after a long walk on a hot day visiting places on the strip and i was utterly disgusted with my order. i had gotten the <mark>Mushroom Swiss Dog</mark> with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, mushrooms and mayo. first of all, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wiener itself was ordinary, almost as if i bought the pack of ten from a grocery store along with grocery store <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> buns. the mushrooms tasted like rubber canned mushrooms that should be stamped inedible. not only that, but a large dollop of mayo on top of this mess made me want to gag. i immediately regretted my order as i saw it and was even more sad to see $7 go to waste. however, i did really enjoy the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, but only temporarily. the mixture of fake beef and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> did not bode well for any of my friends and i would not recommend coming here when there are plenty of other great places on the strip. yelpers, beware.. false franchising!!

well it was a 105 out and the nice cool misting fans were looking nice. 
the wait was to at the mall restaurants so we ended up here! i really do enjoy a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> when they can be found and the last couple i have had were very average. also seeing this on food network a few time made for some big expectations. 

i was excited to try pink's and the line was moving fast. i normally just go with a normal dog with ketchup when trying new places but the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> was sounding good and it sounded big! 

we got our order pretty fast and the serve pepsi bleh, so went with sierra mist when in this situation. 

then i went for the ketchup and then ooooo no cisco ketchup, blehhh, how could you pink's? i don't think i've had to have cisco ketchup since i was at the last country fair. that would be my only complaint here. ketshup is one of the only condiments i enjoy and if i'm eating a top quality <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries, i need the good stuff! 

alas, my giant burrito filled with bacon, chili, cheese and 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was really to be devoured and it was. it was great, filling, and had some hearty chili which is something you either like <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>'t, but i did. 

i was pretty full after that and i would have this again for sure. 

if i had coke, some heinz, and a cooled indoor seat, you could have had that 1 extra star!

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in las vegas are unique and taste pretty decent.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are large and have decent toppings.  i agree with other reviews that this joint offers crappy toppings for you to put on, which implies to me that they are not always using top ingredients for these top dollar dogs.
