this is a place for me to say i ate at, but not something i would go to more than once or twice a year max.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> come with basic long dogs or a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> is nice and big and tastes pretty good.  i would suggest skipping the "<mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>" as it lacks from what a i would call a true chicago style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> was pretty good as was the majove dog.

overall an a-ok place to eat a fancy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but not something you want to eat at often or more than once a year.  be prepared for a pricey experience with somewhat questionable topping quality.

pink's is a humongo staple in la...and every time i'm outside the place i swear off poppin my pink's cherry because of that ridonculous line. but you can't get away from the buzz...you hear about them online, from friends, and it's practically a celebrity hotspot. 

well being the sceptic that i need to be to thrive, i figured it may be a lot of empty hype. i mean a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>'s a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i thought. and i couldn't have been wronger. (yeah. it's a word now ;)

sure, i can't tell a lie...there were only 2-3 people ahead and yet we waited in line for probly 25 minutes. and yeah, for 2 simple styled <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and an <mark>Onion Ring</mark> after all was said & done (including tax & a small tip), it was almost 20 dollars. and the cashier was very knowlegeable, but moved at the speed of a dmv employee..they all did.


but i quickly found out that their food is the real deal holyfield. no empty hype. so damn good. no, i think they put crack in there.
the only time i eat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>....unless i'm having a bbq at my house. these are a heart attack waiting to happen and i love it. eat one or two and that is an instant food coma!
best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> this side of the rio grand!    nice and spicey . . .plus they toast their buns . . . . . something unique to las vegas.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are awesome!!! i was able to read the menu clearly despite the agonizing heat and knew exactly what i was ordering unlike my husband who claims blurred vision for getting a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> instead of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. best tasting dog i've had. the chili was great. as far as the outside only dinning, it was saved by the misters that hang just a few inches above the patron's heads. i would have preferred to eat inside because, let's face it; a mister is just a giant fan (so napkins are flying) with water spraying out at you. the water wasn't the problem, the wind current was. i was dry before i finished my <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> because it was still super hot out. totally worth a few trips back!

everything is ok... but the chili... the chili is the beezneez!  they have other wacky toppings that are quite delicious too, plus if you add bacon to anything it at it's a 1 up.  go here and make sure there's chili on your <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

i was exposed to pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from the food network channel. it was during bobby flay's dog challenge where i believe he won too... their original location is in los angeles. i guess they opened up another location in las vegas inside planet hollywood. 

it was december 2010 when i had my first experience at pink's. it was windy and they did not have indoor seating. it was cold even with the outdoor heater. people were outside eating wearing their leather jackets shivering. aside from that, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was overrated. i order the chilli dog and my fiance ordered some kinda of dog with onions. it tasted like any other <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you would order in a restaurant that serves it.

nothing special about this place.

i had a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> covered in chili, bacon, cheese and tomatoes. i don't know how anyone could complain about that. ever. the lines went fast, the people taking up tables got up and left pretty quickly so not much of a wait. yeah it was hot but you're in vegas, what do you expect. go cry inside.

went here last night. got my usual chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. i don't like crazy things on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. just the usuals-- as in all the usuals. haha ketchup, mustard, saukraut(?), tomatoes and bacon-- oh and relish! definitely have to eat these babies with a knife and fork. don't forget the napkins!
chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> here are delicious. i love their chili. it's a little 'mushier' i guess you can say than other places, but i like it... although my tummy always feels a little funny after. kinda over priced, but it's vegas. what isn't overpriced?

i always heard about pink's & finally got the chance to try it for the first time :)

at first, i was going to be boring & order a regular <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. but since it was my first time, might as well try a specialty!

my friend & i decided to order 2 different specialty dogs & split it so we could have 2 kinds. we ordered the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> & <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> was a bit on the lighter side (compared to the other specialty dogs). i'm not a big bacon person (which was on the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>), but it was quite appetizing. however, it was huge & it fills you up really quick. 

seating is outside under umbrellas. it was kinda nice since it was a shaded area.

customer service was good.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good, but not sure if i'd spend  that much on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> again. worth a try though!

2 of our friends kept raving about this place. so, we came here after we landed and checked in. my sister and i got the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and our friend got 2 <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and fries.

bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> - the chili tasted too mushy, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a good snap to it.
fries -- they were ok.

overall, we weren't wowed by it, but i would return to try something else in the future.

i should've checked yelp instead of listening to all the hype. while on vacation there were a few places my friends and i had heard about quite often and wanted to check out - pink's was one of them. located right in our hotel, we figured it'd be one of the better places to eat during our trip, but ... not so much.

maybe it's because i've been spoiled by all the good food here in san francisco, but pink's didn't strike me as anything special. most of the items seemed to be pretty similar, mostly consisting of chili, bacon, onions, cheese, and other meats; not a ton of variety overall. though i have to say, the portions-to-price ratio was pretty good - you get a gigantic, filling meal for about $10 or so, and unless you have a monstrous appetite you won't need a second <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

as for the food itself? average. even though most of my friends and i were feeling ravenous i think only one out of nine of us managed to finish, and it wasn't really because of how filling the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were. sure, they're packed to the brim with condiments and other things, but it's mostly standard fare. i actually felt kind of sick and bloated for a few hours afterward, and i certainly didn't feel like finishing the leftovers after looking at it later than day.

unfortunately for people thinking they'll get to sit indoors and have a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in an ac-dominated environment, the only seating is outdoors in the hot, hot vegas sun, with only a few tables sitting underneath a bit of shade. it's a pretty small location, so if it's crowded you might just want to bring everything back to your room instead. it'll be less messy that way anyway.

overall i don't think pink's met the hype at all. perhaps because the original is in los angeles and not in vegas, and in addition i've had better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at local joints (sorry!). it's probably worth a stop if you're in vegas, but don't go there expecting the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you've ever had. you'll only set yourself up for disappointment in the end.

ordered two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (big mistake) and ended up putting one in the fridge in the hotel room.

opened the fridge a few hours later to discover a very odd smell coming from it. was hoping to eat it for breakfast the next morning before checkout, but ended up trashing it instead.

that pretty much sums up my experience with pink's. a great big meh.

regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at 2x the price.

this is a very misleading place to be.


seriously.

their <mark>French Fries</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are amazing! extremely crunchy and crispy, really on point. i enjoy their coleslaw but i can also understand why others wouldnt. 

oh yeah, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>..they are decent, perfectly salted.

let's keep this simple: i don't like to give people the eyesore of their epic experiences, word for word and about how we sat down and the waitress rolled her eyes and what not.

service: normal fast food services. pick your own food up. lol

food: extra long <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, with a bit of a crunch. they should at least slightly toast the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> buns! i meant right?? nothing too special. believe it or not, i like 711's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> better. trollololol!

sanitation: (most important to me) tables are alright. some dirty. fast food, like i said.

what i got: chili <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, + bacon. & topped with jalapenos. can you believe?? all those toppings and it still didn't seem all that great!

so whats the big deal??
i guess it's a tourist attraction, obviously.. some people like it, some people don't. best way to know try it out for yourself! it's not like its disgusting. just like theme park food.

other notes:
- seating area is a lovely place to cool down! that's for sure!

pink's!! great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! great toppings! lines weren't long at all when i was there!

i got the <mark>Chili</mark> dog! chili was good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was nice as crispy! another food stop you need to make while in sin city!

i'm sorry to say but gray's papaya in nyc all day everyday!

i know live in vegas and always wanted to try pinks. it's nothing special. i'd rather buy a better tasting & more robust <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> & a drink @ costco for just $1.50 than spend $6-$7 for something less appealing @ pinks.
<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are really good!! a little over priced for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but whatever, las vegas is over priced

expensive for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? yess the quality is super top notch tho. they have some exotic toppings. i tried the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and wowwwww so flavorful. omg and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself? it has a great snap to it when you bite into it. the casing is the best i ever seen. i never heard a perfect snap in a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> before until i tried pink's. 

i would give this 5 stars but for the pricey dog, i have to subtract a star.

good for some drunk food! would say it is expensive but everything in vegas is expensive. can't really complain but enjoyed everything i tried.... <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>:)

finally!  after 3 trips to vegas, i finally got to go here!

friends are always bringing me pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and i'm glad that this place didn't disappoint.  i've had a few of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> before and this time i went with the showdog girl.  

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself was great, nice snap when you bite into it!  i took off one star though because i thought they put too much stuff on it.  i was almost having to search for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> flavor.  maybe i'm just weird, but i like to have minimal "stuff" on my dog.

no matter what, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> here are top notch.  love it.
average <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place... good toppings though.

the seating is outdoors, very limited, under very high powered fans with mist. not really ideal for eating.

husband wanted the lord of the rings dog which was no longer on the menu but they made it for him anyway. so that was nice. i ordered the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. both tasty enough.

i think the price was around $7 for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and $3 for the drinks. 

we split an order of <mark>Onion Ring</mark> with the parents. they are the thick cut rings and the batter was a bit on the sweet side.

overall decent experience for the price but i suspect there are better dogs to be had in chicago.

moderately priced for vegas <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but they're huge!  i think my friend had the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> with chili, and i was eyeing it the whole time.  you can't go wrong with a holy trinity blessed polish: mustard, onions, and sweet relish.

sit back, relax, and enjoy your meal with a cocktail while you stare off into city center and all the twinkling lights around you.  just order a naked polish at 1 in the morning and all is right in your world...
the menu is way smaller than the one in la, but it'll do.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> burrito was really good.  other than that, it's just okay.  place is small and so is the outdoor dining area.
overrated <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.
i was not to fond of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i ordered and the fries, i got really sick after eating there food.

not as many options as the original la stand but also doesn't come with the long line.  the best part about this joint is you can order from inside the ph sports book.  now you can call seat backs, place a bet, and get a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> before the timeouts over.  what could be more fitting than a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> while watching sports?

for the pink newbs:

dog - good meaty flavor with a nice snap to it
chili - delicious rich taste and a smooth texture

make whatever combination of toppings you like mine is

bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, all the fixins, plus sauerkraut.  get a fork its gonna be messy.

a little pricey for a dog but good taste, easy eats, no wait, and convenient if your in the ph sports book.

here goes one of those reviews where i wish i did not have to write. 

i was ecstatic to find out pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is open in vegas. i remembered ordering chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> which turned out horrible. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself tasted like rubber and very chewy. i was disappointed because i really love eating <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. why can't they be good like  the one in la where the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was super scrumptious?

definitely delicious. i thought they had waiter service but nope. guess it keeps the prices down. its moderately priced and they have lots of different <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i had the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with mustard. it had a snap to it. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were fresh and not hard and just delicious. unless your extremely hungry stick to just one dog.

no matter the obscene number of toppings, a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is still a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. overpriced and over-hyped, but i had to try because, well, it was vegas after all. the line wasn't too ridiculous (maybe about a ten minute wait) and seating was readily available. 

the celebrity <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wall was a little embarrassing. just because some b-list celebrity scribbles down their favorite menu item and signs their name next to it doesn't make it worth acknowledging.
best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> ever! they load on the toppings generously.  service is quick and friendly.  my only dislike is the amount of seating available.  there is almost no seating inside.

i'm from l.a., but i was short on time and was starving to death at the miracle mile shops. i figured... pink's, you can never go wrong. it's my favorite <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint where i'm from. wow they really over-priced these things, and i even snuck a peak out back and they don't use high, or even good quality products here. i mean their ketchup packets are even generic, they couldn't spring for heinz? come on, pinks. anyway, my bf and i decided to play it safe, and cheap because their normal <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> that go for $3 in l.a. are $6! madness! it was ok, but the chili just wasn't as flavorful and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didn't have any snap. the topping were piled on pretty good, but i just didn't think they were fantastic. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, on the other hand, were really good, and freshly made to perfection. the inside is very small, and the outside has about 15 tables, which are kept pretty clean. staff is so-so. they're fast and effective but none of them really looked that happy to be working that night. i would never come back here, because i would much rather go to the l.a. location.

a group of 8 of my friends ordered various items off the menu and not a single one had anything good to say about the food. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are plain-jane and the toppings are poor quality. i would recommend eating elsewhere.

we were in a vegas awhile back and just had to try pink's - it was great, they are having fun with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (so many cool toppings to choose from) ... had the chili-<mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  the chili was surprisingly flavorful.  the fries were great too.  it's a fun place to find some good food.;

what i like about pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in vegas is that they will refill any souvenir yard cup, unlike every other place you stop at! the price is reasonable too. this is great because who wants to go alllll the way back to the place where they bought the cup from just to get more alcohol!?! makes no sense!

the pink lemonade that they refill it with is pretty strong and doesnt need an extra shot! whenever i stop by there isn't a major wait. sweeet!

i haven't been to the original in la but the las vegas version at the planet hollywood casino is a pretty good dog - overpriced of course but did you expect anything else?  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are firm and have a nice casing and i honestly thought the chili was pretty good although definitely overloaded to the point of making the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> tough to eat.  not health food but i would definitely go again if i was looking for a quick meal in the area.

nom! i love pinks! especially their spicy sausages, they are extremely flavorful and are happily spicy.

but one of the main reasons why i love pinks is because of its location, it is located right outside of miracle mile so you can enjoy a one mile stroll and work up an appetite before you gorge yourself on <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausages. but make sure you take an extra stroll at the forum shops before hand so you can enjoy the delectable chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. they are super yummy, and if you get in a decent work out during your shopping run you won't even feel that guilty about it.

a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. and at pinks, it's a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with a bunch of stuff thrown onto it. so whatever artery clogging toppings you want, they got. good hangover food, but it's not the best. chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were pretty tasty because they were crispy fries and i love crispy fries. 

it's vegas and everything is over priced, that's a fact so i can't complain about the pricing. 

outside seating was nice with 75 degree weather and you get the nice company of birds hanging out.
good, but still an overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

note: maybe i shouldn't review pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, because i don't eat meat and buns, and i count calories so i can't add more toppings or sauces except veggie stuffs. 

i was very happy that they have a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at planet hollywood! there was no line and not crowded! i would never wait in line for 3 hours in hollywood location! so i got to try world famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! very good location outside miracle mile, walking distance from our hotel cosmopolitan.

very cute place decorated in pink color, there is a wall full of celebrities photos. i was glad they had veggie and turkey <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

a solid 3.5 star, $40 for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, one fries, one <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>, one <mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark> with souvenir cup. 

veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Chopped Tomato</mark>: not much flavor, but it was not bad with mustard sauce and tomatoes 
<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mushrooms and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>: fairly delicious 
fries: not bad
corn dog: good 

<mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark>: yummy

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were good, but not great, veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> needed to wait a bit longer to get my order, other orders were fast. i guess we should've ordered pink's secret recipe chilly on top, that would make our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> more tasty, or add more toppings and sauces. it is a bit pricey for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> though, but it's famous so it's ok i guess. 

i didn't think the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were great, but they were not bad either. i like this fast food place a lot because of the cute decor, and outdoor seats, good view and people watching on the strip, there were some cute little birds walking around, they were fun to watch. so we will go back again for snacks or quick bite. :)

"it's a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>."
"but it's from pink''s!"
"it's. a. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>." 

i ordered the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>, and while i enjoyed it, was it really worth the $6? probably not, considering it's just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it's basically like paying $2 for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and $4 for the famous name. and if it's not even the original hollywood stand, what's the point? definition of a tourist trap. 

i suppose i would recommend everyone to try it once, and don't try to be healthy. lather on the <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, cheese, chili, ect because if you're going to wait an obscene amount of time for a $6-$8 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you might as well go all out. it might help if you were a little tipsy as well to cushion the realization of the resources you are exhausting for minimal nutritional value. hey, it's vegas. luckily for myself, i barely beat the lunch rush, was able to walk up and order, and got my dog in just a few minutes. but the line a few minutes later was crazy! unfortunately for me though, it was also december and freezing outside. none of your $6 goes toward any indoor seating. 

i've always believed las vegas embodies the best and worst things about america, all in one place. such as greasy, overpriced "famous" food. case in point.

i was really looking forward to trying pinks since it is such a landmark <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place in la. i have to say we were a little disappointed. good place for a quick dog, but don't expect an incredible <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> experience.

my first trip to vegas with my boyfriend and we decided before our trip where we wanted to eat/try out.

truly the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had.  i guess other reviews say its just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and nothing special, bu i on the other hand think differently.  i say the sausage goes well with all the different toppings they offer in the store. what really differentiate pink's from other <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> chains is that their sausage tastes different a lot better; a higher quality compared to the others. 

i shared half a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with my boyfriend since we were saving our stomach for belagio buffet, but every bite of the sandwich was delicious.

maybe it's because it's not the original pinks. but we weren't too hungry, but saw that there was no line so we decided to try it.

we ordered a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>... to see if the hype was dog or toppings. also ordered the chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.

chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were disgusting. it was like dog meat. heavy. the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> was also bland. fries were extra crunchy...

<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wasn't too bad, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are broiled, something i could get down in sj at mark's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!

ehhh.

not sure what all the hype was about.  i guess i had to find out the hard and expensive way that coming here wasn't really worth my time.

these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are boiled-something i can get at a baseball game.  i prefer a grilled <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that has char-marks and some snap to it when you bite in.  

i ordered the basic <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>; the toppings overpowered the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, there was so much going with this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i couldn't even enjoy it.  i actually ended up eating it with a fork n knife because the massive amounts of toppings tore the bun apart.  that seriously detracts from any <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> experience. 

it was $8 for one <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and a bottle of water.  

do yourself a favor and spend that $8 next door at earl of sandwich...you'll thank me later. 

and remember...its just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!

good place to check out if you like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and are near the miracle mile. food is cheaper than most sit down restaurants in town. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were good, but you might consider going with some of the "classics" as the rest of the other dogs can be a little overwhelming and really messy. i highly recommend the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, they were by far the best thing we ordered, very crispy, tasty chili and quality <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.

i absolutely love their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! super delish! i went here twice. their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are good, but their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> weren't. i didn't have the urge to finish it. wished there was a pink's in the bay area. oh well! guess i'm going to have to go to la or vegas in the meantime.

overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that aren't special. what more can i say? 

the original one in la is a tad better, still, nothing more than a lot of hype.

i love pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in all incarnations, and this one was no different. i thought the prices were reasonable for las vegas, and i enjoyed my <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. the only problem was that the menu seemed abridged from others i've seen, like their weho location and their truck at the orange county fair.

lacking the snap, character, and deliciousness that the weho pink's has (a solid 4 stars).

also, after trying several of their specialties, i stand by their classic pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the quality of their food is in the house-made sausages, not the average toppings they put on them in my opinion. pink's is just as la as dirty dogs are to me, so maybe they should just stay there...

$4.75 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>?  sure, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were delicious but that's a damnable price to pay for a frankfurter on a bun.  for that kind of money pink's should at least grill them.  i see 7/11 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in my future.

i never thought i'd spend $30 for 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but here i am standing at the pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> shop with my jaw dropped at the cash register in vegas. all i could think while i was waiting is that these damn dogs better be fantastic. 

in about 10 minutes my number was called. i got the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (two dogs in one bun) and <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. i tried a bite of all three and none of them wowed me. <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> was topped with cheap <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, onions, bland guac and tomatoes. there wasn't a spice factor in there at all. the vegas strip was similar to the spicy except that it was two dogs, chili  and had jalapenos, i thought this blended together better but still wasn't "omg this is the best $8 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever put in my mouth" type of good. 

overall, i was full but not satisfied.
izzz just a fuckin <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> mannnn i don't understand what all the hype is about

maybe it's because we don't have a pink's in norcal, but i always end up eating here once when i'm in lv.

love the number of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> variants they have available.
it's a lot of food, for not much $.
everyone should try the classic chili cheese w/ raw onions and yellow mustard at least once.
great garlic fries.

no indoor seating, minimal outdoor seating.  take it to go or post up somewhere inside the ph casino.

this is the worst <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had for $12 .  cold n messed up my order n then told me to get back in a long line to rectify.  i can name a half dozen places in chicago with a dog ten times better.  i will not be back!

this is for anyone who dgaf about what they eat and who don't care about taste. i'm not really ripping this place apart but it's basically a bunch of junk food all combined on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> or a burrito.

i had a bite of my friend's chili cheese burrito with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, cheese, and lots of beef. the fries were thin and crispy but too salty. 

it's really good if you're suffering from a hangover (since this was in vegas, lol) but i wouldn't eat this on my own will

i would save pink's for my vegas diet whenever i come back: alcohol and fatty foods.

while i was in vegas in oct this was one of my must stops... and boy it didn't disappoint! i am not even a big <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan, just wanted to give it a shot since i heard the one in socal was great. i think the one i ordered was the show girl and after the bus ride back to our hotel it was cold but still delicious lol. at $20 for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it was a little pricey but i will definitely go back next time i am in lv or la and make sure i eat it while it's still hot!

i'd never seen such a wide and unique selection of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> before! however, the reason i give it 3 stars is because c'mon...they're still <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> hahaha. i also felt like the food was overpriced.

i remember getting a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (las vegas strip?) that had cheese, chili, and guac on top. it actually came with 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> weiners. it was extremeeeeeely filling but it also cost like $9 after tax. i think that <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> should never have to cost that much, unless the sausages are the classiest of all <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> sausages.

pink's is located near ph towers so i was finally able to see what the hype was all about!!! it's really small inside, there's no seating area inside, but they have a small patio, so if you come here on a cold/windy night like i did, i'd suggest to take your food to go!

since it was my first time, i asked the girl working there what she'd recommend! she recommended the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, which was definitely one of my favorite! it was huge! the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was also good! i was starving after an hour and a  half of walking the strip and going in and out of casinos, so i was able to finish my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with some chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>!!! the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> will cost you a little over five dollars! but one order is a lot!

this is the only time i would spend $8 on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  whenever my friends and i go to vegas we come here for lunch.  i love the wide variety of flavors, although my favorite would be the mel b dog; and i always leave pretty full.  i definitely recommend this place if you're wandering the middle of the strip and you want to grab something quick.

the food here is served in huge portions. it's also good, but greasy. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> taste really good and the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are good because of the cheese sauce used instead of shredded cheese. it's a good place to eat if you're on the strip and want something not pretentious. it's all normal fast food with huge portions and tastes good.

being from la and seeing this-- i was like "oh hell yes! no lines!"

came here on a buzzin' night, and i was some-what satisfied... if only i could remember my favorite dog. but instead, i ordered some dog with mushrooms and mayonnaise, and it was decent. i wouldn't say it was amazing, but i was satisfied.

there was no wait, and the cashier was beyond friendly.

overall, this place was pretty good-- if you love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the pricing was pretty cheap too, so this place is definitely a place for those who are low on cash. i wouldn't mind coming back next time either!

turn ons:
-no lines.

turn offs:
-none

my friends and i came here for breakfast around 1pm after a night at xs. we've had earl's 2 or 3 times by this point in the trip and we wanted to mix it up.

 it was a monday morning, so there was pretty much no line. i'm a guac/avocado type guy so i had the kim kardashian and i thought it was pretty good.  it's basically a blt+guac <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.we sat on the patio and it was a very relaxing meal. the food wasn't too heavy and it felt like the perfect amount at the time.

 i didn't think the food was overpriced or overhyped at all (very different than most of my other reviews)  sure you are paying almost $10 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and earl's is right there but its all relative. you could compare the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to the 24 hour cafes in the area and the price is very reasonable.

as long as there are no lines or just short lines, i'd go back and try it again. besides crossing my fingers and hoping it would be free, there's nothing i'd really change about the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i had or the experience,  just like the  singer pink says, "you are perrrrfect to me" (not really my favorite song but it's my poor attempt to be clever with names)

really excited to finally try pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, certainly a visit i'll never forget. i can't even remember which dogs we ordered but it was all just ok not as great as i thought it would be. my dog consisted of two dogs with guacamole, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and onions. my fiance's was jalapenos, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, guac, and tomato,  threw in some chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> too. i also ordered an alcoholic drink lemonade slushy but it was just filling and not strong at all. so the reason i will never forget this place is because we stopped here before we made our way back home to riverside. as soon as we hit the road my tummy started growling and hurting alot. we reached a rest stop on the 15 fwy and i ran as fast as i could and then all hell broke loose! i'd never experienced anything like it. i felt so weak after and we had such a long way to go, do you know how scary it was to drive for hours and not know when the next restroom stop would come. we bought lots of pepto bismol and thankfully no accidents occurred lol. i know this story is really embarrassing but i just want to warn others , stock up on some pepto and if you do eat here don't do it before a 4 hour drive home hahaha.

why did i go for the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>? i don't like <mark>American Cheese</mark> (it's for hillbillies) and....i don't like chili unless it's in a bowl served by my mother....
sooo....i scraped everything off and i enjoyed the after taste of chili on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

disa opted for the <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark>....(or the heart attack dog) lol but she enjoyed it i believe it was topped with pastrami.

all in all i shouldn't have went crazy....

it's really expensive.....two dogs two drinks was about $20....i'm from chicago...if <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> isn't $1.95....i'm looking for the gold flakes!

i got the groupon ($7 for $15 at pinks) so i took the family. overall the food is great, i had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, knife and fork needed! husband had thepastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> burger, my daughter got the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>, it is huge and very messy. my other daughter got the nacho <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.
the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> them selves are big, very good flavor and a nice snap. the chili is bean free and wonderful on <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, not spicy just good flavor, & how can you go wrong added bacon to anything?? we shared fries very good thin crisp shoesting style and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, nice batter but not as crisp as i would like

pink's is a fun place to eat strip side and people watch. i will warn you its pricey, i added a souvenir cup (the small one $13.50) so after the groupon my check was still $42

after the concert and drinking all that beer, a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> would have hit the spot.  i roll up to pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> expecting a great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> experience and a meal to quiet that growling in my belly...  it wasn't.
it was actually very disgusting.  and some how...2 <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, 1 order of fries, and 2 <mark>Gatorade</mark> cost me $23!  if i went to sonic, it would have been about half that price and taste 5x better.
i got the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> about 4 minutes after my order was completed.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didn't even taste like they were cooked completely, and the chili...well that was the most disgusting part...  the chili tasted like it was just squeezed out of whatever bag it came from and put directly on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  it was pasty and gritty, and was barely warmed up.  and the taste of the chili....well it tasted disgusting!
the fries were okay.  at least they were cooked.  they server those skinny, little, shoe-string fries btw like at steak & shake.
also, no person who worked for the casino had any idea where this place was.  we literally had to just wander around until we found it on our own.
i will never ever go back and try that place again.

i'd eaten at the la pink's a number of times before i tried the vegas pink's, and the vegas one definitely pales in comparison to the original. the menu is different! a lot of my favorites from the la one were not available at the vegas one, which was disappointing. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> here are good, but not amazingly delicious like the ones at the la pink's, so i'm probably biased in that sense.

on the plus side, the line in vegas is wayyy shorter than the line in la probably ever will be. i was here during mlk weekend and there was practically no line at a relatively normal dinner hour. it's really tiny inside, so even if there's only 5 people waiting to order, the line will already be "out <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>." there's no indoor seating, but there are a few tables outside. we just took our food and sat inside in the seating area for earl's. (shhh)

tl;dr: if you've had the original pink's you'll probably be disappointed, but if you want a quick, cheap meal, this will probably hit the spot.

worst experience ever!!! this place got me hella sick!  a whole day in vegas ruined!!!   never eat the chili!!!
right after i ate the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, my stomach was killing me.  i had the runs and i threw up.
a whole night in vegas spent lying in bed sick because of this.

i'm a big fan of pink's, being from the la area so i was happy to try out the one here in vegas.  i came here with my family and luckily we were able to take advantage of the groupon deal a couple of weeks before.  all 3 of us opted for the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, except i had it with a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> instead of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are loaded with toppings.  the casing around <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> has a nice snap when you bite into it and tastes just as good as the pink's in la.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> are shoestring fries which i happen to looove.  i'm not a fan of fat fries, so these were perfect and crispy.  i'm not sure if the make their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> but those are also fantastic, just the right amount of breading and cooked perfectly.  it was chilly out so i also ordered a <mark>Hot Chocolate</mark> only to find the gal behind the counted mixing up a pouch of the powdered stuff with water.... boo! oh well, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were what we came for and they sure did hit the spot. 

also, you can get a naked dog and add ketchup, mustard, onions, relish and pickles for no charge... yum!

after eating at pink's la twice on a trip a few months ago, i was ecstatic to eat at their vegas location.  hey who am i kidding, i was beyond ecstatic, excited more like it truth be told.

location:  pink's las vegas is one of the numerous eateries at the miracle mile shops at the planet hollywood hotel and casino.  please note that pink's is not located within the miracle mile shops.  the entrance and entire eatery can be accessed only externally from the shops themselves.  if you know where earl of sandwich is located, walk directly to the nearest doors that exit to las vegas blvd and there you will find <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> mecca.

i noticed that 2 things were exactly the same at this location:  the menu, of course, and the line!  the wait time was nowhere near that of the la location, but i really didn't expect that many people to be waiting to be quite honest.

food:  my friend and i both decided to order a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> each and shared a side of fries with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.  

price:  price$ are slightly higher than la......this is vega$ after all.

seating:  all available seating, like the la location, is first come first serve and is all outdoors.  some tables have a covering provided while others do not.

awesome: one of the best things about this location is that.....credit cards, namely visa, mc, and amex are accepted!!  

bottom line:  i'll absolutely be back on a future trip to vegas!

pink's is located right outside the planet hollywood hotel & casino. small inside, however large patio outside. if you haven't tried a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you have to if you're in vegas. it's fast and easy, but not the cheapest. but is anything is vegas cheap?

everything is made to order which is nice; i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with a side of <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. the bacon was crisp, the chili was nice and meaty, but the cheese seemed like liquid <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>...however, the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were fresh. 

my friend's tried the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and they enjoyed that as well.

sure you're gonna get a salt bomb in your mouth.. but getting a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at pink's is different from your local <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> shop.. they got plenty of different ways to dress your dog.. and the prices are cheap.. it's even better when you have been drinking.. and i fully recommend this place over earl's inside planet hollywood

the bacon, chili, cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was definitely the worst <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had.  the chili was like commercial brown mush neither nice nor meaty.  the (non-toasted) bun became extremely soggy and inedible.  the skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was average grade school fare at best.  and for all that, premium prices.

probably one of the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever eaten.  i had the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  the line was long, but went fast and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were served quickly as well.  i'd recommend this place to all my friends when they go to las vegas.

very expensive for over processed food. i don't mind paying good money for good food but this was not good. the mushrooms were canned, <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were frozen and the cheese sauce was like cheez-whiz. if pinks is the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> of the stars, they have pretty low standards. we won't be back.

i have been to pinks a few times in los angeles but this is my first time here in vegas. compared to back home, which is in la, i think i'll choose the one in la. but since my boyfriend never had pinks in either location, i decided to pop his pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> cherry. whoa that sounded a little inappropriate lol. but here goes:

my boyfriend ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which is loaded with bacon, cheese, mushroom, and err did i mention bacon?! and i ordered the pastrami britain dog which is just a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> and pastrami. holy moly, the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> is monstrous compared to my <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. if you put then next to each other, it looks like umm you know what evolving. boy becomes a man. haha. since the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> and the bacon overload was too much for the buns, it looked quite messy. well, with two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, a side of fries, and a coke... our total was $18. bull!

pros:
-short line... fast food
-addicting fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>
-good portion... very filling for me especially the fries
-opens late so it's good for after clubbing or unless you're a fatty like me and wants to have a midnight dinner err snack..
-they sell jello shots here

cons:
-even though the line is short, it's so boring. i like that rush of excitement where you see people all hyped up about it order a ton of food and end up not finishing it
-very greasy... made my buns soggy 
-overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i can get at costco for only $1.50 with a free drink
-outdoor seatings only
-my boyfriend wasnt satisfied so it made me look bad. i have to take him to the one in la
i don't understand all of the hype of this place $30 bucks for two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and a drink......maybe celebrities can afford to eat here.....but i can't

never quite had the patience to stand in line in la for this place - tried 2x and gave up before the line even curved towards the front. sorry, but i'll only wait in line for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>'s in chicago. we're in vegas, there's a pink's here (right in front of the planet hollywood hotel), there was no line, and i figured it was worth a shot. i had the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> - <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself was very good - well spiced, no "weird bits", and nice snap. the chili tasted fine, but the texture was gluey and kind of unappetizing. i ended up taking most of it off the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. husband had the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. great flavor, but the skin was a bit tough. the fries were great though. overall, 3 stars. would come back if in the mood for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but not a destination place.

after hearing about all the rave on this place--i was extremely eager to finally try the famous pinks. hmmm , so why did people rave about this so much?? i got <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>, containing jalape\u00f1os, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, onions and guacamole ..sounds like the perfect <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for me but that dog was nearly unbearable to swallow. seriously, how can you go wrong with a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>?! even a bbq <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from my family's party taste a whole lot better. all in all, i was completely disappointed. not worth 7$+ tax for a nasty <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>

went to my first pink's of any kind today. heading into the first bite, i definitely did have high expectations, mainly because i was hungry, and also because the prices looked pretty darn high, even after accounting for the recent groupon deal. however, keep in mind that this in in the heart of the las vegas strip, so really you'd almost expect it to be pricey. it's not fair to compare this to costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on price.

when i tried my friend's <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, my eyes, taste <mark>Bud</mark>, and probably everything else just lit up. yeah, hunger is the best sauce or whatever, but every component of that dog - bun, sausage, chili, and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> - was really delicious and made me wish that i had chosen it. instead, i had gone with the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which was also quite tasty with bacon and some sort of enhanced 'shrooms. i also loved the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, which is fatter than the normal wiener, and the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> went surprisingly well with the rest of the ingredients.

we also shared some deluxe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which had a crapload of toppings on them. in hindsight, if i had known how loaded the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> would be, i would've ordered normal fries for about half the price because my friend was pretty much evacuating his toppings onto the fries. oh well, live and learn.

anyway, i've seen the other reviews, and i'm sure it doesn't match everything that people like about the original pink's - which i still hope to go to some day - but it's still good eating. not considering the price, the only problem i have is that i'd rather go to earl of sandwich, which is right next door and which i love to death, so i might not really see this place much at all in the future. oh well, it was yummy knowing you.

i only ate at pink's because i have heard so much about the one in la. it was better than most <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but not anything exceptional. that could have been because i didn't have a special type of dog. it was a great place for a quick bite before exploring the rest of the strip.

pink's is okay.  i like that they have the option to sub a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>.  i do not, however, enjoy the chewy casing on the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  it's hard to bite through and kinda... rubbery.  overall, i eat here sometimes because it's (usually) pretty quick and easy.  i wouldn't necessarily go out of my way, though.

you know what? this place is just as disappointing as the one in la, minus the waiting time.

let's start with the fries. thin, too crispy, hallow. it's like mcd's fries but hallowed out. and the cheese they throw on for the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> is disgusting nacho-cheese type shit that comes from a huge industrial container type thing. it's gross.

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are less than stellar. they don't taste anything better than what i can buy at a supermarket. let's talk toppings. just as bad. why are my mushrooms cold, wet, and straight out of a can? canned mushrooms are disgusting. especially when they're still wet. my swiss is not even half melted.

you get one point for being fast, and decently cheap. and you open until 1am. guys, don't come here. go inside planet hollywood, turn the corner, and visit earl of sandwiches. they're open 24hrs.

what can i say, i am a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan. their dogs are good. the hollywood location is sort of an experience to go to, stand in line, etc. pretty much same food except a little more expensive here. i still like the naked dog with coleslaw. the line is usually short, the service quick and you get to sit outside and people watch. we go when we have a groupon or visitors from out of town but not a regular stop. keeping with the las vegas strip tradition, they do serve adult type beverages (beer, slushies, jello shots.) they also have pepsi products.

came here with the groupon deal.  i already knew before hand that it's very expensive <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  given it's on the strip, so expect to pay more.  had the mojave and <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>.  very nicely done, the wait was okay and seating is limited.  giving this a 3 stars because it tasted good, but honestly i wouldn't pay full price for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.

overpriced for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but you do get a huge ass wiener.

i'm a girl that craves <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> after midnight, so <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> was the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> of choice and boy did it hit the spot.  

i'm glad they were open at 2am  and i didn't have to go looking for a 7-11.  :)

this should probably be a 3.5 star review - but since you can't do that, and i can't give pink's a 4 star review, i'm going with the 3. i ended up ordering a chili-<mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a dog with mustard, sauerkraut and relish. although not the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had, i do have to say that they were probably the most filled <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had. there was almost a bowl full of chili on the chili-<mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and a pot full of kraut on the other dog. so if you're hungry, i would definitely go here. i had to eat both of my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (didn't finish them..lol..) with a fork and knife - there is that much stuff on them. if you aren't starving, do yourself a favor and order one <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. also, if you want to have fries - you can split an order amongst 3 people - they're huge. but, size doesn't always equate to quality, and the quality of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is just a little lacking (not much though).

i had heard a lot about the la location, so i was excited to see that a vegas location popped up at planet hollywood...this is, until i actually ate there.

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were okay but way overpriced, along with everything else here.  it's good for a quick late night snack or a stop and go lunch while walking the strip, but this definitely shouldn't be a place that's sought out, because you will end up disappointed and lighter in your wallet than you'd care to be.

i have never been to the orginal in la, but did have one from the oc fair  booth and it was bad! so to say i wasn't looking forward to this was a understatement, but  it was good . we both got the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> burrito and we should have just got one cause that would have filled us both up. they have great fries also and cost a little bit but what doesn't in vegas.

in my experience, finding a decent <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> when you don't eat red meat or pork is pretty tough.  i had all but given up on the idea of enjoying a sloppy dog... that is, until i went to pink's.  

i had friends in town who were massively hungover, so they chose pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> as their pick-me-up spot.  i usually just order a side dish (hello, fried food) at this type of joint, but then something caught my eye.  a quarter-pound turkey <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>??  could it be???

i took the chance, and ordered the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> with a simple dressing of ketchup and relish.  i keep it classic.  and what they served looked more like a kielbasa or bratwurst, it was so big.  thick, juicy, and great flavor.  success!  

long story longer, i will definitely be visiting pink's again.  great location, great atmosphere (outside seating), and great food.  the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> rocked as well.  bravo, pink's!

for all the hype and love this place gets, it really isn't good. in fact, it was gross. i'd rather go to mcdonalds, at least bad food is cheap there. 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, the actual meat part of it tasted acceptable, but not good. and they were too skinny. skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are for suckers. go big or go home. if i get a dog, i want it to be mostly meat inside the bun and all the other toppings pouring out of the top of it. thats a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. a skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> covered in onions is as dissatisfying as, well a skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> covered in onions. the "grilled" onions had clearly only been acquainted with the grill top for a few seconds before hoping on to the long twig that was my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and didn't have any of that yummy caramelized taste that real <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> have. the pastrami was plain and dry. call me picky but isn't pastrami supposed to taste like something other than newspaper? i've never had pastrami this disgusting. and i've had a lot of pastrami in my time. you can make yourself a better dog for a 5th of the price by going to the deli section at your local grocery store. this was like an imitation that reminds you of a real <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, if a real <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were a gross, tasteless and pathetic lump of turd.

the only thing keeping this from being a 1 star review was that they sell booze. and i was able to finish half of my friend's giant margarita and get enough of a brain freeze to forget how gross and skinny that <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was.

i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!  it is my go-to, guilty pleasure when i am hungry in between meals.  trying to find a good one in vegas use to be very tough until i found pink's right outside planet hollywood.  you can pretty much have any style dog with any toppings your heart desires.  i had an all beef dog loaded with sauerkraut, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and peppers and plenty of mustard.  it was delish!  my only complaint here is that the people taking your order are rude and seem rushed.  the seating is horrible.  we sat outside and pigeons constantly invade your space which is very annoying.  i actually saw idiots feeding them which only encourages them to stick around.  in addition to this, the place was unclean which really turns me off.  i will still stop here on future visits but will get my dog to go.

visited here in may thanks to a groupon. basically ordered a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, fries and a drink. i had some money left over on my groupon so i bought some cookies, which i gave away. i was very disappointed by the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, the bun was dry and the meat was hard, almost crunchy. it was very long but very thin and didn't taste good at all. the fries were okay, but they were very thin. overall, i was disappointed by the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it was definitely more hype than substance.

this place was only okay. i've been hearing rave reviews on pinks for a while so i came here expecting something great. yes, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good but i could've done without it. it tasted like a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> 
& was way overpriced for what it turned out to be! i enjoyed the mist fans more than the actual food!!

was out in vegas for a quick and cheap getaway and  did the casino thing and took plenty of pics but now it was time for lunch after walking the strip and taking in sites.i had a groupon coupon for pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i think it for $15.00 off my purchase and for me it won't take me long .a chillidog,<mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a powerade-large for all the walking.first bite was that snap in <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> that reminds me of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> in nyc off the push carts in midtown or on fordham rd in the bronx days,<mark>Onion Ring</mark> were crisp and hot and the powerade well i needed it.sat outside on the patio and watched the people on the strip go by and as they watched me digg into my meal.had a good talk with the staff and you get that loud "welcome to pinks" when you enter <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.wish they had one near me..**,

the variety of toppings you can have on your <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is pretty amazing (i.e. the different types you can get)....bacon on top, pastrami, etc... weird.... but not too shabby. i wasn't adventurous to try the ones with bacon on them, but adventurous to try a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> instead of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. haha $7 for a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and i thought it was not bad at all. the portion was decent, lots of mayo (which i love) and they did not skimp on the mushrooms. i have to say though, if the mushrooms were grilled, it would've received more stars for me because non-<mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark> just don't taste the same. 

however, if you just want a quick bite to carry you onto your next activity, this is not a bad stop.

eiw. i am not into the texture of these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i cant believe this place is supposed to be famous???!!!!!!!!!

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> has a weird crunch when you bite into it and break the skin.

super weird. erked. does anyone else feel the same?

while playing tourist this weekend, we decided to try pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and see what the buzz was about (and we had a groupon, so that helped influence the decision).

the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> was huge.  holy crap, i wasn't really expecting that large of a dog, but i guess that is why they are $7+.

everything was fresh and pretty good.  not super great to make me want to go back immediately, but wouldn't turn it down if someone in town wanted me to stop in with them.

so i'm not really a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> person but since they had so many different kinds i wanted to try this place out. i had the big man dog, my sister had the mushroom swiss and the bf had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. his was good but messy it started to break apart. mines was blah, i should have just got a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with ketchup! my sis said hers was ok a little bland. so for 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and a side of fries it was not worth the 27 plus bucks i spent!

pink's serves a good dog. but with all the hype i expected more. the toppings are unique and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are good sized, but at $8/$9 a pop they should be. thanks to groupon, the wife and i have been here twice in the last month. both times we waddled away very content. we had a variety of dogs, <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, and even a pastrami/<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> burrito. all very good. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are thick and crunchy. i'm a great fan of windy city beefs-n-dogs on lake mead, so i'm not sure if i will be back, but it was fun trying pink's out.

first off, this is nothing like the pinks in la. i've been living in san diego for a year now, after having lived in la and i miss pinks. so when i was in vegas and saw pinks on the strip i got really excited. as soon as i walked in, i should have known. this place is everything pink and looks like a retro 50's diner. this caught me off guard considering the real pinks is basically a rundown bungalow covered in photographs and the only thing that's actually pink is the sign out front. next was the menu. i didn't recognize a single 'special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>'. the original pinks special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> either have a la themed name or are named after a celebrity. the pinks in las vegas has special dogs named with a las vegas theme. so i had to ask the girl at the front counter if they knew which dogs were renamed and which dog was the martha stewart dog. she had a list behind the counter that listed which special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were renamed but she told me that most of their special dogs were not their own creations, not renamed dogs from the original location. uhhhh... ok. so basically this pinks is a completely different restaurant with the name pinks slapped on.

now for the food. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (with a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> subbed for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>) with mustard and a side of fries, totally $13 and some odd cents. i waited a few minutes and my order number was called. i went to retrieve my food and got really confused as soon as i saw the <mark>French Fries</mark> which are nothing like the la pinks <mark>French Fries</mark>. i made a comment to the person who gave me my food about it looking nothing like food from the original pinks, and a woman, also from la, walked up behind me and said the same. 

so was the food good? yeah, it was decent. but not worth the 13 bucks i spent on it. the shoe-string fries were nothing like the cajun fries (that the la pinks serves) i was expecting but the were good nonetheless. worth the $5.99 i paid for them? no. but that's what you get for eating on the strip. the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was pretty good and the chili was... not so flavorful. but overall i'm glad i tried it.

the verdict: if you're on the strip near planet hollywood and craving <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, this is probably the best you'll find. however, if you're a lover of the original pinks and have your heart set on your usual order, don't come here. you'll leave with a craving that wasn't curbed, disappointed, and with a wallet that weighs less than when you walked in.

call me cheap, but without a deal, i would not have come to pink's on my own account, knowing it's hyped, mediocre, and over-priced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. luckily, i used a groupon deal that allowed me to try pink's at an affordable price.

the stand is located outside the miracle mile shops, with no access from the planet hollywood casino. we learned that the hard way. -_-

i ordered the brooklyn pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. i like keeping my dogs plain, and dressed with mustard. so i enjoyed this dog, but would have liked it even more if the pastrami came out hot, rather than lukewarm.

i also sampled some of the bf's <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> (2 dogs, bacon, chili, cheese, onions). we ordered <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> without onions, but it came out standard, so he brought it back to have it re-made. the cook was nice about it, probably because there was hardly a line at 4 pm, and served up a new one within 3 minutes, spit-free! it was interesting... glad we tried, but wouldn't order it again. it is also best eaten with the wrapper, because the burrito drips chili grease... yum!

with our $15 groupon, we had to fork out a whopping $0.52. overall, $7.52... i would not mind paying that price, but $15.52 is a bit steep for 2 dogs. i'd rather use that money to buy 2 sammiches from earl's inside. i'll be back once i get my hands on another deal!

expensive for just plain old <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. upon arriving in vegas on my previous trip, this was my first stop with my friends for lunch. since my friend's mom had made spam musubis for the plane ride, i didn't really have enough room to be too adventurous when i ate here. i ended up just getting a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with bbq sauce. however, my one friend got a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with bacon and onions while another friend of mine got the bacon burrito. the bacon burrito was not bad, but it was oily. the oil was literally dripping out of the wrapping. i'm not afraid of oil, but for some reason this made me feel kinda gross. although my first experience here at pink's wasn't a bad one, i don't think i will be returning. the price is a little too much (i think it was like $5 for <mark>Onion Ring</mark>? ... uhhh, i'll pass) and the food isn't extremely amazing - i would be more satisfied with a $1.50 costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that comes with a drink.

(+) planet hollywood <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>... *drooooools. it's a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with bacon, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, tomatoes, <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>... omg drooooool
(+) nice water condensation spray things outside so it's nice and cool when you're waiting in line outside
(+) smaller menus placed around the seating area so you can decide before you line up and slowly reach the bigger menu inside

(-) outdoor seating only. and it's not exactly a lot of tables and seats
(-) fan is conveniently placed near a trash can so that when you attempt to throw away your empty <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> tray and lightweight napkins, it kinda just flies everywhere... make it to the trashcan w/o anything flying off your tray? challenge accepted.
(-) <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> looks wimpy compared to the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>

they're messy, massive, and meaty!  that pretty much sums up my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

i had the "show girl" dog which was fairly simply.  i honestly can't remember what was in it;  just a lot of relish, onions, and bacon, i think.  eh, it wasn't too memorable.  maybe i just wasn't in the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> mood or maybe not drunk enough to devour the beast of a meal.

but, besides the food, it has a great location, right in the heart of the strip.  you'll be able to see the bellagio's fountain show, people watch, and just relax! 

so, the meal wasn't too memorable but what was memorable atmosphere of this quasi famous establishment.  like they say, it's all about the location, location, location!

pinks... you've done it again. i told you, i can't see you anymore. it's too good. your too good...

instead of trying to get the craziest <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the menu, i decided to go with <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> which was amazing. (it wasn't the alcohol talking either, it was sober by that time already!) 
i just checked the online menu but doesn't seem to exist on the main site. it might be a special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> just at the vegas pinks (can anyone at the la pinks confirm this?)

it had onions, relish, sauerkraut and diced tomatoes over a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> smothered with the perfect amount of <mark>Sour Cream</mark>. it is highly recommended. 
i gave pinks lower than 5 stars in the past. this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> just brought it up to a 5! 

please try <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>!

so much to choose from!!  so much $$$!! and soooo disappointing!!  i was anxious to try this place because i heard how great it was, but other than the fact that the original cali location has been around for years, i really don't get what the hype is all about.  yes, there are a ton of different dogs to choose from, and the food itself doesn't taste bad, but it just wasn't that great, and definitely not worth the $25 for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, 1 order of fries, and 1 drink that the hubby and i got.  i'd much rather go to weinerschnitzel.

meh. i've experienced better... exactly what i was thinking!

after all the hype i've heard about the famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in la, i seriously thought i would have been blown away by the experience... maybe its because of the hype that shot my expectations through the roof, but wouldn't you think with all the hype, it should at least make me want to come back for more? 

but i'm the kind of girl that always gives a place the benefit of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, perhaps i ordered something not-so-amazing on the menu -- the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark>, i honestly thought this was a pretty good choice!! equipped with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrami, mustard, <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> & sauerkraut... i mean its not the fattiest of the bunch, but lets be honest the scorching hot weather was taking a negative toll on my appetite. regardless of my choice, i had the chance to have a bite of a few others -- the planet hollywood, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>... nothing really sang to me ya know? in other words, i was hoping for more, something more memorable and amazing rather than just a meal to fill me up. i think i'll give the la pink's a chance, but if that doesn't change my mind, who knows what will.
stop here for a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. can get a bit messy real quick. crowded, long line, and the drunk ppl can get kind of annoying, but hey its the strip! all in all great tasting.

i had the ph <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was pretty good.  it's loaded w/ bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and some mushrooms.  the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> kinda masked the taste of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, i think next time i'll get it w/ just a light amount of cheese.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself is pretty huge too (to the point it's almost difficult to eat lol).  the price tag is reasonable, at $9 i felt this was a decent deal.

my <mark>Bud</mark> ordered some weird stuff that had <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wrapped in tortillas or actual burritos.  i'd pass on this weird stuff as it didn't look good.  if you are coming to pinks then order a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, don't order this weird stuff.  that's like ordering a burger at a taco joint lol. 

tip-
-grab a fat tuesday just in the same shopping plaza of ph!  
-pass on getting the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> (rating 2/5).  they were so sweet they tasted horrible
-eating only availabe in the outdoor patio.  so if it's in the middle of the day i probably wouldn't eat here.  just come here for late night eats

i love this place!!! i wouldn't eat it three times a day, though!
