food: amazing! the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> here aren't your average dogs, one will get you good! i had the ph dog and the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> on my last visit and i barely finished the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and made a tiny dent on the fries! their hod dogs are no joke and are loaded with the goods! my boyfriend tried the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> burrito and that thing had three <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and a bunch of other stuff wrapped in a tortilla! took him a while to finish it!

drinks: just because the place is called pinks and they come in pink cups does not mean they're light. they're good enough to get you a good buzz and the jello shots should be called jello bullets because they're so strong!

service: maybe i'm just lucky, but out of all of the times i've been here, i've always had great customer service! the cashier is always friendly and the food always comes right away. i never really have to wait too long. 

this place is highly recommended and also a place where i have to stop by every time i'm in vegas!

i had the ph dog and must have used 100 napkins. it was good but very difficult to eat and messy. i thought the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were average but good. nothing to really write home about. i think next time i will go with a basic dog so i can eat it with my hands like you are suppose to eat a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!  their reputation preceded them because i've heard about how famous pink's is in los angeles and i was happy to see that there was one so close to the bellagio.

i went with a friend of mind around noon.  pinks is right in front of planet hollywood adjacent to the street.  the wait when we got there was only a few minutes but since it was 105 degrees, it was a little uncomfortable.

i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, a drink, and the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  the total came out to be just under $17 which is a little steep, but i guess it is to be expected in las vegas.  

when the food came, i immediately thought, "how am i supposed to fit this in my mouth." (insert that's what she said joke)   there was a normal sized <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> underneath a mountain of bacon, tomatoes, onions, and chili.  i literally could not pick it up unless i risked having all the insides falling off of my plate.  i had to grab a knife and fork to tackle the foot long an inch at a time.  it tasted fantastic and i could feel my eyes getting heavier immediately from the food induced coma the meat from the chili was putting me in.

after i finished my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> filled with 3 slices of bacon goodness, i was very stuffed.  i'm usually one with a decent size appetite but the high fatty food filled me up quick. ...and then there were the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> to deal with.  it looked as though the workers used a bucket to pour on the chili since there was so much of it and i knew immediately that i had to take it to go and offer it as communal fries.  the few bites i could squeeze into my already full stomach were delicious.  the texture and the size of the fries were crispy and thinner than traditional fries but it worked.  

its definitely worth a try and i would totally go to pink's again.

i guess it was all the hype surrounding this place is one of the reasons for disappointment. the casing on the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was inedible so couldn't finish it, the chili was awful and made the bun soggy, the cheese usually buffers this. i like biting into a plump juicy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, this was not. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were good.  
the line was long but moved right along and there wasn't a lot of seating the people seemed to leave in good increments so the tables opened up. 

so if you like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> don't go here. if all you want are some <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a soda then by all means go..

pink's is pink's
a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>
i got the chi style dog
this was not an og chi dog
i have been to chi
<mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> not have lettuce on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, they put a whole pickle (not relish) and they add a whole chili pepper
this did not happen
did i eat it?
yes
3 stars (absolutely no wait)

this is not chicago
this is las vegas
that is not the eiffel tower
nor is that the empire state building

so it's not a real <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, it's a replica.....like everything in vegas.

good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, expensive prices.

nice crunchy outside flavorful inside. can't complain...other than the prices.

but hey you're in vegas on the strip, can't be no cheapass

not too impressed. we had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and he brooklyn pastrami.

price- pretty expensive for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. got the two mentioned above plus fries for $22.
quality- pinks is known more for their toppings than actual <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the pastrami was very thin and dry and the cheese on the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> was <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.
quantity- decent sized portions.
atmosphere- bit tacky with the celeb pics everywhere.
staff- nice people

probs won't go back.

i just did not have a great experience.  i didn't like the flavor of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (good snap, though) or chili.  the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were pretty good.  the prices were crazy-high.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was probably the most disappointing meal i had on my recent trip to vegas.  the restaurant itself is really awkwardly oriented.  pretty much, you walk in and the menu is on the wall one foot ahead of you.  then one foot to the left, are the cash registers.  order your food, grab your drink, and find a seat outside on the patio.  

now, this wouldn't sound too bad in any other city.  but this is vegas.  if there is any line at all, this means you are waiting outside to order (waiting outside in the 115 degree heat).  then, when you get your food, you're eating in the 115 degree heat because there isn't any indoor seating.  

i ordered a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with sauerkraut added.  it was very mediocre.  my boyfriend and sister ordered the specialty <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  they said there were just mediocre as well.  at the premium price tag, i was just expecting more.  but there was no difference between these dogs and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from costco.

advice: just walk a few more steps and grab a sandwich from earl of sandwich instead.

service: 3/5
food: 3/5
cleanliness: 2/5
price: 2/5 - so disappointing for the price.

when i came here, it was my second time in vegas, and i gotta admit. vegas has wonderful food! i mean, everything i've tried eating in vegas was supes yummy...but here... ukkk, seriously?...

first of all there was way too much hype about this place and when i finally got here i was disappointed with the food and service. first all, the lady that took my order was alright, no smile, no hi, no "how are you doing?", just "what would you like?". mmmm negative. 

i get my burrito <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and it tastes worst then weinersnitchel...great..

i try the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> one of my friends ordered and that tasted wayyy better then the actual dish they should be known for. let me tell you. the fries here are pretty good. i like skinny and crispy fries and pink's fries were bomb.

the actual cleanliness of the place? it's foggy/steamy when you step in. the kitchen is pretty much connected on a small strip-like building and the cashier is taking orders from the kitchen...and the only walk way you get is the walkway out to the patio where you eat/dine... if you find that clean, then i applaud to you.

missing a few small features from the original in la, but close enough. the guadalahara dog is always killer. if you dont know how good <mark>Sour Cream</mark> is on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you better find out and pass on the word! the original does not serve vegas crap like corn dog bites or even fountain drinks, only cans and bottles of root beer. but guess they has to make some changes for lv. but overall food was great, but i wish my sister could have experienced it the same way i did in cali. incase your having trouble finding it, its right next to pbr bar on the ground level of ph facing the strip. outdoor misters on the patio.
this place is hyped and overrated. i'd pick a costco <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> any day over this. and, it's kind of a long wait for a friggin <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. gaahhh.

came here on a friday morning, may 11, 2012.

$6 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is not bad when you see how much they really stack on the condiments (chili, onions, tomatoes)... and that it's vegas.  i never had one at the original location in hollywood, so i can't tell you how they compare, if they're any different at all.  the pink's at planet hollywood, though, i'll say i'm a fan of.  the cole slaw was mediocre, but it did make me feel healthier for balancing out the grease i ingested.

the complaints about the firmness of the bun are spot-on -- you will need a fork to eat your <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.

glancing along the right side of the page reveals a lot of 2- and 3-star reviews and i think it's largely due to unmet expectations.  let me enlighten you: come if you want something quick and greasy to fill up with, and don't want to stand in line at earl's.

(no, i did not mention stellar service, nor did i mention cute decor).

worth making a trek to if you're on the opposite side of the strip?  (30-minute cab on summer weekends?)  no way!  unless you're craving a decent <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  if i'm in the area, this is another spot on my go-to list.

pretty good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> . they have a bunch of different <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that you could get so i feel like its worth it. everyone says its the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place and its pretty good but i wouldnt say i would crave pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

definitely would come back here though...

ok, it's not the same as cali and the food doesn't have celebrity names (they have a cheat sheet in case you only know it by the celeb name) but it's the same food. i hate going to the strip but i suffered through traffic and fatties to get to this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> restaurant. we went inside and ordered too much food and sat outside and ate. it was evening and we had a gorgeous view of the mandarin, drunk people, and people asking for handouts.
what's better than stuffing your face with a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with the person you love? i think they sell alcohol too.

don't bother its nothing like california's famous "pink's"

first off if you've never tried la pinks, your missing out. a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stand that's been free standing in the same location, with the same look since 1939. to my surprise i was super excited when i found out there's was going to be a pinks inside planet hollywood.

food: i personally don't think this place is a "real" pinks location. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> tastes way off than what i originally tasted in la. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were longer and thinner, more bread and also it tasted like rubber. 

service: the service is pretty slow, the place is kind of small and it reminds me of subway. you start your order at one end and you walk to the other to pay. i have no idea why people couldn't concept that idea because it seemed like the place was crowded with confused people looking for a line. 

price: i believe in la prices for pinks are around $3.50-$5 bucks, reasonable. nope not at planet hollywood it was about $8.95+ a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. honestly for the quality of food and the service combined it really wasn't worth it. 

ambiance: outside seating, super hot it was pretty annoying. the place did feel vintage inside but it was very modernized. 

if your looking for the whole pink's experience go to la. you won't find it here at planet hollywood.

nothing special

i wasn't aware that pink's averaged 3 stars before i ate there.
i had the brooklyn pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> which is basically "that."
a tad bit over priced for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> imo
no in-door seating

disappointed seeing how i came from la
there isn't as much <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> as the other one they only have like 4 specialty dogs and the one in la it covers the walls with their specialties
the food wasn't as good as la 
might have been same things but it just didn't taste right with me

i went to the vegas pink's based on the reputation of the stand in la which is legendary. i was sadly disappointed by this location. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was barely cooked and the chili was bland. outdoor seating is the only option. it was also overpriced by about double of the original franchise. i wouldn't have minded paying but the meal was just not good. come on pink's! you can do better! i have not been to the original but i will visit someday. 

check out my blog "tales of a flying brick" for more details...

had a groupon and decided to walk across the street for some <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, one of our main vacation foods. service was lackluster even for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stand and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and buns tasted stale. it is pretty hard to mess up on <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for us. i guess that explains the need for groupons for this chain.

i give this pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> 3 stars it doesn't compare to the one in la, but it still ok and it does have that snap when you bite in to it. but it just doesn't feel the same as the one in cali. it located at planet hollywood, they only have outdoor seating which is ok, but the inside is very small and doesn't have all the choice they have in la. i try the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and it was good. i think i just like the old school <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place that i had in vegas. it true the original is always better.

pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>
nomnomnom is what comes to mind when i am in vegas and staying on the strip. when i need to get my grub on, and only want to pay a low price pinks is your spot. 

this is probably the place to go to when your craving a great priced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> or my personal favorite chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> that is about $8, but my lord do you get bang with your buck cause the quantity is ridiculous.  you definitely find yourself full when trying to conquer this mountain.

since their style of customer service is made to order and quick, this is a great location when your on the go cause their have an option of getting your food togo.

with great prices since your in vegas, and great quantities, while having great taste all pilates the same time you can't go wrong when you try pinks. one warning though if your looking for healthy, look somewhere else. with they style of food you definitely can help your hangover you might of gotten when you woke up. definitely try this place next time you're on the strip.

couldn't wait to try this place. my friends love it. me on the other hand could careless for the overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. it was alright definitely not worth the $. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were better than <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> but that's not good enough for me to go back. i'm giving it 1 star because the employees are very nice!

this place is so overrated. outdoor seating only in 100 degree weather is not okay. the food is crap and ridiculously unhealthy.  if i'm gonna add to my waistline, it at least is gonna be for something delicious. i think i felt my arteries clogging just looking at my uneaten <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. on top of that, $30 for two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and 2 beers is freakin crazy!

tired of earl's (impossible i know but after eating there 3x in one trip maybe you're craving something else)? 

there are a lot of different varieties of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> here. i was craving something <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> -esque. i got the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> one and it wasn't bad. greasy food after a night out is sometimes what you're looking for and this place serves it for sure.

this is a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> review from someone who doesn't like/eat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my fiancee was dying to eat here last year, and we just never got there. so this past august, staying in paris, we were really close and made sure we tried it. it was our first stop off the plane. very good, different, original recipes. my fiancee had a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with tons of stuff on it ( i dont even remember) and i had the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, topped with lots of other stuff. delicious and it didn't repeat on me all day like i remember <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> doing when i last had one years ago. we also had their alcoholic lemonade, which was also great. def recommend and we will be back!

i'm from la & i know pink's is a staple to locals out here. but just like dodger dogs, i have and always will feel like pink's is more hype than anything else. there is nothing remarkable about <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. they're good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but nothing really ever blows you away...not when ordering one of their specialties or when adding all of your own favorite toppings.

the kicker in lv is that pink's costs more here! boom. can't say i'd stop back here when there's an earl's so close by.

the reviews on here are being way to kind. if something tastes like dog food at 3:00 in the morning when you are drunk then you know it's baddddd. just look at the pictures. the <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> is squeeze cheese. this stuff is nasty. i had one bite of my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and threw it in the garbage. nuff said.

pretty good, i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, loaded with 3 strips of bacon, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, mushrooms and onions. pretty messy, which made it even better. i have always heard good things and wasn't disappointed. i have heard the one in la is better, but i mean really, it was pretty great, and honestly, it's a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>...my expectations were met and exceeded even. 
downside: only outdoor seating, i was glad i brought a jacket. also, i asked for water and they gave me a cup that holds 4 ounces. it was like taking water shots. give me a break with that, i understand you're not making money by me drinking water, but it's a convenience issue for your customer, don't you think? having to run back and forth 7 times for water in one meal=super annoying.

we got the nacho chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and the planet hollywood <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>. the nacho chili cheese was pretty good, especially with the free jalapenos. the planet hollywood sucked, and the funny thing is, we thought that we would like that better since it was a special...wrong. this place is just so so, nothing special really. also, my bf ended up getting sick after he ate here. we will not be back.

i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> so when a friend told me about pinks i had to try this place.   they offer many different style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> standard, kelly style and vegetarian.  i tried the standard <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with chilli, onions and mustard....wow! this combo was incredible!. the chilli was very tasty mixed with meat and beans it really made the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> taste out of this world. if you like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you must try this place, the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are pretty damn good also.  a message for my connecticut yelpers in new britain.....capital lunch who??.....i'm serious!

i had never been to pink's before, but had a groupon that was running out, and so we ventured out for dinner on a late thursday night to beat the deadline.  no problem, right?  by all appearances, it was just an unremarkable thursday night.  

so off to planet hollywood we went.  but when we pulled up to valet parking behind three stretch limos, and no valet was in sight, something seemed off.  then i saw that we were about six blocks from the valet stand, again with no valet in view.  so, off to self-parking we went, with uniformed police everywhere, to find a parking spot.  at length we found one--the only one.  something unusual was definitely going on.

so, diane and i walked from the parking garage into the miracle mile shops, and walked and walked.  as we finally reached the entrance to planet hollywood on the other side of the shopping promenade, 9 uniformed sheriff's deputies were assembled together, and fashionably suited males and well-dressed females were everywhere.  about then i realized that we had left the groupon in the car.  oh, well (sigh).  i decided that i wasn't going to walk all the way back and return again just to save a mere $5!  so, we continued on and out the main doors until we finally saw pink's facing las vegas boulevard, and examined the vast menu on the wall before making our selections.

this story does end well.  i really enjoyed my brooklyn pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with pickles, onions, mustard, and sauerkraut added, on a soft old country bun.  it included a generous amount of tender pastrami, and although the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was thin, it was long and had a very nice snap to it when one bit into the casing.  beer-battered <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and nicely salted shoestring fries were both good and tasty.  and i liked the mild <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> sauce for dipping my fries, while diane enjoyed <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>.  to my surprise, one single <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> sufficed to quell my appetite.  and, there were free refills of lemonade and all other available soft drinks.  

the place is nothing fancy, seating is all outside, and there is only counter service.  but staff members were friendly and helpful.  we had a nice view of the strip before us, but it was a mite cold and windy at 10:47 p.m.  heat lamps were present, but not in service.  hard driving music overhead added to the casual ambiance.  so, we finished our food, walked all the way back to the car, and left the parking lot as we were directed out by at least 6 police officers.  just as we were turning onto tropicana avenue, diane asked the last officer if she knew what was going on at planet hollywood, and was told, "soul train awards!"

now i'm sort of glad that i still have my groupon for pink's, which, as luck would have it, does not really expire for another month.  for, it means that i can return again soon to enjoy another tasty classic dog!

i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but this is just too much in just a slender bun. it's not even a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> anymore when you have to cut it with a knife and eat it with a fork since it's too much stuff going on trying to fit in your mouth.
the shoe strings chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are really good.

came here with friends who have actually waited in the long lines of the la pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to eat, so had to try it.

first, let me say that i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  and this place serves so many topping combinations it is amazing.  but when you start with an awesome dog to begin with, you really can't go wrong.  the buns were great, and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are awesome.  

can't wait to come back and try more dogs from their wide variety menu.  the fries were a perfect breaded-crispy that i like too.  also, they seem to be one of the few establishments that serve dr. pepper on the strip, which my boyfriend and i fully appreciated.

i didn't think there was anything special about this place, perhaps the one in la is better. we decided to try this place since we have heard about the original location and since it was in vegas we thought why not. 

first the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are nothing special, not horrible, nor great either even with the special toppings. second it's pretty expensive per <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, if i remember correctly around 8 or 9 bucks a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. maybe i'll try the la location some day but i doubt i will come back here.
i enjoyed my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my friend had <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark> and they made her sick.

second best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on earth (first spot belongs to pink's in los angeles).

can't beat the taste of the original <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  loaded <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> was a new experience for us. gut wrenching and delicious.

this place does not deserve to be called pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i would give it a -2 if it let me. 
if you buy a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and cook it yourself it would taste better. 
for anyone that has been to the original pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in la, do not eat here. you might just cry. 
pinks is known for their custom <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, this place uses the standard/<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you could probably find at walmart.

there's not much to say... it's just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the variety of toppings are fun, and it's a great place to save a few bucks, but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself is just not that good. they also don't grill the bun so it's all soft and doesn't support the weight of a lot of toppings.

came here twice during my weekend stay in vegas. food is alright. i had the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> the first time and the mushroom swiss the second. the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> is alright, but i kept comparing it to the one i had in chicago so i wasn't particularly impressed. the mushroom swiss was good, but tasted slightly odd pairing those ingredients on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. too much mayo. some of the crazier concoctions that my friends tried seemed tastier. i had a bite of the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> which was good as well as the spicy mojave which was piled ridiculously high. it's a good spot when you're sick of buffets and don't want to wait in the line for earl's. otherwise it's just whatever. they take card and the seating is limited to outside tables and chairs.

when you're in vegas not many places to eat are cheap unless you're eating at mcdonalds are the super delicious earl of sandwich (which is literally a few seconds away from pink's. 

this place was just a quick bite if you're trying to save money for gambling later or you just really want a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with extra things on it. if you really want to try a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> eat at the road dog's food truck if you're ever in sj.

pink's is entering its 73rd year in business. admittedly, when comparing prices with the original los angeles venue, the vegas spot appears much more expensive. predictable.

not really seeing a deathly spicy option (not saying that i was gonna find one), i got whatever could be interpreted as spicy to some people. <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> ($8.49) was my choice. yeah, you read that right. it was gonna basically be $9 with tax for a damn <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, pickled jalapenos, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, guacamole, and tomatoes.

it looked and tasted like your basic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> bun here. with the larger <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> and an abundance of toppings, it really needed one of those large gourmet buns to even give me a shot to pick it up. fork and knife would have to do.

flavor-wise, it did the job. it's basically as good as i could have expected this to be. great snap from the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> felt like it came from a container. the veggies and the guacamole tasted fresh. my issue is simply the price. there's no way this poor panda would even want to pay around $9 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, even if edible gold was attached to this sucker. besides, i'd take the edible gold and try to extract monetary value from it anyway.

i look at the yelp reviews for the los angeles pink's, and it's around a three-star average, same as the vegas spot. any complaints are likely directed at the price or the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> not living up to the hype. the line's also longer in l.a., so that probably also affects the reviewer's rating. still, it makes me wonder if the los angeles spot is better.

pink's was good for the experience. i can't complain much about the food other than not being able to pick it up. but i also don't want my wallet to have a reason to riot again.

i'm so sorry but i wasn't very impressed by this place . there <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were okay and the chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i had better .  i found them to be a bit over priced . i spent 16 dollars on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and a bacon cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with a soda  which i think is way too much for just 3 items , i tried them twice and both times i could have done with out . maybe i went on bad days but what can i do i will stick to my cliff dogs and nathans any day sorry pinks

i went for lunch the other day and had a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with bacon and maybe it's just me but it was $13.27 for that and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a small soda which i thought was a little high.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself was good and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were good, but a small portion.  the chilli etc was just fair and net net i think it was a little over priced for the money.

small hole in the wall restaurant. great prices. i ordered the vegas showgirl <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it was very delicious. average sized <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with lots of toppings. friendly cashier. will definitely come back time and time again.

famous by name. pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is to blame. 

i've heard about this opening, and decided to check out the store front in la while visiting. then checked out the location n the las vegas strip. 

it was an o-k <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, though it had the pickins' it was overly priced. 

this one is for the tourist on the go - wanting to experience what las vegas has to offer. 

limited choices, which is different from the la location. 

i wouldn't personally go down the strip for these dawgs.

i've heard a lot of buzz around pink's so when my girlfriends and i were in vegas last month, we made sure to stop by. 

i ordered the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> which is a tortilla with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, bacon, chilli, and cheese. while it wasn't bad, it wasn't anything amazing either. i found it a little too oily for my liking (which i guess shouldn't be surprising given the ingredients) and a little overpriced for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i can spend $8 elsewhere and get more value.

in all honesty, there is no reason to visit pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. no reason if you are a tourist, i can assure you, wherever you are from, you have better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. and especially if you are local, there is no reason at all when you have buldogi's on two different sides of town. 

the quality of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is sub-par and the toppings are nothing to brag about either. and the price, holy cow! nothing merits the price tag, which by the way cannot be found on their website. i also trie dthe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which were ok, but then, buldogi's makes their chili in house so there's really no comparison.

i heard a lot of great things about pink's so when in vegas we decided to give it a shot.  it was a cute little building but the prices were ridiculous.. it cost me over $11 just for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, fries and a drink.  the thing i disliked the most was the only seating they had was outside.  we sat outside and had birds on our table.  i had to dump most of my food because the birds were flying around and sitting practically on top of me.  wouldn't go back.

we go here every time we are in vegas.   we preffer them to nathans thats for sure.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are bigger and have more flavor.  its not the easiert place to find.  in fact we had to help two local women find it and it took us a few tries.   the seating is certainly limited and is all outside but the food is always fresh.   the fries are good as well.   i personally like to make my own combination but my boyfriend like the <mark>Three Dog Night</mark>!   i am more of a mustart and onion kind of gal.  the best part is that you do not have to stand in line for hours like the original one but it is kind of cold to sit outside int he winter.

my boyfriend and i needed to grab a quick bite to eat in order to hold us over until the evening, so we stopped by  pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i've heard of famous pink's, so i was excited to try out their food, though nothing beats chicago's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, so i don't know what i was thinking! 

i got the polish pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> which sounds amazing, however, i couldn't have been more off! it had a very bland taste to it, despite everything that it came with. the hog dog itself is just ok, but the pastrami pieces it came with were so dry, that it was almost hard to eat it. my bf had a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> which is hard to mess up, but he was also very disappointed. besides the less than satisying taste, the prices are incredibly high as well.

it's in a great location inside of ph, which was convienant for us since we were staying across the street, however, i will not be back to pink's. i have earl of sandwich bookmarked for next time, which i regret not checking out due to the stellar reviews it has on yelp.

this is fast easy food. there's no real glamor to it. usually there's a short line, but service is quick. you can get as much sauce as you want. i recommend getting a giant pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> cup with a cocktail. 

blueberry jello shots are pretty gross...especially if you're pounding three. do not recommend.

it's a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>...it's decent. the location is convenient and for that 3 stars.

having gone to the original pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in california, this place is rather disappointing. i was excited to come as i adore the original. the juiciness, the fresh and hot fries, the casual seating all come together for a very hometown feel. this place had none of it. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> here tasted almost as if they were just quickly microwaved and thrown on a bun. nothing special. the cheese seems different as well. the prices are also inflated, though i am not surprised as it is in the middle of the strip. the shoestring fries didn't taste very fresh. the entire meal was a bit bland. my initial giddiness of having my very own pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> available any time was completely deflated. :-/ i guess i will have to travel the hundreds of miles for my fix. the original is totally worth it.

so we went there to soak up some alcohol like everyone else on a friday night after a hard night of clubbing. the service was prompt and the food hot. hense the 2 stars. 

however it is worth noting that as a chicagoan i have high expectations for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (and pizza of course). so when i walk in and saw chicago style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the menu i got psyched! wrong!

my friend pointed out that it actually said "chicago style polish." now if you're from the chi you know our polishes are called "maxwell street polishes" and if you're a lil older you may even know them as "jew town polishes" but not chicago style. but whatever. so my <mark>Bud</mark> orders one for shits and giggles. ugh!

he gets the thing and it's got lettuce, tomato, and relish (not even neon green). the eff? no celery salt? no peppers? no mustard? no <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>? blasphemy! 

my polish was underwhelming too. i got grilled oinions and mustard on mine. it's worth noting however that the onions were chopped not grilled in slices. gross! 

so does pinks do the job? yes. would i go back when i go to vegas? sure i guess. but please for the love of beans take chicago off you menu if you can't get it right. k? thanks!

i love watching food shows, including throwdown with bobby flay. i remembered a few years ago that he visited the (original?) pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in los angeles, ca and thinking that if i ever got a chance to try their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i would make sure to do so. 

i was generally disappointed with the overall experience; however, some of the positive aspects of the visit was fast, friendly service (though i went at about 11:30am before a major lunch rush), and hot fresh food. 

i ordered the chicago polish <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i'm not entirely sure what i expected, but was disappointed because when i go out to eat, i at least hope to have food that would be difficult or impossible for me to replicate at home. i have had better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in my own back yard. 

as a side i had the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, which were hot and crispy, but didn't have an exciting or flavorful batter worth noting. 

another unfortunate part of the experience was the annoying little birds that were very unafraid of people and kept landing on the table/nearby chairs expecting a free handout. 

i won't be going to this location again, but i'd be open to trying pinks again, only in la.

tried to eat at g<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> ramsay burgr, but there was an hour and a half wait.  pinks was right around the corner, so we decided to get a quick lunch.  i was with 5 other people. 

i ordered the polish bacon burrito.  the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was okay, the skin was tough.  i liked the bacon and the chili, but it was very, very, very greasy.  my tortilla was soaked and dripping with grease, it was disgusting.  the others that i was with ordered <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, no tortilla, still really greasy.  the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> that was ordered looked good.  the regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didnt really have all that much flavor, it was nothing special.  the fries were thin cut and crispy. 

i probably won't be back, nothing really special or different about <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> filling my dirty vegas fantasies. just kidding! not really. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are my guilty pleasure and when i'm wasted on the strip, i can't resist.  they have so many different choices and mine is the showgirl. so good and they top those babies off well! also, the <mark>French Fries</mark> are on point. they're thin and perfectly crispy. add some cheese and you're in heaven.

man, do i love snapping into a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!  i've been to this one in vegas and the universal city walk.  i think this one is my fave.  my review is based on an accumulation of about 3 visits.

i usually try to tackle two dogs, even though sometimes that turns out to be a mistake for my tummy.  i love the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> ("2 dogs in one bun, mustard, onions, chili, am cheese, guacamole & jalape\u00f1os") and anything with bacon.  their bacon is really good and crisp, definitely not some broken bits from a can.  i mean, this has ruined me for other <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!

if i have a complaint, it's that <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are too loaded and too messy.  i feel like a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> needs to be eaten with your hands, but some of these are knife-and-forkers.  the bun just doesn't support the toppings, and there's lots of clean-up afterwards.  this certainly isn't the worst thing that could happen, and in the long-run i'd rather this than skimpy toppings.

skip <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>! they're horrible! i mean, terrible! the chili was definitely delicious, so if you're really stuck on going here, grab the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and please save yourself the money and skip <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. i've never been so adamant on telling someone to skip something as i am about this! the bun was stale, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself was bad- it had that pop when you take your first bite, and though i know that is the goal of some places that serve dogs, i know that's not the goal for pinks and i'm pretty sure it poped because it was way overly old and over cooked. i'm sad to have to give a place with such a great reputation in la such a bad review, but clearly they sold themselves out when coming to vegas and just got dollar signs in their eyes without making sure the quality followed with them. i seriously have had much better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at the movie theater. i couldn't even finish my over-priced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> because it was that bad. i know i sound like a snob, but i'm not, i promise. i was hungry after having a long day of walking and beers and all i wanted was a delicious juicy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and this was very disappointing. i keep going on but it was that bad. good luck to you if you ignore this and still get a dog, i pray i just caught them on a really really off and bad day, but from what i understand, i'm not too far off from what others were saying.sorry friends!

late saturday night, i was craving something heavy and unhealthy like a cheesy burger or something similar. walked around miracle mile but the burger joint was closed so i found pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the map right outside planet hollywood. the interior was claustrophobically cramped. basically it's where you order and get your food and there are a lot of outdoor seating. 

i got their <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which consists of 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in 1 bun covered with chili, guacamole, cheese, onions, mustard and jalopenos for about 7 bucks. it was heavy but satisfying. it had many layers of flavors but was mild. but the main point is that my fix was satisfied.

believe it yelpers-3 stars is mediocre at best  i gave pink's 2 stars to get the point across.  overpriced & lousy food. $25 for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, fries & 2 waters! maybe i shouldn't have turned my nose up at the tourists rolling out of mac's!  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at costco is better.

i've never been to a pink's before but had to stop in because it's supposed to be famous and good. :-) i went in for a relatively early lunch.

you order at the counter, wait for your food to come up, and eat outside, overlooking the strip. there are notices asking people to not feed the birds, and i noticed the birds are a real problem. one actually got on my table and started making moves towards my lunch. i tried to wave it away, and it actually pecked me. o_o so be aware that birds are an issue, particularly if you're alone.

i got a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with mustard and onions and some <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were right out of the fryer and good. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was good. i ate it with a fork--knives didn't seem to be available for some reason?

anyway, the food was good, but i don't think it was worth the price i paid. in other words, i paid something like $16 for what i felt was maybe $8 worth of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. it was good, but jeez, the price.

staff was extremely rude and food was not good at all. we are really looking forward to going since we have seen the original on tv a few times and we love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>...what a shame. definitely wont go back or recommend.

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> here are delicious.  they come out fast and the seating outside is perfect for people watching.  they will not accept total rewards comps.  i'm used to fast food stores closing or preparing to close before their closing hours.  however i walked in at 11:56pm and they happily made my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

i saw a worker sneezing where all the food was being prepared.  please go home if you are sick and don't spread it to all of us in vegas.

ok so i ordered two <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and although they weren't the most amazing <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i have ever eaten, they were reasonably good. the skin on the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was a tad bit tough but not overwhelming. the chili had a peculiar but subtle taste (not nasty or anything, just something i've never had and i'm not sure if it was for the better or worse....meh).

i will say that the size of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and the amount of fries are reasonable, and can satisfy any sensible eater. i agree with some of the other posters that the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> can get a bit greasy, and also they only have outdoor seating so be aware if you decide to grab something to eat from here. but aside from that, i do think that pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is in a excellent location on the vegas strip. and with the restaurants outdoor seating makes eating at pink's that much better. especially during the more cooler evening hours when the night life of vegas really comes to life.

in the end i don't think that this pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> sells the kind of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that will convert you to an absolute <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> lover but they are decent and decently satisfying. i feel that one of the main reasons i would go back to pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is because of it's location. with their outside seating who can pass up the chance to sit outside while eating a relatively decent <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and enjoying the vegas strip action.

i always like coming here when i go to vegas because it's cheap (ish), tasty, and it doesn't take forever to get there because it's right on the outside of the miracle mile shops. 

i'm not a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>/pink's expert like maybe everyone else that reviewed this but i've been here a several times and never had a bad experience. i either get <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> or the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>. both are great if you like onions and jalapenos. the chili on the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> is also pretty good and hits the spot if you're starving or hungover. 

the outdoor seating kind of sucks if it's prime lunch time because there's only about 12 small tables. 

all and all, 
great food that's reasonably priced. 
definitely going to keep coming here!

we were looking for something fast so we decided to stop here thinking it would be a quick and cheap stop. i know they have more of these in california and i heard they're pretty popular but after eating here, i cannot find a single reason why.

i don't really like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (which maybe discredits my review) but my two other friends got <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and nobody enjoyed their food. i got a cheeseburger which are usually hard to mess up. it wasn't burnt or anything but there was absolutely no flavor and the tomatoes were diced and the lettuce shredded. i get that shredded premade veggies may be easier but who puts diced tomatoes on a burger? it made it really messy to eat. and at almost 9 bucks for a standard burger (with no fries or drink) i expected a little more. my friends <mark>Mushroom Swiss Dog</mark> had mushrooms that tasted old and my other friend got the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. we all got halfway through and looked at each other with dissatisfied faces and tossed the rest. sadly, i think you'd be better off at a mcdonalds.

oh and to top it off some blaring alarm was going off the whole time and no one seemed to mind it or address to their customers that everything was fine or that it would be turned off shortly. i think it was the fire alarm, idk lights were flashing and a siren going. i understand that it may have been out of their control, but i think good customer service would have acknowledged it and let the customer know the roof wasn't going to fall in or something like that.

we had a couple <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, jello shots, and fries here. the jello shots were basically the same as what you would find anywhere else. 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were definitely good, but nothing about them seemed fantastic. overall it was good and very convenient, but not anything spectacular
everything i expected and more. my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was huge and kept me full for hours. the food was done quick and i love the outside patio.

a solid 3 stars. we came here because the line for earl's were waaay too long. a few seconds walk away and we arrived at pink's. there was absolutely no line to order, the wait to get our food took only 5 minutes! ridiculous! thank you for saving us from our hunger!

i had the spicy mojave <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? it had: onions, guacamole, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, jalapenos, <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. how do you go wrong with that? i haven't eaten in days due to edc so  i gobbled that <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in seconds. it did however need a fork and knife to eat, or else it'd get messy. it was delicious and the jalapenos were spicy. nothing special because it tasted like something i could make at home, just throw all the ingredients in one <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my bf had the roast beef <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? or was it pastrami... anyways the meat for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was thinner since there were other meats on it, he gobbled it quickly and was still hungry. both our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> came out to $18. a bit expensive.

we sat outside in the patio which surprisingly wasn't too bad considering how freaken how it was outside. will come back here if we're ever craving <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! a bit expensive but beats standing in that long hour long line at earl's. service was great.

i've been wanting to try pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, since i've already tried pink taco.

you ordered first and find a table outside afterwards. came here around 9pm, so wasn't that busy. fast service.

i ordered <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and it was huge and delicious! so unhealthy, but so worth the calories!  i had to use utensils to eat my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> since it was falling apart because of so much toppings.

even though i'm from long beach i've never been to the world famous pink's in la. i've been to vegas countless times and have never been to the one at planet hollywood either. a friend from florida wanted to go so we did. i had the brooklyn pastrami. it was a classic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with a slice of swiss (i think, i can't remember; some white cheese), pastrami and mustard. it was good. the pastrami did not compare to carnegie, but it was tender. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was better than what i make at home and definitely not the most expensive thing i've eaten on or off the strip. i'd totally go back!

we came here since we had the groupon for 5 jello shots.  i got the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, my jello shots, and we split some fries smothered in chili, cheese sauce, <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, onions, and tomato.  the chili is really freakin good!  i loved my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  and the fries were amazing!  the portion was huge, plenty split between three people.  the jello shots came in grape, berry, and lime.  they were so gross!  probably because they were 13% alcohol.  i did not enjoy them but had to do it anyways.

i loved my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it was awesome with a great flavor. 

the only reason i give it a 4 star is the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were watery and obviously frozen.

eww, this place was disgusting. the bf and i got the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. 

1) <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> - the chili tasted like pureed ground beef. the texture was just disgusting almost like baby food. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself was tasteless and lacked that crisp of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> casing upon each bite. 

2) the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> came with <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with pastrami on top - this was also gross. the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was tasteless. the pastrami smelled old. 

gross, definitely do not recommend.

i've had <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> .i've had chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. i've had <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>. not all at once, naturally.

but i also thought i had bulimia.

turns out, i just had pink's. 

great way to quickly hate yourself.

not much of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> person, but i was meeting some cousins and this is what they chose. i opted for the chicago polish which is nothing like a chicago style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> -  dressed in mustard, relish, tomatoes and lettuce? weird. anyway the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was pretty big and it had a nice snap to it when bitten, and the inside was nice and juicy and the flavor was pretty savory. not bad.

the food is definitely 5 stars.  their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are amazing.  it is a bit on the expensive side, so i gave it 4 stars, but this is no doubt one of the best place to get <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in the world.  if you love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you have to try a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

i was really excited to try pink's but it was not what i expected. while the meal was good, it did not amaze. i guess my expectations were a bit high for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint but i was expecting something more unique.

i ordered the polish pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with sauerkraut and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> on the side. as mentioned, good but normal and bit salty. i felt that i could just buy a polish at costco and add the same items to it myself so it really wasn't worth the price. i really did enjoy the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> though.

wish they had some indoor seating options because it was pretty hot outside even with a shaded table right in front of the fan. a bit entertaining to watch people come out to the seating area and the fan would attack their napkins the instant they stepped out. unfortunately that means a ton of napkins littered all over - big no no
the burgers and <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are great here. a quick good solid place to go to if you dont have or want to spend the time to go to a sitdown place.

i was a little disappointed..... i was there at an off hour, but that sadly meant the food was a bit off as well. don't get me wrong the brooklyn <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had great flavor, and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a nice crunch, but it was luke warm, and compared to the temp outside it was kind of like eating leftovers. same with the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.... good flavor, but would of been better hot.
i'd go again but make sure the food is served hot

i've heard about this place for a while, and finally got to try it. i've seen tons of pictures from friends on facebook and boy, do they look amazing and delicious! 
well... now that i've had the chance to try it, the taste is not exactly as amazing as it looks. first of all, its definitely overpriced. i ordered the "<mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>" thinking the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> (which i love), guac, and the spicy <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> mixed together would be orgasmic. i don't know about what others think, but i thought the guac didn't have enough avocado in it for me to taste. the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> wasn't as cheesy as i would like, and so the only thing that actually met my expectation for taste was the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> itself. in the end, i wasn't even full! and neither were my friends. 
i guess this would be a good place to go if you were craving something greasy + <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i've had better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at local joints so i probably wouldn't choose to come back here if i had the choice out of all the places i could be eating at in vegas. i was overall disappointed with the food quality especially when its priced at almost $10 a dog! if you're at planet hollywood, you might as well go for earls.

pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in la is now in vegas.  and truly, is that a bad thing?  having one of these artery clogging bad boys after a night of debauchery just hits the spot.

we ordered the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>.  there was a lot of food on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> (mushrooms/bacon/cheese), and while it was extremely messy it was very good..  finished it all, and i would do it again.  since we stayed at planet hollywood we actually repeated the same meal after our second night of debauchery.

are they overpriced?  yes, but a lot of things in vegas are.  should a buffet really be $30 or a burger be $16-18 without fries?  i think not, so when you drop $6-8 on a dog, it's not really that bad.
just a cheap quick snack on the strip, nothing special about it at all. not a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> by any means. i'm a huge <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan, and this spot is all name.
worst <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> ever.... go across the st to earl sandwich.

was tempted to give 2 stars, but i think that was just because i ordered something ridiculous--the 3 <mark>Three Dog Night</mark>. it was 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wrapped up in a tortilla with chili. that was an adult beverage influenced decision. whoops. i would give it another try and get something more reasonable.

i came here for dinner last saturday before watching a movie at the regal on the other side of the casino.  i'm from la and have been to the original pinks, so my initial feelings were a bit mixed, but i decided to give a go.    

we had about an hour before our movie started so we figured we had plenty of time to enjoy our meal.  a nice bonus of this location was that we were able to sit around the edge of the restaurant and watch college football in the sports betting area.  i was hoping that my rival college team would lose, but i guess that is what i get for wishing ill on a team...even my rivals.

if there were half stars i would have given pink's 3.5, but i rounded down for a couple reasons.  one of reasons was that the speed of service left a bit to be desired.  it was a pretty busy saturday night and they only had two people working (one in the kitchen and one at the register) so service was slow.  there was a part of me that thought the menu items were a little over priced...but i rounded down more for the slow service

now to the important part, the food:

the las vegas <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> - came with cheese, chili, jalapenos, guacamole and two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  this was definitely the better of the two dogs we tried.  it was a little less than $7.  really though how can you not like chill and cheese on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>...everything else was just a bonus.

the spicy mojave (with sauerkraut) - the extra sauerkraut definitely saved this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  it just didn't seem like much without it, especially for almost $7.  

chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> - i think this was the highlight of the meal.  there was a great portion of chili and cheese.  and the fries were perfect.  they were a little thicker on than a pencil, crispy outside soft inside.

if you are looking for some comfort fast food while watching a game...or many games at once...this could be a fun spot for you to hit.

this is nothing like pink's in hollywood. it doesn't compare. chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were not good. my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with bacon and tomatoes was just bacon pieces on top. it wasn't bad but it wasn't good. i wouldn't come here again. i rather wait 30 minutes in line in hollywood any day

overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my friends told me that i had to try pinks so i did. i was not impressed. it was okay. i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. maybe i needed to try a diff style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  one order of fries can feed 2 pple though.

if you're into <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, come to pink's for some very large dogs that come in a wide variety of flavors and tastes. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are heavily loaded, so bring your appetite!

been to two pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> now....the supposedly good one and this one and this one sucks.
the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> just sucks. it's nasty. make it  bearable by putting every condiment on it and put pastrami and whatever they have. cause <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> just straight up sucks. 
oh ya the service is not that great either. small little place. wouldn't go  if your drunk. just go eat mcdonalds or pizza. not this

saw the place while walking from aria to planet hollywood.  not sure if its the same place but it reminded me of pink's pizza.  so we decided to make a pit stop and try it out.  i had the planet hollywood <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i can tell you it ain't an easy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to eat without your hands getting all messy.  i am a bit ocd and it annoys me to no end when my hands are all messy.  okay enough of that rant.

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> just wasnt anything special and it didnt really stick out.  heck, i dont even remember how it tasted like exactly just that i didnt care for it.  i mean it wasnt a bad <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but nothing just extraordinary.  maybe others have a different opinion but whoknows.  place was dead though... so i might not be alone on that thought.  there was a lot of foot traffic so it was fun to people watch.  i might come again and maybe try a smaller <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>?  won't knock a place unless you try it so come try it and maybe you will like it but probably not for me.

i love a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and pink's did not disappoint!  i ordered the nacho <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a side of <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.  the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were just so-so... but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was awesome... great chili!  thinking i'll try the fries next time.

ok. i don't know how much better than average these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are. buns are standard. we ate the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which had the potential to be a super guilty, but worth-it experience, but it was just that - standard ingredients of a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, and bacon with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>. you can probably just load it up like that at home and make it just as good, or better. maybe i was just expecting more with the hype.

after an 8 hour flight & another hour for the shuttle to drive me to my hotel not to mention going to the airport 2 hours before departure, i can barely contain my hunger...you know how the airlines does not provide decent meals anymore...they just provide a snack of pretzel & peanuts with your soda...

as soon as i arrive in my hotel, my friend came over & went out for some late night snack.  it was almost 11:00 pm so we walked down the strip and notice this small pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stall right before the entrance of the planet hollywood, has a small seating area of around a dozen or less tables & decided to give it a try.  

i am not really a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan but  the menu makes me want to try it...besides, bellagio is right across where you can enjoy the dancing waters. we both had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which consists of <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, bacon& cheese. quite expensive for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> paid around $20.00 but hey this is vegas... you can add whatever condiment you want from the counter...ketchup or mustard or both, fries & soda...it was very filling & enjoyed it so much.  this much i can say...the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a lot longer than the bun....would i try it again..definitely!!!

just go to pink's in la. 
if you can't, the one in vegas is fine. don't cry about it. 
you order from a large menu posted. the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> was godlike. how can you really complain about this delicious <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? they put a bunch of toppings on it, serve it to you hot, crispy and obese-friendly- why are you whining about it? 

thank you, vegas! i love that i can get my cali fixes here. ;)
i love their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> it just a hassle to find a place to park then walk

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> there are good, not the greatest, but i like the different toppings and types of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> they have. this wouldn't be a place i have to go to every time i'm in vegas, but would definitely go if i wanted something quick and easy. the service was nice, quick, and friendly.

unfortunately, it was really windy the day we went so we had to stand inside at a very small counter. it's pretty small inside. i wish there were more inside seating. there is plenty of outside patio seating if the weather was nice enough.

we ordered:
-<mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>
-<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>
-mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>

got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. it's a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with onions, bacon, cheese and awesome. it's messy and delicious. yes, it's a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. if you came here thinking high quality food, you must be trippin. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. keep your expectations in check. for what it is, it's awesome. little more expensive than their la location but it's a nice little meal after a night of drinking.

big fancy sign with the name "pink's" on it? looks like i'm in the right place! not gonna lie, i've heard about this place many times before but i never knew where it was. turns out, my friends were talking about the one in la, but whatevs, i'm not gonna pass on my chance to try pink's famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

anyways, you're greeted by this enormous menu once you walk in the front door, but feel free to step to the side and look at a normal sized menu if <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is too crowded. 

personally, i think that the prices are a little overpriced but it's nice to order a "high end" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with a handful of toppings after a night of drinking. i've only been here twice and i can't seem to recall what i ordered on my first visit but i can say that the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are really good and they definitely put a lot of thought into the different combinations. 

& as a fan of chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, how could i pass on the deluxe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> for a good portion of my wallet (costs the same if not more than a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>). i mean, it's pretty good, but probably not worth the cost.

overall, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are pretty good here but i just wish that it was a little cheaper (i guess it's okay since it's vegas). i can't wait to try the one in la!

almost as good as the pink's in la.... almost.
the pink's in <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> not have cake, like the original pink's los angeles. and for the record the cake is made from scratch, not a box; according to my dad. who isn't skinny, and knows a thing or two about cake. but that doesn't matter, because there is no cake at the pink's in vegas.

i don't know why people are questioning the price? these are not the same <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> as costco! pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> are better, overall. higher quality meat, casing, larger in size, and with toppings. pink's is not in the miracle mile shops, they are on the front of the ph, with patio seating on the strip. so no. $5-10 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> loaded with toppings and bacon isn't a lot. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at serendipity 3 at caesar's is $15.

and if you ask politely, they will do half fries / half <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.

the food was decent but for the price and the environment it wasn't really worth it. you order your food inside and pick up your food but all the seating is outdoors (not really clean especially if birds are flying by).

the portions was good but they place so many toppings on the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that you can't really eat it like a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. you probably have to use a fork and knife to brush off some of the toppings. the food was good but nothing extraordinary.

overall: 3.5/5. nothing extraordinary, but to be fair..it is just <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with toppings. 

very famous place, so i came here on a recommendation from a friend. it's a fast food joint with expensive pricing, but large portions with a ton of toppings. i definitely needed a fork to eat my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it was good, but i think i prefer my costco <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> with some ketchup and onions, instead of a mountain of toppings. 

good drunk food though and right in the middle of the strip, making it easy to walk to. there's outdoor seating with heater lamps and usually someone cleaning the tables. afternoons have a lot of birds walking around.

i am a fan of the regular <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. but when we ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> we were really disappointed. a waste of money basically, i wouldn't order those again and the sausage was too hard. also, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are very expensive. but it's vegas i guess, what else can i expect. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were very good too. as a suggestion, just stick to the original dog, the others are below average

nasty i like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but this was just awful i have been waiting forever to try this and was so disappointed it's over priced and i could go to tj for a better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and there 1$ something extra for <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark> were canned mushrooms and i couldn't even finish it but if ur hungry and here i did enjoy there chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> save ur self the seven dollars and walk away

i had heard about the famous location in holywood, so i had my wife try it.. she wasn't very impressed, but i had a bite too and it was pretty decent. typical <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> if that's what you want. <mark>Onion Ring</mark> looked like they would have been really good. cool people watching on the strip though!
i guess its my fault for ordering a burger at a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint. staff wasnt too polite. pickles tasted weird. good location though. oh the burger was terrible.

cool little spot to get a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the strip.  as far as <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> go, this is the place to get them.  if you're not in the mood for a full sit down meal, or you don't want to spend $30 a person, definitely consider checking out pink's.

pro:
+great dogs.  try the "<mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>" (flour tortilla wrapped 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, 2 slices of cheese, 3 strips of bacon, chili & onion).  it's amazing.

con:
-inside of the shop is cramped
-outdoor seating can get crowded / noisy at times
-<mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> can be a bit greasy

i ordered the original chili <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with everything on top. the chili is an all meat one (no beans!!!). the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were great for a late night snack!!! i'll definitely be coming back next time i visit vegas.

blissful happiness after missing closing time (3 am on weekend) after a particularly great night of winning and drinking and good times we had been wanting nothing but a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that morning and were so bummed when we walked back to find it closed, but months later we came back and after a great night of happiness we got our pinks!!!! and we're not disappointed :) <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are original and delicious the perfect drunken happy food and had a great memory to go with

these are some serious <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! i had the classic <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and it was fantastic. come with a big appetite and ready to stuff your face with sinfulness good eats! las vegas has various great places to eat, but this place is a must!

we ate lunch here before heading to the airport. we were staying at planet hollywood so it was convenient. my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> & fries were great. portion sizes are huge so i would definitely recommend splitting them with someone else. we enjoyed out experience & would recommend for a quick, junk food meal on-the-go. also, a great view of the strip & people watching.

pinks, in la you need to wait 90 min to get a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. here, 0-5 min! i'm sure it's better in la but hey! next best thing right?!?

we ordered the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and bbq cole slaw dog. both were incredibly delicious. the bun was way too soft and instantly broke apart, allowing <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> to fall through (knife and fork time!) but what made me give this 4 stars was the actual dog. it's natural casing had the biggest "snap" i've ever tasted! each bite "snap"! it was awesome! loved <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, liked the toppings, hated the bread (the fact it fell apart, otherwise it was doughy good!)

pricey though! $6-8 a dog!

so i haven't had pink's in years. i figured this would be the perfect chance to put some food in my system after too much day drinking. you know me, i go hard. so i order chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that has chili, pastrami, guacamole, mustard, jalapenos, and onions. i remember this meal costing me a good $20.

i sit down to chow down and to my surprise, i am wildly disappointed with every part of the meal. every individual component was flavorless, and not even a marriage of all of them created anything enjoyable. i ending up eat half of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries because i really grew tired of the flavor.

i don't know if it's pink's or this location but that sucked.

to my fellow yelpers this place deserves more than 3 stars. 

one star for the variety of their menu, raging from sauerkraut to bbq sauce. 

another star for the urgency of preparing my order in a fashionable manner. 

a star for the quality of their food. i received pinks special and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>,  there <mark>Onion Ring</mark> where amazing along with there gourmet <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.
