and the final star goes to the location, you will have a nice view of the cosmopolitan and lots of lights, i was looking around the whole time. checking out the scenery! 

and being a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> enthusiast, this place is 4/5 for me. defiantly worth your time and money.

i finally had to try the infamous pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, even though i didn't get to go to their original california location. i had <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> millennium dog, which comes with jalapenos, tomatoes, chili, guacamole, onions, lettuce, and two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the toppings were really good, and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a perfect 'snap' when you bite into it. just the way a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> should be. now if only they followed costco's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> pricing....

i discovered this place on my friend's instagram, but i thought that i'd never try it because a norcal girl like me wouldn't be in socal too often. however, to my luck, it was fate that my vegas trip brought me here to dine with my girlfriends for a bite. we ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were super crispy and fresh, and definitely one of the best fries i've ever tasted. they were gone instantly among the four of us. i split the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> with my friend since it had two dogs inside of it, and i never thought i'd be eating guacamole on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> until that day. it was delicious! i have no other words to describe it, but both guacamole and chili were great additions to my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i haven't tried the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, but my friends gushed about how great it tasted.

the prices may be expensive for something like a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but you're paying for the presentation and quality of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> combinations, which are all pretty amazing.

disappointed.

visited la's pink's back in december. hadn't expected much, so was pleasantly surprised at how tasty their dogs and toppings were. \u00a0so, when in vegas last month, stopped by pink's at planet hollywood, expecting that same satisfaction. \u00a0no bueno.

perhaps what this pink's was missing was the original pink's grill - the grill that has been around for years and years and has charred many a regular and celebrity dog. \u00a0and hadn't that original grill grilled my bun as well? \u00a0because vegas' pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was just sad. \u00a0no grill marks, and my bread was not toasty. \u00a0nothing special at all.\u00a0

what a waste of a snack given all the other foodie spots in vegas. \u00a0skip this place and stick with the og, people.

it's just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> loaded with condiments.  sounds so simple.  so how good can it be?  well, the quality of the meat and bun along with the combination of the extras does the trick.  while i cannot review all of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> on the menu, the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> was the most memorable the last time i ordered from pink's.  bacon, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and onions!!!  i'm not a big fan of the classic since it tastes rather plain compared to all of these special dogs.  since it opens relatively late (early for lv standards), you have no excuse to not skip pink's.

hubby and i both had the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. yummm! perfectly cooked <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, snapped when you bit into it! perfect proportion of chili so you can still eat it with your hands! the only thing i would change is the cheese.. would have preferred shredded cheese rather than the kraft singles.. but still delicious, and a perfect snack right on the strip!

never been to the original one in l.a., so this is my first time ever. i forgot the name of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i ordered but it had onions, tomato, bacon, and mustard. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was pretty good. toppings were great. the onions and tomatoes were fresh. the bacon was crispy but not burnt. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was also cooked well. love how it snapped with each bite. but, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> by itself is ok. in my opinion, if the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> can stand alone without the toppings, then i'd be wow'd. however, since i've only tried one <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the menu, i'll be sure to be back. hopefully, the next time i eat a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it'll be at the original one in l.a.

this place is nothing special.

you get many options for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> toppings, and the food isn't bad, but it's definitely overrated and there are better places to eat on the strip.

i've been here before, and every time i order something i'm more "eh" about it. the basic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is incredibly overpriced--$5 for one with nothing on it. the options with a selection of toppings are way better deals, at around $9 after tax. pink's is pretty over-hyped though, either way. the hog dog itself was alright, and it did have a bit of the "snap" that other reviewers mention, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> bun was definitely a letdown. it was cold and basically tastes like something you get out of a bag from the grocery store that's been sitting around maybe a few days too long--it's edible but just doesn't add anything at all to the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my friend had a few too many drinks, and even he knew better than to eat the bun, instead eating his hog dog and toppings with a fork and knife. 

overall, it's a decent meal if you want to spend three times as much on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> as you should, but imo, pink's is nothing to get excited about. i'd just as soon pick up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at ikea and probably give it the same star rating. in vegas, though, you're better off popping inside and paying the same amount (or less, in some cases) for an awesome sandwich from earl's.

pink's is... okay.

overpriced? definitely.
filling? not so much.

even though you get a plethora of toppings, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> meat is very thin and not satisfying. it's like any <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you can buy at the grocery store and cook yourself. same thing for the bun, i swore i've had the same cheap ones from safeway and they didn't even bother to toast it.

i ordered the showgirl, which came with bacon, <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, tomatoes, onions, and some relish. the bacon was pretty bad, super thin and way too salty. and halfway through eating it, a pigeon took a huge dump on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. luckily they were nice about it and willing to replace my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>... but they really need to put umbrellas over all their tables. 

i'd skip this place and go for in-n-out.

this isn't your la pink's.

while this joint is emblazoned with the usual pink's decor and the name, it doesn't live up to its pedigree. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> choices don't have the usual celebrity variety and "feel" that the ones in la do, and really, everything on the menu sounds like a different variety of chili cheese or <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>.

one unique thing about this place is the burrito. rather than using the bun, many options use a tortilla instead to wrap 2-3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> together with a ton of ingredients. it's a convenient package and definitely an interesting experience.

also featured at the vegas location are jell-o shots and yardstick drinks. i haven't had the chance to try either, but i am sure they are decent.

this place commands the pink's premium price, yet it doesn't live up to the expected pink's standards. this will still be a place i'd definitely hit up late at night, since it gets the job done, but i am not coming here expecting <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that will change my life. you'll have to wait a couple hours for that down in la.

tip: try the burritos. they're actually really good. also open late!
can anyone tell me where i can get a homemade style corn dog in vegas? <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on a stick and wiener schnitzel don't count. thank you

i only came here because gemma and my mom like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i ended up getting the  pink's specialty - mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> which i had no idea was drowning in mayonnaise. they do not have indoor seating so you're stuck sitting outside with crap mister's blowing into every direction but you. the service was quick but the food just made me feel greasy. they have signs everywhere that says do not feed the birds but of course you have very sober idiots that kept throwing food at them causing this chaos of pigeons flying everywhere. 

gemma got her usual bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and i honestly think she just wants the bacon and chili. we let logan (our son) try the fries and of course he fell in love with ketchup. i guess it's like sugar dip for kids. 

very over priced skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> masked in toppings. i would not come again.

i love their fries! i think i'll go back to this place for the fries alone! as for their main entree, i didn't think it was anything special (i got a burger because i don't like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>). the hamburger is huge though! so if you want more bang-for-your-buck, skip <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and get the beef! 

i do agree that this place is overprice.

delicious!  i truly do enjoy pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> every now and then.  this time i got the <mark>Western Guacamole Burger</mark> (i'm not sure what it's called but it had guacamole in it).  very tasty.  absolutely satisfying.  no complaints!

also, no line!  unlike earl of sandwich which had an hour of wait time.

the bun could have been better for the bun for my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>- the planet hollywood- was soggy and had a bad texture to it. the price could have been better too but that's what you expect i guess with all the foods at the vegas strip. other than that, it was absolutely delicious. would recommend!

my mom and i both enjoyed it. we each ordered a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> and split a fry and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. it was pretty good. we got to sit outside, eat, and people watch. we are not big fans of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> of any type so we probably won't be back. but we're glad we tried it.

i would have rather licked a casino floor than eat this shit. if this is a good representation of the location in la, then seriously shame on your palettes. went here with another couple while nursing a hangover and i ordered the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>.  i could eat mushroom and swiss on cardboard and it would have been an improvement. so much mayo. at least a quarter bottle full of mayo on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with canned mushrooms.  disgusting.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are spectacular!  both their classic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and specialty <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are delicious and more than satisfying; if you're a fan of natural casing then you'll be in heaven.  the menu feels smaller than the legendary hollywood location's, but they have all the classics and favorites, though sometimes under different names.

i developed a fondness for pink's while living in la and i've missed it terribly since i left, part of that is because there isn't much of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> scene where i live, so if you are visiting from a city with great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joints, you may not be as impressed.

i was dismayed when i didn't recognize the menu, i'd been harboring a mad craving for a martha stewart dog and it wasn't to be found.  fortunately the cashier helped me identify the vegas equivalent of the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and i found it, it is <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and i highly recommend it.  if you're more in a sausage mood, the planet hollywood is a delicious option.  i missed pink's so much i had both of these gigantic dogs.

finally got to try this place.

verdict: <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were as plain as you can get, tasted just like a plain ol' nathan's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i got the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which had two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in one bun + mustard + ketchup + chili + cheese + guacamole + jalape\u00f1os. basically they serve a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with various junk you can add on top. 

the fries were really good though. perfect level of crispiness on the outside and fluffiness on the inside.

one other downside is that this place only has an outdoor patio for seating.

way too much money for what you get my husband got the <mark>Pastrami Burrito</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a drink.  i could have made the burrito at home with hormel chili some pastrami from the deli and <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and tortillas.  sorry just not worth all the hype.  the location is great if you want to buy alcoholic drinks for the walk down strip.

i love pinks!! i come to vegas every couple of months and always have to make sure i stop and get a pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. yeah... .most people complain about the price on here...but hey... the only thing that is much cheaper on the strip is mcdonalds! i paid about 6 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was great! they have fantastic chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> too! between my boyfriend and i we usually spend about 30 dollars when we go. the service is great too!

wanted to give it a try after hearing all the talk about it. we went after a night out (so at that point everything should be delicious). it did hit the spot, but it wasn't anything to die for. it wouldn't be my first choice as a lunch spot, but i would go back again if i was craving a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> after a night out.

it's worth a try if you have never been to pinks and it is good, but i wouldn't make a special trip to go.

pricing: good-expensive. at the end of the day, this is still just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>...
quality: good-excellent. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was definitely a good mix of meat and very good chili.
turnaround: good. put down the order, got a drink, found a table, and the order was done.
service: good. the cashier was nice.

i actually really enjoyed the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, which was of an ample size overspilling with toppings. however, at the end of the day, this is still a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i felt not quite worth the price. nevertheless, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was made of good quality meat with none of the processed texture and artificial flavoring as expected from supermarket <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. in addition, the chili that pink's use for their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> taste like legitimate chili of slow-cooked ground beef simmered over low fire in a soup base of onions and other spices. the raw tomatoes threw me off in terms of texture and flavoring, but at the end of the meal, i was glad for it because the bacon, chili, and cheese on the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was actually very heavy for a standalone meal. the turnaround was relatively quick where i never felt like i was just standing around doing nothing, but i would have been more impressed if they actually finished my order before i even walked out the restaurant to find a table. there is no waiter service so i cannot say much about the service, but the lady at the cashier was patient in letting us take our time mulling over what to order.

overrated.... i was majorly disappointed with pinks. i have heard all this hype around this chain. it was actually kinda disgusting. my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was not fully cooked, the toppings were overloaded and it was really not satisfying. if your in vegas there are way better restaurants for your buck where you can find amazing <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the quality of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself was mediocre.. nothing special. it's over priced, unfriendly staff, and overall over rated. in my opinion it's not worth the 12-14$ for a dog!

i tried pink's a couple of years ago...i had it again recently and was extremely disappointed. i remembered it tasting so much better! while the portions are large, you question the integrity of the concept...my+1 who accompanied me on this trip made some really good points! the first questioning if kim k would ever actually be caught eating a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. these days, celebrities are most known for the latest and greatest juice cleanse. food for thought. 

sorry pink's, you'll need to step your game up or i'm waiting in line for earl's next time.

during my trip in las vegas. i finally made it to famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!! 
my friends and i walked past about several times before we actually decided to go and get it. the line could be a bit discouraging. but i'm here...why not try it right?
i had <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> with the works and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. it was so tasty and delicious. hands down the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i have had ever. i know i'm not a meat person and haven't had that many <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i knew this was going to be special when there was lettuce.
we had a seat and eat on the patio watching people walking around. it was nice out and laid back location.  
i'm telling you now..this place is definitely worth visiting and you have to try it once.

do get their <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, which showcases all the ingredients you can load up on for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to scream supreme!

this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> spot is conveniently located near walgreens, semi-corner of planet hollywood - on the outside.  the staff brings <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> out when ready.

their <mark>French Fries</mark> were fried and textured delightfully. 

if you are craving for some <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, this spot is the place to be!

the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> is my favorite. i don't even like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but this dog is freaking amazing. we've tried others but this one is the one i dream about when we come to vegas.

one of the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've eaten so far and when i came to pink's, i tried <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and it met my expectations. except i wished the bacon wasn't cooked too crispy and burnt other than that i give it a plus but a minus for their prices.

pros:
-affordable (less than $10 per person)
-quick
-good location - middle of the strip, outside of planet hollywood

cons:
-seating - outdoor seating. vegas gets cold at night and in the winter. there are heat lamps but they didn't seem to help all that much. not sure if there was any kind of indoor seating available. 

we ordered a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a hamburger. i wouldn't say this was the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had, but it was fine. fries were good.

absolutely loved our food. my husband, whose favorite food is <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, said this beats out all other <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> places he's been to (which is saying a lot). i had the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and thought it was awesome- the chili was top notch, and i love chili. he got a <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> with real pastrami., sauerkraut, mustard and melted swiss. he is already asking to go back.

omg so this place is better than words can even describe! i know i had no business ending up here last weekend but i'm sure glad i did! i've always wanted to try this place out! after a long night of having fun and gambling a group of my friends stumbled across this place! sometimes there are certain foods that taste even better when your drunk and this place happens to be one if them! i ordered the vegas style <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> and added <mark>Sour Cream</mark>! a bit messy and kind of expensive for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> meal but it was worth every penny spent :-) the fact that they offer a huge variety of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> styles means i will be returning until i've tried all the ones i'd like to try!

despite all the reviews, you see this place on food network so i wanted to give it a try...
but i regret it and it was my only meal that i did not enjoy on our trip.

on yelp, there's a free <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> offer.
somewhere on the details, it should tell you the hours... basically there's restriction on the offer which i cannot find. maybe it's on the full site, not on the mobile site.  anyways, this was a let down for us too since we were just looking into snacking here with the offer, instead of eating a full meal.

i ordered the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.
it was better than their regular dogs, which looks very unfilling. their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were okay but it was also spicy onions... like the onions weren't cooked all the way through... the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were okay.

overall, average <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stand... nothing special.

well in a effort to save a few bucks on the strip ( hard) we decided to eat at pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> , well you get what you pay for here
not anything like it used to be
no steamed bun
cheese wouldn't even melt
just a fast thrown together effort for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>
fries were great

wow what a let down. for a day of fun, as las vegas locals, we valet'd at paris and walked over to pink's - there was no line and nobody eating at all. i ordered a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> (maybe that was my mistake) and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. the fries were the best part of the meal - i hate, i mean i hate gray, boiled looking <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> -- gosh i wish it was grilled i guess i should've asked but being from l.a. this place is suppose to be the best so i figured i'd leave it all in their hands....it was a let down and i won't be going back.

i enjoyed the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at pink!  good flavor great snap on the first bite.  we had the chili cheese and chicago style dogs with fries.  we were staying at planet hollywood during recent christmas holiday and were able to visit twice while in vegas.  each time food was consistent even on the late night (1am) visit.  i want to visit the la location now.

you get what you pay for here! if you're just trying to eat on the strip for under $10-15 than this is the place to go. the service is good and the tables are always clean. they have a good amount of condiments and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are pretty good too. i always try and eat here at least once while on the strip. the only cons is the outdoor seating; vegas is burning hot in the summer and freezing in the winter but they have heaters during winter! its a good place, would definitely recommend for a quick bite!!!

nothing beats the real pinky's in la near hollywood.  perhaps i just ordered the wrong things or maybe eating at a second location is like watching the movie after reading the book.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didn't have that nite to them that i remember in la. and yes, i was sober when eating at both locations, so there was no variable to be counted there. lol!  in any case, the vegas version was more glitz than nom-ness, in my opinion. there is just something to be said for the quaintness of the hollywood site.

this review is based on my own personal experience and all the statements made herein are my personal opinions.  your experience could be completely different!

great <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>.bigger than the bun...<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good too. <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were great as well.a bunch of different combinations to have a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with

we weren't hungry, but were tired do passing by this place and not at least splitting a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> ... well that's over with.  we'll be back too.  <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were the size of hand cuffs, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was absolutely delicious.  

we split a bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, it was overflowing with chili and crisp bacon.  next time in vegas will definitely be back.

this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was fantastic!  we came by for a snack.....what a great treat.  the bacon chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was pure paradise.  overflowing.  crisp bacon.  tasty chili.  a crisp and sizable <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  doesn't get better than this.  i liked that you could order at the counter and head outside to enjoy and devour the food.  the cashier was not friendly, and i think they could liven up the outdoor seating area...so one star off.

not impressed.... chili was cold and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was not cooked to perfection.... looked like it was just slopped together wasted my 10$ on something not worth the hype mabey it's just las vegas location ... there wasn't even a line the sad thing is i had a nathan's dog a day earlier and it was way better than pinks

while attending a convention at planet hollywood, i stopped into pink's. i was a little hesitant; 6 bucks for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and it was just good. the ingredients are fresh and tasty. then i thought, for being right on the strip, 7 bucks isn't bad for topping-crazy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i would probably go again!

i was really craving a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i couldn't think of any other place in vegas to get one besides pinks  i'm sure pinks las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>'t compare to the original in la, but i absolutely enjoyed it. besides minimal seating and long line of tourist, i would go back.

i'm so happy to see this place here in town! i've been wanting to go forever. my one complaint is there's very little shade and all of the seating is outside. i ended up going and the sun was blasting us which just made it extra hot.

the food is so good with lots of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> choices and my favorite dog here is the bacon with chili on it. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are very large and we also ordered <mark>Onion Ring</mark> that are huge. it's all very filling and i can never get enough bacon. lots of these dogs come with bacon on them so that makes me very happy. if you plan on visiting in the summer just plan in the heat outside or take your dog to go and find a spot inside the casino. maybe next to a machine so you can eat and win some money at the same time.

disclaimer: i'm not a huge <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan but this place may very well change that. i decided to try it based on what i've heard about the la location and i'm happy i did. it was delicious, the menu was a bit intimating as there are waaaayyy to many choices for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i guess any <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> lover would love that right? well i went the safe route and got a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and an order of <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> to share. it was glutinous but delicious and i'm sure i worked it off by staying up walking the strip most of the night...but who cares about that!! vegas is all about indulgence and you'll do exactly that at this spot. if you decide to eat in the outdoor eating area beware of the pigeons, they love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> too!

i got the bacon chili something with onions and tomatoes. it could have been out of this world awesome, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was over cooked and the skin was difficult to bit into.
12.00 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and bottle of water. be prepared. 

make sure to check in on yelp for a buy two get one free offer.

found this place on my way to fat tuesdays! this has become a secret junt of mine to kill my diet softly lol. yeah im focused to lose weight for my wedding but everyone gets a cheat day and i use my cheat day here. this will be the last <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you eva crave. the things these people do with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> <mark>Chili</mark> dogs and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> will send you on a trip. mhm on a journey to heaven with each and every bite. you come with the munchies leave with the pot belly. they dont hold back on the good stuff. god bless these people at pinks. omg did i tell you about the bread & cheese and how it should be against the law of cooking to have something this good. oh my lord they sale burgers also. you got to taste this. hello my name is queen and im addicted to pinks. ok everyone chant along with me hi queen lol. see you here! lord knows i will be around slurping and burping on this goodness!

i truly hate giving pinks such a low rating, because coming from chicago, i truly love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but giving them 2 stars was actually generous (i originally gave them 2 stars for the fries, but as i wrote this, i realized that fries for $30 plus isn't a reason to give them 2 stars). from service, to the final product, i was beyond disappointed, especially when compared to their other, much more busy la location. i was the hungry, and the only one in line, and ordered 5 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and 1 fry, one chile, and 4 "chicago style". i paid, and stood to wait for my for my dogs to be prepared, 4 or 5 people beyond the line chit chatting, laughing, totally ignoring me and my food. about 10 minutes later, one of the 5 workers starting half hazardously started throwing the extremely expensive <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> together in a painfully slow fashion all the while still chitchatting with his other co-workers, not giving another care in the world, let alone me, the customer. 
now to the consumption of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. i've eaten probably a 1000 dogs in my lifetime, all over the world, many i would say were pretty bad- these i would say were horrible. the bun to dog ratio were way off, which would not be bad, if the bun were steamed and not cool and on the border of being stale. i ate the chile dog first, which made the bun bearable. the second dog, which was there interpretation of the "chicago style", who's toppings were way beyond ice cold- unbearably cold. so cold, the actual <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was cold why the time i got to it (above room temp), and extremely inedible, especially combined with the large stale bun. i wasn't the only one who felt this way, either. since i paid, the other two in my party just politely didn't finished their food (just a single <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>) without a peep, both starving before we got there.  
pinks, don't go opening restaurants in hopes they become tourist traps, because i moved to las vegas last month, and my second day here, i was trapped by this restaurant thinking it was the same quality as the one in la. i'm a local who could have been repeat business for you. my husband works right there, and the disgusting service (that i only scratched the surface on) and food you proved is enough for him to steer everyone clear. you fooled me, and my wallet out of a lot of money. fool me once...fool me never again. thanks, pinks

everytime we passed pinks, we told ourselves that we were going to try it, we finally did. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were ok, they were a bit dry....it's probably due to having <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> out for too long or over cooked. it almost taste like rubber. on the other hand their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were really really good! they were very well loaded!

they overcharge you purposely. check your receipt carefully. i ordered two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and water. i checked the receipt after eating and saw i got charged for a combo and soda. there was no line when we ordered. so it was obvious he just wanted to slip in the extra charge. hope the extra $2 you earned / overcharged us is worth this 1 star review. not smart mr pinks.

love pinks! the only down side to this place and the one in l.a. was the menu was different. i attempted to order the tamale smothered with chili and cheese, it was a no-go! however, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were delightful and the staff was super friendly!!! i sat on the patio and people watched, why not?! it's the vegas strip this spot is perfect for taking a break from the bustle. you can never go wrong ordering a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> here, they have several varieties on their menu

i stopped here for a quick snack while i was in vegas.  i'm vegan and supposedly their <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> is highly rated.  

it was around 2pm on a monday afternoon when i stopped in and luckily there were only a couple people ahead of me.  the wait was minimal.  from the time i got in line to receiving my dog, it was 5-10 min max.

my order was pretty basic.  <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> with ketchup, mustard and relish.  my dog plus a bottle of water was $9.00.  logical price for a snack on the strip!

the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> was great!  taste and texture were both right on.  i was pleasantly surprised!  they're known for having great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and they didn't disappoint on the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> either!  

i have walked past here when the line is insane, so just keep that in mind if you plan on going.  no indoor seating, only outdoor patio with table umbrellas for shade.  it was about 90 degrees the day i went, but i was still comfortable with the shade.

really nice staff. i feel like these are designer dogs. lol. they're pretty good, but  something about the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was weird. all the toppings kinda fell off my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> too. so i was left with a rubbery salty flacid stick. lol.

luckily we did not have to see a kardashian there. ;^) 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are extra long, and skinnier than a chicago-dog guy is used to eating. 

the meat is very tasty, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> have a good, crisp casing that makes each bite "pop" when you break the casing. 

the menu contains a huge list of "celebrity" dogs, one assumes that each is catered to the taste of the given celeb. these combinations range from "sounds good" to "absurd". 

i like my dogs two ways, if it is a <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> then it's "through the garden". any other dog i like with just yellow mustard and sweet relish.  

since the pink's dogs are made to have tons of ingredients heaped on them, the bun is oversized, providing twice the amount of bread than you need for the relatively skinny little dog hidden underneath. 

my dog came with about a cup (4 oz) of relish on it!! i scraped off most of it and then ate what was a very tasty dog. 

the <mark>French Fries</mark> are perfect - they had a nice crispy exterior with a wonderful almost creamy interior, perfectly cooked and a nice big serving - enough for two.  great potato flavor and not greasy. they are a nice size, about 3/8" square, which also helps the perfect cook and flavor. 

the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. wow.  the best i have ever eaten - and i don't say that lightly! they remind me of my grandfathers rings he served at carnivals in the 60s when he had a corn dog wagon he took around to fairs. 

the batter appears to be some sort of beer batter, and it is crunchy and crisp and melts in your mouth. the onions are sweet and perfectly cooked, tender....perfect. 

i hate it when you get an <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and take a bite only to pull out half of an undercooked onion that flops down on your chin, splashing hot grease and water on your shirt. not going to happen at pinks! 

the serving size on the rings was again more than enough to share for two. 

i am going with a 3 star, just because the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> should be the star here, and it really is not - the sides are some of the best you are going to find, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are tasty. 

price wise, it is a little high for a dog and fry place, but the location i went to is vegas and, well, you know. 

very enjoyable, casual place to stop and people watch on the strip just outside of planet hollywood.

there is nothing special about this place. honestly, it's just overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint to me. well, i got to give them some credit of overachieving. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> came with topping above topping. beside that, this place is a ok.

my husband loves <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, so for his birthday we went there before we went to a show.......hey it was his birthday........that being said....we didn't have any line at all, but when we got our order, my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was cold, i am not a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> lover by any means, but honestly i have had a better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at dairy queen.

you wouldn't believe how difficult it is to locate a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> restaurant on the vegas strip that carries vegetarian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. we went to three different places on our hunt and were unable to find any place that carried such a thing. i get it, most veggie wieners are pretty bland and "adequate" would be a stretch for quality, but most of us who eat them know this and have found ways to make them appealing. when you don't carry any vegetarian options for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you lose out on our business, plus any business that might come with those non-vegetarians that are with us!

fortunately after an hour of searching, we stopped in at pink's and they had a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> listed on their menu!  yay!  i ordered one, dressed as a <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> and my partner ordered a beef <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with minimal toppings. we skipped out on fries as we just wanted a light snack, but we did each get a drink (beer and cider in cans). 

we sat outside in the awesome weather and dug in. my <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> was covered in amazing toppings and was delicious. i had to get a fork to clean up the bits that dropped out, i didn't want to leave anything behind. my partner enjoyed his meal as well, and we were able to leave knowing that we both got exactly what we wanted.

thanks for carrying a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> when very few others are pink's!

i love me a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. but i also like being able to eat said <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. and that did not happen here at pink's. 

i ordered myself <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. this thing was so over the top ridiculously stacked with toppings. i tried. believe me. you are literally unable to eat this thing the way you're supposed to normally eat a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i got nearly halfway through it with only slight spillage. then all of a sudden, it just exploded on me and i lost everything. i got cheese and guacamole everywhere. my hands looked like i just got done fingerpainting. just a complete mess.

it's a nice novelty, but i probably won't ever be back. not my cup of tea.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are my favorite <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! it's nice to be able to grab one in vegas during late night. it's pretty comparable to the original one in hollywood. same great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, same great chili, same great kraut, same great fries. 

i do wish that they had the celebrity names associated to the one in vegas to help me order! i have no clue what comes on mine, but i know i like the rosie o'donnell. i had to guess/try to make it up... chilli, sour kraut...not sure what else? 

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were also delicious and very reminiscent of the great ones at the la location. 

the patio is right on the strip in front of planet hollywood and is a great place to people watch no matter the time of day!

wow, has it really been 5 years since my last review at pink's??  well, other than satisfy my craving for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, nothing's really changed from my last experience here except for the prices which have increased since then.

chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> -- http://bit.ly/1fssnto
mustard, relish, lettuce & tomatoes
the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good but it was basically a salad on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  because it's on their classic dog side of the menu, the price wasn't too bad but still pricey though for what i got.  i guess i probably should've ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (http://bit.ly/1jikjji) again because at least it has more of a 'wow' factor.

for convenience on being right on the strip, i like pink's.  but i think i'd rather get my gourmet <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fix off the strip at buldogis or even at g<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> ramsay burgr.

contrary to all the hype, i was honestly a bit sad that i was not that impressed with pink's.

i would have to say that you'd be better off going to costco for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the quality of the wieners that are utilized are not the best. with all the added heavy toppings like jalapeno's and chili, in my case, i ended up just feeling like my arteries had been clogged.

i'd have to say that my experience here was neither good or bad. there were many different style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the menu to choose from. the cashier was super friendly and inviting. we ordered a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and a <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, both of which were under $8 each. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i have to say in my opinion were bland. i don't think the flavors were anything exciting or memorable. i was most disappointed with my mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> because i felt the mushrooms were too rubbery and flavorless. however, it was nice to sit outside with the water mist to cool us down.

my bf and i made a foodie bucket list and i had come across pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was a must add! we got here a little before they closed on a friday night. it is located outside the miracle mile in planet hollywood on the las vegas strip. 
as we waited in line their were a fair amount of people in front. the older gentlemen in front of us willingly gave us some advice. he said the pink's in la is tastier but it is very good here as well, also if you get one dog it's plenty. wow! i'm telling my bf this guy has got me looking forward to this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it's been long overdue since i've even eaten one.
so we ordered two <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> add jalape\u00f1os please! yum. the wait was not long at all such a plus especially when we are acting and feeling like we haven't eaten for days. we grabbed a seat on their patio outside, great view. the bellagio and cosmo are across the street so the view was beautiful. if you're lucky you can see the water show. took my first bite and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was skinny.. i was expecting something meatier i guess? tasted like a typical <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with jalape\u00f1os. no wow just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with accessories. i was fairly disappointed but i definitely still ate it, it's still a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! haha we looked at each other after we finished and laughed saying "i could definitely eat another one" the man who said one would be enough wasn't! we didn't get another because it was mediocre and it was almost $8 a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. overall my experience was good but the quality, taste and price.. very disappointing.

it's tuesday night, my bf and i decided to walk the strip to check off some vegas vacation must-do's. we started our night grabbing some fat tuesdays at the mirage and doing the usual vegas strip exploring. we were walking for some blocks now, and realized that we were smelling some delicious meat from somewhere nearby, funny because we had been having some cravings for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> lately. we walk across the street to planet hollywood and are trying to figure out where the smell is coming from. can you tell how buzzed we were at this point?? lol. anyways, behold-- pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> right in front of us. yes! we didn't hesitate to order. we both ordered the classic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, no toppings, except ketchup for me, and mayo for him, and a side order of some fries. we received our food fairly quickly, and the employees were very nice. first thing we noticed was how huge these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were, without any extra toppings. we dig in, and damn these were soooooo good!!!! crunchy sausage, warm bun, so perfect. the fries were also delicious. that is literally all we wanted to eat the rest of the weekend, and we even swore we'd go back before we flew back home. sure enough, after a great night at xs, we couldn't wait to go back to pinks, in fact we went back, ordered the same thing, twice, that's right we got seconds, after our seconds. it's fast, a very reasonable price for what you are getting, and the perfect drunk food. i definitely recommend it when you're in town. i'm so sad there is none in northern california/bay area, hopefully we see one soon.

i can't believe i live in los angeles and my first time was at the vegas location. i tried the polish pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and it was absolutely delicious. it's a small store with a seating area for ~20 people. the prices are fair for the strip and the portions are big. i usually never crave <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but it's been less than a week since i tried pink's and i already want to try the los angeles location!

not impressed. spent $24 for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries
i ordered and <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with bacon and cheese. for a $10 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i expect more than a slice of american yellow cheese. $4 fries were good though. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was really salty
worst <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever eaten. undercooked sausage, bad quality buns. this place is only standing on it's location on the strip. avoid at all costs.

there are <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, then there's pink's. the difference is in the quality and taste.
i don't feel right calling what they serve at pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> because you can buy a pack of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for $1. what they serve at pink's are premium sausages on buns with an assortment of toppings.
i dropped in at the planet hollywood location while vacationing in vegas.

we were starving and only had 45 min before jeff dunham started so we got <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and took it back to our room! they were great and the cashier mad a combo to save us money without us asking. i like that! they have a hard frozen lemonade there that was the best frozen drink i had in vegas. we got the showgirl (no relish) and <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. we ate the whole thing. we will be back next time we are in vegas and will absolutely  get my frozen drink there instead of the other syrupy sweet places.

i'll make it short. i was disappointing that they didn't have the same menu as the one in los angeles. i didn't enjoy my food because of it. even writing this right now bummed out. it's just... i wanted to buy a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with the celebrity made ones so my mother could try it, but they just had the standard one. the taste to the ones in l.a. where somewhat close to the taste, but very far away. i wouldn't go here again because it just feels like a cosmetically made <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i mean look at whos being advertised... mel b, kim kardashian and holly madison. bunch of whores. that made my meal worse. just could not enjoy the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at all. ordered a show girls dog and a <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. :(
dunyada en ama en sevdigim <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! i\u00e7i juicy d\u0131s\u0131 h\u0131\u015f\u0131r chili li denemeni tavsiye ederim;)

i was a in the mood for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> while on my stay, and made a stop at pinks. delicious <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with bacon! only complaint is seating sucks! not the cleanest outside either. on the pricer side i've ever paid for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but over all good eats.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in vegas repeats the formula from the original la store. good enough sausage variations, good ingredients, cool store and friendly staff. some people tastes and experience vary but i never had anything to complain here.

chicago is a good option to try, and for more traditionalists, there is always cheddar and chilly options!

a good decent <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. a great spot to stop, take a break, and watch pedestrians. i mean, it is on the vegas strip next to the "miracle mile" shops?! basically, i could have walked down the street and gotten a $3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from nathan's famous and been equally as satisfied. probably wouldn't return.

i have tried the original pink's, in los angeles, once.  since i am in vegas much more than la i was excited to see one open.  it is just like the original minus the pesky birds who will steal your food if you don't beat them away.  the draw here is the toppings.  the actual <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is skinny but long and you are paying for the toppings, which they pile on.  they also have other sausage/bratwurst options, which are quite delicious as well. i have had several different options and they have all been quite delicious.

i wanted to see what the fuss was all about with pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.   

the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> at planet hollywood was   awesome.  it was just loaded with tomato,  cheese,chili, <mark>Sour Cream</mark> and onions. the chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was a difficult task just trying to keep it together while eating it.  it was good but nothing special! not really  worth the $8.50? it's on the strip so i'm not going to complain on the price.

so yeah, we spent about $16 on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and a drink .  sounds expensive, but now at least i got to experience what  pink's has to offer, just wish i knew what all the excitement was about  maybe next time i'll give their <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark> a try.  looks really yummy! 

it was alright!

every time i hit vegas, i go to pinks now. they take <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to another level. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are worth it, and the 3 <mark>Three Dog Night</mark> is my fav <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> selection they offer. street level seating mid strip. perfect location.

why did i ever think it would be anything close to what i extremely enjoy in l.a.. rhetorical!!! my bad. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was less then room temp. their was barely any chili in the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>. they must know it's embarrassing and that's why theirs a wall that doesn't allow you to see your order being prepared. this is not pinks at all. pinks family you set the bar really high many years ago. i absolutely believe you should have stuck with the original idea of never trying to duplicate what you have already mastered in l.a.. i apologize for not proving my loyalty and stepping foot in your disappointing attempt of a mirror.

great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausage dogs.  large portions.  good fries.  if your looking for good comfort food then this is the place.  this is not a fancy place however.  stand in line, get your food, and sit outside and enjoy the people watching.
best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had in my whole life. definitely a place to visit while you're in vegas.

we tried 4 different dogs and they were ok at best. the buns weren't super fresh and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> themselves didn't taste great. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were covered with toppings which probably helped to hide the bad taste of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. but they had a wide selection and various types of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausages to pick from.

this was another cheap place to have lunch and it was close to the hotel (planet hollywood) which we where staying at while in vegas. they had a number interesting <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. we decided to get the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which was awesome and the and the ruben dog which was really good and a order of <mark>Onion Ring</mark> which you can't go wrong with. this place was a nice little find and the service was fast. 

seating was restricted to outside only which was ok they did have the heat warmers which made it better the only down fall was there was a lot of birds that where always around but they weren't to bad. it was a nice place to have a quick cheap lunch and just enjoy some people watching. i really don't think you could find a bad dog on the menu as it was a pretty large menu! i will definitely be back!

definitely not the awesome experience that i had with the pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i tried in la.  the place in planet hollywood is of course cleaner and newer.  but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i ordered (with pastrami, <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> and mustard) was nothing special.  what i thought was surprisingly good were their <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.

my friends that i went to eat with all had similar reactions. (one ordered the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>-based dog, which he said was overcooked and dried).

maybe it is new and they are still trying to get up to speed, but just under $8 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! not including any beverage, that is totally not worth going back to try again, no matter how much i miss the pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from la.

had to see if this place lives up to par with the infamous pink's in la. i actually kind of missed the special celeb dogs from la.. this place only had 3-4 specials: the kim kardashian, holly madison, and 2 others that i can't remember at the moment because they are probably insignificant. i ended up getting a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> and chili which was good, but definitely not worth $7. but whatever, a meal is a meal. and i was fed and happy.

i had the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> (figured i should counter all the grease and calories with the lettuce, tomato, and relish that comes on this dog), almost like a mini salad on top of my <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>! it was ok except for the fact that my bun completely fell apart, thus defeating the purpose of eating a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my friend had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, which i had a bite of and really enjoyed. the bacon added just the right amount of salty goodness. the fries here were really tasty, and although we didn't order <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, almost every other table around us had them so i'm guessing they're popular. 

what is nice about this place is its location on the strip and the outdoor seating. a great place to people-watch and enjoy the weather. as a sun-starved seattleite, it was nice to be able to get some vitamin d and uv rays in since most of our vegas cavorting usually happens at night.

if you want yummy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries, or just some hangover food that hits the spot, i'd recommend. if you're a tourist in vegas and are trying to experience pink's in the city of sin, this surely isn't it. too clean, too friendly, too flashy. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and dirtiness, and hour-long wait in line that you'll find at the original pink's in la is what makes it special, for better or for worse.

dude, it's pink's...in vegas. my two favorite things in the world. ok, i really don't feel that way. but if i was a surfer dude from redondo beach out with my <mark>Bud</mark> for a vegas weekend, this would certainly be my dining destination of choice. since i'm not, i guess i can be a little more discriminating. but dude, it's pink's. well not quite pink's. just a reasonable facsimile in an apt setting, planet hollywood. 

jamie w. and i really wanted some dogs after strolling through the sterile city center complex which has none of the kitsch that really is vegas. luckily, pink's has kitsch to spare in its patio setting outside the hotel entrance. the menu looked familiar. we decided to each get a $4.75 giant 12-inch jalapeno dog with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> and chili, and share a $6.50 "planet hollywood" dog, which consisted of a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, bacon and cheese (see photos). oh did i mention the fries, too? nice and tasty they were. 

indigestion thy name is pink's. the jalapeno dog has that snap to the wiener that i don't care for much. i prefer a meatier dog to the tooth, and the mustard was way overwhelming, but chili, cheese and diced onions are bulletproof on a dog as far as i'm concerned. the "planet hollywood" dog has quite a pile of toppings to maneuver in your mouth starting with the bacon strips lording over the sausage already drowning in melted cheese. the mushrooms seemed almost incidental to the creation, but they were good. hell, it was all good in a bad, bad way. 

food - 3 stars....quite an abundance of toppings on those dogs but not quite the pink's i remember in la 
ambiance - 2 stars...hell, it's just a patio...in pink 
service - 2.5 stars...just keep moving the line and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> will eventually be there 
total - 3 stars...a middling experience based on a distant memory of the pink's in la

i couldn't believe it!  pink's on the las vegas strip?  how have i not noticed this before on my other visits?  i thought pink's was strictly a l.a. phenomenon.  well, finally, i was going to have my chance to try them.  

so, maybe i just didn't order correctly.  i had their <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> which came with chili, finely chopped vidalia onions, and liberal use of american style mustard.  the bun was not particularly substantial, so there was no way to eat the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in the traditional way.  resorting to using a plastic knife and fork, i took my first bite.  really?  the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was just okay.  the chili was a touch deplorable, and while i enjoyed the sweetness from the onions, i thought the mustard a little too heavy handed.  for similar reasons, my order of <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were less than remarkable.  but there was one saving grace.  i tried natasha's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and thought it was pretty tasty.  apparently i just failed to order what they are famous for.  the ambience is good though being centrally located on the strip with plentiful outdoor seating.

on my last day in vegas, i went on a search for this pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> as i was told by my girlfriend that their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are suppose to be really good.  i guess it is more than a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it's an experience.  well...experience is the right word for it.  they not only have regular dogs, but they have specialty dogs as well with everything imaginable on top.

first...the entrance to pinks is from the sidewalk on the strip.  i was parked in the back parking garage, so coming from the backside of the miracle mile, i was lost.  i thought pinks was inside or would have an entrance from the inside.  they do not.  i walked around for about 20 min. trying to find it before i realized it was outside.

looking over the menu i just didn't want to have an old fashioned <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i wanted to try one of their special dogs.  i ordered up a <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with cheese sauce, mushrooms, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and bacon.  they have a list of other dogs as well for anything you are craving.  my order arrived and i was ready to eat.  

well...it was an experience that's for sure!  trying to eat this huge dog with all the toppings gave a new meaning to messy!  i had to finish with a fork because it was just too much!

while the prices of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are a bit high ($8 for my ph dog), it's a good place to try a specialty dog while you are in vegas.  would i try it again?  possibly...

was walking the strip when i saw this place. "ohh pinks! that's that famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> spot in la where all the celebrities go and people line up for 2 hours to get a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!" situated right in front of planet hollywood, i knew i just to get one of those wonderful meats encased in tube form, as anthony bourdain would say...lol. the place itself is really small, you order, slide down to the left to pick up your food, and there's an outdor patio where you can eat. there's a quite extensive menu including not only <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but burgers as well and a myriad of toppings...the most familiar being chili and cheese to the exotic of avocado and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>. i went with the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, onions, cheese, and bacon. it was hearty and delicious. a lil pricey at around $8 but i think it was worth it....will definitely be checking out other menu offerings the next time i'm in vegas!

my bf and i had been walking the strip and were tired and thirsty and hungry and about done for the day. we saw pinks while crossing over from aria/crystals. i was really trying to be good that day so we decided if we were going to eat @ pink's we needed to split one. we had been to the location in la and wasted our entire day waiting in line for over 3 hrs . by that time it was already dark and it was time to go home. dang it. so since we enjoyed pinks (somewhat) in la we decided to get something new. we went w/ the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. nothing fancy or speciality. omg either that was the best bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> i've ever had or i was starving. wait.. that was the 1st and only bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> i've ever had.  it was really good... i'd def. order again but nxt time i'd get something with <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> or italian sausage. ;)

this place is the shizzle!  i was craving a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> especially after drinking a yard stick from fat tuesday.  so my friends and i head over here and to my surprise, there were only 4 people in line!  
my friend tells me the kim kardashian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> looks good and she was right!  the kim kardashian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with cheese, bacon and mushrooms.  ohh my gawd!  it was frickin awesome!   the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was juicy with nice snap.  the bacon was off the hook.  and the cheese just enough to get everything wet.  
now in my drunk state of mind, i'm thinking i can eat like a champ, so i also order a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with no mustard and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>!  what the heck was i thinking!  thank god my friends were there to eat half my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and half the fries.  
either way, everything they had was sooo good!  definitely coming back here next time i'm in vegas.

i forgot the name of my order, but i do remember what was in it!  <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> and bacon!  sounded like an amazing combination on paper.  mushrooms, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and bacon??  some of my favorite things!  the reality of it however did not blow me away.  it was a good late night snack for a hungry gal beginning to sober up, but in all honesty i wish it'd been better, especially for the $8.50 i paid for it.

comparing to the la pink's, this place is only so-so. but, after a long day of walking up and down the strip with no food, this place makes for a decent, quick, & filling dinner. though not necessarily cheap. but if you're comparing to a lot of other places on the strip, with the exception of mcdonalds, you're not going to really find anything cheaper than this place.

my friend got one that had 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with chili, cheese, onions, and guacamole. she loved the topping combinations offered.
i was feeling a little hungrier so i got the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>, which is a gigantic <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, chili, cheese, and 2 pieces of bacon wrapped in a tortilla. it was good, but the sausage casing was kind of chewy. my friend and i both agreed the chili was pretty good as a topping. it's much more about the toppings here than it is about the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, so know that going in.

the seating here is sketchy, since it's all outdoors. so if they're busy, you might be out of luck. try to go when there isn't a line. but even when there is a line, it always moves pretty fast.

thoroughly over-rated!

7.50$ for a greasy <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, covered in "chili" that looks like a pile of poo-poo & tastes accordingly (( this stuff looked synthetic - im talking taco bell might be better)

the sausage was okay but it was super salty and greasy, the bun was completely soggy (think wonderbread) & the chilli was honestly repulsive (i scooped as much as possible off before eating)

the relish and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> were the only things that saved the day.

i would seriously pick the  costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>/<mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> over this stuff any day!

meh is a spot-on description for pink's in las vegas.

i had heard such great things about pink's in la that we decided to try it for lunch one day on our recent vegas trip.  maybe you have to be drunk to really appreciate these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i was less than impressed.  on the plus side, there are some interesting combinations on the menu, but the execution was so average.  my husband had a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> which was mediocre at best- the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a good snap to it, but the taste wasn't anything to write home about and i've had better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (vienna and koegel's in the midwest).  i had about 2 bites of my polish (i can't remember the name of it, but it had guacamole, hot peppers, etc. which was fine) and again, was less than impressed with the meat.  i guess for a truly great <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, i'll stick to ballparks, who seem to get it right.  i'd take a wrigley field polish over a pink's any day of the week.

i have long heard about pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> being a go-to hot spot late at night for grub and the chance to run into celebrities out in hollywood but have never had the chance to go.  thus i was really excited when i saw that pink's had opened a storefront right on the strip in vegas.  

after a long night of debauchery, i walked halfway across the strip just so i could eat at pink's.  i have to give them credit, they sure know how to jazz up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i ordered a <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>, which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, guacamole and jalape\u00f1o peppers on it.  i ordered relish on it as well.  

the combination works well in theory as well as in practice.  but in practice all of that stuff on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> makes it damn near impossible to eat as you would normally.  picking it up makes all the toppings fall off, and a sloppy mess gets all over your hands.  so i had to resort to eating <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> with a fork and knife.  i felt pretty stupid, but it was the only way to do it and plenty of people around me were doing the same.  

but eating like that made the bun soggy, which is not good.  i appreciate the effort they put into dressing up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i only give it three stars because i've had amazing "gourmet" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in chicago before, with toppings piled high, but with which i could still eat as <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are intended to be eaten - with your hands.

wow! best. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. ever!

i forget the name of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i ordered but it was a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, cheese, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and mushrooms (i think it was the ph <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i could be wrong).. a-freakin'-mazing! toppings over load! there were lots of <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and mushrooms which i much appreciated because most places are so skimpy with the toppings. the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was fat and juicy, just the way i like them ;)
boyfriend got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> with just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrami and mustard - i don't like mustard so i didn't get to try a bite but he said it was good and i'll trust him on that. i can't imagine it being anything amazing like mine though because it just seems so plain!

can't say to much for the service because you wait in line, walk up, order and pick up your food at the next spot so there isn't too much interaction with the employees. but i can say the girl who took my order was very friendly and patience because i still wasn't sure of what i wanted and i didn't feel rushed by her at all.

someone please open a pink's in the bay!!!

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are awesome!!! i was able to read the menu clearly despite the agonizing heat and knew exactly what i was ordering unlike my husband who claims blurred vision for getting a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> instead of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. best tasting dog i've had. the chili was great. as far as the outside only dinning, it was saved by the misters that hang just a few inches above the patron's heads. i would have preferred to eat inside because, let's face it; a mister is just a giant fan (so napkins are flying) with water spraying out at you. the water wasn't the problem, the wind current was. i was dry before i finished my <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> because it was still super hot out. totally worth a few trips back!

one of the few places that i've been to that actually lived up to the hype. it was soo good, i came here twice. i got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. if it is your first time i suggest you try the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>. i also tried the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, this thing is a beast. you seriously need 3 people to finish the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. definitely a spot to hit up for a quick eat.

i'm a big fan of pink's, being from the la area so i was happy to try out the one here in vegas.  i came here with my family and luckily we were able to take advantage of the groupon deal a couple of weeks before.  all 3 of us opted for the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, except i had it with a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> instead of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are loaded with toppings.  the casing around <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> has a nice snap when you bite into it and tastes just as good as the pink's in la.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> are shoestring fries which i happen to looove.  i'm not a fan of fat fries, so these were perfect and crispy.  i'm not sure if the make their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> but those are also fantastic, just the right amount of breading and cooked perfectly.  it was chilly out so i also ordered a <mark>Hot Chocolate</mark> only to find the gal behind the counted mixing up a pouch of the powdered stuff with water.... boo! oh well, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were what we came for and they sure did hit the spot. 

also, you can get a naked dog and add ketchup, mustard, onions, relish and pickles for no charge... yum!

went to my first pink's of any kind today. heading into the first bite, i definitely did have high expectations, mainly because i was hungry, and also because the prices looked pretty darn high, even after accounting for the recent groupon deal. however, keep in mind that this in in the heart of the las vegas strip, so really you'd almost expect it to be pricey. it's not fair to compare this to costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on price.

when i tried my friend's <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, my eyes, taste <mark>Bud</mark>, and probably everything else just lit up. yeah, hunger is the best sauce or whatever, but every component of that dog - bun, sausage, chili, and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> - was really delicious and made me wish that i had chosen it. instead, i had gone with the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which was also quite tasty with bacon and some sort of enhanced 'shrooms. i also loved the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, which is fatter than the normal wiener, and the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> went surprisingly well with the rest of the ingredients.

we also shared some deluxe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which had a crapload of toppings on them. in hindsight, if i had known how loaded the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> would be, i would've ordered normal fries for about half the price because my friend was pretty much evacuating his toppings onto the fries. oh well, live and learn.

anyway, i've seen the other reviews, and i'm sure it doesn't match everything that people like about the original pink's - which i still hope to go to some day - but it's still good eating. not considering the price, the only problem i have is that i'd rather go to earl of sandwich, which is right next door and which i love to death, so i might not really see this place much at all in the future. oh well, it was yummy knowing you.

first off, this is nothing like the pinks in la. i've been living in san diego for a year now, after having lived in la and i miss pinks. so when i was in vegas and saw pinks on the strip i got really excited. as soon as i walked in, i should have known. this place is everything pink and looks like a retro 50's diner. this caught me off guard considering the real pinks is basically a rundown bungalow covered in photographs and the only thing that's actually pink is the sign out front. next was the menu. i didn't recognize a single 'special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>'. the original pinks special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> either have a la themed name or are named after a celebrity. the pinks in las vegas has special dogs named with a las vegas theme. so i had to ask the girl at the front counter if they knew which dogs were renamed and which dog was the martha stewart dog. she had a list behind the counter that listed which special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were renamed but she told me that most of their special dogs were not their own creations, not renamed dogs from the original location. uhhhh... ok. so basically this pinks is a completely different restaurant with the name pinks slapped on.
