now for the food. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (with a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> subbed for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>) with mustard and a side of fries, totally $13 and some odd cents. i waited a few minutes and my order number was called. i went to retrieve my food and got really confused as soon as i saw the <mark>French Fries</mark> which are nothing like the la pinks <mark>French Fries</mark>. i made a comment to the person who gave me my food about it looking nothing like food from the original pinks, and a woman, also from la, walked up behind me and said the same. 

so was the food good? yeah, it was decent. but not worth the 13 bucks i spent on it. the shoe-string fries were nothing like the cajun fries (that the la pinks serves) i was expecting but the were good nonetheless. worth the $5.99 i paid for them? no. but that's what you get for eating on the strip. the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was pretty good and the chili was... not so flavorful. but overall i'm glad i tried it.

the verdict: if you're on the strip near planet hollywood and craving <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, this is probably the best you'll find. however, if you're a lover of the original pinks and have your heart set on your usual order, don't come here. you'll leave with a craving that wasn't curbed, disappointed, and with a wallet that weighs less than when you walked in.

(+) planet hollywood <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>... *drooooools. it's a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with bacon, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, tomatoes, <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>... omg drooooool
(+) nice water condensation spray things outside so it's nice and cool when you're waiting in line outside
(+) smaller menus placed around the seating area so you can decide before you line up and slowly reach the bigger menu inside

(-) outdoor seating only. and it's not exactly a lot of tables and seats
(-) fan is conveniently placed near a trash can so that when you attempt to throw away your empty <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> tray and lightweight napkins, it kinda just flies everywhere... make it to the trashcan w/o anything flying off your tray? challenge accepted.
(-) <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> looks wimpy compared to the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>

i had the ph <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was pretty good.  it's loaded w/ bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and some mushrooms.  the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> kinda masked the taste of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, i think next time i'll get it w/ just a light amount of cheese.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself is pretty huge too (to the point it's almost difficult to eat lol).  the price tag is reasonable, at $9 i felt this was a decent deal.

my <mark>Bud</mark> ordered some weird stuff that had <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wrapped in tortillas or actual burritos.  i'd pass on this weird stuff as it didn't look good.  if you are coming to pinks then order a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, don't order this weird stuff.  that's like ordering a burger at a taco joint lol. 

tip-
-grab a fat tuesday just in the same shopping plaza of ph!  
-pass on getting the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> (rating 2/5).  they were so sweet they tasted horrible
-eating only availabe in the outdoor patio.  so if it's in the middle of the day i probably wouldn't eat here.  just come here for late night eats

after seeing so many television programs about pink's and how amazing it is, i had to try it when i was in vegas.  i ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> in a bun with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, bacon, and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.  the onions and mushrooms were scarce and barely grilled. the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> was just the normal <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> you get anywhere else.  there were about 5 strips of crispy bacon, but that didn't seem to justify the price of $8.99.  the sausage wasn't even particularly amazing either.  

i also didn't like how cramped <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and overall space was.  only two parties can stand in line before people must wait outside in the 100+ degree weather.  while the seating area did have fans, they were so powerful that they were more bothersome than pleasant - my napkins kept flying away and my hair flew in my face!

i'm glad i checked it off of my places to try, but i wouldn't go back again.  i'd much rather spend $1.50 at costco and get a soda as well!
this place is hyped and overrated. i'd pick a costco <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> any day over this. and, it's kind of a long wait for a friggin <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. gaahhh.

this is a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> review from someone who doesn't like/eat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my fiancee was dying to eat here last year, and we just never got there. so this past august, staying in paris, we were really close and made sure we tried it. it was our first stop off the plane. very good, different, original recipes. my fiancee had a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with tons of stuff on it ( i dont even remember) and i had the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, topped with lots of other stuff. delicious and it didn't repeat on me all day like i remember <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> doing when i last had one years ago. we also had their alcoholic lemonade, which was also great. def recommend and we will be back!

we got the nacho chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and the planet hollywood <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>. the nacho chili cheese was pretty good, especially with the free jalapenos. the planet hollywood sucked, and the funny thing is, we thought that we would like that better since it was a special...wrong. this place is just so so, nothing special really. also, my bf ended up getting sick after he ate here. we will not be back.

so here goes, i will say the one thing bad about this place has got to be the price. i guess with it being on the strip, one has to overlook that. but, i had gotten the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with pastrami, swiss, onions and mustard. and they charge 7.79$!!! wow, thats a lot of money. now with that being said, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself was good. the pastrami, wasn't juicy but it also wasn't dry. i usually like my pastrami, juicy, and a little bit of fat on the outside. the polish itself was the highlight. the first bite, it's juices ran down my lip and onto my jaw. great flavor and a great crunch. with that being said, i don't know if i am sold on it being an 8$ dog....plus tax of course.

so this place is awesome.  don't come here looking for something healthy -- come here to splurge and indulge to your hearts content.  

i ordered  the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which had <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> & mushrooms, a pancetta-like bacon that was out of this world, all smothered in <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.  this was divine.  of course, i could barely finish half of it.  but it was worth every penny and every calorie.  

my friend ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, which had 2 dogs in one bun, mustard, onions, chili, <mark>American Cheese</mark>, guacamole and jalape\u00f1os.  she said it was just as amazing.  

and of course, we had to get chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  

the ambiance was fun - we sat on the patio and got to people watch.  it's right in the middle of the vegas strip, so it's a great location.  the cashier was friendly and helpful, the food took maybe 5 minutes to prepare.  it was just a great experience.  if/when i go back to vegas, i will definitely come again!  maybe this time i'll use it as hangover food though.... ;)

pink's is entering its 73rd year in business. admittedly, when comparing prices with the original los angeles venue, the vegas spot appears much more expensive. predictable.

not really seeing a deathly spicy option (not saying that i was gonna find one), i got whatever could be interpreted as spicy to some people. <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> ($8.49) was my choice. yeah, you read that right. it was gonna basically be $9 with tax for a damn <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, pickled jalapenos, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, guacamole, and tomatoes.

it looked and tasted like your basic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> bun here. with the larger <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> and an abundance of toppings, it really needed one of those large gourmet buns to even give me a shot to pick it up. fork and knife would have to do.

flavor-wise, it did the job. it's basically as good as i could have expected this to be. great snap from the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> felt like it came from a container. the veggies and the guacamole tasted fresh. my issue is simply the price. there's no way this poor panda would even want to pay around $9 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, even if edible gold was attached to this sucker. besides, i'd take the edible gold and try to extract monetary value from it anyway.

i look at the yelp reviews for the los angeles pink's, and it's around a three-star average, same as the vegas spot. any complaints are likely directed at the price or the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> not living up to the hype. the line's also longer in l.a., so that probably also affects the reviewer's rating. still, it makes me wonder if the los angeles spot is better.

pink's was good for the experience. i can't complain much about the food other than not being able to pick it up. but i also don't want my wallet to have a reason to riot again.

for the longest time, two places have sat at the top fo my vegas to try list - craftsteak...and pink's.  yep, i know.  quite possibly the only time those two will ever be #1 and #2 on the same list.  for anything.  ever.

unlike earl of sandwich, which had its usual, ridiculous line going on, nary a person could be found at the at counter at pink's.  perfect for us since we just wanted a quick lunch before our flight...and because we probably took 10 minutes to figure out what to get from their giant menu board (it took me so long, i swear they all started to sound the same...).  although it wasn't one of the sexier options, i ordered the polish pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> ($8.49), and tried some for the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> ($6.79) that my friend had ordered for our group to share.  

topped with pastrami, <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, and mustard (forgot to add on the sour kraut), the polish wasn't bad but hardly exciting (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pinks-hot-dogs-las-vegas-2?select=ii0a_yyiuqlfkwpttnfima#2cd3mm114u75fre4_z9ong).  while the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> itself was fine (who knew it went so well with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>?), the shreds of pastrami were really dry and a bit salty.  the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were guiltfully tasty though (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pinks-hot-dogs-las-vegas-2?select=ii0a_yyiuqlfkwpttnfima#zcy7utuimph17rzsk5ttga).  not so much for the cheese sauce (because it's, you know, cheese sauce), but because their chili is surprisingly decent!  plus...who doesn't love some good <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>?

all in all, i'd come back if i needed something relatively quick and simple, as well as to try some of the more unique and "exotic" combinations (stomach ache on a plane?  ummm...no).  pink's is probably one of the better bets around based on convenience alone, but at about $8 a pop, they do an even better job of making me appreciate costco's $1.50 polish and a drink that much more.

tried to eat at g<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> ramsay burgr, but there was an hour and a half wait.  pinks was right around the corner, so we decided to get a quick lunch.  i was with 5 other people. 

i ordered the polish bacon burrito.  the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was okay, the skin was tough.  i liked the bacon and the chili, but it was very, very, very greasy.  my tortilla was soaked and dripping with grease, it was disgusting.  the others that i was with ordered <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, no tortilla, still really greasy.  the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> that was ordered looked good.  the regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didnt really have all that much flavor, it was nothing special.  the fries were thin cut and crispy. 

i probably won't be back, nothing really special or different about <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.

eww, this place was disgusting. the bf and i got the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. 

1) <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> - the chili tasted like pureed ground beef. the texture was just disgusting almost like baby food. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself was tasteless and lacked that crisp of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> casing upon each bite. 

2) the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> came with <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with pastrami on top - this was also gross. the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was tasteless. the pastrami smelled old. 

gross, definitely do not recommend.

not much of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> person, but i was meeting some cousins and this is what they chose. i opted for the chicago polish which is nothing like a chicago style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> -  dressed in mustard, relish, tomatoes and lettuce? weird. anyway the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was pretty big and it had a nice snap to it when bitten, and the inside was nice and juicy and the flavor was pretty savory. not bad.

ok. i don't know how much better than average these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are. buns are standard. we ate the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which had the potential to be a super guilty, but worth-it experience, but it was just that - standard ingredients of a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, and bacon with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>. you can probably just load it up like that at home and make it just as good, or better. maybe i was just expecting more with the hype.

got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. it's a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with onions, bacon, cheese and awesome. it's messy and delicious. yes, it's a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. if you came here thinking high quality food, you must be trippin. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. keep your expectations in check. for what it is, it's awesome. little more expensive than their la location but it's a nice little meal after a night of drinking.

almost as good as the pink's in la.... almost.
the pink's in <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> not have cake, like the original pink's los angeles. and for the record the cake is made from scratch, not a box; according to my dad. who isn't skinny, and knows a thing or two about cake. but that doesn't matter, because there is no cake at the pink's in vegas.

i don't know why people are questioning the price? these are not the same <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> as costco! pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> are better, overall. higher quality meat, casing, larger in size, and with toppings. pink's is not in the miracle mile shops, they are on the front of the ph, with patio seating on the strip. so no. $5-10 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> loaded with toppings and bacon isn't a lot. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at serendipity 3 at caesar's is $15.

and if you ask politely, they will do half fries / half <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.

great <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>.bigger than the bun...<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good too. <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were great as well.a bunch of different combinations to have a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with

got the spicy mojave with a regular dog instead of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>. it was delicious and the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were out of this world.

you want a review of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? you came to the right girl.

some people grow out of eating <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. not this girl. my love f<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> has grown only stronger with age. i just see <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i'm hungry. i pass by vendors, and i have to stop. doesn't even matter if i've just eaten a three course meal and my jeans are unbuttoned. i will never pass up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. steamed, boiled, fried, or grilled.

so imagine me, in vegas, a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place attached to the front of my hotel! how superfrikkinexciting. i'm all by my lonesome, just the way i like it, and i am starving!

pink's is where my tired feet carry me. i take my place in the ever growing line outside <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. the smell is fantastic. i am like a little kid hopping from foot to foot, trying to look over me and determine my wait time.

evidently, a few people ahead of me a woman is struggling with what kind of dog to order. c'mon, lady! i'm withering away here!

i get close enough to check the menu and now have to decide between a regular dog with some mustard, or a specialty dog. the list is massive. how many ways can you tweak a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. now i am seeing there are many! 

i order a specialty. hell, i am in vegas. go big or go home. a <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>. fries. and a soda.

i wait five minutes and whoot! number 80 is called. that's me! i sit down at the one table that's open, still dirty from the previous diner. i unwrap this massive thing, and take a huge bite. bleh!

it felt like i was biting through a rubber dog drenched in chili. and through the rubber <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> wasn't very tasteful. if you've ever over-boiled a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you know the flavor i speak of. it's like cooking the flavor right out. i choked down half of it. after all, i was starving and needed to eat some of my money's worth. but half is all i got through. and i am a woman who can eat quite a few dogs in one sitting. the rest got tossed.

las vegas needs a few <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> vendors on the street.

no big deal is all i can really say. 

pink's looked pretty busy and happening, and its menu sounded mouthwatering. its multiple "celebrity" endorsements and "new" <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> sold me, and $7-something later i was settling down with a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> piled with swiss and sauerkraut. 

it was the perfect <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> - for a 5-year-old. i don't know what i was expecting but it certainly wasn't a rubbery boiled <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stuck in a web of gooey melted processed swiss, sandwiched inside a cloudlike wonderbread style bun. it was all right, but completely lacking in sophistication. generous on the sauerkraut, though, i will give them that. 

i doubt i'll be revisiting pink's anytime soon - not with so many other options for quick bites crowding the strip and vying for my money.

i don't meat, but i still came here. really, i don't miss eating meat, but i do miss a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> + bun combo! so we came here, also because of the cheap prices. 

ended up getting the only veggie option - <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. was cooked to order, but pretty good - got tomatoes, ketchup, mustard, lettuce for my toppings. only downside was that the bread was a bit too flimsy for my liking - when i eat a dog, i want some solid bread that can withstand any amount of toppings! costed about $6 or so. i'd like to know what it was made out of, actually... texture-wise, it was very <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

bummer that <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> don't come with a side... and i wasn't about to spend $4 just to have some <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. but a friend did get the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which they described as covered with "low grade meat" but delicious "once you're drunk enough." speaking of drunk - on the weekends they are open late - about 3 am or so - so a perfect place for the drunk munchies! 

what else? $20 for a bucket of 5 beers, you mix and match.

i never got to go to the one in la... but anyway, they have <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>!  haha, the pink lemonade slushie was pretty good (a little too sweet though).  they  have a lot of toppings (my boyfriend got sausage with chili and i don't remember what else but it looked insane and insanely good) and they are famous in la... sorry, can't give too much insight because i kind of like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> haha.  3.5!

since this place is also pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i believe i have the right to compare it to the original pinks in la, which would probably laugh at this place.

i was so excited when i hear ph was opening a pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i was even more excited when i got to the place and saw that there was almost no line to wait in. in la i had to wait in line for over an hour just to get a delicious dog. however, i was very disappointed when i got to their menu.

this pinks is nothing compared to the la pinks. the selection pretty much sucks. i could make these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at home in my kitchen <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> the street at 7-11 for a lot cheaper. just because everything is piled on high, doesn't mean it's any good. 

there aren't even many side orders or any additional toppings from what i see on the menus. what kind of place is this!? you should be able to create your own monster or pick something incredible off of the menu, but you can't. even the fries are boring. you can get better fries at any mexican fast food joint. 

no wonder this place barely has a line whenever i pass by. the staff at the la pinks should come by and teach them a thing or two before this place goes out of business.

after working up an appetite wandering up and down the strip and in the planet hollywood shops, my friends and i decided pinks would be the perfect place to grab a quick lunch. coincidently, we also happened to each be wearing pink (not planned!) so it seemed even more fitting. 

i ordered the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mushrooms and swiss. my friend ordered a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and another ordered the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. we also ordered a side of fries and rings to share. 

food came out quickly and i thought my dog was delicious. the fries were good but got cold quickly...most likely because it was cold outside where we were sitting, but still. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were ginormous and tasty. 

lunch came out to a bit under $10 per person which i don't think is bad. i would come back.

pink's was one of the cheapest meals we had in vegas! $26 for three people was a nice change of pace from spending triple & quadruple that at other eateries. 

this was my first time eating at this vegas location but i'd been to the original so cal one a few times. i ordered my usual: a veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> covered in chili cheese & onions. completely messy & totally heavy in the stomach; exactly what junk food should be. my companions ordered <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. 

even though i don't eat meat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i like that i don't have to be excluded from dining at pink's with people who do because they serve <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. brownie points for that. pink's food is kind of 'eh' but it's fun to eat outside, under heating lamps & surrounded by lights on the strip.

well it was a 105 out and the nice cool misting fans were looking nice. 
the wait was to at the mall restaurants so we ended up here! i really do enjoy a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> when they can be found and the last couple i have had were very average. also seeing this on food network a few time made for some big expectations. 

i was excited to try pink's and the line was moving fast. i normally just go with a normal dog with ketchup when trying new places but the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> was sounding good and it sounded big! 

we got our order pretty fast and the serve pepsi bleh, so went with sierra mist when in this situation. 

then i went for the ketchup and then ooooo no cisco ketchup, blehhh, how could you pink's? i don't think i've had to have cisco ketchup since i was at the last country fair. that would be my only complaint here. ketshup is one of the only condiments i enjoy and if i'm eating a top quality <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries, i need the good stuff! 

alas, my giant burrito filled with bacon, chili, cheese and 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was really to be devoured and it was. it was great, filling, and had some hearty chili which is something you either like <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>'t, but i did. 

i was pretty full after that and i would have this again for sure. 

if i had coke, some heinz, and a cooled indoor seat, you could have had that 1 extra star!

pink's is okay.  i like that they have the option to sub a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>.  i do not, however, enjoy the chewy casing on the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  it's hard to bite through and kinda... rubbery.  overall, i eat here sometimes because it's (usually) pretty quick and easy.  i wouldn't necessarily go out of my way, though.

in my experience, finding a decent <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> when you don't eat red meat or pork is pretty tough.  i had all but given up on the idea of enjoying a sloppy dog... that is, until i went to pink's.  

i had friends in town who were massively hungover, so they chose pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> as their pick-me-up spot.  i usually just order a side dish (hello, fried food) at this type of joint, but then something caught my eye.  a quarter-pound turkey <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>??  could it be???

i took the chance, and ordered the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> with a simple dressing of ketchup and relish.  i keep it classic.  and what they served looked more like a kielbasa or bratwurst, it was so big.  thick, juicy, and great flavor.  success!  

long story longer, i will definitely be visiting pink's again.  great location, great atmosphere (outside seating), and great food.  the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> rocked as well.  bravo, pink's!

this bad review is my fault.  i am a terrible person, but i came here and ordered a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> with gauc.  before i lose 100% credibility as a meat eater, i have to say that i had been in vegas for days already eating nothing but greasy greasy food...burgers fries and alcohol.  i don't think i had pooped since i got to vegas...i'm serious, and the thought of trying a delicious <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> would probably make me puke.

it i were to go right now, i would have gotten the biggest meatiest delicious thing there.  but i have to review my guac <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>.

i've eaten a fair share of <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark> and dogs, so that being said it wasn't bad.  my issue was that the consistency was off, not super off like terrible, but i've had better.  the guac was not that good.  it wasn't like chipotle or home made, but it was some like green spread that was thin and kind of looked like bird shit honestly.  taste wise, it wasn't bad though.  i ate it and stole pastrami off my boyfriends for more flavor.  so, if you're in vegas feeling as i was, try to get a salad with bacon instead of a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> at pinks.

tried to eat at g<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> ramsay burgr, but there was an hour and a half wait.  pinks was right around the corner, so we decided to get a quick lunch.  i was with 5 other people. 

i ordered the polish bacon burrito.  the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was okay, the skin was tough.  i liked the bacon and the chili, but it was very, very, very greasy.  my tortilla was soaked and dripping with grease, it was disgusting.  the others that i was with ordered <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, no tortilla, still really greasy.  the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> that was ordered looked good.  the regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didnt really have all that much flavor, it was nothing special.  the fries were thin cut and crispy. 

i probably won't be back, nothing really special or different about <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.

my mom and i both enjoyed it. we each ordered a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> and split a fry and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. it was pretty good. we got to sit outside, eat, and people watch. we are not big fans of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> of any type so we probably won't be back. but we're glad we tried it.

wow what a let down. for a day of fun, as las vegas locals, we valet'd at paris and walked over to pink's - there was no line and nobody eating at all. i ordered a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> (maybe that was my mistake) and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. the fries were the best part of the meal - i hate, i mean i hate gray, boiled looking <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> -- gosh i wish it was grilled i guess i should've asked but being from l.a. this place is suppose to be the best so i figured i'd leave it all in their hands....it was a let down and i won't be going back.

they have <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> and <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark>. 

for all of the people who have eaten at the la location, don't compare the two. this one is not as fast and is just different. that aside, it's a good place to grab a quick, cheap (relatively for the strip) bite. 

can't go wrong with their coleslaw, fries, or <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.

i stopped here for a quick snack while i was in vegas.  i'm vegan and supposedly their <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> is highly rated.  

it was around 2pm on a monday afternoon when i stopped in and luckily there were only a couple people ahead of me.  the wait was minimal.  from the time i got in line to receiving my dog, it was 5-10 min max.

my order was pretty basic.  <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> with ketchup, mustard and relish.  my dog plus a bottle of water was $9.00.  logical price for a snack on the strip!

the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> was great!  taste and texture were both right on.  i was pleasantly surprised!  they're known for having great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and they didn't disappoint on the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> either!  

i have walked past here when the line is insane, so just keep that in mind if you plan on going.  no indoor seating, only outdoor patio with table umbrellas for shade.  it was about 90 degrees the day i went, but i was still comfortable with the shade.

we come here every time we go to vegas for affordable vegan fast food (they have <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>!) every time is delicious but this time was exceptional as we had gerome working. he was so funny and nice and went out of his way for us. great employee you have there!!

you wouldn't believe how difficult it is to locate a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> restaurant on the vegas strip that carries vegetarian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. we went to three different places on our hunt and were unable to find any place that carried such a thing. i get it, most veggie wieners are pretty bland and "adequate" would be a stretch for quality, but most of us who eat them know this and have found ways to make them appealing. when you don't carry any vegetarian options for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you lose out on our business, plus any business that might come with those non-vegetarians that are with us!

fortunately after an hour of searching, we stopped in at pink's and they had a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> listed on their menu!  yay!  i ordered one, dressed as a <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> and my partner ordered a beef <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with minimal toppings. we skipped out on fries as we just wanted a light snack, but we did each get a drink (beer and cider in cans). 

we sat outside in the awesome weather and dug in. my <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> was covered in amazing toppings and was delicious. i had to get a fork to clean up the bits that dropped out, i didn't want to leave anything behind. my partner enjoyed his meal as well, and we were able to leave knowing that we both got exactly what we wanted.

thanks for carrying a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> when very few others are pink's!

wow, has it really been 5 years since my last review at pink's??  well, other than satisfy my craving for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, nothing's really changed from my last experience here except for the prices which have increased since then.

chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> -- http://bit.ly/1fssnto
mustard, relish, lettuce & tomatoes
the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good but it was basically a salad on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  because it's on their classic dog side of the menu, the price wasn't too bad but still pricey though for what i got.  i guess i probably should've ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (http://bit.ly/1jikjji) again because at least it has more of a 'wow' factor.

for convenience on being right on the strip, i like pink's.  but i think i'd rather get my gourmet <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fix off the strip at buldogis or even at g<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> ramsay burgr.
dish_name: Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog

text:
for lunch i wanted to try pink's--finally.  i heard that their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were very good and decided to try for myself.  there are a few things to keep in mind when it comes to pink's--size and cost. i'll explain in a minute.

just to let everyone know, pink's it outside of planet hollywood/miracle mile shops facing the boulevard.  i walked around for awhile till i found the sign in the building and realized it was outside.  anyway, there wasn't a line and their seating is all outside, so i went in to take a look at their menu.

the menu is simple with pre-made options for you and even burgers if you aren't into their dogs. at almost 10 dollars a dog it was pretty pricey, but i expected that from a famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> eaterie.  they even have their special dogs from celebrities on a flyer at the entrance and near the menu, so check those out, too.

i went for a <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>--<mark>Sour Cream</mark>, tomatoes, onions and relish--and my husband ate their classic <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with onions.  we grabbed a water and fountain drink for a total of 25 dollars and moved on down to the pick up area. when i saw our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i freaked out.  i love toppings, but really?  really?  this was definitely a fork and knife dog.

i love eating my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> by hand.  it's just the way that it should be, but at pink's it's difficult to do so.  too many toppings on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> cause the flavor of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> to be lost, so i scraped everything off on one half to get down to what matters--that fried dog.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is good with a slight snap to it, but it's not an amazing.  i ate the rest with my utensils, feeling as if i violated some ethical <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> code by not eating with my hands.

if you want to try <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, buy a plain one and ask for toppings on the side if you need them, that way you can really taste what a pink's dog is all about.  if you want something really good, their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was decent.

overall <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was decent and i can at least say that i've tried it once. would i fight my way down there through traffic again for it?  nope.  but it's something you have to try once so you can say that you have.

i tried the popular <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>. both were pretty good but extremely messy. the guadalajara had too much <mark>Sour Cream</mark> on it. the fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were awesome - definitely complimented the meal. my friends tried some other dogs, they were wrapped up in soft tortillas and stuff. they had mixed reviews but i would suggest sticking to a regular bun. service was pretty quick and they have a small outdoor section to sit. i think they open late enough, one night we were starving and drunk or something and needed something like this to hit the spot, unfortunately it was closed already.

this was my first meal upon my arrival in las vegas. i ordered the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>- came with tomatoes, relish, onions and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>.  i thought it was quite tasty, a bit expensive for just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  some friends got the specialty dogs, and they enjoyed them quite a bit as well!

oh pink's, how you have been able to somewhat redeem yourself. going to college in los angeles, you're bound to go to pink's at least once. after having it there, i really thought this place was overrated. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were just ok, and were definitely not worth the wait in line (at least 30 minutes).

because of that, i really did not want to give this location a chance. however, we were leaving las vegas and wanted something were it would've be relatively quick. hesitantly, i agreed to go to pink's. and you know what, i'm really glad i did.

for those that do not know where pink's is, it's outside on the strip. when we got here, i was honestly surprised that there was no line here. i had to initially do a double take to make sure i was at the right location. there were the familiar pictures of celebrities on the wall which helped me know that i was at the right place.

due to being hungry, i ordered <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>. the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark> was good, the mix of <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, tomatoes, and relish was a nice combination with the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i'm not the biggest fan of relish, but i liked it in this case. <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> was pretty awesome. to warn you in advance, make sure you have napkins, a fork, and a knife. i rarely eat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with a knife and fork, but in this case, you must! the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> have a nice pop when you take a bite, which i love in a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

there's no room to eat inside, but there are tables outside for you to sit and enjoy the strip on a nice warm day. especially after a big night of partying, this is a nice way to recover. 

overall, i'd give it 3.5 stars. the reason i rounded it down to a 3 was due to my experiences at the hollywood location. though i'll definitely would come back to this location whenever i'm in vegas.

i've had the original pink's before. it's been 10 years, but i recall my dog fondly and it was well worth the long wait in line that we had. 

there was no line at this pink's. well, there were about 4 people ahead of us. but with only one cashier it's kind of hard to not have a tiny wait. i ordered the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>. 

in general, it was decent. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was fairly snappy, and the toppings were fresh. the guadalajara has relish, onions and tomatoes with <mark>Sour Cream</mark> on top. the relish was a little overpowering, but very fresh and flavorful. 

the problem is that 2 days before i had a nathan's dog at new york, new york. that dog, with just fried onions and ketchup, beat pink's hands down. maybe if i hadn't had that dog, i would have rated pink's just a little higher, but even with all the amazing toppings they can't compare. 

i probably won't go back next time we're in vegas. i just don't think it has what the original pink's in la has.

let me just start out by saying this... i am not a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> person, in general.  i have to be in the right mood, in the right frame of mind, otherwise i think they taste gross.
i loved my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at pink's and would go back today were in possible.  i got the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark> with <mark>Sour Cream</mark> (it's ok, it was good!) and my husband got the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> which was just about as insane as it sounds, but he loved it.  (what? a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in a tortilla?? they did it!)

i have to give them three stars based on the following:
1. i dont usually like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i enjoyed my experience and would def go back
2. originality in both names, flavors, various types of dogs and condiments

i go here every time we are in vegas.  this time we got a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> (which is my fave), <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>, and the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> with 2 orders of fries and onions rings for 4 people.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were enough for 4 people to share.  i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was pretty big.  they have outside seating.  they probably have like 6 or 7 tables out there.  
i think on fridays and saturdays they close at 0300 which is good for a early morning snack.  each <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is like under $9 which isnt bad.  they accept credit cards and cash.

this place makes me kinda sad because in la, pink's is a huge hit. i wish this place could have all the options the one in <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, but it doesn't. it has the original toppings, but the celebrity specialties are missing. the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark> sufficed for my trips here, but definitely wasn't worth it while having a hangover.

other than that, wait is pretty short and there's plenty of outdoor seating which is conveniently placed in mist.

"it's a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>."
"but it's from pink''s!"
"it's. a. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>." 

i ordered the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>, and while i enjoyed it, was it really worth the $6? probably not, considering it's just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it's basically like paying $2 for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and $4 for the famous name. and if it's not even the original hollywood stand, what's the point? definition of a tourist trap. 

i suppose i would recommend everyone to try it once, and don't try to be healthy. lather on the <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, cheese, chili, ect because if you're going to wait an obscene amount of time for a $6-$8 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you might as well go all out. it might help if you were a little tipsy as well to cushion the realization of the resources you are exhausting for minimal nutritional value. hey, it's vegas. luckily for myself, i barely beat the lunch rush, was able to walk up and order, and got my dog in just a few minutes. but the line a few minutes later was crazy! unfortunately for me though, it was also december and freezing outside. none of your $6 goes toward any indoor seating. 

i've always believed las vegas embodies the best and worst things about america, all in one place. such as greasy, overpriced "famous" food. case in point.

good for a quick bite on the strip. tons of options. the famous chilli wasn't that good i was sick the rest of the day. my husband loved the one he had <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark> i think it was called.
a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place... with no <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>?!?!?!? what a disgrace!

note: maybe i shouldn't review pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, because i don't eat meat and buns, and i count calories so i can't add more toppings or sauces except veggie stuffs. 

i was very happy that they have a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at planet hollywood! there was no line and not crowded! i would never wait in line for 3 hours in hollywood location! so i got to try world famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! very good location outside miracle mile, walking distance from our hotel cosmopolitan.

very cute place decorated in pink color, there is a wall full of celebrities photos. i was glad they had veggie and turkey <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

a solid 3.5 star, $40 for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, one fries, one <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>, one <mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark> with souvenir cup. 

veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Chopped Tomato</mark>: not much flavor, but it was not bad with mustard sauce and tomatoes 
<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mushrooms and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>: fairly delicious 
fries: not bad
corn dog: good 

<mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark>: yummy

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were good, but not great, veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> needed to wait a bit longer to get my order, other orders were fast. i guess we should've ordered pink's secret recipe chilly on top, that would make our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> more tasty, or add more toppings and sauces. it is a bit pricey for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> though, but it's famous so it's ok i guess. 

i didn't think the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were great, but they were not bad either. i like this fast food place a lot because of the cute decor, and outdoor seats, good view and people watching on the strip, there were some cute little birds walking around, they were fun to watch. so we will go back again for snacks or quick bite. :)

i had never been to pink's before, but had a groupon that was running out, and so we ventured out for dinner on a late thursday night to beat the deadline.  no problem, right?  by all appearances, it was just an unremarkable thursday night.  

so off to planet hollywood we went.  but when we pulled up to valet parking behind three stretch limos, and no valet was in sight, something seemed off.  then i saw that we were about six blocks from the valet stand, again with no valet in view.  so, off to self-parking we went, with uniformed police everywhere, to find a parking spot.  at length we found one--the only one.  something unusual was definitely going on.

so, diane and i walked from the parking garage into the miracle mile shops, and walked and walked.  as we finally reached the entrance to planet hollywood on the other side of the shopping promenade, 9 uniformed sheriff's deputies were assembled together, and fashionably suited males and well-dressed females were everywhere.  about then i realized that we had left the groupon in the car.  oh, well (sigh).  i decided that i wasn't going to walk all the way back and return again just to save a mere $5!  so, we continued on and out the main doors until we finally saw pink's facing las vegas boulevard, and examined the vast menu on the wall before making our selections.

this story does end well.  i really enjoyed my brooklyn pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with pickles, onions, mustard, and sauerkraut added, on a soft old country bun.  it included a generous amount of tender pastrami, and although the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was thin, it was long and had a very nice snap to it when one bit into the casing.  beer-battered <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and nicely salted shoestring fries were both good and tasty.  and i liked the mild <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> sauce for dipping my fries, while diane enjoyed <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>.  to my surprise, one single <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> sufficed to quell my appetite.  and, there were free refills of lemonade and all other available soft drinks.  

the place is nothing fancy, seating is all outside, and there is only counter service.  but staff members were friendly and helpful.  we had a nice view of the strip before us, but it was a mite cold and windy at 10:47 p.m.  heat lamps were present, but not in service.  hard driving music overhead added to the casual ambiance.  so, we finished our food, walked all the way back to the car, and left the parking lot as we were directed out by at least 6 police officers.  just as we were turning onto tropicana avenue, diane asked the last officer if she knew what was going on at planet hollywood, and was told, "soul train awards!"

now i'm sort of glad that i still have my groupon for pink's, which, as luck would have it, does not really expire for another month.  for, it means that i can return again soon to enjoy another tasty classic dog!
i enjoyed my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my friend had <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark> and they made her sick.

i've had <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> .i've had chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. i've had <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>. not all at once, naturally.

but i also thought i had bulimia.

turns out, i just had pink's. 

great way to quickly hate yourself.

so the fries can feed two to three.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are topped to overflowing.  it was alright.  we were hungry and needed something fast.  i got the <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark> and they were okay albeit a little over done.  :(

was hoping for water and i got watered lemonade... not a huge fan.  especially when super thirsty.

finally got to try their food.

 i ordered chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, they were really good & hot.  i burned my tongue because it smelled so good i couldn't wait.  chili isn't too spicy. just right. if you love spicy, you'll be disappointed.  i believe it was $6.79. boyfriend had 10 <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark> & a "big man" dog. he said it was perfect.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> even snapped because of the skin.  it had tomatoes & onions.  no picture because he really chowed it down. 

great service.  thanks much.

dish_name: Double Burger or Double Chili Burger

text: i've been wanting to try this for a while after seeing it on a food network special.  while in vegas, this was my first and last meal.  the first meal was a classic dog with chili, mustard, onions, and tomatoes (possibly cheese too but i can't remember for sure).  the last meal of my trip was a life saver after a very long night out.  i got the <mark>Western Guacamole Burger</mark> (with a scoop of chili on top).  it was a amazing, the chili had great flavor and the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> with guacamole were a nice touch as well.

while walking through ph, i decided to try pink's. let me just say, yummy!!! i had the <mark>Western Guacamole Burger</mark> and i think i bite my finger on accident, because i was eating it si fast! lol. it was so good and so reasonably priced. it was cooked to order and all veggies were fresh, crisp and perfectly layered. 
yes, presentation means a lot as well.

delicious!  i truly do enjoy pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> every now and then.  this time i got the <mark>Western Guacamole Burger</mark> (i'm not sure what it's called but it had guacamole in it).  very tasty.  absolutely satisfying.  no complaints!

also, no line!  unlike earl of sandwich which had an hour of wait time.

it's pink's. it's fast. it's cheap food on the strip.

there was absolutely no line when we walked in on a tuesday night for pre-clubbing eats. it does however make me wonder why the one back in la always has a long line?

i like that their menu specifies that their <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark> is vegan. it's $6.79. it's decent. i added guacamole to mine: http://su.pr/96msdn

$1.79 is a lot for guacamole. but i feel like the burger would've sucked without it.

i bet it would taste even better with <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark> but i would have to pay another $1.49 to add that.

i guess it's kinda cool that they serve jello shots. even though vegan me didn't have one, my friends paid $20 for six shots and it came with free <mark>French Fries</mark>: http://su.pr/5talb6

this bad review is my fault.  i am a terrible person, but i came here and ordered a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> with gauc.  before i lose 100% credibility as a meat eater, i have to say that i had been in vegas for days already eating nothing but greasy greasy food...burgers fries and alcohol.  i don't think i had pooped since i got to vegas...i'm serious, and the thought of trying a delicious <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> would probably make me puke.

it i were to go right now, i would have gotten the biggest meatiest delicious thing there.  but i have to review my guac <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>.

i've eaten a fair share of <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark> and dogs, so that being said it wasn't bad.  my issue was that the consistency was off, not super off like terrible, but i've had better.  the guac was not that good.  it wasn't like chipotle or home made, but it was some like green spread that was thin and kind of looked like bird shit honestly.  taste wise, it wasn't bad though.  i ate it and stole pastrami off my boyfriends for more flavor.  so, if you're in vegas feeling as i was, try to get a salad with bacon instead of a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> at pinks.

they have <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> and <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark>. 

for all of the people who have eaten at the la location, don't compare the two. this one is not as fast and is just different. that aside, it's a good place to grab a quick, cheap (relatively for the strip) bite. 

can't go wrong with their coleslaw, fries, or <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.

i wanted to see what the fuss was all about with pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.   

the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> at planet hollywood was   awesome.  it was just loaded with tomato,  cheese,chili, <mark>Sour Cream</mark> and onions. the chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was a difficult task just trying to keep it together while eating it.  it was good but nothing special! not really  worth the $8.50? it's on the strip so i'm not going to complain on the price.

so yeah, we spent about $16 on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and a drink .  sounds expensive, but now at least i got to experience what  pink's has to offer, just wish i knew what all the excitement was about  maybe next time i'll give their <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark> a try.  looks really yummy! 

it was alright!

decent. if you've been to the original la location, prepare to be somewhat disappointed. 

food: meh. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> seemed precooked, the buns were plain, and the mushrooms looked canned. the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> was damn near $8 alone. i had to ask for a side of <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, because the ph dog here only comes with a slice of what looked like kraft cheese. the prices were at least $2 more than the la location, but i guess its understandable since its las vegas. the fries weren't freshly prepared like the la location either. and to top it off, they didn't have grape crush soda or yoo-hoo like the la location. 

service: the cashier chicks were nice. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and sides were served up/made in assembly line unlike the personal attention you get from one person at the la location. 

overall, it was just meh. i'd rather drive 4 hours, then wait in line for another hour to have an authentic pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i probably won't come back here unless they somehow manage to replicate everything that the la location offers. this place seemed like the "mcdonalds" version of pink's. the only good thing is that they accept credit cards, while the la location is only accepts cash.

i had lunch here monday with several friends.

<mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>: 3.5/5
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>: 3.5/5
service: 3.5/5
ambience: 2/5

during my thanksgiving vacation my first dinner in vegas is pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i was told the pink <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is the most famous one in hollywood. since i never got a chance to visit the hollywood one, we decided to give it a try and see how their "hollywood" tastes.

my <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> comes with some bacon and melted cheese, along with the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it was not that bad but i did feel a little bit ripped off. i guess anyone who has bacon, american cheddar, <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and bun could easily make a <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> at home with a much lower price. is it because it's on the strip and they need to pay for the rent and renovation (and advertising as well)? 

i would think even the costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> has more cost-performance value than pink's at las vegas. after visiting this store, i think i need to find out how the real socal, hollywood pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> tastes, not the fake hollywood!

oh by the way - don't order their fries. very expensive and small portion.

this pink's serves up tasty dogs for sure - but i suppose it's all about the toppings. i opted for the cheesy-grilled mush/onion-<mark>Bacon</mark> goodness of the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (i guess a new creation just for this las vegas location) which was exactly what i'd expect a polish piled with melted cheese, grilled stuff, and good bacon to taste like. 

my only qualm is the outdoor-only seating where you see large hordes of asian families hovering around the deck heaters (perhaps this was simply a product of being here around christmastime), and the pricing - which is a little more than i'd expect out of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (considering for the price i could have a pretty decent lunch at a many a sit-down restaurant).

it was good, but nothing too special.

i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which was good, but nothing crazy!

definite yes in my book.
i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which consists of clogging your arteries but it's so good. ( <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, cheese, onions, and  bacon).
add some fries and a drink and i was a happy camper. kind of pricey ( $15.00) but it's vegas baby. it's all play money anyway.
i had to walk the whole strip to work off the calories.

so i was really excited to try this place.  i heard pink's is the #1 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, better than gray's papaya in new york.  i seriously couldn't wait after i saw that planet hollywood had a pink's there.  i decided to order something different.  it was the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> or something like that..  i didn't like it at all.  i didn't want to try anything else because i paid $16 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, fries, and a coke.  they get two stars because i liked the fries.  my friends told me i would like the los angeles location better.  hopefully it is better than las vegas.

i really wanted to see what the hype was all about with pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i have to say it can be good depending on what you order.  

the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> really blew me away.  it was just loaded with bacon, cheese, mushrooms, and onions.  it was a complete task just trying to keep it together while eating it.  and somewhere under all that mess was a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  it was really good!  worth the $8.50?  well, it's on the strip so i'm not going to knock it on price.

i also ordered the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark>.  this one didn't really blow me away, but it was also a task to keep this one together. still good though, but it tasted like something i could've had at nathan's.   price was a little cheaper though at $7.50.

so yeah, i spent about $16 on two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  sounds crazy i know, but now at least have a taste of what pink's has to offer.  maybe next time i'll give their pastrami <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> a shot.  looks really heavy! 

it was a-ok!

on my last day in vegas, i went on a search for this pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> as i was told by my girlfriend that their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are suppose to be really good.  i guess it is more than a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it's an experience.  well...experience is the right word for it.  they not only have regular dogs, but they have specialty dogs as well with everything imaginable on top.

first...the entrance to pinks is from the sidewalk on the strip.  i was parked in the back parking garage, so coming from the backside of the miracle mile, i was lost.  i thought pinks was inside or would have an entrance from the inside.  they do not.  i walked around for about 20 min. trying to find it before i realized it was outside.

looking over the menu i just didn't want to have an old fashioned <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i wanted to try one of their special dogs.  i ordered up a <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with cheese sauce, mushrooms, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and bacon.  they have a list of other dogs as well for anything you are craving.  my order arrived and i was ready to eat.  

well...it was an experience that's for sure!  trying to eat this huge dog with all the toppings gave a new meaning to messy!  i had to finish with a fork because it was just too much!

while the prices of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are a bit high ($8 for my ph dog), it's a good place to try a specialty dog while you are in vegas.  would i try it again?  possibly...

flippin' delicious!!!! i had the mushroom & <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. i yummed that down in a matter of minutes.. my husband even laughed that i scarffed it all down when he'd just started eating. i'm not normally a fan of food like this.. but holy cow. i wish i'd gone before we were supposed to be catching a flight in 3 hours. my husband had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>.. which was giant compared to mine.. i tasted that one too.. yum! prices were good.. [was under $15 until we added fries, beer, water & a pinks lemonade... which bumped us up to almost $40] 

the food was hot & fresh. there was no line or wait when we went [on a friday at around 6pm].. not much seating, but as they weren't busy it was okay and there was plenty of room. the giant pink fan that continually spray out water felt great. we will return next trip!

oh, and the staff was very friendly!

first time had a pink <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i got me a chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> for $16.  i'm not sure if its was worth it but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was good.  
sorry i had to use fork and knife, i din't want any cheese and chili dripping all over me.

was walking the strip when i saw this place. "ohh pinks! that's that famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> spot in la where all the celebrities go and people line up for 2 hours to get a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!" situated right in front of planet hollywood, i knew i just to get one of those wonderful meats encased in tube form, as anthony bourdain would say...lol. the place itself is really small, you order, slide down to the left to pick up your food, and there's an outdor patio where you can eat. there's a quite extensive menu including not only <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but burgers as well and a myriad of toppings...the most familiar being chili and cheese to the exotic of avocado and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>. i went with the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, onions, cheese, and bacon. it was hearty and delicious. a lil pricey at around $8 but i think it was worth it....will definitely be checking out other menu offerings the next time i'm in vegas!

i've heard a lot about this place and i think i was expecting too much from the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. honestly, they didn't taste special to me at all. it was a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but definitely not worth the hype. we ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which came with 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, guacamole, jalapenos, chili cheese, mustard and onions. we also got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which was a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> that came with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushroom, bacon and cheese. both tasted decent. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were mediocre. it was worth a shot but i don't plan on visiting this place again.

my house people told me that i gained weight. who's to blame?
i didn't go to many other food places in vegas. who's to blame?

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!

i spent 4 days in vegas, and pinks fed my stomach 3 times in 4 days.
day 1:
chilli <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (me)
mushroom <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 2:
<mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (my friend)
<mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> (me)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 4: 
2 <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (me& my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>
coleslaw

* the coleslaw is a no, but whatever, i love you still, pinks!

after a night of excessive drinking...what would be better for breakfast than a giant <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> smothered in salty ooze?

i got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. polish. <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>. onions. mushrooms. bacon. bacon. omg. wut?

i came. i saw. i left 2 inches of dog left....  next time i shall do less extravagantly.

p.s. don't go shopping and try on tight clothes afterwards.

i wish my friends and i had some self-control when it came to food cause we were not planning on eating when we walked out of the planet hollywood hotel but it smelled sooooooo good outside of  pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that we turned,  looked at each other and walked in! the menu hot a huge selection and i ended up choosing the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which came with cheese, mushrooms, bacon and i forgot what else. it was huge and cost over $9!  there were some you could get for around $5. after i made my decision i noticed that by the register they had a paper that advertised the hot-dogs wanna be celebrities like holly madison and kim kardashian like.  i love reality shows so i would probably have copied  one of their choices, lol. anyways, my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good but not $9 good. i probably would only go back if i was in the area but would not go out of my way to visit the one in la.  it was still cool to hang out there on the strip and people watch while we ate.

i was looking forward to trying this place out all weekend!

after having drinks all day and night, i really wanted something bad.. real bad for me..

i decided to order a <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>.  this had bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> on top of a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  let me tell ya, it was exactly what i was craving.  it was a bit on the salty side though.  i was already dehydrated enough, the bacon was real salty... and i love salty things ;)  other than that, i've never had a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> so yummy and so big!  i couldn't finish it.

the wait wasn't too bad when we came and actually getting our dogs didn't take long either.  i liked the environment, it was fun and exciting.

i'll probably come back here when i have a huge appetite and i haven't done my make-up.  by the end of eating your dog, you've wiped off all the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> that's gotten on your face and your freshly put on make-up!

i go here every time we are in vegas.  this time we got a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> (which is my fave), <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>, and the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> with 2 orders of fries and onions rings for 4 people.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were enough for 4 people to share.  i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was pretty big.  they have outside seating.  they probably have like 6 or 7 tables out there.  
i think on fridays and saturdays they close at 0300 which is good for a early morning snack.  each <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is like under $9 which isnt bad.  they accept credit cards and cash.

i always heard about pink's & finally got the chance to try it for the first time :)

at first, i was going to be boring & order a regular <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. but since it was my first time, might as well try a specialty!

my friend & i decided to order 2 different specialty dogs & split it so we could have 2 kinds. we ordered the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> & <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> was a bit on the lighter side (compared to the other specialty dogs). i'm not a big bacon person (which was on the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>), but it was quite appetizing. however, it was huge & it fills you up really quick. 

seating is outside under umbrellas. it was kinda nice since it was a shaded area.

customer service was good.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good, but not sure if i'd spend  that much on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> again. worth a try though!

this place makes me kinda sad because in la, pink's is a huge hit. i wish this place could have all the options the one in <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, but it doesn't. it has the original toppings, but the celebrity specialties are missing. the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark> sufficed for my trips here, but definitely wasn't worth it while having a hangover.

other than that, wait is pretty short and there's plenty of outdoor seating which is conveniently placed in mist.

one of the few places that i've been to that actually lived up to the hype. it was soo good, i came here twice. i got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. if it is your first time i suggest you try the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>. i also tried the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, this thing is a beast. you seriously need 3 people to finish the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. definitely a spot to hit up for a quick eat.

pink's is located right outside the planet hollywood hotel & casino. small inside, however large patio outside. if you haven't tried a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you have to if you're in vegas. it's fast and easy, but not the cheapest. but is anything is vegas cheap?

everything is made to order which is nice; i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with a side of <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. the bacon was crisp, the chili was nice and meaty, but the cheese seemed like liquid <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>...however, the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were fresh. 

my friend's tried the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and they enjoyed that as well.

i have been to pinks a few times in los angeles but this is my first time here in vegas. compared to back home, which is in la, i think i'll choose the one in la. but since my boyfriend never had pinks in either location, i decided to pop his pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> cherry. whoa that sounded a little inappropriate lol. but here goes:

my boyfriend ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which is loaded with bacon, cheese, mushroom, and err did i mention bacon?! and i ordered the pastrami britain dog which is just a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> and pastrami. holy moly, the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> is monstrous compared to my <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. if you put then next to each other, it looks like umm you know what evolving. boy becomes a man. haha. since the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> and the bacon overload was too much for the buns, it looked quite messy. well, with two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, a side of fries, and a coke... our total was $18. bull!

pros:
-short line... fast food
-addicting fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>
-good portion... very filling for me especially the fries
-opens late so it's good for after clubbing or unless you're a fatty like me and wants to have a midnight dinner err snack..
-they sell jello shots here

cons:
-even though the line is short, it's so boring. i like that rush of excitement where you see people all hyped up about it order a ton of food and end up not finishing it
-very greasy... made my buns soggy 
-overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i can get at costco for only $1.50 with a free drink
-outdoor seatings only
-my boyfriend wasnt satisfied so it made me look bad. i have to take him to the one in la

went to my first pink's of any kind today. heading into the first bite, i definitely did have high expectations, mainly because i was hungry, and also because the prices looked pretty darn high, even after accounting for the recent groupon deal. however, keep in mind that this in in the heart of the las vegas strip, so really you'd almost expect it to be pricey. it's not fair to compare this to costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on price.

when i tried my friend's <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, my eyes, taste <mark>Bud</mark>, and probably everything else just lit up. yeah, hunger is the best sauce or whatever, but every component of that dog - bun, sausage, chili, and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> - was really delicious and made me wish that i had chosen it. instead, i had gone with the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which was also quite tasty with bacon and some sort of enhanced 'shrooms. i also loved the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, which is fatter than the normal wiener, and the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> went surprisingly well with the rest of the ingredients.

we also shared some deluxe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which had a crapload of toppings on them. in hindsight, if i had known how loaded the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> would be, i would've ordered normal fries for about half the price because my friend was pretty much evacuating his toppings onto the fries. oh well, live and learn.

anyway, i've seen the other reviews, and i'm sure it doesn't match everything that people like about the original pink's - which i still hope to go to some day - but it's still good eating. not considering the price, the only problem i have is that i'd rather go to earl of sandwich, which is right next door and which i love to death, so i might not really see this place much at all in the future. oh well, it was yummy knowing you.
