after seeing so many television programs about pink's and how amazing it is, i had to try it when i was in vegas.  i ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> in a bun with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, bacon, and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.  the onions and mushrooms were scarce and barely grilled. the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> was just the normal <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> you get anywhere else.  there were about 5 strips of crispy bacon, but that didn't seem to justify the price of $8.99.  the sausage wasn't even particularly amazing either.  

i also didn't like how cramped <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and overall space was.  only two parties can stand in line before people must wait outside in the 100+ degree weather.  while the seating area did have fans, they were so powerful that they were more bothersome than pleasant - my napkins kept flying away and my hair flew in my face!

i'm glad i checked it off of my places to try, but i wouldn't go back again.  i'd much rather spend $1.50 at costco and get a soda as well!

not too impressed. we had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and he brooklyn pastrami.

price- pretty expensive for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. got the two mentioned above plus fries for $22.
quality- pinks is known more for their toppings than actual <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the pastrami was very thin and dry and the cheese on the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> was <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.
quantity- decent sized portions.
atmosphere- bit tacky with the celeb pics everywhere.
staff- nice people

probs won't go back.

i give this pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> 3 stars it doesn't compare to the one in la, but it still ok and it does have that snap when you bite in to it. but it just doesn't feel the same as the one in cali. it located at planet hollywood, they only have outdoor seating which is ok, but the inside is very small and doesn't have all the choice they have in la. i try the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and it was good. i think i just like the old school <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place that i had in vegas. it true the original is always better.

pretty good, i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, loaded with 3 strips of bacon, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, mushrooms and onions. pretty messy, which made it even better. i have always heard good things and wasn't disappointed. i have heard the one in la is better, but i mean really, it was pretty great, and honestly, it's a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>...my expectations were met and exceeded even. 
downside: only outdoor seating, i was glad i brought a jacket. also, i asked for water and they gave me a cup that holds 4 ounces. it was like taking water shots. give me a break with that, i understand you're not making money by me drinking water, but it's a convenience issue for your customer, don't you think? having to run back and forth 7 times for water in one meal=super annoying.

so this place is awesome.  don't come here looking for something healthy -- come here to splurge and indulge to your hearts content.  

i ordered  the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which had <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> & mushrooms, a pancetta-like bacon that was out of this world, all smothered in <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.  this was divine.  of course, i could barely finish half of it.  but it was worth every penny and every calorie.  

my friend ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, which had 2 dogs in one bun, mustard, onions, chili, <mark>American Cheese</mark>, guacamole and jalape\u00f1os.  she said it was just as amazing.  

and of course, we had to get chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  

the ambiance was fun - we sat on the patio and got to people watch.  it's right in the middle of the vegas strip, so it's a great location.  the cashier was friendly and helpful, the food took maybe 5 minutes to prepare.  it was just a great experience.  if/when i go back to vegas, i will definitely come again!  maybe this time i'll use it as hangover food though.... ;)

i didn't know there was a pink's in vegas and so when i walked by, i just had to stop in. 

it was packed in the outside seating area but the counter was free so there wasn't too bad of a wait and finding a table worked out pretty well too. 

i went with the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> because the combo of bacon, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> and other grilled goodness was just too hard to pass up. 

when i got my food, there was no way to eat this thing with my hands, had to fork and knife-up for this one.

while cutting through my first piece of deliciousness my knife melted at the steaming cheese and scorching hot <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. the knife was a mangled mess but fortunately my food was still intact...and what does my dumbass do?? i take a big ole bite of that crazy hot <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> and burn the living bejesus out of my tongue!!! (all my fault too, but i just couldn't wait)

anyways... from what i was able to taste, the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> was very flavorful and definitely filling. it was your typical gut-bomb type of food but do would you expect anything different??

just make sure to let it cool down a bit if it melts any of your utensils before taking a bite lol.

pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in la is now in vegas.  and truly, is that a bad thing?  having one of these artery clogging bad boys after a night of debauchery just hits the spot.

we ordered the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>.  there was a lot of food on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> (mushrooms/bacon/cheese), and while it was extremely messy it was very good..  finished it all, and i would do it again.  since we stayed at planet hollywood we actually repeated the same meal after our second night of debauchery.

are they overpriced?  yes, but a lot of things in vegas are.  should a buffet really be $30 or a burger be $16-18 without fries?  i think not, so when you drop $6-8 on a dog, it's not really that bad.

overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my friends told me that i had to try pinks so i did. i was not impressed. it was okay. i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. maybe i needed to try a diff style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  one order of fries can feed 2 pple though.

ok. i don't know how much better than average these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are. buns are standard. we ate the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which had the potential to be a super guilty, but worth-it experience, but it was just that - standard ingredients of a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, and bacon with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>. you can probably just load it up like that at home and make it just as good, or better. maybe i was just expecting more with the hype.

after an 8 hour flight & another hour for the shuttle to drive me to my hotel not to mention going to the airport 2 hours before departure, i can barely contain my hunger...you know how the airlines does not provide decent meals anymore...they just provide a snack of pretzel & peanuts with your soda...

as soon as i arrive in my hotel, my friend came over & went out for some late night snack.  it was almost 11:00 pm so we walked down the strip and notice this small pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stall right before the entrance of the planet hollywood, has a small seating area of around a dozen or less tables & decided to give it a try.  

i am not really a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan but  the menu makes me want to try it...besides, bellagio is right across where you can enjoy the dancing waters. we both had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which consists of <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, bacon& cheese. quite expensive for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> paid around $20.00 but hey this is vegas... you can add whatever condiment you want from the counter...ketchup or mustard or both, fries & soda...it was very filling & enjoyed it so much.  this much i can say...the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a lot longer than the bun....would i try it again..definitely!!!

got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. it's a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with onions, bacon, cheese and awesome. it's messy and delicious. yes, it's a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. if you came here thinking high quality food, you must be trippin. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. keep your expectations in check. for what it is, it's awesome. little more expensive than their la location but it's a nice little meal after a night of drinking.

almost as good as the pink's in la.... almost.
the pink's in <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> not have cake, like the original pink's los angeles. and for the record the cake is made from scratch, not a box; according to my dad. who isn't skinny, and knows a thing or two about cake. but that doesn't matter, because there is no cake at the pink's in vegas.

i don't know why people are questioning the price? these are not the same <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> as costco! pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> are better, overall. higher quality meat, casing, larger in size, and with toppings. pink's is not in the miracle mile shops, they are on the front of the ph, with patio seating on the strip. so no. $5-10 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> loaded with toppings and bacon isn't a lot. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at serendipity 3 at caesar's is $15.

and if you ask politely, they will do half fries / half <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.

i am a fan of the regular <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. but when we ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> we were really disappointed. a waste of money basically, i wouldn't order those again and the sausage was too hard. also, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are very expensive. but it's vegas i guess, what else can i expect. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were very good too. as a suggestion, just stick to the original dog, the others are below average

i discovered this place on my friend's instagram, but i thought that i'd never try it because a norcal girl like me wouldn't be in socal too often. however, to my luck, it was fate that my vegas trip brought me here to dine with my girlfriends for a bite. we ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were super crispy and fresh, and definitely one of the best fries i've ever tasted. they were gone instantly among the four of us. i split the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> with my friend since it had two dogs inside of it, and i never thought i'd be eating guacamole on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> until that day. it was delicious! i have no other words to describe it, but both guacamole and chili were great additions to my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i haven't tried the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, but my friends gushed about how great it tasted.

the prices may be expensive for something like a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but you're paying for the presentation and quality of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> combinations, which are all pretty amazing.

it's just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> loaded with condiments.  sounds so simple.  so how good can it be?  well, the quality of the meat and bun along with the combination of the extras does the trick.  while i cannot review all of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> on the menu, the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> was the most memorable the last time i ordered from pink's.  bacon, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and onions!!!  i'm not a big fan of the classic since it tastes rather plain compared to all of these special dogs.  since it opens relatively late (early for lv standards), you have no excuse to not skip pink's.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are spectacular!  both their classic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and specialty <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are delicious and more than satisfying; if you're a fan of natural casing then you'll be in heaven.  the menu feels smaller than the legendary hollywood location's, but they have all the classics and favorites, though sometimes under different names.

i developed a fondness for pink's while living in la and i've missed it terribly since i left, part of that is because there isn't much of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> scene where i live, so if you are visiting from a city with great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joints, you may not be as impressed.

i was dismayed when i didn't recognize the menu, i'd been harboring a mad craving for a martha stewart dog and it wasn't to be found.  fortunately the cashier helped me identify the vegas equivalent of the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and i found it, it is <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and i highly recommend it.  if you're more in a sausage mood, the planet hollywood is a delicious option.  i missed pink's so much i had both of these gigantic dogs.
i got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. it was polish with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and sauted mushrooms, it was awesome. and cheap too.

wow, has it really been 5 years since my last review at pink's??  well, other than satisfy my craving for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, nothing's really changed from my last experience here except for the prices which have increased since then.

chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> -- http://bit.ly/1fssnto
mustard, relish, lettuce & tomatoes
the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good but it was basically a salad on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  because it's on their classic dog side of the menu, the price wasn't too bad but still pricey though for what i got.  i guess i probably should've ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (http://bit.ly/1jikjji) again because at least it has more of a 'wow' factor.

for convenience on being right on the strip, i like pink's.  but i think i'd rather get my gourmet <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fix off the strip at buldogis or even at g<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> ramsay burgr.

sometimes you just want to indulge with meat, cheese, bacon and other junk. if that's what you're looking for, this place will hit the spot. definitely not for the dieter, but would definitely make a great cheat meal. the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> was fantastic. i scarfed it down so fast.

good food, but i thought the price was a little too much. i spent almost $30 for the <mark>Mushroom Swiss Dog</mark>, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, the (something) man dog, and a small bowl of chili. i ate everything but the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, i was too drunk to finish it. 

bottomline: i probably wouldn't come back here again, it seems to me the one in la tasted better.

one word: disgraceful. this rendition of pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was nothing comparable to the one in los angeles. i came here after a long walk on a hot day visiting places on the strip and i was utterly disgusted with my order. i had gotten the <mark>Mushroom Swiss Dog</mark> with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, mushrooms and mayo. first of all, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wiener itself was ordinary, almost as if i bought the pack of ten from a grocery store along with grocery store <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> buns. the mushrooms tasted like rubber canned mushrooms that should be stamped inedible. not only that, but a large dollop of mayo on top of this mess made me want to gag. i immediately regretted my order as i saw it and was even more sad to see $7 go to waste. however, i did really enjoy the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, but only temporarily. the mixture of fake beef and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> did not bode well for any of my friends and i would not recommend coming here when there are plenty of other great places on the strip. yelpers, beware.. false franchising!!

i went here twice while i was in vegas. don't trust my review though, since i wasn't exactly sober lol.

the first night, i went for the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. from what i can remember, it was freaking amazing. my best friend told me i scarfed it down.

the second day, i went for the <mark>Mushroom Swiss Dog</mark> (i forgot the exact name). it was just a-ok.

definitely going back when i go back to vegas though :)

we were looking for something fast so we decided to stop here thinking it would be a quick and cheap stop. i know they have more of these in california and i heard they're pretty popular but after eating here, i cannot find a single reason why.

i don't really like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (which maybe discredits my review) but my two other friends got <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and nobody enjoyed their food. i got a cheeseburger which are usually hard to mess up. it wasn't burnt or anything but there was absolutely no flavor and the tomatoes were diced and the lettuce shredded. i get that shredded premade veggies may be easier but who puts diced tomatoes on a burger? it made it really messy to eat. and at almost 9 bucks for a standard burger (with no fries or drink) i expected a little more. my friends <mark>Mushroom Swiss Dog</mark> had mushrooms that tasted old and my other friend got the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. we all got halfway through and looked at each other with dissatisfied faces and tossed the rest. sadly, i think you'd be better off at a mcdonalds.

oh and to top it off some blaring alarm was going off the whole time and no one seemed to mind it or address to their customers that everything was fine or that it would be turned off shortly. i think it was the fire alarm, idk lights were flashing and a siren going. i understand that it may have been out of their control, but i think good customer service would have acknowledged it and let the customer know the roof wasn't going to fall in or something like that.

the pink's in southern california is another one of my bookmarked businesses. and again the franchise opened another location in las vegas. 

located right on the busy las vegas blvd strip and in the planet hollywood resort, there are no indoor seating, but plenty of outdoor seating. a great view of the strip and the bellagio hotel located across the street. 

i had one of their unique hot-dogs-"<mark>Three Dog Night</mark>". for $8.25, i get three skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wrapped with bacon and chlli, cheese and chopped red onions in a flour tortilla. this gourmet <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is featured on triple-d in so-cal and guy fieri considered this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, "money". but my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is nowhere as good as his, where my slices of bacon was "undercooked" and not crispy. i still prefer the <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> cart on mission st in san francisco any given day. 

the only positive thing about the small <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place is that i get to see the fountain show at the bellagio while eating my subpar snack. 

i'll still go to the pink's in southern california and check out other items though.

<mark>Three Dog Night</mark>: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/t0uw6vwwfo3el29wbodamq?select=zpkgzbo64jo7u91bf6exsa

extremely mediocre. i went with the 3 <mark>Three Dog Night</mark> which is: 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, wrapped in a giant tortilla, 3 slices of cheese, 3 slices of bacon, chili & onions. with a lineup like that, you'd think it would be earth shattering. it was not. it was actually borderline gross. the chili was very oily, flavorless, but every aromatic.....to the point that i had to wash my hands...... twice. overall, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were good, but i think this place is grossly over hyped and there is a line. i'll try the one in hollywood next time i'm in l.a., but the lv version is not worth your time. meh.

we go here every time we are in vegas.   we preffer them to nathans thats for sure.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are bigger and have more flavor.  its not the easiert place to find.  in fact we had to help two local women find it and it took us a few tries.   the seating is certainly limited and is all outside but the food is always fresh.   the fries are good as well.   i personally like to make my own combination but my boyfriend like the <mark>Three Dog Night</mark>!   i am more of a mustart and onion kind of gal.  the best part is that you do not have to stand in line for hours like the original one but it is kind of cold to sit outside int he winter.

was tempted to give 2 stars, but i think that was just because i ordered something ridiculous--the 3 <mark>Three Dog Night</mark>. it was 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wrapped up in a tortilla with chili. that was an adult beverage influenced decision. whoops. i would give it another try and get something more reasonable.

every time i hit vegas, i go to pinks now. they take <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to another level. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are worth it, and the 3 <mark>Three Dog Night</mark> is my fav <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> selection they offer. street level seating mid strip. perfect location.

i do feel the need to paint a little picture before writing this review... its monday morning, last day in vegas, ish needs too go down. bottle of gentlemen jack - killed by 1030am. 4 rounds of flip cup for shots donezo by noon. the day is now set for ultimate triumph or complete utter disaster. 

walking down the strip, i had seen pinks the day before. i had no clue that pinks had expanded from la and was stoked! when we got in, i had to ask if it was the same and homeboy at the counter said "yeah, its exactly the same but we just charge a lot more." i laughed and asked where he was from.... 408... gotta love the bay!! 

i ordered a las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>: 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, chili, cheese, guac, onions, mustard, jalapeno. 
a friend order some kind of bacon, cheese chili craziness dog. wow 
to top it all off, we split some <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. 

ok - i get that its really pricey for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i was so full that it didn't matter. when it comes down to it, 9 bucks isnt that bad if you end up satisfied it is?

the perfect end to an awesome weekend in lv.

i went here for lunch the last day i was in vegas.  i had the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which was 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in the same bun with chili, mustard, onions, guacamole and jalapenos.  it was good, but i have had better.  i do have to give them a thumbs up for the selection of dogs they had considering it just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint.  i make sure you only come here when the weather is nice.  they only have outdoor seating so you'll be really hot in the summer nad really cold in the winter.

yummy!!! as im typing this im craving one now. too bad im back at home and we dont have pinks here!! i ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> and it was great!!! loved everything abt it. glad i split it with my husband or else i dont think i would have been able to finish it.

the only downfall is no seating inside. ummmm hello this is vegas. why would the only tables be outside in the heat?!?!? 

otherwise, it was a great place. will gladly go back again

my friends were excited to try out this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint, since its pretty famous in la.  however, when i got there, it was nothing special.  i got the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>.  it has 2 <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> in one bun, mustard, jalapenos, onions, chili cheese, and guacamole -- all for $7.25. its huge! the looks of it seems delicious, but after a few bites of it..i got sick of it.  not only because it was too big to finish but the flavoring was too much! especially with all the cheese, and guacamole together. blehh. if you like spicy then you should go for this one. the jalapenos gave a lot of flavor and spice into it. 

they don't have indoor sitting, and their patio is pretty small, so finding a seat can be hard. it was hot about 100+ degrees when i went there and they had the fan blowing into my face while i was eating.  it was so hard to eat.   

eh, i thought costco $1.50 <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> + drink taste better than this. its was pretty expensive for me since i only took a few bites and got sick of it.

giving this spot 4 stars would only be submitting to the hype. i liked it...don't get me wrong, but it didn't really give me a foodgasm. wifey ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and i ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>. <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> consisted of dos dogs, guac, mustard, cheese, onions, a mound of chili and topped w/ 'penos all stuffed in a single bun. good stuff, but a little over the top. we were both satisfied, but not in a craving way. the thing that stood out the most was the snap and the juiciness as you bite into the "pink" weiner (that doesn't sound right, but oh well... ). 

for the crazy decked out <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> experience alone...it's worth it! good luck figuring out how to eat one of these monstrosities.

i've been here twice now (the second time hoping that it would be better) but of course, it wasn't any better the second time around. firstly, the pink's in la is wayyyyy better. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were semi-cold. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was only decent. i ordered the mushroom swiss and the mushrooms were rubbery and cold. the second time i ordered the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (?) it was much better but still only ok. overall, don't expect la pink's quality and if there is a huge line, it's definitely not worth the wait.

we went to las vegas for my 30th birthday bash and my sister told me they had a pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> there in vegas like da one in hollywood and so i had to try one before i left....my friend, husband and i were on a mission to find it...we asked security at the new york new york hotel where pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was at and he directed us to hard rock hotel...so we take a cab to the hotel we get there...only to find out that its pink's tacos and not <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>...i was soo pissed but i still wanted to get there! we take a cab back n the guy tells us its right on the strip by planet hollywood lol....that made me more mad! so we get to pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> finally at 2am! i order the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which has 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on one bun, chili, cheese, <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, avocado, onions, jalape\u00f1os mustard n keptchup! omg it was delish! i love how da <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a crunch sorta like a hot link....my husbands <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was delish too! 

overall it was delish just like i had imagined! love me some pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i will most def come here again when i am in vegas!

while on our honeymoon in vegas last week, i found out that there was a pink's there! i thought there was only the one in cali. so needless to say we went there for lunch. it was so good! my husband had the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>, and i had the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>. these dogs were huge and totally worth the price. the fries were crisp, fresh and very tasty. they also offer free refills on soda. i wish that pink's would open a location here in s.fl.

i've heard a lot about this place and i think i was expecting too much from the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. honestly, they didn't taste special to me at all. it was a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but definitely not worth the hype. we ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which came with 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, guacamole, jalapenos, chili cheese, mustard and onions. we also got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which was a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> that came with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushroom, bacon and cheese. both tasted decent. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were mediocre. it was worth a shot but i don't plan on visiting this place again.

my house people told me that i gained weight. who's to blame?
i didn't go to many other food places in vegas. who's to blame?

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!

i spent 4 days in vegas, and pinks fed my stomach 3 times in 4 days.
day 1:
chilli <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (me)
mushroom <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 2:
<mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (my friend)
<mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> (me)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 4: 
2 <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (me& my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>
coleslaw

* the coleslaw is a no, but whatever, i love you still, pinks!

ive been to pinks in la a lot.. this one in <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> not compare to the la one. the la ones are so much jucier and bigger. this one skimps on the toppings. la does not.. they pile that stuff on like nobodys business. definately give it a try if you have not ate at pinks before though because it is cool to try out all of the unique dogs.:)

good food, but i thought the price was a little too much. i spent almost $30 for the <mark>Mushroom Swiss Dog</mark>, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, the (something) man dog, and a small bowl of chili. i ate everything but the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, i was too drunk to finish it. 

bottomline: i probably wouldn't come back here again, it seems to me the one in la tasted better.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in las vegas are unique and taste pretty decent.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are large and have decent toppings.  i agree with other reviews that this joint offers crappy toppings for you to put on, which implies to me that they are not always using top ingredients for these top dollar dogs.

this is a place for me to say i ate at, but not something i would go to more than once or twice a year max.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> come with basic long dogs or a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> is nice and big and tastes pretty good.  i would suggest skipping the "<mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>" as it lacks from what a i would call a true chicago style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> was pretty good as was the majove dog.

overall an a-ok place to eat a fancy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but not something you want to eat at often or more than once a year.  be prepared for a pricey experience with somewhat questionable topping quality.

my wife and i finally made it here on our last night, i had the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> and it was lovely and i will certainly go again, yes <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> maybe a little on the expensive side but  you can sit outside and view the strip while eating your dogs so i'm not going to complain.
along with the earl of sandwich this is a great place to snack before you start your evening or to finish off a great night in vegas.

i never thought i'd spend $30 for 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but here i am standing at the pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> shop with my jaw dropped at the cash register in vegas. all i could think while i was waiting is that these damn dogs better be fantastic. 

in about 10 minutes my number was called. i got the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (two dogs in one bun) and <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. i tried a bite of all three and none of them wowed me. <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> was topped with cheap <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, onions, bland guac and tomatoes. there wasn't a spice factor in there at all. the vegas strip was similar to the spicy except that it was two dogs, chili  and had jalapenos, i thought this blended together better but still wasn't "omg this is the best $8 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever put in my mouth" type of good. 

overall, i was full but not satisfied.

probably one of the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever eaten.  i had the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  the line was long, but went fast and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were served quickly as well.  i'd recommend this place to all my friends when they go to las vegas.

came here with the groupon deal.  i already knew before hand that it's very expensive <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  given it's on the strip, so expect to pay more.  had the mojave and <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>.  very nicely done, the wait was okay and seating is limited.  giving this a 3 stars because it tasted good, but honestly i wouldn't pay full price for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.

meh. i've experienced better... exactly what i was thinking!

after all the hype i've heard about the famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in la, i seriously thought i would have been blown away by the experience... maybe its because of the hype that shot my expectations through the roof, but wouldn't you think with all the hype, it should at least make me want to come back for more? 

but i'm the kind of girl that always gives a place the benefit of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, perhaps i ordered something not-so-amazing on the menu -- the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark>, i honestly thought this was a pretty good choice!! equipped with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrami, mustard, <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> & sauerkraut... i mean its not the fattiest of the bunch, but lets be honest the scorching hot weather was taking a negative toll on my appetite. regardless of my choice, i had the chance to have a bite of a few others -- the planet hollywood, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>... nothing really sang to me ya know? in other words, i was hoping for more, something more memorable and amazing rather than just a meal to fill me up. i think i'll give the la pink's a chance, but if that doesn't change my mind, who knows what will.

so this place is awesome.  don't come here looking for something healthy -- come here to splurge and indulge to your hearts content.  

i ordered  the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which had <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> & mushrooms, a pancetta-like bacon that was out of this world, all smothered in <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.  this was divine.  of course, i could barely finish half of it.  but it was worth every penny and every calorie.  

my friend ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, which had 2 dogs in one bun, mustard, onions, chili, <mark>American Cheese</mark>, guacamole and jalape\u00f1os.  she said it was just as amazing.  

and of course, we had to get chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  

the ambiance was fun - we sat on the patio and got to people watch.  it's right in the middle of the vegas strip, so it's a great location.  the cashier was friendly and helpful, the food took maybe 5 minutes to prepare.  it was just a great experience.  if/when i go back to vegas, i will definitely come again!  maybe this time i'll use it as hangover food though.... ;)

man, do i love snapping into a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!  i've been to this one in vegas and the universal city walk.  i think this one is my fave.  my review is based on an accumulation of about 3 visits.

i usually try to tackle two dogs, even though sometimes that turns out to be a mistake for my tummy.  i love the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> ("2 dogs in one bun, mustard, onions, chili, am cheese, guacamole & jalape\u00f1os") and anything with bacon.  their bacon is really good and crisp, definitely not some broken bits from a can.  i mean, this has ruined me for other <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!

if i have a complaint, it's that <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are too loaded and too messy.  i feel like a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> needs to be eaten with your hands, but some of these are knife-and-forkers.  the bun just doesn't support the toppings, and there's lots of clean-up afterwards.  this certainly isn't the worst thing that could happen, and in the long-run i'd rather this than skimpy toppings.

late saturday night, i was craving something heavy and unhealthy like a cheesy burger or something similar. walked around miracle mile but the burger joint was closed so i found pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the map right outside planet hollywood. the interior was claustrophobically cramped. basically it's where you order and get your food and there are a lot of outdoor seating. 

i got their <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which consists of 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in 1 bun covered with chili, guacamole, cheese, onions, mustard and jalopenos for about 7 bucks. it was heavy but satisfying. it had many layers of flavors but was mild. but the main point is that my fix was satisfied.

i always like coming here when i go to vegas because it's cheap (ish), tasty, and it doesn't take forever to get there because it's right on the outside of the miracle mile shops. 

i'm not a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>/pink's expert like maybe everyone else that reviewed this but i've been here a several times and never had a bad experience. i either get <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> or the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>. both are great if you like onions and jalapenos. the chili on the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> is also pretty good and hits the spot if you're starving or hungover. 

the outdoor seating kind of sucks if it's prime lunch time because there's only about 12 small tables. 

all and all, 
great food that's reasonably priced. 
definitely going to keep coming here!

should've went to nathans!

i visited pinks 4th of july.. i was staying at planet hollywood so it was very convenient not too mention all the hooplah about it made me of course want to try it out for myself. this price is overpriced .. the chili on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is very bland... i don't know.. gave me heartburn or indigestion after.. the worse = ((

 even ordered the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which included bacon and tomatoes etc.. it was all just an overpriced wreck
oh and the cheese was like a <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> sauce or something.. like the orange kind that comes out of a big can.. no bueno!

like the other reviews said.. keep walking.. so not worth the $20 for a huge wienie and some chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>...lol

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> there are good, not the greatest, but i like the different toppings and types of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> they have. this wouldn't be a place i have to go to every time i'm in vegas, but would definitely go if i wanted something quick and easy. the service was nice, quick, and friendly.

unfortunately, it was really windy the day we went so we had to stand inside at a very small counter. it's pretty small inside. i wish there were more inside seating. there is plenty of outside patio seating if the weather was nice enough.

we ordered:
-<mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>
-<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>
-mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>

so sure, it's not like the real pink's in la, but it's still delicious. and, thankfully, it never has near the line/wait that the la pink's does. plus, it has dogs that are unique to this vegas location. the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> is total must - 2 dogs, mustard, onion, chili, cheese, guac, and jalapenos. oh my! it was filling and yummy. and, of course, you have to get fries too. there's only outdoor seating, but they have heat lamps. and since it's right on the strip, it's some good people-watching, which i always appreciate. so if you're at planet hollywood, or walking by, and find yourself hungry, don't miss this spot.
pink's becomes delicious late at night, especially the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> - full of guacamole and goodness. add fries and some chili and you are good to go!

i discovered this place on my friend's instagram, but i thought that i'd never try it because a norcal girl like me wouldn't be in socal too often. however, to my luck, it was fate that my vegas trip brought me here to dine with my girlfriends for a bite. we ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were super crispy and fresh, and definitely one of the best fries i've ever tasted. they were gone instantly among the four of us. i split the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> with my friend since it had two dogs inside of it, and i never thought i'd be eating guacamole on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> until that day. it was delicious! i have no other words to describe it, but both guacamole and chili were great additions to my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i haven't tried the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, but my friends gushed about how great it tasted.

the prices may be expensive for something like a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but you're paying for the presentation and quality of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> combinations, which are all pretty amazing.

finally got to try this place.

verdict: <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were as plain as you can get, tasted just like a plain ol' nathan's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i got the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which had two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in one bun + mustard + ketchup + chili + cheese + guacamole + jalape\u00f1os. basically they serve a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with various junk you can add on top. 

the fries were really good though. perfect level of crispiness on the outside and fluffiness on the inside.

one other downside is that this place only has an outdoor patio for seating.

omg so this place is better than words can even describe! i know i had no business ending up here last weekend but i'm sure glad i did! i've always wanted to try this place out! after a long night of having fun and gambling a group of my friends stumbled across this place! sometimes there are certain foods that taste even better when your drunk and this place happens to be one if them! i ordered the vegas style <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> and added <mark>Sour Cream</mark>! a bit messy and kind of expensive for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> meal but it was worth every penny spent :-) the fact that they offer a huge variety of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> styles means i will be returning until i've tried all the ones i'd like to try!

i was really craving a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i couldn't think of any other place in vegas to get one besides pinks  i'm sure pinks las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>'t compare to the original in la, but i absolutely enjoyed it. besides minimal seating and long line of tourist, i would go back.

this place is pretty good, nothing too amazing though. it's more expensive than the la pink's and not as tasty, but i expected as much eating in vegas. ordered a <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (2 dogs, jalpenos, cheese, onions) which came out pretty quickly with chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. it's a lot of food though. an order of chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> is enough to feed one or even two people. seating is outside and with the wind it's a bit annoying but you get to see all the weirdos down the street and sometimes cool performers.

i've had many opportunities to go to the pink's in la, but i just can't stand waiting in lines for things. oh please let me patronize your business. i'll do anything! i'll wait for an hour for the right to hand you money in exchange for food! those kind of places just seem obscene to me, like they are disrespecting the customers valuable time just to seem more popular. the long lines places want to have that hip vibe like they just can't keep up with the demand, but realistically they could have hire more people or expand. but they choose not to because they want the long lines.

but the location in <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>'t have that kind of jackassery and i could just try their food without the surrounding crap. it was quite good! very creative toppings. good portions for the money. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself had a proper snap and was juicy.

i want to give it more than 3 stars, but 4 stars is entering fine dining territory. i'm surprised that after all these years yelp has not done half star system yet to be more precise in the ratings. 3.5 stars would be the actual proper rating for this. it's worth a trip!

i'd have to say that my experience here was neither good or bad. there were many different style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the menu to choose from. the cashier was super friendly and inviting. we ordered a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and a <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, both of which were under $8 each. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i have to say in my opinion were bland. i don't think the flavors were anything exciting or memorable. i was most disappointed with my mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> because i felt the mushrooms were too rubbery and flavorless. however, it was nice to sit outside with the water mist to cool us down.

this was another cheap place to have lunch and it was close to the hotel (planet hollywood) which we where staying at while in vegas. they had a number interesting <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. we decided to get the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which was awesome and the and the ruben dog which was really good and a order of <mark>Onion Ring</mark> which you can't go wrong with. this place was a nice little find and the service was fast. 

seating was restricted to outside only which was ok they did have the heat warmers which made it better the only down fall was there was a lot of birds that where always around but they weren't to bad. it was a nice place to have a quick cheap lunch and just enjoy some people watching. i really don't think you could find a bad dog on the menu as it was a pretty large menu! i will definitely be back!

i had my hopes of trying pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for the longest time, and i finally tried it here at planet hollywood's race & sports book. 

ooooooo... what a disappointment!

it was just a small little stand with one worker who looked like he didn't want to be there!

i ordered a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> combo, which came with chips, that cost $5.95. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> combo was $6.95. it just tasted like a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, except that it had a nice "snap" to it (which made me give the place an extra star!). other than that, nothing special about it. the chili tasted like crap on it, probably because it was old and in the container all day! ewww! actually, i bet all the food they served there was old! ekkkk! =o

i had asked the guy working there when they will be opening the actual official stand, and he said he wasn't sure. however, they will be opening one near the hawaiian tropic entrance of planet hollywood. sooo..look out! hopefully by that time, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> will be better...

decent. if you've been to the original la location, prepare to be somewhat disappointed. 

food: meh. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> seemed precooked, the buns were plain, and the mushrooms looked canned. the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> was damn near $8 alone. i had to ask for a side of <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, because the ph dog here only comes with a slice of what looked like kraft cheese. the prices were at least $2 more than the la location, but i guess its understandable since its las vegas. the fries weren't freshly prepared like the la location either. and to top it off, they didn't have grape crush soda or yoo-hoo like the la location. 

service: the cashier chicks were nice. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and sides were served up/made in assembly line unlike the personal attention you get from one person at the la location. 

overall, it was just meh. i'd rather drive 4 hours, then wait in line for another hour to have an authentic pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i probably won't come back here unless they somehow manage to replicate everything that the la location offers. this place seemed like the "mcdonalds" version of pink's. the only good thing is that they accept credit cards, while the la location is only accepts cash.

way overpriced for some tiny dogs, but they're pretty good. i haven't eaten the one in los angeles yet, so i need to give that a try. once i go to la, i will definitely update this review. 

getting it to go is such a mess!! we had no choice but to and the huge stack of napkins totally helped. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> basically exploded in the bag and it was messy for sure.

come to pinks for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, not the fries or <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. they are soo greasy that i felt like a tub of lard eating just one ring!

this place is meh times twenty. i've had a better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from the refrigerator section at the grocery store. 

i would definitely skip this place all together. although all the glitz and glam of the pinks restaurant sign and ambiance is nice, it is so not worth digesting this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

i ordered the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> and the bf ordered the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. both were forgettable and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> did not have a lot of flavor, such a bummer. the total of two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and one large drink was $20, so not worth it. 

i am guessing this is not the pink's of la, because that pink's has a much better reputation than this two star joint.

ok it was like 107 degrees in vegas when i visited and pinks only offer outdoor seating. 

sucky seating aside, the food is way overrated.  i mean like $6 for a nothing special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>... that's ridics even for vegas.  my <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was bitter, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself is skinny, and tastes like any dog you can get in the deli section of safeway.  

i will not eat here again.

went to pink's on the weekend of oct 2nd.  after drinking on an empty stomach, my two friends and i decided to go to pink's before meeting up with the rest of our friends at a club.  i'm not sure what it is about my group of friends but we like to have a few drinks before an intermission of (greasy but quick) food.  this can either be good or bad when it comes to writing reviews.  

we were starving and needed food asap.  we actually took a cab to ph for the sole purpose of getting pink's (instead of just eating something in the vicinity of our first spot or the next drinking spot) because after 2 nights of eating at expensive restaurants, clubs, and losing money at the tables - we wanted to eat something noteworthy but cheap.  

according to my friend who is born/raised socal, it is not as good as the original in cali.  i figured this was a mind-over-matter slash original-is-always-better-duhhh situation.  we ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, fries, and beer.   my other friend (a newyorker) and i thought it was good but agreed it wasn't awesome.  considering the acclamation pink's receives from born and bred la-ers, i changed my assumption and decided it probably is better at the original stand in la.  i remember thinking it wasn't as amazing of an experience as i was hoping to get - and was a bit disappointed by the lack of "snap" in <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself.  also, it was a bit... much.  i have a feeling <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had better snap to it before it got doused in the chili.   

that being said, i did enjoy my experience there.  it was exactly what i was looking for at that moment.  we were buzzed and looking to eat something extremely unhealthy but tasty - and that's exactly what we got.

i'd definitely try it again because for some reason, i think it was just an off night.  and we had some strange concoction of drinks before going there so all of this might be completely in my head.

wanted to try pink's in hollywood, but the line was crazy long.  was surprised to see it on the strip in vegas, i gave it a try.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was really good and tasty with lots of toppings.  the only thing is the price, but it's just like going to the baseball or football game and buying a dog there.  i had the chicago this time.  i'll try something else next time.

i do not normally eat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i love a good bratwurst or italian sausage.

between the four of us we had four <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausage dishes, plus a burger, the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, and chili-fries.

we expected the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausages to be of great quality, but we found them to be lacking in flavor.     i would have given the restaurant 1 star, but bumped them up to two stars for the following:
- the bacon on my planet hollywood was amazing (but everything else in it was blah)
- the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were very tasty (the chili-<mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> on the other hand were not).
- when they messed up our order, they quickly corrected it and additionally let us keep the sausage plate that we hadn't ordered.
- my friends said that unlike <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, the burger was actually quite tasty

for me, i think the sausages that one finds at an outdoor fair have much better taste/quality than what i found at pinks.   

i recalled the meals being much better at the one in l.a......was that  because after waiting an hour in line in the cold in l.a. anything they served me would have tasted good?   i don't know, but i know i won't be returning to the vegas pink's.

i had the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> (figured i should counter all the grease and calories with the lettuce, tomato, and relish that comes on this dog), almost like a mini salad on top of my <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>! it was ok except for the fact that my bun completely fell apart, thus defeating the purpose of eating a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my friend had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, which i had a bite of and really enjoyed. the bacon added just the right amount of salty goodness. the fries here were really tasty, and although we didn't order <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, almost every other table around us had them so i'm guessing they're popular. 

what is nice about this place is its location on the strip and the outdoor seating. a great place to people-watch and enjoy the weather. as a sun-starved seattleite, it was nice to be able to get some vitamin d and uv rays in since most of our vegas cavorting usually happens at night.

if you want yummy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries, or just some hangover food that hits the spot, i'd recommend. if you're a tourist in vegas and are trying to experience pink's in the city of sin, this surely isn't it. too clean, too friendly, too flashy. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and dirtiness, and hour-long wait in line that you'll find at the original pink's in la is what makes it special, for better or for worse.

i go every time i go for a trek up and down the strip and will continue to do so.

the reason i'm only giving three stars is that although the service is good, and the place is clean, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> aren't bad, they're not all that great either.  mainly i like the place for the variety.

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> by itself can't hold up to a properly done nathans, but it's nowhere near as bad as a bar s.

the rueben dog is good, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself gets lost in the reuben part, which isn't bad, but i'd like to taste <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> if it's there.

now, what makes pinks (la anyways) famous is the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  i recently had the bacon chili <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>.  the bacon was nice if undercooked, but that's about it.  the cheese and onions got lost in the chili which was pretty dang boring.  it's not spicy, it's not flavourful.  it tastes kind of like bean powder was mixed with ground beef, gravy, and a dash of tabasco.  not anything special.

if a place is famous for something, it should be good, that's why they're famous.  so it was very disappointing to discover it tastes like something out of a <mark>Bud</mark> can.

good and one of the few places on the strip where you can get full or under $10. i'm not a fan of the snap/almost crunch of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, but the toppings are plentiful and the prices are reasonable for vegas. i went mid afternoon and waited 5 minutes, i'm a pretty big guy and ordered two dogs...mistake! one is plenty, like i said not my favorite type of dog, but what they do they do well, i'll probably be back.

what do you do when your friend is on a winning streak at the craps table? you go outside and eat some pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! that and the fact that we had a coupon you couldn't go wrong. 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were decent. being from nyc we're not used to have so much stuff loaded onto <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. had a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a reuben. quite tasty indeed, but nothing to brag about. filling? yes. it didn't taste like rubber <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and it wasn't a dirty water dog, but hell why not? try it if you're in vegas, use the coupon people!

dude, it's pink's...in vegas. my two favorite things in the world. ok, i really don't feel that way. but if i was a surfer dude from redondo beach out with my <mark>Bud</mark> for a vegas weekend, this would certainly be my dining destination of choice. since i'm not, i guess i can be a little more discriminating. but dude, it's pink's. well not quite pink's. just a reasonable facsimile in an apt setting, planet hollywood. 

jamie w. and i really wanted some dogs after strolling through the sterile city center complex which has none of the kitsch that really is vegas. luckily, pink's has kitsch to spare in its patio setting outside the hotel entrance. the menu looked familiar. we decided to each get a $4.75 giant 12-inch jalapeno dog with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> and chili, and share a $6.50 "planet hollywood" dog, which consisted of a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, bacon and cheese (see photos). oh did i mention the fries, too? nice and tasty they were. 

indigestion thy name is pink's. the jalapeno dog has that snap to the wiener that i don't care for much. i prefer a meatier dog to the tooth, and the mustard was way overwhelming, but chili, cheese and diced onions are bulletproof on a dog as far as i'm concerned. the "planet hollywood" dog has quite a pile of toppings to maneuver in your mouth starting with the bacon strips lording over the sausage already drowning in melted cheese. the mushrooms seemed almost incidental to the creation, but they were good. hell, it was all good in a bad, bad way. 

food - 3 stars....quite an abundance of toppings on those dogs but not quite the pink's i remember in la 
ambiance - 2 stars...hell, it's just a patio...in pink 
service - 2.5 stars...just keep moving the line and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> will eventually be there 
total - 3 stars...a middling experience based on a distant memory of the pink's in la

i live in la and have to say that the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> here are just as good and the wait is shorter!!!! we were walking by and hungry, this is a good alternative to a sit down place because <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are always great. i hate all the crazy extras, i stick to the basics and fries and you won't go wrong. i also don't like the outdoor seating only, had to take food to go because it was such a chilly nite!

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was just kind of eh. since the place is so talked about, and has thousands of reviews for it's original cali location, i have to admit; i was expecting a dog that would blow my mind. i didn't quite get that. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was decent, but was way too loaded with toppings so it had to be eaten with a knife and fork. kind of just turned into a mess of bread, beef, and mustard that frustrated more than satisfied. 

on the other hand, the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were pretty good... but paying $30 bucks for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, 2 drinks and an order of fries isn't worth it for what you get. it's basically fast food for sit down restaurant prices... which is ass-backwards. it'll probably hit the spot if you're really hungry like we were, but sadly i can't recommend pinks. 2/5.

perhaps i can't write a completely accurate review because i was sharing a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and hamburger with a lame person who only wanted <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and sauteed mushrooms on the burger  (seriously?? no effing beef chili, no cheese, no nothing!?  jesus).  but just based off the actual <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and hamburger, they weren't great. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wasn't the juicy, thick tube of meat i was anticipating.  instead, it was a thin, dry, floppy thing that looked like one of those balloons you tie into animals.  

the hamburger wasn't much better - pretty overcooked.  the fries, however, were decent - crispy, fresh and hot.  i didn't get the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, but they looked like they could have been pretty good too.

for lunch i wanted to try pink's--finally.  i heard that their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were very good and decided to try for myself.  there are a few things to keep in mind when it comes to pink's--size and cost. i'll explain in a minute.

just to let everyone know, pink's it outside of planet hollywood/miracle mile shops facing the boulevard.  i walked around for awhile till i found the sign in the building and realized it was outside.  anyway, there wasn't a line and their seating is all outside, so i went in to take a look at their menu.

the menu is simple with pre-made options for you and even burgers if you aren't into their dogs. at almost 10 dollars a dog it was pretty pricey, but i expected that from a famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> eaterie.  they even have their special dogs from celebrities on a flyer at the entrance and near the menu, so check those out, too.

i went for a <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>--<mark>Sour Cream</mark>, tomatoes, onions and relish--and my husband ate their classic <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with onions.  we grabbed a water and fountain drink for a total of 25 dollars and moved on down to the pick up area. when i saw our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i freaked out.  i love toppings, but really?  really?  this was definitely a fork and knife dog.

i love eating my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> by hand.  it's just the way that it should be, but at pink's it's difficult to do so.  too many toppings on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> cause the flavor of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> to be lost, so i scraped everything off on one half to get down to what matters--that fried dog.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is good with a slight snap to it, but it's not an amazing.  i ate the rest with my utensils, feeling as if i violated some ethical <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> code by not eating with my hands.

if you want to try <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, buy a plain one and ask for toppings on the side if you need them, that way you can really taste what a pink's dog is all about.  if you want something really good, their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was decent.

overall <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was decent and i can at least say that i've tried it once. would i fight my way down there through traffic again for it?  nope.  but it's something you have to try once so you can say that you have.

it's like comparing <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and hamburgers!!! i lived in so-cal for a while and was lucky enough to be dating a young lady who went to school off of lebrea and sunset and just down the street was pinks. " the real pinks"  you would wait in line for an hour to get a dog but it was worth it. this sad rendition of pinks let me down.

a good dog is hard to find no matter where you look. since i lucky enough to have the original maybe it is just a bias opinion, but when you say light mustard on a dog and it tastes like <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is stuffed with mustard it just does not fly with me.   maybe it has a lot to do with the fact that i waited in line for about the same amount of time i did in sunny california and i was expecting the same amazing culinary experience.... can i call a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> a culinary experience?

this is turning into a rant of sorts, so i am calling this review... the food was not good, not worth the price, and not worth the experience, so in this case there is no saving grace for this pinks in my eye!! 

i guess if you have a craving for a dog and there is no sams club near by this might be an option.. enjoy at your own risk, and apologize to your taste <mark>Bud</mark> ahead of time.

so me and my girlfriend planned a vegas birthday trip with a group of our friends for the weekend back in january. at this time, city center had just barely opened and we were staying at aria in the sky suites. the sky suites at aria blew me away and they are amazing!!! but that's for another review... anyway, that morning we arrived, we decided to leave our comfy suite at aria and to take a stroll down the strip. being that it's january and still winter, i was stupid and brought a thin-ass jacket to wear and of course it did nothing to keep me warm. 

as we walk across the street from city center into planet hollywood, we see some people walking into pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. and since we were all freezing in the cold and hungry, we decided to rush to <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and order up some <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!

let me make something clear: we're la folk and we love heading down la brea ave in la to have a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> late at night after leaving the clubs. so you can imagine my excitement as we stepped in through <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and out of the cold. i was gearing up to order myself a "martha stewart" dog but sadly, they don't offer it at this location. ok, not a big deal. i'll order whatever is on the menu. i think i had the holly madison... insert sad face. to make a long story short, this did not please me. 

i don't care what condiments and sides came with that damn <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, when i bit into that thing, i wanted to spit it right out. i know what a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> tastes like and that was not a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it was soft and mushy and didn't have that firm, juicy texture that i'm accustomed to at the pink's in la. i firmly believe that if you're going to call yourself pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you better serve it up like it's pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! 

am i being a bit overdramatic? maybe. but think of it like this... what if you walked into a mcdonald's and ordered a big mac but it ended up looking like and tasting like something that came from an elementary school cafeteria? or out of the back of some fat guy's ass? what then? i would rather pass out in the bosom of an obese woman with three eyes, one large breast and one little breast, and a tentacle hanging from her double-chin than eat another of those things. 

if not for beer and gambling, i would have done nothing that entire weekend in vegas but complain that it's not the same. and since i'm not in vegas and i'm sober, i'll say it anyway... 

it's not the same!!

on my last day in vegas, i went on a search for this pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> as i was told by my girlfriend that their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are suppose to be really good.  i guess it is more than a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it's an experience.  well...experience is the right word for it.  they not only have regular dogs, but they have specialty dogs as well with everything imaginable on top.

first...the entrance to pinks is from the sidewalk on the strip.  i was parked in the back parking garage, so coming from the backside of the miracle mile, i was lost.  i thought pinks was inside or would have an entrance from the inside.  they do not.  i walked around for about 20 min. trying to find it before i realized it was outside.

looking over the menu i just didn't want to have an old fashioned <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i wanted to try one of their special dogs.  i ordered up a <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with cheese sauce, mushrooms, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and bacon.  they have a list of other dogs as well for anything you are craving.  my order arrived and i was ready to eat.  

well...it was an experience that's for sure!  trying to eat this huge dog with all the toppings gave a new meaning to messy!  i had to finish with a fork because it was just too much!

while the prices of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are a bit high ($8 for my ph dog), it's a good place to try a specialty dog while you are in vegas.  would i try it again?  possibly...

being a huge travel channel fan, i have often seen pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the shows featured on there. luckily it was right in my hotel, planet hollywood. i was able to try the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (minus the mustard & onions), fries, and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. the fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were really good and the chili on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had great flavor to it!

minus 2 stars for how slow the line moves and the higher than usual prices (but i guess it's expected since it is right on the strip).

i find it strange that i've lived in southern california my whole life and i have yet to experience the original pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in los angeles but when i leave on a mini vacay to vegas i try it for the first time.  everyone tells me that nothing is like the original so i will have to check that out soon.

however, the pinks in vegas was absolutely amazing!  granted the place is pretty tiny but what pinks isn't?  the service was quick and the people working there was extremely helpful and friendly.  granted i was a bit impaired when i ordered and ate <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> but without a doubt i enjoyed it very much.

i have tried this place twice now and i think it is great. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are giant and the toppings are plentiful. the first trip me and my boyfriend ordered chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> which were huge, we both got <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and topped them with the chili and cheese from the fries, there was more than enough! the place was only open a couple weeks and had a special where you could get a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and beer for like $8 i think. the second trip they didn't have the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and beer special so we were kind of disappointed. i would give them 5 stars if they brought back the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>/beer combo. overall, great tasting dogs!

first time had a pink <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i got me a chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> for $16.  i'm not sure if its was worth it but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was good.  
sorry i had to use fork and knife, i din't want any cheese and chili dripping all over me.

damn good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> overhyped or not
the chili is great in moderation 
but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was perfectly spiced,just a damn good dog

a lot of reviewers compare this pinks to the original in la. i can't do that, as i've never been to la, let alone the pinks there.  so i'm judging pinks on its own merit.

i give it 4 stars in spite of the crappy patio setup, and small size. it needs a bigger area, some indoor seating, and a better looking patio -- it feels like they built it as an afterthought because they had some extra space left in a wall. it really should be built better.

however, i found the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to be fantastic! that's why it gets all four stars. they're a bit spendy for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but when you've got bacon, <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, onions, relish, ketchup, and kraut on it -- it's not exactly going to be cheap. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> themselves weren't exactly top-notch, but the toppings all over and the ginormous size really made <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> great.  next time i'm back in vegas i will definitely stop here again. it's perfect for a quick dog fix over lunch, with some incredible topping combos that you won't see anywhere else.

if you're in vegas, stop at pinks!

sad, sad, sad! this place is no where near close to what the hollywood location has to offer. the lines are much longer in hollywood i have to admit, but the service and food quality has to be the worse. when we got up to the front, yes! the front of the line. the girl presume to chat with her co workers and both registers were open they just continued on chatting for a good 3 minute and sweet little me don't want to interrupt their thought process and waited on them. so i couldn't take it any longer and asked her for an ozzie dog! what in the blue? they don't have it at this location?? okay so i got the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that was closest to it. fine, after we ordered she still stood there chatting away. omg! why were they hired? we didn't get our food until 20 minutes later. umm it's just <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, put <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> into the bun and add the condiments. not that hard and not too much to ask for. i will not be going to this establishment ever again. what a pity.

had lunch at pinks recently.  i would have given it 5 stars after our first visit, but dropped a star because it wasnt as good as i remember it last time but still satisfying.  we got 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for the 2 of us and a drink which came to $25.  be prepared to spend about 7 bucks per dog.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are filling, they're good, and since i have never been to la i cant compare them to the original.  its a fun thing to splurge on when your in vegas.

we came here because it was the closest thing resembling food in sight (i'm guessing this is probably the standard place to eat for drunk people walking by).

i ordered <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and it was humongous and loaded with bacon, onions, relish, mustard, and sauerkraut.   i could barely find the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> underneath the mess of condiments, and i had to use a fork to fish for it.
