i definitely wasn't blown away by this place, and i think the idea of having a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with so much crap on it is just a little too much for me.  i prefer the classic chicago <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> myself :9

i love pink's anywhere it goes! this however felt like a cleaner, less greasy, less 50-plus old <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint. although i do like that feeling, nothing beats the feeling of the original place.

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are the same, except they have some different ones here i don't think i've seen. i stuck to what i know, which was the <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>. it's still delicious. 

this location is definitely vegas-ed up. meaning, it's got those super cool daquiri cups in many large sizes and it has a lot of outdoor seating with water fans going on constantly. the line and wait here isn't as long as it'd be in la, so i'd have to say that is a plus, especially since you're waiting in 100 degree heat for some <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

if you're ever in vegas, i say visit. but if you're looking to experience the original, check out la.

this location definitely has some work to do if it is going to garner the same charm as the la location.

they had all of 4 "specialty" dogs, where the la location has literally run out of room on the walls and counters to hang up the fliers of their custom dogs.

also, no spicy <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>?  why would you omit those from the menu when they're an absolute staple of the la shop!

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and toppings were comparable to the la versions, however the buns seemed much more inadequate.  

everyone complaining about seating i tend to ignore, as la isn't known for their seating, on several occasions i've enjoyed a pinks on the curb or back in my car... the one nice thing about the vegas version was the complete absence of a line.

overall, its nice to have the option when i'm in vegas, but i won't be rushing back like i do to the la shop... this just feels too much like a watered down glossed over version of the iconic original.

sooo walking down the strip at 3 in the afternoon drunk off our asses not even 3 hours after landing, 2 friends and myself stumbled across pinks and decided to grab a bite and just sit down for a bit. i had seen and heard of the pinks in la, but never had the chance to wait and stand in the long line. the one in vegas, however, had no line whatsoever, but now i know why. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and when i got the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, the bun was a little too small for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. the bread was already soggy from the chili and it had a little too much oil dripping everywhere. to be honest, i kind of think pinks is overhyped, but maybe the one in la is alot better...i think i'll just stick to costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

you want a review of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? you came to the right girl.

some people grow out of eating <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. not this girl. my love f<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> has grown only stronger with age. i just see <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i'm hungry. i pass by vendors, and i have to stop. doesn't even matter if i've just eaten a three course meal and my jeans are unbuttoned. i will never pass up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. steamed, boiled, fried, or grilled.

so imagine me, in vegas, a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place attached to the front of my hotel! how superfrikkinexciting. i'm all by my lonesome, just the way i like it, and i am starving!

pink's is where my tired feet carry me. i take my place in the ever growing line outside <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. the smell is fantastic. i am like a little kid hopping from foot to foot, trying to look over me and determine my wait time.

evidently, a few people ahead of me a woman is struggling with what kind of dog to order. c'mon, lady! i'm withering away here!

i get close enough to check the menu and now have to decide between a regular dog with some mustard, or a specialty dog. the list is massive. how many ways can you tweak a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. now i am seeing there are many! 

i order a specialty. hell, i am in vegas. go big or go home. a <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>. fries. and a soda.

i wait five minutes and whoot! number 80 is called. that's me! i sit down at the one table that's open, still dirty from the previous diner. i unwrap this massive thing, and take a huge bite. bleh!

it felt like i was biting through a rubber dog drenched in chili. and through the rubber <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> wasn't very tasteful. if you've ever over-boiled a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you know the flavor i speak of. it's like cooking the flavor right out. i choked down half of it. after all, i was starving and needed to eat some of my money's worth. but half is all i got through. and i am a woman who can eat quite a few dogs in one sitting. the rest got tossed.

las vegas needs a few <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> vendors on the street.

i've had the original pink's before. it's been 10 years, but i recall my dog fondly and it was well worth the long wait in line that we had. 

there was no line at this pink's. well, there were about 4 people ahead of us. but with only one cashier it's kind of hard to not have a tiny wait. i ordered the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>. 

in general, it was decent. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was fairly snappy, and the toppings were fresh. the guadalajara has relish, onions and tomatoes with <mark>Sour Cream</mark> on top. the relish was a little overpowering, but very fresh and flavorful. 

the problem is that 2 days before i had a nathan's dog at new york, new york. that dog, with just fried onions and ketchup, beat pink's hands down. maybe if i hadn't had that dog, i would have rated pink's just a little higher, but even with all the amazing toppings they can't compare. 

i probably won't go back next time we're in vegas. i just don't think it has what the original pink's in la has.

i don't meat, but i still came here. really, i don't miss eating meat, but i do miss a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> + bun combo! so we came here, also because of the cheap prices. 

ended up getting the only veggie option - <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. was cooked to order, but pretty good - got tomatoes, ketchup, mustard, lettuce for my toppings. only downside was that the bread was a bit too flimsy for my liking - when i eat a dog, i want some solid bread that can withstand any amount of toppings! costed about $6 or so. i'd like to know what it was made out of, actually... texture-wise, it was very <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

bummer that <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> don't come with a side... and i wasn't about to spend $4 just to have some <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. but a friend did get the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which they described as covered with "low grade meat" but delicious "once you're drunk enough." speaking of drunk - on the weekends they are open late - about 3 am or so - so a perfect place for the drunk munchies! 

what else? $20 for a bucket of 5 beers, you mix and match.

this place is ridiculous. 

my boyfriend and i usually order this, then take it to the mall or to our hotel room and eat it there, because the outdoor seating is sooooo gross and it tends to be windy. 

i love their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. one order of these, and i'm set for that meal. but i always feel the need to get their dogs too! i feel like i can't win! chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> or a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, oh the dilemma. i get into a mini panic attack because i can't choose. and then i end up getting both, and regret eating whatever i had eaten first, because now i can't eat as much as i could of the second one.

you get to order and receive your order fairly quickly. makes it hard to make a decision, and you end up making really stupid ones like ordering way more than you can eat because you don't want to hold up the line, but you can't decide between <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> or the fries or the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. 

i'm glad i don't live near one of these. i would visit it every day.

all i have to say is i would come here for just the bacon. it is so freaking good. i of course got <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> that would come with the most bacon. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good but the bacon was the best part. i think i might have clogged up my arteries just a little bit after eating that <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.
the location is cool because it's right in front of the strip and you can sit and just look at the strip, but it's not fun to be sitting out there when it's super windy and hot. service was good and quick. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were pretty awesome too!

the bf had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and i had <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. both dogs were filled w toppings, which is good but hard to  just pick up and eat. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were good but nothing spectacular. pretty much can make at home w your fav <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and whatever toppings you desire! 

customer service: was ok. the employees weren't very upbeat and while we were eating at the patio, an employee sprayed a cleaner onto a rag right next to us while we were eating and i felt the mist . very unprofessional and gross!

i gave it four stars because well, i'm not a huge fan of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> anyway. husband however loves them. while i didn't think the actual flavor of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was anything to rave about...but the skin snapping on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, even drenched in the quite tasty chili, that was nice.
the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were well worth the calories (and sadly, stomachache that followed from eating too much!)...and the service was super fast and friendly. i like the outside seating, especially with the big heaters to offset the chilly vegas evening.

overpriced for what you get... i don't see what the hype is all about. i've always heard stories about the pink's down in la and how the line is crazy long, but it was pretty empty here.

they were pretty messy to eat, as they had veggies and goodies piled on top of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. i ordered the mushroom swiss <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but was not impressed... the cheese was gross!

i knew i should've trusted fellow yelpers. even though pink's didn't get very good reviews i still went there and tried one of their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. we tried their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and were very disappointed. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had no flavor at all. it tasted like nothing, if that's even possible. the chili was just okay. nothing that would enhance <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>'s flavor, but it didn't make is taste any worse. not only was it lacking flavor, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was also quite expensive. $8 for one!  wouldn't recommend or visit this place in the future. my advice, just skip this place and go somewhere else.

extremely mediocre. i went with the 3 <mark>Three Dog Night</mark> which is: 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, wrapped in a giant tortilla, 3 slices of cheese, 3 slices of bacon, chili & onions. with a lineup like that, you'd think it would be earth shattering. it was not. it was actually borderline gross. the chili was very oily, flavorless, but every aromatic.....to the point that i had to wash my hands...... twice. overall, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were good, but i think this place is grossly over hyped and there is a line. i'll try the one in hollywood next time i'm in l.a., but the lv version is not worth your time. meh.

after all the hype i've heard about pink's, it does not live up to it's raves. maybe the la joint is better so i may give it a second chance when i'm in la, but don't try pink's in vegas.
i got the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and my friend got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. the chili on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was very questionable, kinda like elementary school lunch chili what the hell kinda meat is in here but i don't care because i'm 7? kinda chili. mushy and questionable. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself? i think i've tasted better microwaving ones from the grocery store. it's bland, and just soft.
didn't try my friend's pastrami <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but he said it just tasted like what it looks like. we also got <mark>Onion Ring</mark>-- after a few of them, you might want to food coma.

i am all for greasy, fat food, but pink's does not do it for me.

wow, how the la counterpart allows this place to keep using the pink's name is beyond me.  the first time i went when it opened i was like meh.  the second time i went last month i was like wth!!!  i don't see this place lasting with it never having people there it seems.  the chili is pretty spot on to being the same as well as <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> but man everything else is just horrible.  i mean i got a crusted tortilla wrapper that was litterarly cracking and breaking as if it was a cracker.  it's almost like they left the tortilla sitting on the counter all night and decided to use it anyways.  i mean if you are going to bring a prized la landmark like this to la then do it right.  i mean in-n-out and tommy's do it right.  it's just a downright shame for pink's.

i don't know what they we're thinking with this pink's. most if not all <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> offered in hollywood have been replaced or renamed for vegas. i was so confused. 

either way, i went with the desert named one, sonora or what have you. it came loaded in a fry dolly. bun, dog, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and jalape\u00f1os. i think i got it all, honestly j could have forgot something. there was so much junk on it that i couldn't pick it up and ha to cradle it with the fry holder. 

it was a huge mess that didn't taste amazing but got the job done. i was hungover as usual and this was a good fix. throw a cold beer in, and i was good to go. 

i won't return, it's a tourist spot that doesn't need to be there. pack up shop and move to hollywood where you could alleviate the long lines at the flagship joint.

i havent had the opportunity to experience pinks in southern california being as i'm from the sf bay area but this pinks was actually alright in my opinion. 

dude chill...i already said i didnt get a chance to try the original pinks so i'm gonna write about what i know.

i ordered the g...jsdoifahefoiasjfsaoif dog. the one with tomatos onions and relish with <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, cept i cut the onions cause me and onions dont get along.

overall i think this was a bad choice because none of the condiments really complimented each other, the relish was over powering, the tomatoes were tasteless, and the <mark>Sour Cream</mark> was barely noticeable. 

the bun and that long gay looking sausage made it all worth it. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had a crisp bite and bursted with juicy flavor (no homo...) and the bun was soft and not to filling. 

the price is way steep for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but it may be worth it to come back to every one in a while. for all the other times...there be costco dogs!

omg, this place is <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>!

i mean c'mon, for $8, i thought the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i got was not worth it until it was on my plate.

i can't remember which one, but it was the one with 5 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, chili, cheese, onions all wrapped up. it was really really good. i would eat one right now actually if i could

got <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>: bacon, sauerkraut, relish, tomatoes, onions and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>. i definitely liked my dog because i'm a big fan of sauerkraut, and fresh tomatoes.  they have outdoor seating so it's nice to eat outside on a sunny day.  this was my first time at pink's, and there wasn't a long  line like the one in la, my dog was good, but i don't think it would be worth a long ass wait tho, but i'd definitely go to pink's again as long as there isn't a long wait

they basically have your average <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stuff with one exception....their chilli is pretty rad so make sure to get it on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> of your choice....i got mine with chilli, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, jalapenos, onions, mustard, and no regrets

i had gone to la last year and was pretty bummed i didnt get to visit the famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  so naturally, i was pretty excited when i realized they had a pink's in planet hollywood, where i was staying.

<mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>: awesome
i had <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and i forgot the name of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> my boyfriend had, but i liked his better even though they were both yummy. his had jalapenos, all i remember. sorry guys! lol. my only complaint is that they put too much of the condiments on to the point where it took me a few minutes to strategize my game plan on how to actually eat the thing :)

i definitely recommend a trip to pink's!

i have long heard about pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> being a go-to hot spot late at night for grub and the chance to run into celebrities out in hollywood but have never had the chance to go.  thus i was really excited when i saw that pink's had opened a storefront right on the strip in vegas.  

after a long night of debauchery, i walked halfway across the strip just so i could eat at pink's.  i have to give them credit, they sure know how to jazz up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i ordered a <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>, which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, guacamole and jalape\u00f1o peppers on it.  i ordered relish on it as well.  

the combination works well in theory as well as in practice.  but in practice all of that stuff on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> makes it damn near impossible to eat as you would normally.  picking it up makes all the toppings fall off, and a sloppy mess gets all over your hands.  so i had to resort to eating <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> with a fork and knife.  i felt pretty stupid, but it was the only way to do it and plenty of people around me were doing the same.  

but eating like that made the bun soggy, which is not good.  i appreciate the effort they put into dressing up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i only give it three stars because i've had amazing "gourmet" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in chicago before, with toppings piled high, but with which i could still eat as <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are intended to be eaten - with your hands.

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> snap just like the original spot.  customer service was amazing, especially kieth and lucia.  

they need to be open later though.

i wanted to "like" this place more, but nothing says "no thank you" more than sysco products.

brief summary
-- spin off location from the original pink's in hollywood
-- located on the lv strip & only has outdoor seating
-- not for the cheap of heart
-- say no to the chili or say yes to the toilet
-- bring your own ketchup // condiments

i've seen pink's featured on food network before. so when my friends suggested we go there for lunch, i was down!

luckily we got here right before the huge lunch rush. you can imagine the line getting very long during a busy hour on the lv strip.

--- our order ---
** pinks lemonade (no alcohol) -- it was delicious, get it!

** <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> & <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> -- pass, the chili is definitely the east coast style that is mostly just greasy meat/beef. the cheese didn't taste real, must have been some "sysco" cheese matter. this stuff stuck to my ribs and made me want to "yack" later that night. my tummy was hurting. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was good, i ended up just eating it alone. 

** chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> -- i ate these before <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and they were mostly good because i was so hungry. again the chili is just greasy meat, not really the ranch style chili (if that's what you like).

my biggest complaint about pink's is that they only have sysco ketchup which is very disgusting. it doesn't even taste like tomatoes or ketchup, it just looks like it. on top of that, it's more of a thick paste then a sauce. i seriously wish i could have gotten some heinz!

this place got a 1 star bump for my friend's polish with pastrami that i tasted. although, it was kind of dry and in need of mustard, the flavors were there and it was juicy and hot.

i won't be back here any time soon, but i hope to try the original in hollywood!

went here last night. got my usual chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. i don't like crazy things on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. just the usuals-- as in all the usuals. haha ketchup, mustard, saukraut(?), tomatoes and bacon-- oh and relish! definitely have to eat these babies with a knife and fork. don't forget the napkins!
chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> here are delicious. i love their chili. it's a little 'mushier' i guess you can say than other places, but i like it... although my tummy always feels a little funny after. kinda over priced, but it's vegas. what isn't overpriced?
<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are really good!! a little over priced for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but whatever, las vegas is over priced

finally!  after 3 trips to vegas, i finally got to go here!

friends are always bringing me pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and i'm glad that this place didn't disappoint.  i've had a few of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> before and this time i went with the showdog girl.  

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself was great, nice snap when you bite into it!  i took off one star though because i thought they put too much stuff on it.  i was almost having to search for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> flavor.  maybe i'm just weird, but i like to have minimal "stuff" on my dog.

no matter what, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> here are top notch.  love it.

my wife and i finally made it here on our last night, i had the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> and it was lovely and i will certainly go again, yes <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> maybe a little on the expensive side but  you can sit outside and view the strip while eating your dogs so i'm not going to complain.
along with the earl of sandwich this is a great place to snack before you start your evening or to finish off a great night in vegas.

maybe it's because it's not the original pinks. but we weren't too hungry, but saw that there was no line so we decided to try it.

we ordered a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>... to see if the hype was dog or toppings. also ordered the chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.

chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were disgusting. it was like dog meat. heavy. the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> was also bland. fries were extra crunchy...

<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wasn't too bad, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are broiled, something i could get down in sj at mark's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!

$4.75 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>?  sure, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were delicious but that's a damnable price to pay for a frankfurter on a bun.  for that kind of money pink's should at least grill them.  i see 7/11 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in my future.

why did i go for the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>? i don't like <mark>American Cheese</mark> (it's for hillbillies) and....i don't like chili unless it's in a bowl served by my mother....
sooo....i scraped everything off and i enjoyed the after taste of chili on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

disa opted for the <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark>....(or the heart attack dog) lol but she enjoyed it i believe it was topped with pastrami.

all in all i shouldn't have went crazy....

it's really expensive.....two dogs two drinks was about $20....i'm from chicago...if <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> isn't $1.95....i'm looking for the gold flakes!

i'd eaten at the la pink's a number of times before i tried the vegas pink's, and the vegas one definitely pales in comparison to the original. the menu is different! a lot of my favorites from the la one were not available at the vegas one, which was disappointing. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> here are good, but not amazingly delicious like the ones at the la pink's, so i'm probably biased in that sense.

on the plus side, the line in vegas is wayyy shorter than the line in la probably ever will be. i was here during mlk weekend and there was practically no line at a relatively normal dinner hour. it's really tiny inside, so even if there's only 5 people waiting to order, the line will already be "out <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>." there's no indoor seating, but there are a few tables outside. we just took our food and sat inside in the seating area for earl's. (shhh)

tl;dr: if you've had the original pink's you'll probably be disappointed, but if you want a quick, cheap meal, this will probably hit the spot.

i'm a big fan of pink's, being from the la area so i was happy to try out the one here in vegas.  i came here with my family and luckily we were able to take advantage of the groupon deal a couple of weeks before.  all 3 of us opted for the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, except i had it with a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> instead of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are loaded with toppings.  the casing around <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> has a nice snap when you bite into it and tastes just as good as the pink's in la.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> are shoestring fries which i happen to looove.  i'm not a fan of fat fries, so these were perfect and crispy.  i'm not sure if the make their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> but those are also fantastic, just the right amount of breading and cooked perfectly.  it was chilly out so i also ordered a <mark>Hot Chocolate</mark> only to find the gal behind the counted mixing up a pouch of the powdered stuff with water.... boo! oh well, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were what we came for and they sure did hit the spot. 

also, you can get a naked dog and add ketchup, mustard, onions, relish and pickles for no charge... yum!

fell way short of all the hype. from what i'm reading, la is better, but i can't imagine them being that much better. for starters, i did not care for the hard casings on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. flavor was not that great either. i really think this place gets by on their image more than their food.

probably one of the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever eaten.  i had the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  the line was long, but went fast and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were served quickly as well.  i'd recommend this place to all my friends when they go to las vegas.

i was mildly impressed by the pink's in hollywood, but was pleasantly surprised by the las vegas location, conveniently located in the planet hollywood hotel & casino.  one of my main complaints about the southern california location is the fact that while <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were tasty, they were too small.  no such problem at this location.

a: im not a pinks fan in general
b: the og one on melrose gets way too ass packed and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> aren't worth the wait. 
c: the universal citywalk one is better b/c suddenly <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are proportionate to the wait (its usually a short line and the prices aren't super high despite being at citywalk) 
and last and probably least.....
d: here there is a longish line and......different quality dogs and no spicy <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>? no spicy polish??? one of their classic top selling dogs??? i wouldnt bother...

came here with the groupon deal.  i already knew before hand that it's very expensive <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  given it's on the strip, so expect to pay more.  had the mojave and <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>.  very nicely done, the wait was okay and seating is limited.  giving this a 3 stars because it tasted good, but honestly i wouldn't pay full price for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.

this should probably be a 3.5 star review - but since you can't do that, and i can't give pink's a 4 star review, i'm going with the 3. i ended up ordering a chili-<mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a dog with mustard, sauerkraut and relish. although not the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had, i do have to say that they were probably the most filled <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had. there was almost a bowl full of chili on the chili-<mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and a pot full of kraut on the other dog. so if you're hungry, i would definitely go here. i had to eat both of my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (didn't finish them..lol..) with a fork and knife - there is that much stuff on them. if you aren't starving, do yourself a favor and order one <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. also, if you want to have fries - you can split an order amongst 3 people - they're huge. but, size doesn't always equate to quality, and the quality of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is just a little lacking (not much though).

was out in vegas for a quick and cheap getaway and  did the casino thing and took plenty of pics but now it was time for lunch after walking the strip and taking in sites.i had a groupon coupon for pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i think it for $15.00 off my purchase and for me it won't take me long .a chillidog,<mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a powerade-large for all the walking.first bite was that snap in <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> that reminds me of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> in nyc off the push carts in midtown or on fordham rd in the bronx days,<mark>Onion Ring</mark> were crisp and hot and the powerade well i needed it.sat outside on the patio and watched the people on the strip go by and as they watched me digg into my meal.had a good talk with the staff and you get that loud "welcome to pinks" when you enter <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.wish they had one near me..**,

pink's serves a good dog. but with all the hype i expected more. the toppings are unique and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are good sized, but at $8/$9 a pop they should be. thanks to groupon, the wife and i have been here twice in the last month. both times we waddled away very content. we had a variety of dogs, <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, and even a pastrami/<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> burrito. all very good. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are thick and crunchy. i'm a great fan of windy city beefs-n-dogs on lake mead, so i'm not sure if i will be back, but it was fun trying pink's out.

call me cheap, but without a deal, i would not have come to pink's on my own account, knowing it's hyped, mediocre, and over-priced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. luckily, i used a groupon deal that allowed me to try pink's at an affordable price.

the stand is located outside the miracle mile shops, with no access from the planet hollywood casino. we learned that the hard way. -_-

i ordered the brooklyn pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. i like keeping my dogs plain, and dressed with mustard. so i enjoyed this dog, but would have liked it even more if the pastrami came out hot, rather than lukewarm.

i also sampled some of the bf's <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> (2 dogs, bacon, chili, cheese, onions). we ordered <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> without onions, but it came out standard, so he brought it back to have it re-made. the cook was nice about it, probably because there was hardly a line at 4 pm, and served up a new one within 3 minutes, spit-free! it was interesting... glad we tried, but wouldn't order it again. it is also best eaten with the wrapper, because the burrito drips chili grease... yum!

with our $15 groupon, we had to fork out a whopping $0.52. overall, $7.52... i would not mind paying that price, but $15.52 is a bit steep for 2 dogs. i'd rather use that money to buy 2 sammiches from earl's inside. i'll be back once i get my hands on another deal!

pinks... you've done it again. i told you, i can't see you anymore. it's too good. your too good...

instead of trying to get the craziest <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the menu, i decided to go with <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> which was amazing. (it wasn't the alcohol talking either, it was sober by that time already!) 
i just checked the online menu but doesn't seem to exist on the main site. it might be a special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> just at the vegas pinks (can anyone at the la pinks confirm this?)

it had onions, relish, sauerkraut and diced tomatoes over a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> smothered with the perfect amount of <mark>Sour Cream</mark>. it is highly recommended. 
i gave pinks lower than 5 stars in the past. this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> just brought it up to a 5! 

please try <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>!

meh. i've experienced better... exactly what i was thinking!

after all the hype i've heard about the famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in la, i seriously thought i would have been blown away by the experience... maybe its because of the hype that shot my expectations through the roof, but wouldn't you think with all the hype, it should at least make me want to come back for more? 

but i'm the kind of girl that always gives a place the benefit of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, perhaps i ordered something not-so-amazing on the menu -- the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark>, i honestly thought this was a pretty good choice!! equipped with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrami, mustard, <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> & sauerkraut... i mean its not the fattiest of the bunch, but lets be honest the scorching hot weather was taking a negative toll on my appetite. regardless of my choice, i had the chance to have a bite of a few others -- the planet hollywood, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>... nothing really sang to me ya know? in other words, i was hoping for more, something more memorable and amazing rather than just a meal to fill me up. i think i'll give the la pink's a chance, but if that doesn't change my mind, who knows what will.

pink's is pink's
a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>
i got the chi style dog
this was not an og chi dog
i have been to chi
<mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> not have lettuce on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, they put a whole pickle (not relish) and they add a whole chili pepper
this did not happen
did i eat it?
yes
3 stars (absolutely no wait)

this is not chicago
this is las vegas
that is not the eiffel tower
nor is that the empire state building

so it's not a real <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, it's a replica.....like everything in vegas.

after seeing so many television programs about pink's and how amazing it is, i had to try it when i was in vegas.  i ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> in a bun with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, bacon, and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.  the onions and mushrooms were scarce and barely grilled. the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> was just the normal <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> you get anywhere else.  there were about 5 strips of crispy bacon, but that didn't seem to justify the price of $8.99.  the sausage wasn't even particularly amazing either.  

i also didn't like how cramped <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and overall space was.  only two parties can stand in line before people must wait outside in the 100+ degree weather.  while the seating area did have fans, they were so powerful that they were more bothersome than pleasant - my napkins kept flying away and my hair flew in my face!

i'm glad i checked it off of my places to try, but i wouldn't go back again.  i'd much rather spend $1.50 at costco and get a soda as well!

first time here and had <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, daughter had naked dog and hubby had kim kardashian and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.  daughter and i loved ours. hubby was not too keen on the kardashian dog because it was a polish one but he loves <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.  we would come back again. had it in the late evening and sat  outside and people watched.  we would come back again and try out the other items they have to offer.  it was a bit pricey though for four four dogs and three drinks came to about $50 and that was with a 10% off coupon we got from our hotel.

couldn't wait to try this place. my friends love it. me on the other hand could careless for the overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. it was alright definitely not worth the $. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were better than <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> but that's not good enough for me to go back. i'm giving it 1 star because the employees are very nice!

i'm from la & i know pink's is a staple to locals out here. but just like dodger dogs, i have and always will feel like pink's is more hype than anything else. there is nothing remarkable about <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. they're good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but nothing really ever blows you away...not when ordering one of their specialties or when adding all of your own favorite toppings.

the kicker in lv is that pink's costs more here! boom. can't say i'd stop back here when there's an earl's so close by.

so here goes, i will say the one thing bad about this place has got to be the price. i guess with it being on the strip, one has to overlook that. but, i had gotten the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with pastrami, swiss, onions and mustard. and they charge 7.79$!!! wow, thats a lot of money. now with that being said, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself was good. the pastrami, wasn't juicy but it also wasn't dry. i usually like my pastrami, juicy, and a little bit of fat on the outside. the polish itself was the highlight. the first bite, it's juices ran down my lip and onto my jaw. great flavor and a great crunch. with that being said, i don't know if i am sold on it being an 8$ dog....plus tax of course.

there's not much to say... it's just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the variety of toppings are fun, and it's a great place to save a few bucks, but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself is just not that good. they also don't grill the bun so it's all soft and doesn't support the weight of a lot of toppings.

in all honesty, there is no reason to visit pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. no reason if you are a tourist, i can assure you, wherever you are from, you have better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. and especially if you are local, there is no reason at all when you have buldogi's on two different sides of town. 

the quality of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is sub-par and the toppings are nothing to brag about either. and the price, holy cow! nothing merits the price tag, which by the way cannot be found on their website. i also trie dthe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which were ok, but then, buldogi's makes their chili in house so there's really no comparison.

tried to eat at g<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> ramsay burgr, but there was an hour and a half wait.  pinks was right around the corner, so we decided to get a quick lunch.  i was with 5 other people. 

i ordered the polish bacon burrito.  the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was okay, the skin was tough.  i liked the bacon and the chili, but it was very, very, very greasy.  my tortilla was soaked and dripping with grease, it was disgusting.  the others that i was with ordered <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, no tortilla, still really greasy.  the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> that was ordered looked good.  the regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didnt really have all that much flavor, it was nothing special.  the fries were thin cut and crispy. 

i probably won't be back, nothing really special or different about <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.

man, do i love snapping into a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!  i've been to this one in vegas and the universal city walk.  i think this one is my fave.  my review is based on an accumulation of about 3 visits.

i usually try to tackle two dogs, even though sometimes that turns out to be a mistake for my tummy.  i love the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> ("2 dogs in one bun, mustard, onions, chili, am cheese, guacamole & jalape\u00f1os") and anything with bacon.  their bacon is really good and crisp, definitely not some broken bits from a can.  i mean, this has ruined me for other <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!

if i have a complaint, it's that <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are too loaded and too messy.  i feel like a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> needs to be eaten with your hands, but some of these are knife-and-forkers.  the bun just doesn't support the toppings, and there's lots of clean-up afterwards.  this certainly isn't the worst thing that could happen, and in the long-run i'd rather this than skimpy toppings.

skip <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>! they're horrible! i mean, terrible! the chili was definitely delicious, so if you're really stuck on going here, grab the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and please save yourself the money and skip <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. i've never been so adamant on telling someone to skip something as i am about this! the bun was stale, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself was bad- it had that pop when you take your first bite, and though i know that is the goal of some places that serve dogs, i know that's not the goal for pinks and i'm pretty sure it poped because it was way overly old and over cooked. i'm sad to have to give a place with such a great reputation in la such a bad review, but clearly they sold themselves out when coming to vegas and just got dollar signs in their eyes without making sure the quality followed with them. i seriously have had much better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at the movie theater. i couldn't even finish my over-priced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> because it was that bad. i know i sound like a snob, but i'm not, i promise. i was hungry after having a long day of walking and beers and all i wanted was a delicious juicy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and this was very disappointing. i keep going on but it was that bad. good luck to you if you ignore this and still get a dog, i pray i just caught them on a really really off and bad day, but from what i understand, i'm not too far off from what others were saying.sorry friends!

i remember liking the pink's in la much more as i was growing up... these dogs were nothing special, the buns tasted stale, and the chilli on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had way too much cinnamon...   the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were bland and tasteless like all other frozen <mark>Onion Ring</mark> out there.

i am disappoint. i miss la for yet another reason.

snap of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is fantastic!  <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was right temperature, chili tasted fine, and onions were a good mix.  definitely a great snapping dog and a real distinct taste.

fast service, not much seating.

should've went to nathans!

i visited pinks 4th of july.. i was staying at planet hollywood so it was very convenient not too mention all the hooplah about it made me of course want to try it out for myself. this price is overpriced .. the chili on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is very bland... i don't know.. gave me heartburn or indigestion after.. the worse = ((

 even ordered the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which included bacon and tomatoes etc.. it was all just an overpriced wreck
oh and the cheese was like a <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> sauce or something.. like the orange kind that comes out of a big can.. no bueno!

like the other reviews said.. keep walking.. so not worth the $20 for a huge wienie and some chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>...lol

pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in la is now in vegas.  and truly, is that a bad thing?  having one of these artery clogging bad boys after a night of debauchery just hits the spot.

we ordered the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>.  there was a lot of food on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> (mushrooms/bacon/cheese), and while it was extremely messy it was very good..  finished it all, and i would do it again.  since we stayed at planet hollywood we actually repeated the same meal after our second night of debauchery.

are they overpriced?  yes, but a lot of things in vegas are.  should a buffet really be $30 or a burger be $16-18 without fries?  i think not, so when you drop $6-8 on a dog, it's not really that bad.

so the fries can feed two to three.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are topped to overflowing.  it was alright.  we were hungry and needed something fast.  i got the <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark> and they were okay albeit a little over done.  :(

was hoping for water and i got watered lemonade... not a huge fan.  especially when super thirsty.

been to two pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> now....the supposedly good one and this one and this one sucks.
the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> just sucks. it's nasty. make it  bearable by putting every condiment on it and put pastrami and whatever they have. cause <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> just straight up sucks. 
oh ya the service is not that great either. small little place. wouldn't go  if your drunk. just go eat mcdonalds or pizza. not this

i love a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and pink's did not disappoint!  i ordered the nacho <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a side of <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.  the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were just so-so... but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was awesome... great chili!  thinking i'll try the fries next time.

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> there are good, not the greatest, but i like the different toppings and types of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> they have. this wouldn't be a place i have to go to every time i'm in vegas, but would definitely go if i wanted something quick and easy. the service was nice, quick, and friendly.

unfortunately, it was really windy the day we went so we had to stand inside at a very small counter. it's pretty small inside. i wish there were more inside seating. there is plenty of outside patio seating if the weather was nice enough.

we ordered:
-<mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>
-<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>
-mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>

big fancy sign with the name "pink's" on it? looks like i'm in the right place! not gonna lie, i've heard about this place many times before but i never knew where it was. turns out, my friends were talking about the one in la, but whatevs, i'm not gonna pass on my chance to try pink's famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

anyways, you're greeted by this enormous menu once you walk in the front door, but feel free to step to the side and look at a normal sized menu if <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is too crowded. 

personally, i think that the prices are a little overpriced but it's nice to order a "high end" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with a handful of toppings after a night of drinking. i've only been here twice and i can't seem to recall what i ordered on my first visit but i can say that the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are really good and they definitely put a lot of thought into the different combinations. 

& as a fan of chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, how could i pass on the deluxe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> for a good portion of my wallet (costs the same if not more than a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>). i mean, it's pretty good, but probably not worth the cost.

overall, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are pretty good here but i just wish that it was a little cheaper (i guess it's okay since it's vegas). i can't wait to try the one in la!

blissful happiness after missing closing time (3 am on weekend) after a particularly great night of winning and drinking and good times we had been wanting nothing but a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that morning and were so bummed when we walked back to find it closed, but months later we came back and after a great night of happiness we got our pinks!!!! and we're not disappointed :) <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are original and delicious the perfect drunken happy food and had a great memory to go with

my boyfriend and i are from texas and have been wanting to try pinks for some time. we made it a point to eat here on our most recent trip to vegas and were not disappointed. we had 3 dogs, a drink and fries for $30 total and we felt the price was vert  fair!

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were loaded with toppings and our order came out fast. the inside is pretty small but we got there near opening time and had no problem grabbing a table outside.  our meal was, filling delicious and fairly inexpensive for the strip!

pinks, in la you need to wait 90 min to get a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. here, 0-5 min! i'm sure it's better in la but hey! next best thing right?!?

we ordered the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and bbq cole slaw dog. both were incredibly delicious. the bun was way too soft and instantly broke apart, allowing <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> to fall through (knife and fork time!) but what made me give this 4 stars was the actual dog. it's natural casing had the biggest "snap" i've ever tasted! each bite "snap"! it was awesome! loved <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, liked the toppings, hated the bread (the fact it fell apart, otherwise it was doughy good!)

pricey though! $6-8 a dog!

i finally had to try the infamous pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, even though i didn't get to go to their original california location. i had <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> millennium dog, which comes with jalapenos, tomatoes, chili, guacamole, onions, lettuce, and two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the toppings were really good, and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a perfect 'snap' when you bite into it. just the way a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> should be. now if only they followed costco's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> pricing....

it's just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> loaded with condiments.  sounds so simple.  so how good can it be?  well, the quality of the meat and bun along with the combination of the extras does the trick.  while i cannot review all of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> on the menu, the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> was the most memorable the last time i ordered from pink's.  bacon, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and onions!!!  i'm not a big fan of the classic since it tastes rather plain compared to all of these special dogs.  since it opens relatively late (early for lv standards), you have no excuse to not skip pink's.

i love their fries! i think i'll go back to this place for the fries alone! as for their main entree, i didn't think it was anything special (i got a burger because i don't like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>). the hamburger is huge though! so if you want more bang-for-your-buck, skip <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and get the beef! 

i do agree that this place is overprice.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are spectacular!  both their classic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and specialty <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are delicious and more than satisfying; if you're a fan of natural casing then you'll be in heaven.  the menu feels smaller than the legendary hollywood location's, but they have all the classics and favorites, though sometimes under different names.

i developed a fondness for pink's while living in la and i've missed it terribly since i left, part of that is because there isn't much of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> scene where i live, so if you are visiting from a city with great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joints, you may not be as impressed.

i was dismayed when i didn't recognize the menu, i'd been harboring a mad craving for a martha stewart dog and it wasn't to be found.  fortunately the cashier helped me identify the vegas equivalent of the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and i found it, it is <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and i highly recommend it.  if you're more in a sausage mood, the planet hollywood is a delicious option.  i missed pink's so much i had both of these gigantic dogs.

finally got to try their food.

 i ordered chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, they were really good & hot.  i burned my tongue because it smelled so good i couldn't wait.  chili isn't too spicy. just right. if you love spicy, you'll be disappointed.  i believe it was $6.79. boyfriend had 10 <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark> & a "big man" dog. he said it was perfect.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> even snapped because of the skin.  it had tomatoes & onions.  no picture because he really chowed it down. 

great service.  thanks much.

overrated.... i was majorly disappointed with pinks. i have heard all this hype around this chain. it was actually kinda disgusting. my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was not fully cooked, the toppings were overloaded and it was really not satisfying. if your in vegas there are way better restaurants for your buck where you can find amazing <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. the quality of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself was mediocre.. nothing special. it's over priced, unfriendly staff, and overall over rated. in my opinion it's not worth the 12-14$ for a dog!

do get their <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, which showcases all the ingredients you can load up on for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to scream supreme!

this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> spot is conveniently located near walgreens, semi-corner of planet hollywood - on the outside.  the staff brings <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> out when ready.

their <mark>French Fries</mark> were fried and textured delightfully. 

if you are craving for some <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, this spot is the place to be!

i expected more because of the way people amp this place up but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> aren't that good to me. they're ok. homemade <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> taste better. just my opinion though, you may think otherwise.

one of the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've eaten so far and when i came to pink's, i tried <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and it met my expectations. except i wished the bacon wasn't cooked too crispy and burnt other than that i give it a plus but a minus for their prices.

well in a effort to save a few bucks on the strip ( hard) we decided to eat at pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> , well you get what you pay for here
not anything like it used to be
no steamed bun
cheese wouldn't even melt
just a fast thrown together effort for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>
fries were great

i'm so happy to see this place here in town! i've been wanting to go forever. my one complaint is there's very little shade and all of the seating is outside. i ended up going and the sun was blasting us which just made it extra hot.

the food is so good with lots of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> choices and my favorite dog here is the bacon with chili on it. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are very large and we also ordered <mark>Onion Ring</mark> that are huge. it's all very filling and i can never get enough bacon. lots of these dogs come with bacon on them so that makes me very happy. if you plan on visiting in the summer just plan in the heat outside or take your dog to go and find a spot inside the casino. maybe next to a machine so you can eat and win some money at the same time.

i truly hate giving pinks such a low rating, because coming from chicago, i truly love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but giving them 2 stars was actually generous (i originally gave them 2 stars for the fries, but as i wrote this, i realized that fries for $30 plus isn't a reason to give them 2 stars). from service, to the final product, i was beyond disappointed, especially when compared to their other, much more busy la location. i was the hungry, and the only one in line, and ordered 5 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and 1 fry, one chile, and 4 "chicago style". i paid, and stood to wait for my for my dogs to be prepared, 4 or 5 people beyond the line chit chatting, laughing, totally ignoring me and my food. about 10 minutes later, one of the 5 workers starting half hazardously started throwing the extremely expensive <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> together in a painfully slow fashion all the while still chitchatting with his other co-workers, not giving another care in the world, let alone me, the customer. 
now to the consumption of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. i've eaten probably a 1000 dogs in my lifetime, all over the world, many i would say were pretty bad- these i would say were horrible. the bun to dog ratio were way off, which would not be bad, if the bun were steamed and not cool and on the border of being stale. i ate the chile dog first, which made the bun bearable. the second dog, which was there interpretation of the "chicago style", who's toppings were way beyond ice cold- unbearably cold. so cold, the actual <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was cold why the time i got to it (above room temp), and extremely inedible, especially combined with the large stale bun. i wasn't the only one who felt this way, either. since i paid, the other two in my party just politely didn't finished their food (just a single <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>) without a peep, both starving before we got there.  
pinks, don't go opening restaurants in hopes they become tourist traps, because i moved to las vegas last month, and my second day here, i was trapped by this restaurant thinking it was the same quality as the one in la. i'm a local who could have been repeat business for you. my husband works right there, and the disgusting service (that i only scratched the surface on) and food you proved is enough for him to steer everyone clear. you fooled me, and my wallet out of a lot of money. fool me once...fool me never again. thanks, pinks

i've had many opportunities to go to the pink's in la, but i just can't stand waiting in lines for things. oh please let me patronize your business. i'll do anything! i'll wait for an hour for the right to hand you money in exchange for food! those kind of places just seem obscene to me, like they are disrespecting the customers valuable time just to seem more popular. the long lines places want to have that hip vibe like they just can't keep up with the demand, but realistically they could have hire more people or expand. but they choose not to because they want the long lines.

but the location in <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>'t have that kind of jackassery and i could just try their food without the surrounding crap. it was quite good! very creative toppings. good portions for the money. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself had a proper snap and was juicy.

i want to give it more than 3 stars, but 4 stars is entering fine dining territory. i'm surprised that after all these years yelp has not done half star system yet to be more precise in the ratings. 3.5 stars would be the actual proper rating for this. it's worth a trip!

everytime we passed pinks, we told ourselves that we were going to try it, we finally did. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were ok, they were a bit dry....it's probably due to having <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> out for too long or over cooked. it almost taste like rubber. on the other hand their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were really really good! they were very well loaded!

loved <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, best i had in a long time. i was in los angeles and thought i would go and see what all the hype was and it was! now the only thing i didn't like was the drinks served in bottle, i would rather pay more and get a cup with ice, it was very hot that day i went so a drink on ice would have been great.

luckily we did not have to see a kardashian there. ;^) 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are extra long, and skinnier than a chicago-dog guy is used to eating. 

the meat is very tasty, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> have a good, crisp casing that makes each bite "pop" when you break the casing. 

the menu contains a huge list of "celebrity" dogs, one assumes that each is catered to the taste of the given celeb. these combinations range from "sounds good" to "absurd". 

i like my dogs two ways, if it is a <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> then it's "through the garden". any other dog i like with just yellow mustard and sweet relish.  

since the pink's dogs are made to have tons of ingredients heaped on them, the bun is oversized, providing twice the amount of bread than you need for the relatively skinny little dog hidden underneath. 

my dog came with about a cup (4 oz) of relish on it!! i scraped off most of it and then ate what was a very tasty dog. 

the <mark>French Fries</mark> are perfect - they had a nice crispy exterior with a wonderful almost creamy interior, perfectly cooked and a nice big serving - enough for two.  great potato flavor and not greasy. they are a nice size, about 3/8" square, which also helps the perfect cook and flavor. 

the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. wow.  the best i have ever eaten - and i don't say that lightly! they remind me of my grandfathers rings he served at carnivals in the 60s when he had a corn dog wagon he took around to fairs. 

the batter appears to be some sort of beer batter, and it is crunchy and crisp and melts in your mouth. the onions are sweet and perfectly cooked, tender....perfect. 

i hate it when you get an <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and take a bite only to pull out half of an undercooked onion that flops down on your chin, splashing hot grease and water on your shirt. not going to happen at pinks! 

the serving size on the rings was again more than enough to share for two. 

i am going with a 3 star, just because the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> should be the star here, and it really is not - the sides are some of the best you are going to find, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are tasty. 

price wise, it is a little high for a dog and fry place, but the location i went to is vegas and, well, you know. 

very enjoyable, casual place to stop and people watch on the strip just outside of planet hollywood.

pink's has always been a favorite spot. so when we took a spontaneous vegas trip, this past weekend, pink's was on our to do list. 

i'm a vegetarian so i always look forward to getting a veggie <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>. this time, however, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was throw together and was very unappealing. my husband spent some quality in the bathroom after his <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were pretty decent though. 

possible scam**** when we were paying for our food - prior to even tasting it - there was an error with processing my husband's credit card. we paid cash instead. my husband received an alert from his bank verifying that he just tried to make a purchase. we were visiting from san diego. he never used that card again but since we walked out of pink's, there were a total of 12 fraudulent charges totaling more than $700. i don't know if there is a connection or if there was a phishing device on their reader but it's awfully suspicious. pay cash!!!

my bf and i made a foodie bucket list and i had come across pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was a must add! we got here a little before they closed on a friday night. it is located outside the miracle mile in planet hollywood on the las vegas strip. 
as we waited in line their were a fair amount of people in front. the older gentlemen in front of us willingly gave us some advice. he said the pink's in la is tastier but it is very good here as well, also if you get one dog it's plenty. wow! i'm telling my bf this guy has got me looking forward to this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it's been long overdue since i've even eaten one.
so we ordered two <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> add jalape\u00f1os please! yum. the wait was not long at all such a plus especially when we are acting and feeling like we haven't eaten for days. we grabbed a seat on their patio outside, great view. the bellagio and cosmo are across the street so the view was beautiful. if you're lucky you can see the water show. took my first bite and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was skinny.. i was expecting something meatier i guess? tasted like a typical <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with jalape\u00f1os. no wow just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with accessories. i was fairly disappointed but i definitely still ate it, it's still a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! haha we looked at each other after we finished and laughed saying "i could definitely eat another one" the man who said one would be enough wasn't! we didn't get another because it was mediocre and it was almost $8 a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. overall my experience was good but the quality, taste and price.. very disappointing.

purely average at best.  for $9.00 <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was not up to standards in taste, quality and size.  the combo fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were average also.  four of us ate here and all had the same opinion of pink's.  you can do much better on the strip.

ever since seeing the original pink's highlighted on a food channel travelogue, i've always wanted to give this a whirl. since central la isn't high on my list of visited places, i'll settle for a branch office.

the "snap" of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was just amazing! i had mine with mustard, onions, and kraut. that's how i like it, and i liked it. i asked the counter staff whether i should get fries or <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. they said, "how about half and half?" nice touch. after trying both, i would have opted for all rings. very good.

we tried 4 different dogs and they were ok at best. the buns weren't super fresh and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> themselves didn't taste great. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were covered with toppings which probably helped to hide the bad taste of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. but they had a wide selection and various types of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausages to pick from.

nothing special here, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is ok, as is the bun.  the chili was bland and the fries ok.  there are a lot better food options in the area i would probably pass pink's by next time around.

i'm not a huge fan of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to begin with... but i heard a lot about this place.  my friends hyped it up and made it sound like it is the best thing to eat on the strip.  blah.

i can't speak for the other dogs, but i had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and i wasn't too impressed.  the guacamole looked like it came straight out of a tube i could have purchased at the 99 cent store.  i expected real guacamole since i was paying about 8 bucks for a freakin' <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  (you do realize that you can get a big <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> at costco for less than $2... and it comes with a drink, right?  just wanted to remind you)

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> was so bland.  the chili was very bland.  i asked for <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> over my <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> (think in n out) and the onions it actually came with was raw.  disappointed.  i usually love fries... <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>... and this place was very whomp whomp whomp.

i wouldn't eat here again.  i tried it once and thats all i need to know that i don't like it.

oh pink's, how you have been able to somewhat redeem yourself. going to college in los angeles, you're bound to go to pink's at least once. after having it there, i really thought this place was overrated. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were just ok, and were definitely not worth the wait in line (at least 30 minutes).

because of that, i really did not want to give this location a chance. however, we were leaving las vegas and wanted something were it would've be relatively quick. hesitantly, i agreed to go to pink's. and you know what, i'm really glad i did.

for those that do not know where pink's is, it's outside on the strip. when we got here, i was honestly surprised that there was no line here. i had to initially do a double take to make sure i was at the right location. there were the familiar pictures of celebrities on the wall which helped me know that i was at the right place.

due to being hungry, i ordered <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>. the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark> was good, the mix of <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, tomatoes, and relish was a nice combination with the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i'm not the biggest fan of relish, but i liked it in this case. <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> was pretty awesome. to warn you in advance, make sure you have napkins, a fork, and a knife. i rarely eat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with a knife and fork, but in this case, you must! the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> have a nice pop when you take a bite, which i love in a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

there's no room to eat inside, but there are tables outside for you to sit and enjoy the strip on a nice warm day. especially after a big night of partying, this is a nice way to recover. 

overall, i'd give it 3.5 stars. the reason i rounded it down to a 3 was due to my experiences at the hollywood location. though i'll definitely would come back to this location whenever i'm in vegas.

i was excited to hear that las vegas was going to have a pink's. i went with my sister to check it out. we are pretty familiar with planet hollywood, but pink's is really hard to find. it's not on any of the signs in the casino. we asked the ph concierge and she informed us that it was outside.

i ordered <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> with a veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i really enjoyed it. it was messy to it but that didn't bother me. it was a little expensive. $24 for two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and one drink. the high prices are expected for the strip.

the seating area is pretty small. i would imagine it to be very hard to find a spot at times. also the only outdoor seating has to be rough with the unpredictable weather here.

overall, its a great place to check out.

the bf had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and i had <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. both dogs were filled w toppings, which is good but hard to  just pick up and eat. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were good but nothing spectacular. pretty much can make at home w your fav <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and whatever toppings you desire! 

customer service: was ok. the employees weren't very upbeat and while we were eating at the patio, an employee sprayed a cleaner onto a rag right next to us while we were eating and i felt the mist . very unprofessional and gross!

my house people told me that i gained weight. who's to blame?
i didn't go to many other food places in vegas. who's to blame?

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!

i spent 4 days in vegas, and pinks fed my stomach 3 times in 4 days.
day 1:
chilli <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (me)
mushroom <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 2:
<mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (my friend)
<mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> (me)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 4: 
2 <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (me& my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>
coleslaw

* the coleslaw is a no, but whatever, i love you still, pinks!

i have long heard about pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> being a go-to hot spot late at night for grub and the chance to run into celebrities out in hollywood but have never had the chance to go.  thus i was really excited when i saw that pink's had opened a storefront right on the strip in vegas.  

after a long night of debauchery, i walked halfway across the strip just so i could eat at pink's.  i have to give them credit, they sure know how to jazz up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i ordered a <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>, which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, guacamole and jalape\u00f1o peppers on it.  i ordered relish on it as well.  

the combination works well in theory as well as in practice.  but in practice all of that stuff on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> makes it damn near impossible to eat as you would normally.  picking it up makes all the toppings fall off, and a sloppy mess gets all over your hands.  so i had to resort to eating <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> with a fork and knife.  i felt pretty stupid, but it was the only way to do it and plenty of people around me were doing the same.  

but eating like that made the bun soggy, which is not good.  i appreciate the effort they put into dressing up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i only give it three stars because i've had amazing "gourmet" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in chicago before, with toppings piled high, but with which i could still eat as <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are intended to be eaten - with your hands.

i believe i got <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>, which was topped with cheese, salsa, jalapenos, and guacamole. it was heavenly, to put it short. i don't understand why people give it 2-3 stars for being hard to eat without forks and spoons. well, it's topped with goodies, duh!
the reason i gave it a 4-star was bc i ordered a coleslaw. worst slaw i ever had. i think it was b/c they used something other than cabbage. but can't blame it on others, who orders a slaw at a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place? lesson learned!

i never thought i'd spend $30 for 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but here i am standing at the pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> shop with my jaw dropped at the cash register in vegas. all i could think while i was waiting is that these damn dogs better be fantastic. 

in about 10 minutes my number was called. i got the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (two dogs in one bun) and <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. i tried a bite of all three and none of them wowed me. <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> was topped with cheap <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, onions, bland guac and tomatoes. there wasn't a spice factor in there at all. the vegas strip was similar to the spicy except that it was two dogs, chili  and had jalapenos, i thought this blended together better but still wasn't "omg this is the best $8 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever put in my mouth" type of good. 

overall, i was full but not satisfied.

pinks, i expected more from you!
