i stood in lines 2 hours for you in la and thought you were a little better than average. then i come to las vegas to try you again with barley any lines, and you were not great to me at all! i am totally breaking up with you. 

i tried <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. both were okay and had nothing special about them. this place is small, expensive for what you get, and seating is only outside. this place is truly overrated.

after hearing about all the rave on this place--i was extremely eager to finally try the famous pinks. hmmm , so why did people rave about this so much?? i got <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>, containing jalape\u00f1os, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, onions and guacamole ..sounds like the perfect <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for me but that dog was nearly unbearable to swallow. seriously, how can you go wrong with a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>?! even a bbq <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from my family's party taste a whole lot better. all in all, i was completely disappointed. not worth 7$+ tax for a nasty <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>

overpriced for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but you do get a huge ass wiener.

i'm a girl that craves <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> after midnight, so <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> was the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> of choice and boy did it hit the spot.  

i'm glad they were open at 2am  and i didn't have to go looking for a 7-11.  :)

so i'm not really a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> person but since they had so many different kinds i wanted to try this place out. i had the big man dog, my sister had the mushroom swiss and the bf had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. his was good but messy it started to break apart. mines was blah, i should have just got a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with ketchup! my sis said hers was ok a little bland. so for 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and a side of fries it was not worth the 27 plus bucks i spent!

couldn't wait to try this place. my friends love it. me on the other hand could careless for the overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. it was alright definitely not worth the $. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were better than <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> but that's not good enough for me to go back. i'm giving it 1 star because the employees are very nice!

pink's is entering its 73rd year in business. admittedly, when comparing prices with the original los angeles venue, the vegas spot appears much more expensive. predictable.

not really seeing a deathly spicy option (not saying that i was gonna find one), i got whatever could be interpreted as spicy to some people. <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> ($8.49) was my choice. yeah, you read that right. it was gonna basically be $9 with tax for a damn <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, pickled jalapenos, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, guacamole, and tomatoes.

it looked and tasted like your basic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> bun here. with the larger <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> and an abundance of toppings, it really needed one of those large gourmet buns to even give me a shot to pick it up. fork and knife would have to do.

flavor-wise, it did the job. it's basically as good as i could have expected this to be. great snap from the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> felt like it came from a container. the veggies and the guacamole tasted fresh. my issue is simply the price. there's no way this poor panda would even want to pay around $9 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, even if edible gold was attached to this sucker. besides, i'd take the edible gold and try to extract monetary value from it anyway.

i look at the yelp reviews for the los angeles pink's, and it's around a three-star average, same as the vegas spot. any complaints are likely directed at the price or the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> not living up to the hype. the line's also longer in l.a., so that probably also affects the reviewer's rating. still, it makes me wonder if the los angeles spot is better.

pink's was good for the experience. i can't complain much about the food other than not being able to pick it up. but i also don't want my wallet to have a reason to riot again.

i always like coming here when i go to vegas because it's cheap (ish), tasty, and it doesn't take forever to get there because it's right on the outside of the miracle mile shops. 

i'm not a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>/pink's expert like maybe everyone else that reviewed this but i've been here a several times and never had a bad experience. i either get <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> or the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>. both are great if you like onions and jalapenos. the chili on the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> is also pretty good and hits the spot if you're starving or hungover. 

the outdoor seating kind of sucks if it's prime lunch time because there's only about 12 small tables. 

all and all, 
great food that's reasonably priced. 
definitely going to keep coming here!

i've been wanting to try pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, since i've already tried pink taco.

you ordered first and find a table outside afterwards. came here around 9pm, so wasn't that busy. fast service.

i ordered <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and it was huge and delicious! so unhealthy, but so worth the calories!  i had to use utensils to eat my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> since it was falling apart because of so much toppings.

i've heard about this place for a while, and finally got to try it. i've seen tons of pictures from friends on facebook and boy, do they look amazing and delicious! 
well... now that i've had the chance to try it, the taste is not exactly as amazing as it looks. first of all, its definitely overpriced. i ordered the "<mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>" thinking the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> (which i love), guac, and the spicy <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> mixed together would be orgasmic. i don't know about what others think, but i thought the guac didn't have enough avocado in it for me to taste. the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> wasn't as cheesy as i would like, and so the only thing that actually met my expectation for taste was the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> itself. in the end, i wasn't even full! and neither were my friends. 
i guess this would be a good place to go if you were craving something greasy + <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i've had better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at local joints so i probably wouldn't choose to come back here if i had the choice out of all the places i could be eating at in vegas. i was overall disappointed with the food quality especially when its priced at almost $10 a dog! if you're at planet hollywood, you might as well go for earls.

i am a fan of the regular <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. but when we ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> we were really disappointed. a waste of money basically, i wouldn't order those again and the sausage was too hard. also, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are very expensive. but it's vegas i guess, what else can i expect. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were very good too. as a suggestion, just stick to the original dog, the others are below average

i love me a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. but i also like being able to eat said <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. and that did not happen here at pink's. 

i ordered myself <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. this thing was so over the top ridiculously stacked with toppings. i tried. believe me. you are literally unable to eat this thing the way you're supposed to normally eat a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i got nearly halfway through it with only slight spillage. then all of a sudden, it just exploded on me and i lost everything. i got cheese and guacamole everywhere. my hands looked like i just got done fingerpainting. just a complete mess.

it's a nice novelty, but i probably won't ever be back. not my cup of tea.

we were starving and only had 45 min before jeff dunham started so we got <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and took it back to our room! they were great and the cashier mad a combo to save us money without us asking. i like that! they have a hard frozen lemonade there that was the best frozen drink i had in vegas. we got the showgirl (no relish) and <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. we ate the whole thing. we will be back next time we are in vegas and will absolutely  get my frozen drink there instead of the other syrupy sweet places.

i'll make it short. i was disappointing that they didn't have the same menu as the one in los angeles. i didn't enjoy my food because of it. even writing this right now bummed out. it's just... i wanted to buy a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with the celebrity made ones so my mother could try it, but they just had the standard one. the taste to the ones in l.a. where somewhat close to the taste, but very far away. i wouldn't go here again because it just feels like a cosmetically made <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i mean look at whos being advertised... mel b, kim kardashian and holly madison. bunch of whores. that made my meal worse. just could not enjoy the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at all. ordered a show girls dog and a <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. :(

i go every time i go for a trek up and down the strip and will continue to do so.

the reason i'm only giving three stars is that although the service is good, and the place is clean, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> aren't bad, they're not all that great either.  mainly i like the place for the variety.

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> by itself can't hold up to a properly done nathans, but it's nowhere near as bad as a bar s.

the rueben dog is good, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself gets lost in the reuben part, which isn't bad, but i'd like to taste <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> if it's there.

now, what makes pinks (la anyways) famous is the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  i recently had the bacon chili <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>.  the bacon was nice if undercooked, but that's about it.  the cheese and onions got lost in the chili which was pretty dang boring.  it's not spicy, it's not flavourful.  it tastes kind of like bean powder was mixed with ground beef, gravy, and a dash of tabasco.  not anything special.

if a place is famous for something, it should be good, that's why they're famous.  so it was very disappointing to discover it tastes like something out of a <mark>Bud</mark> can.

ooooommmmg.  at first i didn't want to eat here because i thought it was just another <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i'm glad i tried it.  one thing you have to remember when going to this place is this is going to cost you when you get back home.  at least an extra hour on the treadmill.  this place is super fat and i hate to admit it, but i like it.  

i had the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> and shared it with my friend weez because i would be in a food comma still. in the burrito it had two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, bacon, chili and cheese. i wanted another one, but good thing the line got  hella long. i would be complaining all day on how fat i got on this vacation. 

overall a good place for something oily and greasy after a night of partying.  and i suggest ordering the burritos because all the other dogs look to messy to eat.

i really wanted to see what the hype was all about with pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i have to say it can be good depending on what you order.  

the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> really blew me away.  it was just loaded with bacon, cheese, mushrooms, and onions.  it was a complete task just trying to keep it together while eating it.  and somewhere under all that mess was a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  it was really good!  worth the $8.50?  well, it's on the strip so i'm not going to knock it on price.

i also ordered the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark>.  this one didn't really blow me away, but it was also a task to keep this one together. still good though, but it tasted like something i could've had at nathan's.   price was a little cheaper though at $7.50.

so yeah, i spent about $16 on two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  sounds crazy i know, but now at least have a taste of what pink's has to offer.  maybe next time i'll give their pastrami <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> a shot.  looks really heavy! 

it was a-ok!

you want a review of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? you came to the right girl.

some people grow out of eating <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. not this girl. my love f<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> has grown only stronger with age. i just see <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i'm hungry. i pass by vendors, and i have to stop. doesn't even matter if i've just eaten a three course meal and my jeans are unbuttoned. i will never pass up a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. steamed, boiled, fried, or grilled.

so imagine me, in vegas, a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place attached to the front of my hotel! how superfrikkinexciting. i'm all by my lonesome, just the way i like it, and i am starving!

pink's is where my tired feet carry me. i take my place in the ever growing line outside <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. the smell is fantastic. i am like a little kid hopping from foot to foot, trying to look over me and determine my wait time.

evidently, a few people ahead of me a woman is struggling with what kind of dog to order. c'mon, lady! i'm withering away here!

i get close enough to check the menu and now have to decide between a regular dog with some mustard, or a specialty dog. the list is massive. how many ways can you tweak a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. now i am seeing there are many! 

i order a specialty. hell, i am in vegas. go big or go home. a <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>. fries. and a soda.

i wait five minutes and whoot! number 80 is called. that's me! i sit down at the one table that's open, still dirty from the previous diner. i unwrap this massive thing, and take a huge bite. bleh!

it felt like i was biting through a rubber dog drenched in chili. and through the rubber <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> wasn't very tasteful. if you've ever over-boiled a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you know the flavor i speak of. it's like cooking the flavor right out. i choked down half of it. after all, i was starving and needed to eat some of my money's worth. but half is all i got through. and i am a woman who can eat quite a few dogs in one sitting. the rest got tossed.

las vegas needs a few <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> vendors on the street.

let me just start out by saying this... i am not a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> person, in general.  i have to be in the right mood, in the right frame of mind, otherwise i think they taste gross.
i loved my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at pink's and would go back today were in possible.  i got the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark> with <mark>Sour Cream</mark> (it's ok, it was good!) and my husband got the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> which was just about as insane as it sounds, but he loved it.  (what? a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in a tortilla?? they did it!)

i have to give them three stars based on the following:
1. i dont usually like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i enjoyed my experience and would def go back
2. originality in both names, flavors, various types of dogs and condiments

while on our honeymoon in vegas last week, i found out that there was a pink's there! i thought there was only the one in cali. so needless to say we went there for lunch. it was so good! my husband had the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>, and i had the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>. these dogs were huge and totally worth the price. the fries were crisp, fresh and very tasty. they also offer free refills on soda. i wish that pink's would open a location here in s.fl.

comparing to the la pink's, this place is only so-so. but, after a long day of walking up and down the strip with no food, this place makes for a decent, quick, & filling dinner. though not necessarily cheap. but if you're comparing to a lot of other places on the strip, with the exception of mcdonalds, you're not going to really find anything cheaper than this place.

my friend got one that had 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with chili, cheese, onions, and guacamole. she loved the topping combinations offered.
i was feeling a little hungrier so i got the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>, which is a gigantic <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, chili, cheese, and 2 pieces of bacon wrapped in a tortilla. it was good, but the sausage casing was kind of chewy. my friend and i both agreed the chili was pretty good as a topping. it's much more about the toppings here than it is about the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, so know that going in.

the seating here is sketchy, since it's all outdoors. so if they're busy, you might be out of luck. try to go when there isn't a line. but even when there is a line, it always moves pretty fast.

yummy! small little place, needs more seating. 
loved my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, had great snap! my husband had the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> and also really liked it. will go again!

well it was a 105 out and the nice cool misting fans were looking nice. 
the wait was to at the mall restaurants so we ended up here! i really do enjoy a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> when they can be found and the last couple i have had were very average. also seeing this on food network a few time made for some big expectations. 

i was excited to try pink's and the line was moving fast. i normally just go with a normal dog with ketchup when trying new places but the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> was sounding good and it sounded big! 

we got our order pretty fast and the serve pepsi bleh, so went with sierra mist when in this situation. 

then i went for the ketchup and then ooooo no cisco ketchup, blehhh, how could you pink's? i don't think i've had to have cisco ketchup since i was at the last country fair. that would be my only complaint here. ketshup is one of the only condiments i enjoy and if i'm eating a top quality <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries, i need the good stuff! 

alas, my giant burrito filled with bacon, chili, cheese and 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was really to be devoured and it was. it was great, filling, and had some hearty chili which is something you either like <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>'t, but i did. 

i was pretty full after that and i would have this again for sure. 

if i had coke, some heinz, and a cooled indoor seat, you could have had that 1 extra star!

i got the groupon ($7 for $15 at pinks) so i took the family. overall the food is great, i had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, knife and fork needed! husband had thepastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> burger, my daughter got the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>, it is huge and very messy. my other daughter got the nacho <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.
the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> them selves are big, very good flavor and a nice snap. the chili is bean free and wonderful on <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, not spicy just good flavor, & how can you go wrong added bacon to anything?? we shared fries very good thin crisp shoesting style and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, nice batter but not as crisp as i would like

pink's is a fun place to eat strip side and people watch. i will warn you its pricey, i added a souvenir cup (the small one $13.50) so after the groupon my check was still $42

call me cheap, but without a deal, i would not have come to pink's on my own account, knowing it's hyped, mediocre, and over-priced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. luckily, i used a groupon deal that allowed me to try pink's at an affordable price.

the stand is located outside the miracle mile shops, with no access from the planet hollywood casino. we learned that the hard way. -_-

i ordered the brooklyn pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. i like keeping my dogs plain, and dressed with mustard. so i enjoyed this dog, but would have liked it even more if the pastrami came out hot, rather than lukewarm.

i also sampled some of the bf's <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> (2 dogs, bacon, chili, cheese, onions). we ordered <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> without onions, but it came out standard, so he brought it back to have it re-made. the cook was nice about it, probably because there was hardly a line at 4 pm, and served up a new one within 3 minutes, spit-free! it was interesting... glad we tried, but wouldn't order it again. it is also best eaten with the wrapper, because the burrito drips chili grease... yum!

with our $15 groupon, we had to fork out a whopping $0.52. overall, $7.52... i would not mind paying that price, but $15.52 is a bit steep for 2 dogs. i'd rather use that money to buy 2 sammiches from earl's inside. i'll be back once i get my hands on another deal!

i've heard a lot of buzz around pink's so when my girlfriends and i were in vegas last month, we made sure to stop by. 

i ordered the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> which is a tortilla with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, bacon, chilli, and cheese. while it wasn't bad, it wasn't anything amazing either. i found it a little too oily for my liking (which i guess shouldn't be surprising given the ingredients) and a little overpriced for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i can spend $8 elsewhere and get more value.

hmmmm, what should i say about pink's? every time i eat one of their delicious <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> i know i'm in for some discomfort. the pressure builds up as it quickly passes through my system until the gates burst open with enough force to practically lift me off the seat. for some reason, i still occasionally subject myself to it because i really like their greasy ass chili.

my favorite thing on the menu though is their burger. i've only tried one once, but it was a very pleasant surprise. with pastrami and swiss (no chili), it was better than most burger joints i've been to and it was much gentler on my guts.

cool little spot to get a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the strip.  as far as <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> go, this is the place to get them.  if you're not in the mood for a full sit down meal, or you don't want to spend $30 a person, definitely consider checking out pink's.

pro:
+great dogs.  try the "<mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>" (flour tortilla wrapped 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, 2 slices of cheese, 3 strips of bacon, chili & onion).  it's amazing.

con:
-inside of the shop is cramped
-outdoor seating can get crowded / noisy at times
-<mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> can be a bit greasy

why did i ever think it would be anything close to what i extremely enjoy in l.a.. rhetorical!!! my bad. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was less then room temp. their was barely any chili in the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>. they must know it's embarrassing and that's why theirs a wall that doesn't allow you to see your order being prepared. this is not pinks at all. pinks family you set the bar really high many years ago. i absolutely believe you should have stuck with the original idea of never trying to duplicate what you have already mastered in l.a.. i apologize for not proving my loyalty and stepping foot in your disappointing attempt of a mirror.

with our $15 groupon, we had to fork out a whopping $0.52. overall, $7.52... i would not mind paying that price, but $15.52 is a bit steep for 2 dogs. i'd rather use that money to buy 2 sammiches from earl's inside. i'll be back once i get my hands on another deal!

i've heard a lot of buzz around pink's so when my girlfriends and i were in vegas last month, we made sure to stop by. 

i ordered the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> which is a tortilla with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, bacon, chilli, and cheese. while it wasn't bad, it wasn't anything amazing either. i found it a little too oily for my liking (which i guess shouldn't be surprising given the ingredients) and a little overpriced for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i can spend $8 elsewhere and get more value.

hmmmm, what should i say about pink's? every time i eat one of their delicious <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> i know i'm in for some discomfort. the pressure builds up as it quickly passes through my system until the gates burst open with enough force to practically lift me off the seat. for some reason, i still occasionally subject myself to it because i really like their greasy ass chili.

my favorite thing on the menu though is their burger. i've only tried one once, but it was a very pleasant surprise. with pastrami and swiss (no chili), it was better than most burger joints i've been to and it was much gentler on my guts.

cool little spot to get a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the strip.  as far as <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> go, this is the place to get them.  if you're not in the mood for a full sit down meal, or you don't want to spend $30 a person, definitely consider checking out pink's.

pro:
+great dogs.  try the "<mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>" (flour tortilla wrapped 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, 2 slices of cheese, 3 strips of bacon, chili & onion).  it's amazing.

con:
-inside of the shop is cramped
-outdoor seating can get crowded / noisy at times
-<mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> can be a bit greasy

why did i ever think it would be anything close to what i extremely enjoy in l.a.. rhetorical!!! my bad. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was less then room temp. their was barely any chili in the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>. they must know it's embarrassing and that's why theirs a wall that doesn't allow you to see your order being prepared. this is not pinks at all. pinks family you set the bar really high many years ago. i absolutely believe you should have stuck with the original idea of never trying to duplicate what you have already mastered in l.a.. i apologize for not proving my loyalty and stepping foot in your disappointing attempt of a mirror.

it was pretty exciting to try pink's for the very first time. but my sis said this location is $3-$4 more per item compared to the la location. not only that, but the menu is shorter and the specials are not the same. the good thing is, there's no crazy hour wait like in la. 

had the vegas strip <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, served with chili, mustard, guacamole and jalapenos. very tasty, but a bit on the heavy side. especially in 100+ degree weather since there's only outdoor seating. sis had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, which was pretty good too. gotta love chili! had a bite of the <mark>Pastrami Burrito</mark>. now that was just weird. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrimi, chili, cheese and onions. odd combo and taste. pass. lastly, their fries were very good. seasoned and crispy, just the way i like it. 

after combo-ing my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it came out to like $12! wow. that's some expensive <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i couldn't even finish. not because it was big, but it was just too difficult to eat in that hot weather.

it's not the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place i've been to but it got the job done. 

if you're walking down the strip, a little drunk and your stomach is asking to be fed, this might be the place for you. the prices were reasonable and the selection of toppings is pretty good but i didn't really understand why this place is famous for its <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

i ordered the <mark>Pastrami Burrito</mark> (or whatever it's called, i was drunk) and it was pretty good but i really don't remember any pastrami in it. it was more like meat/bean paste with a couple <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> thrown in.

it wouldn't be my first choice for food while in vegas but if your tired, want something quick and you're in the area it might be worth a look.

way too much money for what you get my husband got the <mark>Pastrami Burrito</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a drink.  i could have made the burrito at home with hormel chili some pastrami from the deli and <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and tortillas.  sorry just not worth all the hype.  the location is great if you want to buy alcoholic drinks for the walk down strip.

i really wanted to see what the hype was all about with pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i have to say it can be good depending on what you order.  

the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> really blew me away.  it was just loaded with bacon, cheese, mushrooms, and onions.  it was a complete task just trying to keep it together while eating it.  and somewhere under all that mess was a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  it was really good!  worth the $8.50?  well, it's on the strip so i'm not going to knock it on price.

i also ordered the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark>.  this one didn't really blow me away, but it was also a task to keep this one together. still good though, but it tasted like something i could've had at nathan's.   price was a little cheaper though at $7.50.

so yeah, i spent about $16 on two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  sounds crazy i know, but now at least have a taste of what pink's has to offer.  maybe next time i'll give their pastrami <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> a shot.  looks really heavy! 

it was a-ok!

meh. i've experienced better... exactly what i was thinking!

after all the hype i've heard about the famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in la, i seriously thought i would have been blown away by the experience... maybe its because of the hype that shot my expectations through the roof, but wouldn't you think with all the hype, it should at least make me want to come back for more? 

but i'm the kind of girl that always gives a place the benefit of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, perhaps i ordered something not-so-amazing on the menu -- the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark>, i honestly thought this was a pretty good choice!! equipped with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrami, mustard, <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> & sauerkraut... i mean its not the fattiest of the bunch, but lets be honest the scorching hot weather was taking a negative toll on my appetite. regardless of my choice, i had the chance to have a bite of a few others -- the planet hollywood, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>... nothing really sang to me ya know? in other words, i was hoping for more, something more memorable and amazing rather than just a meal to fill me up. i think i'll give the la pink's a chance, but if that doesn't change my mind, who knows what will.

tried to eat at g<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> ramsay burgr, but there was an hour and a half wait.  pinks was right around the corner, so we decided to get a quick lunch.  i was with 5 other people. 

i ordered the polish bacon burrito.  the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was okay, the skin was tough.  i liked the bacon and the chili, but it was very, very, very greasy.  my tortilla was soaked and dripping with grease, it was disgusting.  the others that i was with ordered <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, no tortilla, still really greasy.  the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> that was ordered looked good.  the regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didnt really have all that much flavor, it was nothing special.  the fries were thin cut and crispy. 

i probably won't be back, nothing really special or different about <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.

just go to pink's in la. 
if you can't, the one in vegas is fine. don't cry about it. 
you order from a large menu posted. the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> was godlike. how can you really complain about this delicious <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? they put a bunch of toppings on it, serve it to you hot, crispy and obese-friendly- why are you whining about it? 

thank you, vegas! i love that i can get my cali fixes here. ;)

the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> is my favorite. i don't even like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but this dog is freaking amazing. we've tried others but this one is the one i dream about when we come to vegas.

absolutely loved our food. my husband, whose favorite food is <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, said this beats out all other <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> places he's been to (which is saying a lot). i had the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and thought it was awesome- the chili was top notch, and i love chili. he got a <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> with real pastrami., sauerkraut, mustard and melted swiss. he is already asking to go back.

i've been wanting to try this for a while after seeing it on a food network special.  while in vegas, this was my first and last meal.  the first meal was a classic dog with chili, mustard, onions, and tomatoes (possibly cheese too but i can't remember for sure).  the last meal of my trip was a life saver after a very long night out.  i got the <mark>Western Guacamole Burger</mark> (with a scoop of chili on top).  it was a amazing, the chili had great flavor and the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> with guacamole were a nice touch as well.

while walking through ph, i decided to try pink's. let me just say, yummy!!! i had the <mark>Western Guacamole Burger</mark> and i think i bite my finger on accident, because i was eating it si fast! lol. it was so good and so reasonably priced. it was cooked to order and all veggies were fresh, crisp and perfectly layered. 
yes, presentation means a lot as well.

delicious!  i truly do enjoy pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> every now and then.  this time i got the <mark>Western Guacamole Burger</mark> (i'm not sure what it's called but it had guacamole in it).  very tasty.  absolutely satisfying.  no complaints!

also, no line!  unlike earl of sandwich which had an hour of wait time.

i had my hopes of trying pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for the longest time, and i finally tried it here at planet hollywood's race & sports book. 

ooooooo... what a disappointment!

it was just a small little stand with one worker who looked like he didn't want to be there!

i ordered a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> combo, which came with chips, that cost $5.95. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> combo was $6.95. it just tasted like a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, except that it had a nice "snap" to it (which made me give the place an extra star!). other than that, nothing special about it. the chili tasted like crap on it, probably because it was old and in the container all day! ewww! actually, i bet all the food they served there was old! ekkkk! =o

i had asked the guy working there when they will be opening the actual official stand, and he said he wasn't sure. however, they will be opening one near the hawaiian tropic entrance of planet hollywood. sooo..look out! hopefully by that time, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> will be better...

way overpriced for some tiny dogs, but they're pretty good. i haven't eaten the one in los angeles yet, so i need to give that a try. once i go to la, i will definitely update this review. 

getting it to go is such a mess!! we had no choice but to and the huge stack of napkins totally helped. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> basically exploded in the bag and it was messy for sure.

come to pinks for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, not the fries or <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. they are soo greasy that i felt like a tub of lard eating just one ring!

i was super excited that this past weekend, i got to have pinks in las vegas. it's there people's, but it's located on the outside corner of planet hollywood

pros: 
-pinks's was vegas out,,,,super bright pink signs
-didn't even have to wait in line
-quick food for vegas
- yummy bacon
-order of fries is automatically seasoned, yumo!

cons:
-it's too hot to eat outside in vegas during summer, we took our food into the planet hollywood mall and ate at the tables near fat tuesday's
-canned mushrooms
-didn't like the taste of the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> here 
-scaled down menu from the original

***so i still haven't found the right dog for me at pink's la or lv, but i'd definitely give it a another shot**

but honestly....i still love my sf mission bacon wrapped <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> from the carts)  and costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (super duper cheap) way better.

this place is meh times twenty. i've had a better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from the refrigerator section at the grocery store. 

i would definitely skip this place all together. although all the glitz and glam of the pinks restaurant sign and ambiance is nice, it is so not worth digesting this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

i ordered the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> and the bf ordered the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. both were forgettable and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> did not have a lot of flavor, such a bummer. the total of two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and one large drink was $20, so not worth it. 

i am guessing this is not the pink's of la, because that pink's has a much better reputation than this two star joint.

ok it was like 107 degrees in vegas when i visited and pinks only offer outdoor seating. 

sucky seating aside, the food is way overrated.  i mean like $6 for a nothing special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>... that's ridics even for vegas.  my <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was bitter, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself is skinny, and tastes like any dog you can get in the deli section of safeway.  

i will not eat here again.

it was pretty exciting to try pink's for the very first time. but my sis said this location is $3-$4 more per item compared to the la location. not only that, but the menu is shorter and the specials are not the same. the good thing is, there's no crazy hour wait like in la. 

had the vegas strip <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, served with chili, mustard, guacamole and jalapenos. very tasty, but a bit on the heavy side. especially in 100+ degree weather since there's only outdoor seating. sis had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, which was pretty good too. gotta love chili! had a bite of the <mark>Pastrami Burrito</mark>. now that was just weird. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrimi, chili, cheese and onions. odd combo and taste. pass. lastly, their fries were very good. seasoned and crispy, just the way i like it. 

after combo-ing my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it came out to like $12! wow. that's some expensive <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i couldn't even finish. not because it was big, but it was just too difficult to eat in that hot weather.

pink's is one of those over-hyped places and since this location is in vegas, also super over-priced! it was located right outside the planet hollywood hotel and wasn't hard to find with its bright, pink name etched on the glass. at least there was no line at all when we got there. only outdoor seating so refrain from getting anything too spicy in the humid weather.

it was $6.75 for my bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>...not really worth it especially when the ones at the original pink's in la cost almost half that. it was topped with bacon, tomato, cheese, and mustard since i didn't want onions on mine. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uqb9ks7lzesghltmuunmea?select=3fcshb9yqxmpuyvnn8fyxa) the bacon was nice and crispy but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was tiny and wasn't anything special. the ones from costco are way bigger! 

my bun was also flimsy and broke in half after 2 bites. it could have used much more chili and the cheese wasn't melted enough. it was still a tasty meal overall but totally not worth the price tag.

i visited this pinks at about 2am after drinking alll day. for some reason a burger with coleslaw and mustard sounded amazing. too bad the cole slaw at pinks is soooo gross. it has almost no flavor and its just not good. the slaw is chopped up all funky...not uniformish...i hated it. needed salt and a lil sugar...it was like mayo salad vomit.

the burger patty was fine. my friends got turkey <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and i tried that...it was good.

the fried something we had...i think it was <mark>French Fries</mark> were good. 

the whole set up of this place is a narrow hallway...you can barely read the menu. its about 4ft between the wall and the counter. then there is an assembly line of cooks and at the end is a soda fountain.

i guess its a good place to go cause its open late and they have a lot of options.

i love their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>! its really nothing special but this location beats the la location with a 5 minute wait versus 90 minutes. it is in the back of the planet hollywood. the only thing i don't like about this location is you can only eat outside and it sucks during the summer.

went to pink's on the weekend of oct 2nd.  after drinking on an empty stomach, my two friends and i decided to go to pink's before meeting up with the rest of our friends at a club.  i'm not sure what it is about my group of friends but we like to have a few drinks before an intermission of (greasy but quick) food.  this can either be good or bad when it comes to writing reviews.  

we were starving and needed food asap.  we actually took a cab to ph for the sole purpose of getting pink's (instead of just eating something in the vicinity of our first spot or the next drinking spot) because after 2 nights of eating at expensive restaurants, clubs, and losing money at the tables - we wanted to eat something noteworthy but cheap.  

according to my friend who is born/raised socal, it is not as good as the original in cali.  i figured this was a mind-over-matter slash original-is-always-better-duhhh situation.  we ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, fries, and beer.   my other friend (a newyorker) and i thought it was good but agreed it wasn't awesome.  considering the acclamation pink's receives from born and bred la-ers, i changed my assumption and decided it probably is better at the original stand in la.  i remember thinking it wasn't as amazing of an experience as i was hoping to get - and was a bit disappointed by the lack of "snap" in <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself.  also, it was a bit... much.  i have a feeling <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had better snap to it before it got doused in the chili.   

that being said, i did enjoy my experience there.  it was exactly what i was looking for at that moment.  we were buzzed and looking to eat something extremely unhealthy but tasty - and that's exactly what we got.

i'd definitely try it again because for some reason, i think it was just an off night.  and we had some strange concoction of drinks before going there so all of this might be completely in my head.

i had the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> without onions and was a little disappointed that the chili did not contain beans.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> were nice and crispy.  i made the mistake of eating outside on a cold december day, so my food cooled off quickly; i think it may have been better warm.  overall, i thought the food was good, but not worthy of all the hype.

i had the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> (figured i should counter all the grease and calories with the lettuce, tomato, and relish that comes on this dog), almost like a mini salad on top of my <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>! it was ok except for the fact that my bun completely fell apart, thus defeating the purpose of eating a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my friend had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, which i had a bite of and really enjoyed. the bacon added just the right amount of salty goodness. the fries here were really tasty, and although we didn't order <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, almost every other table around us had them so i'm guessing they're popular. 

what is nice about this place is its location on the strip and the outdoor seating. a great place to people-watch and enjoy the weather. as a sun-starved seattleite, it was nice to be able to get some vitamin d and uv rays in since most of our vegas cavorting usually happens at night.

if you want yummy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries, or just some hangover food that hits the spot, i'd recommend. if you're a tourist in vegas and are trying to experience pink's in the city of sin, this surely isn't it. too clean, too friendly, too flashy. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and dirtiness, and hour-long wait in line that you'll find at the original pink's in la is what makes it special, for better or for worse.

i go every time i go for a trek up and down the strip and will continue to do so.

the reason i'm only giving three stars is that although the service is good, and the place is clean, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> aren't bad, they're not all that great either.  mainly i like the place for the variety.

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> by itself can't hold up to a properly done nathans, but it's nowhere near as bad as a bar s.

the rueben dog is good, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself gets lost in the reuben part, which isn't bad, but i'd like to taste <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> if it's there.

now, what makes pinks (la anyways) famous is the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  i recently had the bacon chili <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>.  the bacon was nice if undercooked, but that's about it.  the cheese and onions got lost in the chili which was pretty dang boring.  it's not spicy, it's not flavourful.  it tastes kind of like bean powder was mixed with ground beef, gravy, and a dash of tabasco.  not anything special.

if a place is famous for something, it should be good, that's why they're famous.  so it was very disappointing to discover it tastes like something out of a <mark>Bud</mark> can.

i havent had the original pinks in la, but the people i was with wouldnt stop raving about it so we tried it here in vegas. i came away pretty unimpressed. the toppings were matched very well and there were a lot of interesting combinations. however, i tried the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself (i got a polish) and it had no flavor to it. i guess they have good toppings but their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> have no flavor? this was the biggest disappointment, especially for paying a good 7-10 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i'd much rather have a costco <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.

this place was fun and conveniently located, and the food is fine but not at all special.  i had a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the chili was not good quality and the cheese was liquid cheese served with a ladle.  same goes for the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  it was kind of fun to have <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for lunch but they are no better than <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you'd get anywhere else.  if you really feel like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> or are looking for something fast in that area then this might be a good pick for you, but otherwise look elsewhere.

the pink's in southern california is another one of my bookmarked businesses. and again the franchise opened another location in las vegas. 

located right on the busy las vegas blvd strip and in the planet hollywood resort, there are no indoor seating, but plenty of outdoor seating. a great view of the strip and the bellagio hotel located across the street. 

i had one of their unique hot-dogs-"<mark>Three Dog Night</mark>". for $8.25, i get three skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wrapped with bacon and chlli, cheese and chopped red onions in a flour tortilla. this gourmet <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is featured on triple-d in so-cal and guy fieri considered this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, "money". but my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is nowhere as good as his, where my slices of bacon was "undercooked" and not crispy. i still prefer the <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> cart on mission st in san francisco any given day. 

the only positive thing about the small <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place is that i get to see the fountain show at the bellagio while eating my subpar snack. 

i'll still go to the pink's in southern california and check out other items though.

<mark>Three Dog Night</mark>: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/t0uw6vwwfo3el29wbodamq?select=zpkgzbo64jo7u91bf6exsa

what do you do when your friend is on a winning streak at the craps table? you go outside and eat some pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! that and the fact that we had a coupon you couldn't go wrong. 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were decent. being from nyc we're not used to have so much stuff loaded onto <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. had a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a reuben. quite tasty indeed, but nothing to brag about. filling? yes. it didn't taste like rubber <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and it wasn't a dirty water dog, but hell why not? try it if you're in vegas, use the coupon people!

it's not the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place i've been to but it got the job done. 

if you're walking down the strip, a little drunk and your stomach is asking to be fed, this might be the place for you. the prices were reasonable and the selection of toppings is pretty good but i didn't really understand why this place is famous for its <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

i ordered the <mark>Pastrami Burrito</mark> (or whatever it's called, i was drunk) and it was pretty good but i really don't remember any pastrami in it. it was more like meat/bean paste with a couple <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> thrown in.

it wouldn't be my first choice for food while in vegas but if your tired, want something quick and you're in the area it might be worth a look.

i had no idea there was a pinks here! but alas, on our walk towards the mgm, we found it.  bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> for me please.

the good thing is that pinks is a nice break from the plethora of buffets on the strip.  just try to avoid it in bad weather.  outdoor seating is the only seating, and the only available heat is space heater.

but after being surrounded by $$$ buffets and restaurants, its nice to know that there are some cheaper reliable  eats around

i'm not a huge fan of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to begin with... but i heard a lot about this place.  my friends hyped it up and made it sound like it is the best thing to eat on the strip.  blah.

i can't speak for the other dogs, but i had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and i wasn't too impressed.  the guacamole looked like it came straight out of a tube i could have purchased at the 99 cent store.  i expected real guacamole since i was paying about 8 bucks for a freakin' <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  (you do realize that you can get a big <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> at costco for less than $2... and it comes with a drink, right?  just wanted to remind you)

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> was so bland.  the chili was very bland.  i asked for <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> over my <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> (think in n out) and the onions it actually came with was raw.  disappointed.  i usually love fries... <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>... and this place was very whomp whomp whomp.

i wouldn't eat here again.  i tried it once and thats all i need to know that i don't like it.

i"ve heard a lot about pink's and was hoping not to be let down when i happened there in january.  and thank goodness, it was pretty good.   i had the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and it was actually pretty tasty.  not what i'd call cheap ( i think it was $5.50 when i went), but given it's location and the novelty, i expected that.   there wasn't much of a line, thank goodness, as it's a pretty small place.   there's a seating area outside on the sidewalk of the las vegas strip and that allows for a pretty nice view while eating.

i was getting a little hungry in the afternoon after walking so much and decided to get a quick bite to eat at pink's. the key word here is decided to get a quick bite to eat. when we jumped in line, there were only 10 other people in front of us but it took nearly 30 minutes just to get up to the counter to order. this place is freakin' slow! while we were waiting in line for 30 minutes the line grew to epic proportions... easily like 50+ people behind us in line. i hate to think what they had to wait at the end just to order.

i ended up ordering a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with a side of fries (it only took me 45 seconds from pulling up to the counter to order to leaving the line and not the average of 3 minutes to order per person. it isn't that hard.). the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was good... slightly above average for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

the problem with pink's is the wait time to order to taste ratio. its good to try once but it definitely isn't worth the wait. the second thing is the seating area outside is very very small. if you come at a busy time, you might have to hover until you find a place to sit. it didn't happen with me, but i can see it happening.

for lunch i wanted to try pink's--finally.  i heard that their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were very good and decided to try for myself.  there are a few things to keep in mind when it comes to pink's--size and cost. i'll explain in a minute.

just to let everyone know, pink's it outside of planet hollywood/miracle mile shops facing the boulevard.  i walked around for awhile till i found the sign in the building and realized it was outside.  anyway, there wasn't a line and their seating is all outside, so i went in to take a look at their menu.

the menu is simple with pre-made options for you and even burgers if you aren't into their dogs. at almost 10 dollars a dog it was pretty pricey, but i expected that from a famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> eaterie.  they even have their special dogs from celebrities on a flyer at the entrance and near the menu, so check those out, too.

i went for a <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>--<mark>Sour Cream</mark>, tomatoes, onions and relish--and my husband ate their classic <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with onions.  we grabbed a water and fountain drink for a total of 25 dollars and moved on down to the pick up area. when i saw our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i freaked out.  i love toppings, but really?  really?  this was definitely a fork and knife dog.

i love eating my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> by hand.  it's just the way that it should be, but at pink's it's difficult to do so.  too many toppings on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> cause the flavor of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> to be lost, so i scraped everything off on one half to get down to what matters--that fried dog.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is good with a slight snap to it, but it's not an amazing.  i ate the rest with my utensils, feeling as if i violated some ethical <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> code by not eating with my hands.

if you want to try <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, buy a plain one and ask for toppings on the side if you need them, that way you can really taste what a pink's dog is all about.  if you want something really good, their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was decent.

overall <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was decent and i can at least say that i've tried it once. would i fight my way down there through traffic again for it?  nope.  but it's something you have to try once so you can say that you have.

although this place is tiny and the line may be long, it is worth the cramped wait. maybe it was just so satisfying because i was starving after walking the strip, but i thought their <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was amazing. sure its just your regular long <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with toppings, but for some reason it just hit the spot in the perfect way. i thought it was super fresh, the chili was perfect and the cheese was nicely melted and gooey. i left the mustard off.. that didn't sound appealing but all in all i enjoyed the food and eating on their little patio in the sunshine.

i tried the popular <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>. both were pretty good but extremely messy. the guadalajara had too much <mark>Sour Cream</mark> on it. the fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were awesome - definitely complimented the meal. my friends tried some other dogs, they were wrapped up in soft tortillas and stuff. they had mixed reviews but i would suggest sticking to a regular bun. service was pretty quick and they have a small outdoor section to sit. i think they open late enough, one night we were starving and drunk or something and needed something like this to hit the spot, unfortunately it was closed already.

after checking in and settling down in our planet hollywood room, anchalee was starving for something simple. we hadn't eaten anything since our breakfast at firewood grill inside sfo at about 10 am, and now it was around 3:30 pm. the first eatery that caught her eye was pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> located outside planet hollywood but still around the premises because she was thinking of top dog in berkeley. you really couldn't miss it with it's big pink sign. 

there was a super extensive menu of dogs, burgers, burritos, soda and alcoholic beverages, sides, and desserts. we chose only one <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to share, a naked polish, since we weren't looking for all the fix-ins. can you really justify a $6 <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>? and that's before tax too. maybe it was possibly for the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> size and since we were in a tourist attraction city, but i wouldn't want to pay this price on a daily basis. if it included a drink as a meal, then maybe that's a deal. yes, the polish was spicy, juicy, and hot. but there wasn't anything special about the bun. 

after consuming this expensive snack, i thought to myself i can't wait to get back to the bay area so i can really be spoiled and eat a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from top dog for $3.25 each. 

family owned since 1939, it's always worth a try for something new with a little flair!

just another place trying to make money just off the name.. let's just say.. i would not go back to this location... after eating at the one in la... i don't even know how they can even call themselves pinks... they should just call themselves - just another <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place.   very disappointed and i got a stomach ache after eating a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>...

lousy location,no place to sit inside,just a bunch of chairs outside the
the front.
that's fine on a nice day ,but vegas gets very hot in the summer and cold in the winter.
today it was 50 ,windy and overcast and the last thing i wanted to do was sit and freeze my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.
what were they thinking,this is not a dairy queen where you sit in your car and sip a malt and eat a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>,so what's up with local?

i really wanted to see what the hype was all about with pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i have to say it can be good depending on what you order.  

the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> really blew me away.  it was just loaded with bacon, cheese, mushrooms, and onions.  it was a complete task just trying to keep it together while eating it.  and somewhere under all that mess was a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  it was really good!  worth the $8.50?  well, it's on the strip so i'm not going to knock it on price.

i also ordered the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark>.  this one didn't really blow me away, but it was also a task to keep this one together. still good though, but it tasted like something i could've had at nathan's.   price was a little cheaper though at $7.50.

so yeah, i spent about $16 on two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  sounds crazy i know, but now at least have a taste of what pink's has to offer.  maybe next time i'll give their pastrami <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> a shot.  looks really heavy! 

it was a-ok!

being a huge travel channel fan, i have often seen pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the shows featured on there. luckily it was right in my hotel, planet hollywood. i was able to try the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (minus the mustard & onions), fries, and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. the fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were really good and the chili on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had great flavor to it!

minus 2 stars for how slow the line moves and the higher than usual prices (but i guess it's expected since it is right on the strip).

this place is all the wait of the la location, none of the taste.  10 minutes to get a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> that was 90% chili and 10% of what tasted like slim jims for $8ish?  urgh!   talk about a disappointment.

stopped here for lunch after hearing all the hype about the la location.

after waiting in a bit of a line, we ordered and snagged a table in the shade. as a pale irish east coaster, it was almost a deal breaker that there was no inside seating since i fry to a crisp in the sun. so that's where one star went.

i had a holly madison naked dog, which is basically a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> overloaded with ketchup, and it was great. i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with casing so they snap when you bite into them, so i loved pink's dogs. my husband at the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and said it was great. <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were solid, too.

the only downside is that it's super pricey, even by strip standards as far as i'm concerned. that's where the other star went. but it was a fun place for lunch, nonetheless!

flippin' delicious!!!! i had the mushroom & <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. i yummed that down in a matter of minutes.. my husband even laughed that i scarffed it all down when he'd just started eating. i'm not normally a fan of food like this.. but holy cow. i wish i'd gone before we were supposed to be catching a flight in 3 hours. my husband had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>.. which was giant compared to mine.. i tasted that one too.. yum! prices were good.. [was under $15 until we added fries, beer, water & a pinks lemonade... which bumped us up to almost $40] 

the food was hot & fresh. there was no line or wait when we went [on a friday at around 6pm].. not much seating, but as they weren't busy it was okay and there was plenty of room. the giant pink fan that continually spray out water felt great. we will return next trip!

oh, and the staff was very friendly!

my friends were excited to try out this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint, since its pretty famous in la.  however, when i got there, it was nothing special.  i got the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>.  it has 2 <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> in one bun, mustard, jalapenos, onions, chili cheese, and guacamole -- all for $7.25. its huge! the looks of it seems delicious, but after a few bites of it..i got sick of it.  not only because it was too big to finish but the flavoring was too much! especially with all the cheese, and guacamole together. blehh. if you like spicy then you should go for this one. the jalapenos gave a lot of flavor and spice into it. 

they don't have indoor sitting, and their patio is pretty small, so finding a seat can be hard. it was hot about 100+ degrees when i went there and they had the fan blowing into my face while i was eating.  it was so hard to eat.   

eh, i thought costco $1.50 <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> + drink taste better than this. its was pretty expensive for me since i only took a few bites and got sick of it.

i'm an la native and my first experience at pinks was in las vegas, go figure. lol

on a sunday afternoon in the middle of july, the boyfriend's friend decided he wanted to eat at pinks, so pinks we went.
pinks as you may know is located just outside of planet hollywood.
very small with a small outdoor seating section, which i did not enjoy too much because it was about 110 degrees outside.

boyfriend mentioned that the price was a little more expensive than the la location.
we stood in line for about 15 minutes out in the sun. 
boyfriend ordered a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that had pastrami, jalapeno, and guacamole ( i forgot the name). he enjoyed it 
i ordered the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> which had chili and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>. it was good but nothing too special, i guess i should have ordered one of their specialties.
we also ordered the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> which were yummmy! greasy and big! =p
not bad, but not great. i guess i'll give it another try, but at the la location instead. i wouldn't go back to the las vegas location though, because of where it's located and the fact that the price is higher than the la location.

after hearing so much hype about the pink's in la, i could not wait to finally try their famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> when i was in vegas. the line, was what i expected it to be.. long. what made the wait seem 10x longer was the fact that the actual place is so small that once about 5 people are inside, the rest of the line is waiting outside in the scorching heat. in a way i was glad that there was a line so that my party and i would have time to browse the menu. i also noticed their had a few special celebrity <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, which certain celebrities conned, obviously. there were <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> by holly madison and kim kardashian, and a few others too. after a few minutes, i decided on the swiss mushroom <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, which was a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, mayo, and of course, mushrooms. my mom got the chili cheese and <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> while my dad played it safer with just the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. i must say that i was definitely not impressed with any of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> we ordered. i am a fan of mayo but the amount of mayo on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was just way too much for my liking. the mushrooms were almost flavorless and the cheese was not even melted; it was as if it was just placed on top of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for decoration. although my parents' chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were pretty similar, besides the bacon on my mom's, they were nothing special at all. i think i would have enjoyed a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from top dog in berkeley or even a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> from wienerschnitzel.. would have saved us a few dollars, too. i don't know about ya'll but $7-8 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> topped with basic kitchen ingredients just doesn't seem right. maybe the la location is better? but will i ever know? nope, because i doubt i'll go outta my way to try another one of their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

pinks was okay...my cousins and i went during the winter time so you can imagine how cold it was. i did not like the fact that the heater thingy's were not working. 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were okay i ordered the mushroom swiss <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> which was okay, i think if they used fresh mushrooms it would of made it much better, but mushrooms from a can umm i think not. on the bright side it is enough to share since it is a pretty big <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my bf on the other hand ordered the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, he liked it. the prices though are just a little bit overboard, i think costco or sam's club for $1.50 is probably way better and a medium drink is included! you are talking about $7 to $8 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>/ <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. better yet you can actually just buy a good pack of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and make it anyway you want it.

wanting for many years to visit the hollywood location, i jumped at the chance to finally taste one of these famous dogs albeit in the planet hollywood in las vegas. it probably isn't the same experience, but hey, it was a pretty good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it's located right on the strip, outside of the planet hollywood hotel and casino. there is a gated off area outside to sit and eat that is cooled by mist fans. it was still hot, but i was enjoying my dog too much to care.

i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. it was a mouth watering experience with the popping <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> casing, to the beefy flavor, the addition of chili, and the paramount additive that is crispy bacon. the crusty sweet <mark>Onion Ring</mark> put it all over the top. honestly on this trip, this was probably the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i had. the other being from nathan's in ny ny (http://www.yelp.com/biz/nathans-famous-hot-dogs-las-vegas), but i'm sure it was a result of the fashion in which it was prepared (i.e. griddle which is best vs hot rollers).

yeah, i didn't see any hollywood stars but who cares. i was there for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was really good.

giving this spot 4 stars would only be submitting to the hype. i liked it...don't get me wrong, but it didn't really give me a foodgasm. wifey ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and i ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>. <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> consisted of dos dogs, guac, mustard, cheese, onions, a mound of chili and topped w/ 'penos all stuffed in a single bun. good stuff, but a little over the top. we were both satisfied, but not in a craving way. the thing that stood out the most was the snap and the juiciness as you bite into the "pink" weiner (that doesn't sound right, but oh well... ). 

for the crazy decked out <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> experience alone...it's worth it! good luck figuring out how to eat one of these monstrosities.

mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>! go get them!

it was such a hot day... so i guess the workers got more anal. -_-"

this place is ok overall... the hype must die. don't get my wrong... it's good, but ain't that great. just stop by and grab a bite if you are on the strip. don't go through so much trouble to get there...

i had pretty much the same experience as other yelpers:

-no indoor seating. it's no fun eating your dog in the heat and wind.

-dogs were so so. i will say my <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> had a good snap 
 to it, but it just wasn't worth the $8 i paid for it. by the way, that $8 did 
  not  include fries. they do have a naked dog for around $4.50, but   
  why bother?

-the drinks were mainly pepsi products. no coke. 

-when you're sitting in the great outdoors enjoying the 105+ 
 temperatures and 15 mph breeze, you really don't need to have music 
 that must of been borrowed from an abercrombie and fitch store 
 blasting in your ears.

i agree with one of the yelpers who said that you are better off just going inside planet hollywood and finding a place to eat.

i love pink's anywhere it goes! this however felt like a cleaner, less greasy, less 50-plus old <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint. although i do like that feeling, nothing beats the feeling of the original place.

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are the same, except they have some different ones here i don't think i've seen. i stuck to what i know, which was the <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>. it's still delicious.
