i got a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with mustard and onions and some <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were right out of the fryer and good. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was good. i ate it with a fork--knives didn't seem to be available for some reason?

anyway, the food was good, but i don't think it was worth the price i paid. in other words, i paid something like $16 for what i felt was maybe $8 worth of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. it was good, but jeez, the price.

ok so i ordered two <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and although they weren't the most amazing <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i have ever eaten, they were reasonably good. the skin on the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was a tad bit tough but not overwhelming. the chili had a peculiar but subtle taste (not nasty or anything, just something i've never had and i'm not sure if it was for the better or worse....meh).

i will say that the size of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and the amount of fries are reasonable, and can satisfy any sensible eater. i agree with some of the other posters that the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> can get a bit greasy, and also they only have outdoor seating so be aware if you decide to grab something to eat from here. but aside from that, i do think that pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is in a excellent location on the vegas strip. and with the restaurants outdoor seating makes eating at pink's that much better. especially during the more cooler evening hours when the night life of vegas really comes to life.

in the end i don't think that this pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> sells the kind of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that will convert you to an absolute <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> lover but they are decent and decently satisfying. i feel that one of the main reasons i would go back to pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is because of it's location. with their outside seating who can pass up the chance to sit outside while eating a relatively decent <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and enjoying the vegas strip action.

we were looking for something fast so we decided to stop here thinking it would be a quick and cheap stop. i know they have more of these in california and i heard they're pretty popular but after eating here, i cannot find a single reason why.

i don't really like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (which maybe discredits my review) but my two other friends got <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and nobody enjoyed their food. i got a cheeseburger which are usually hard to mess up. it wasn't burnt or anything but there was absolutely no flavor and the tomatoes were diced and the lettuce shredded. i get that shredded premade veggies may be easier but who puts diced tomatoes on a burger? it made it really messy to eat. and at almost 9 bucks for a standard burger (with no fries or drink) i expected a little more. my friends <mark>Mushroom Swiss Dog</mark> had mushrooms that tasted old and my other friend got the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. we all got halfway through and looked at each other with dissatisfied faces and tossed the rest. sadly, i think you'd be better off at a mcdonalds.

oh and to top it off some blaring alarm was going off the whole time and no one seemed to mind it or address to their customers that everything was fine or that it would be turned off shortly. i think it was the fire alarm, idk lights were flashing and a siren going. i understand that it may have been out of their control, but i think good customer service would have acknowledged it and let the customer know the roof wasn't going to fall in or something like that.

one of my cali friends kept telling me about this place and i'm glad she did! i tried the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, which was very tasty and kept me full for a long time! only thing is if you eat outside... watch out for the hungry birds!

the restaurant is located right outside planet hollywood on the strip.

 i immediately noticed the outdoor patio. great spot to people watch. i tried the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, the polish and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. they were all pretty good but nothing great. price wise, i guess it's cheaper compared to the rest of the area.

the whole time i was eating i just felt like they just missed the mark of the original. but maybe they didn't? is it possible that  the foods the same but the subtraction of los angeles detracts from the experience? i'm not quite sure.  a very improbable thing occurs when someone catches lightning in bottle. an even less probable thing is attempted when people try to catch the same lightning in a different bottle, in a different city.

snap of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is fantastic!  <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was right temperature, chili tasted fine, and onions were a good mix.  definitely a great snapping dog and a real distinct taste.

fast service, not much seating.

we came here since we had the groupon for 5 jello shots.  i got the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, my jello shots, and we split some fries smothered in chili, cheese sauce, <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, onions, and tomato.  the chili is really freakin good!  i loved my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  and the fries were amazing!  the portion was huge, plenty split between three people.  the jello shots came in grape, berry, and lime.  they were so gross!  probably because they were 13% alcohol.  i did not enjoy them but had to do it anyways.

eww, this place was disgusting. the bf and i got the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. 

1) <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> - the chili tasted like pureed ground beef. the texture was just disgusting almost like baby food. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself was tasteless and lacked that crisp of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> casing upon each bite. 

2) the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> came with <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with pastrami on top - this was also gross. the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was tasteless. the pastrami smelled old. 

gross, definitely do not recommend.

should've went to nathans!

i visited pinks 4th of july.. i was staying at planet hollywood so it was very convenient not too mention all the hooplah about it made me of course want to try it out for myself. this price is overpriced .. the chili on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is very bland... i don't know.. gave me heartburn or indigestion after.. the worse = ((

 even ordered the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which included bacon and tomatoes etc.. it was all just an overpriced wreck
oh and the cheese was like a <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> sauce or something.. like the orange kind that comes out of a big can.. no bueno!

like the other reviews said.. keep walking.. so not worth the $20 for a huge wienie and some chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>...lol

i've had <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> .i've had chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. i've had <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>. not all at once, naturally.

but i also thought i had bulimia.

turns out, i just had pink's. 

great way to quickly hate yourself.

we went here just to try the experience. after all, pink's has been on the food network and all over the internet. 

the reality, however, was far from great. the food is overpriced and mediocre in quality. the jalape\u00f1os are overdone in order to really bring out the spiciness  - but all you get is lots of heat and very little flavor. the meat sauce for the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and fries is canned and seating is extremely limited (not a good thing when you are talking about 100 degree vegas weather).

if you want to try it for the experience, go for it. if you decide to skip it - you wont miss a thing.  there are way better places on the strip.

i was really excited to try pink's but it was not what i expected. while the meal was good, it did not amaze. i guess my expectations were a bit high for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint but i was expecting something more unique.

i ordered the polish pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with sauerkraut and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> on the side. as mentioned, good but normal and bit salty. i felt that i could just buy a polish at costco and add the same items to it myself so it really wasn't worth the price. i really did enjoy the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> though.

wish they had some indoor seating options because it was pretty hot outside even with a shaded table right in front of the fan. a bit entertaining to watch people come out to the seating area and the fan would attack their napkins the instant they stepped out. unfortunately that means a ton of napkins littered all over - big no no

i've heard about this place for a while, and finally got to try it. i've seen tons of pictures from friends on facebook and boy, do they look amazing and delicious! 
well... now that i've had the chance to try it, the taste is not exactly as amazing as it looks. first of all, its definitely overpriced. i ordered the "<mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>" thinking the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> (which i love), guac, and the spicy <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> mixed together would be orgasmic. i don't know about what others think, but i thought the guac didn't have enough avocado in it for me to taste. the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> wasn't as cheesy as i would like, and so the only thing that actually met my expectation for taste was the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> itself. in the end, i wasn't even full! and neither were my friends. 
i guess this would be a good place to go if you were craving something greasy + <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i've had better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at local joints so i probably wouldn't choose to come back here if i had the choice out of all the places i could be eating at in vegas. i was overall disappointed with the food quality especially when its priced at almost $10 a dog! if you're at planet hollywood, you might as well go for earls.

pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in la is now in vegas.  and truly, is that a bad thing?  having one of these artery clogging bad boys after a night of debauchery just hits the spot.

we ordered the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>.  there was a lot of food on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> (mushrooms/bacon/cheese), and while it was extremely messy it was very good..  finished it all, and i would do it again.  since we stayed at planet hollywood we actually repeated the same meal after our second night of debauchery.

are they overpriced?  yes, but a lot of things in vegas are.  should a buffet really be $30 or a burger be $16-18 without fries?  i think not, so when you drop $6-8 on a dog, it's not really that bad.

their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> is the bomb...!
the best chili i ever had...!

i came here for dinner last saturday before watching a movie at the regal on the other side of the casino.  i'm from la and have been to the original pinks, so my initial feelings were a bit mixed, but i decided to give a go.    

we had about an hour before our movie started so we figured we had plenty of time to enjoy our meal.  a nice bonus of this location was that we were able to sit around the edge of the restaurant and watch college football in the sports betting area.  i was hoping that my rival college team would lose, but i guess that is what i get for wishing ill on a team...even my rivals.

if there were half stars i would have given pink's 3.5, but i rounded down for a couple reasons.  one of reasons was that the speed of service left a bit to be desired.  it was a pretty busy saturday night and they only had two people working (one in the kitchen and one at the register) so service was slow.  there was a part of me that thought the menu items were a little over priced...but i rounded down more for the slow service

now to the important part, the food:

the las vegas <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> - came with cheese, chili, jalapenos, guacamole and two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  this was definitely the better of the two dogs we tried.  it was a little less than $7.  really though how can you not like chill and cheese on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>...everything else was just a bonus.

the spicy mojave (with sauerkraut) - the extra sauerkraut definitely saved this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  it just didn't seem like much without it, especially for almost $7.  

chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> - i think this was the highlight of the meal.  there was a great portion of chili and cheese.  and the fries were perfect.  they were a little thicker on than a pencil, crispy outside soft inside.

if you are looking for some comfort fast food while watching a game...or many games at once...this could be a fun spot for you to hit.

this is nothing like pink's in hollywood. it doesn't compare. chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were not good. my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with bacon and tomatoes was just bacon pieces on top. it wasn't bad but it wasn't good. i wouldn't come here again. i rather wait 30 minutes in line in hollywood any day

i love a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and pink's did not disappoint!  i ordered the nacho <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a side of <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.  the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were just so-so... but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was awesome... great chili!  thinking i'll try the fries next time.

big fancy sign with the name "pink's" on it? looks like i'm in the right place! not gonna lie, i've heard about this place many times before but i never knew where it was. turns out, my friends were talking about the one in la, but whatevs, i'm not gonna pass on my chance to try pink's famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

anyways, you're greeted by this enormous menu once you walk in the front door, but feel free to step to the side and look at a normal sized menu if <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is too crowded. 

personally, i think that the prices are a little overpriced but it's nice to order a "high end" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with a handful of toppings after a night of drinking. i've only been here twice and i can't seem to recall what i ordered on my first visit but i can say that the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are really good and they definitely put a lot of thought into the different combinations. 

& as a fan of chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, how could i pass on the deluxe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> for a good portion of my wallet (costs the same if not more than a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>). i mean, it's pretty good, but probably not worth the cost.

overall, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are pretty good here but i just wish that it was a little cheaper (i guess it's okay since it's vegas). i can't wait to try the one in la!

overall: 3.5/5. nothing extraordinary, but to be fair..it is just <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with toppings. 

very famous place, so i came here on a recommendation from a friend. it's a fast food joint with expensive pricing, but large portions with a ton of toppings. i definitely needed a fork to eat my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it was good, but i think i prefer my costco <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> with some ketchup and onions, instead of a mountain of toppings. 

good drunk food though and right in the middle of the strip, making it easy to walk to. there's outdoor seating with heater lamps and usually someone cleaning the tables. afternoons have a lot of birds walking around.

i am a fan of the regular <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. but when we ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> we were really disappointed. a waste of money basically, i wouldn't order those again and the sausage was too hard. also, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are very expensive. but it's vegas i guess, what else can i expect. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were very good too. as a suggestion, just stick to the original dog, the others are below average

nasty i like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but this was just awful i have been waiting forever to try this and was so disappointed it's over priced and i could go to tj for a better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and there 1$ something extra for <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark> were canned mushrooms and i couldn't even finish it but if ur hungry and here i did enjoy there chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> save ur self the seven dollars and walk away

these are some serious <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! i had the classic <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and it was fantastic. come with a big appetite and ready to stuff your face with sinfulness good eats! las vegas has various great places to eat, but this place is a must!

pinks, in la you need to wait 90 min to get a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. here, 0-5 min! i'm sure it's better in la but hey! next best thing right?!?

we ordered the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and bbq cole slaw dog. both were incredibly delicious. the bun was way too soft and instantly broke apart, allowing <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> to fall through (knife and fork time!) but what made me give this 4 stars was the actual dog. it's natural casing had the biggest "snap" i've ever tasted! each bite "snap"! it was awesome! loved <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, liked the toppings, hated the bread (the fact it fell apart, otherwise it was doughy good!)

pricey though! $6-8 a dog!

so i haven't had pink's in years. i figured this would be the perfect chance to put some food in my system after too much day drinking. you know me, i go hard. so i order chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that has chili, pastrami, guacamole, mustard, jalapenos, and onions. i remember this meal costing me a good $20.

i sit down to chow down and to my surprise, i am wildly disappointed with every part of the meal. every individual component was flavorless, and not even a marriage of all of them created anything enjoyable. i ending up eat half of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries because i really grew tired of the flavor.

i don't know if it's pink's or this location but that sucked.

i discovered this place on my friend's instagram, but i thought that i'd never try it because a norcal girl like me wouldn't be in socal too often. however, to my luck, it was fate that my vegas trip brought me here to dine with my girlfriends for a bite. we ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were super crispy and fresh, and definitely one of the best fries i've ever tasted. they were gone instantly among the four of us. i split the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> with my friend since it had two dogs inside of it, and i never thought i'd be eating guacamole on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> until that day. it was delicious! i have no other words to describe it, but both guacamole and chili were great additions to my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i haven't tried the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, but my friends gushed about how great it tasted.

the prices may be expensive for something like a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but you're paying for the presentation and quality of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> combinations, which are all pretty amazing.

no offense, pink's, but i don't understand why people rave about you.  i had the polish <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>... i really wanted to like it, i did. but part of me wishes i just had costco's $1.50 <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> instead. it wasn't bad, but it didn't blow me away by any means.  i ate it to fill my tummy, nothing exciting.

hubby and i both had the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. yummm! perfectly cooked <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, snapped when you bit into it! perfect proportion of chili so you can still eat it with your hands! the only thing i would change is the cheese.. would have preferred shredded cheese rather than the kraft singles.. but still delicious, and a perfect snack right on the strip!

good chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> super quick. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were so-so. when you're comparing things like buffets at other hotels ($30 and $40 - yikes!) this place is a winner.

i only came here because gemma and my mom like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i ended up getting the  pink's specialty - mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> which i had no idea was drowning in mayonnaise. they do not have indoor seating so you're stuck sitting outside with crap mister's blowing into every direction but you. the service was quick but the food just made me feel greasy. they have signs everywhere that says do not feed the birds but of course you have very sober idiots that kept throwing food at them causing this chaos of pigeons flying everywhere. 

gemma got her usual bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and i honestly think she just wants the bacon and chili. we let logan (our son) try the fries and of course he fell in love with ketchup. i guess it's like sugar dip for kids. 

very over priced skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> masked in toppings. i would not come again.

not good.  very soggy bread, over stuffed with your basic grocery store relish.  had the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  the meat itself was very chewy.  way overpriced for the quality.  not eating here again.

this place is not really worth it. i had to pay $7 for a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and it wasn't even filling. over-hyped for sure. earl of sandwich is much better and located just a short walk away from pink's. don't come here.

this place was delicious! we had the reuben and one that was served with bacon but i can't remember the name. we also split regular fries, <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. everything was very delicious! my only complaint is that there is only seating outside. as you know, vegas is hot, hot, hot. i would definitely come back here the next time i'm here!

ok so i am from la the original pinks is pretty delicious. this was is ok. the fries are perfect. my <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> didn't have hardly enough chili. i went inside to get more, cost me a dollar & it was like a measured amount of like 2 more table spoons..... kinda wack.

finally got to try their food.

 i ordered chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, they were really good & hot.  i burned my tongue because it smelled so good i couldn't wait.  chili isn't too spicy. just right. if you love spicy, you'll be disappointed.  i believe it was $6.79. boyfriend had 10 <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark> & a "big man" dog. he said it was perfect.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> even snapped because of the skin.  it had tomatoes & onions.  no picture because he really chowed it down. 

great service.  thanks much.

i love pinks!! i come to vegas every couple of months and always have to make sure i stop and get a pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. yeah... .most people complain about the price on here...but hey... the only thing that is much cheaper on the strip is mcdonalds! i paid about 6 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was great! they have fantastic chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> too! between my boyfriend and i we usually spend about 30 dollars when we go. the service is great too!

i expected more because of the way people amp this place up but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> aren't that good to me. they're ok. homemade <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> taste better. just my opinion though, you may think otherwise.

what i like about this place

- it's pink's from la!  
- the classic <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> is fab
- somewhat speedy service (on the front end, the wait for the food is a bit longer)
- good location in the middle of the strip
- relatively inexpensive option compared to other places nearby on the strip

what i don't like
- limited seating when it gets busy
- some weird people will show up and ask for money (this has happened to me several times on different visits) in the seating area

all in all it's a solid 3.5 in my book.

pros:
-affordable (less than $10 per person)
-quick
-good location - middle of the strip, outside of planet hollywood

cons:
-seating - outdoor seating. vegas gets cold at night and in the winter. there are heat lamps but they didn't seem to help all that much. not sure if there was any kind of indoor seating available. 

we ordered a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a hamburger. i wouldn't say this was the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had, but it was fine. fries were good.

absolutely loved our food. my husband, whose favorite food is <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, said this beats out all other <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> places he's been to (which is saying a lot). i had the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and thought it was awesome- the chili was top notch, and i love chili. he got a <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark> with real pastrami., sauerkraut, mustard and melted swiss. he is already asking to go back.

best chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> i've ever had. the sauce was perfection topped with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>. soooo freaking good. i was scarfing them down. the alcoholic drinks were a bit pricey but it's vegas so live a little. glad i was able to stop and try the world famous pinks. i was even able to even catch a street show.

despite all the reviews, you see this place on food network so i wanted to give it a try...
but i regret it and it was my only meal that i did not enjoy on our trip.

on yelp, there's a free <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> offer.
somewhere on the details, it should tell you the hours... basically there's restriction on the offer which i cannot find. maybe it's on the full site, not on the mobile site.  anyways, this was a let down for us too since we were just looking into snacking here with the offer, instead of eating a full meal.

i ordered the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.
it was better than their regular dogs, which looks very unfilling. their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were okay but it was also spicy onions... like the onions weren't cooked all the way through... the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were okay.

overall, average <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stand... nothing special.

wow what a let down. for a day of fun, as las vegas locals, we valet'd at paris and walked over to pink's - there was no line and nobody eating at all. i ordered a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> (maybe that was my mistake) and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. the fries were the best part of the meal - i hate, i mean i hate gray, boiled looking <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> -- gosh i wish it was grilled i guess i should've asked but being from l.a. this place is suppose to be the best so i figured i'd leave it all in their hands....it was a let down and i won't be going back.

we weren't hungry, but were tired do passing by this place and not at least splitting a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> ... well that's over with.  we'll be back too.  <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were the size of hand cuffs, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was absolutely delicious.  

we split a bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, it was overflowing with chili and crisp bacon.  next time in vegas will definitely be back.

while attending a convention at planet hollywood, i stopped into pink's. i was a little hesitant; 6 bucks for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and it was just good. the ingredients are fresh and tasty. then i thought, for being right on the strip, 7 bucks isn't bad for topping-crazy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i would probably go again!

stopped by for a pinks <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. was a wednesday afternoon and no line. the chick working was super friendly and was served within 5 minutes of arriving. also got a tasty lemonade. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was really good and fresh bun. would recommend as long as not a crazy line. i'd hit it again, but wouldn't stand on line for it.

this place is pretty good, nothing too amazing though. it's more expensive than the la pink's and not as tasty, but i expected as much eating in vegas. ordered a <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (2 dogs, jalpenos, cheese, onions) which came out pretty quickly with chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. it's a lot of food though. an order of chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> is enough to feed one or even two people. seating is outside and with the wind it's a bit annoying but you get to see all the weirdos down the street and sometimes cool performers.
today for lunch i had the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> & i loved it!!! the chili didn't taste gross or cheap. very good quality!
great chili-<mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, but beware if you sit outside of hungry pigeons and people yelling crazy comments on the strip!

disclaimer: i'm not a huge <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan but this place may very well change that. i decided to try it based on what i've heard about the la location and i'm happy i did. it was delicious, the menu was a bit intimating as there are waaaayyy to many choices for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i guess any <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> lover would love that right? well i went the safe route and got a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and an order of <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> to share. it was glutinous but delicious and i'm sure i worked it off by staying up walking the strip most of the night...but who cares about that!! vegas is all about indulgence and you'll do exactly that at this spot. if you decide to eat in the outdoor eating area beware of the pigeons, they love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> too!

found this place on my way to fat tuesdays! this has become a secret junt of mine to kill my diet softly lol. yeah im focused to lose weight for my wedding but everyone gets a cheat day and i use my cheat day here. this will be the last <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you eva crave. the things these people do with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> <mark>Chili</mark> dogs and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> will send you on a trip. mhm on a journey to heaven with each and every bite. you come with the munchies leave with the pot belly. they dont hold back on the good stuff. god bless these people at pinks. omg did i tell you about the bread & cheese and how it should be against the law of cooking to have something this good. oh my lord they sale burgers also. you got to taste this. hello my name is queen and im addicted to pinks. ok everyone chant along with me hi queen lol. see you here! lord knows i will be around slurping and burping on this goodness!

after a long night on the strip (aka a normal night on the strip), we were hungry and on the prowl for a greasy cure to the night before. we walked and walked before finally deciding on pink's--though half the group gave up long before we got here and settled on some food court inside a random casino. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, beer battered <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, & a diet coke. it was all pretty decent and hit the spot, because, you know, vegas. the greasiness was perhaps on an even other level than what we were looking for--the grease had melted through the bottom of my <mark>Onion Ring</mark> basket by the time i reached for the last couple rings. oh well. not even worried about it.  

price came out to about $14, so heads up on that.

everytime we passed pinks, we told ourselves that we were going to try it, we finally did. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were ok, they were a bit dry....it's probably due to having <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> out for too long or over cooked. it almost taste like rubber. on the other hand their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were really really good! they were very well loaded!

loved pink's! i got a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and they jam packed it with their famous chili and it almost looked like a boat of chili - yet i didn't spill one drop while eating it! i had no wait in line, but as i was leaving there was a line, so i must have gotten lucky.

pink's has always been a favorite spot. so when we took a spontaneous vegas trip, this past weekend, pink's was on our to do list. 

i'm a vegetarian so i always look forward to getting a veggie <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>. this time, however, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was throw together and was very unappealing. my husband spent some quality in the bathroom after his <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were pretty decent though. 

possible scam**** when we were paying for our food - prior to even tasting it - there was an error with processing my husband's credit card. we paid cash instead. my husband received an alert from his bank verifying that he just tried to make a purchase. we were visiting from san diego. he never used that card again but since we walked out of pink's, there were a total of 12 fraudulent charges totaling more than $700. i don't know if there is a connection or if there was a phishing device on their reader but it's awfully suspicious. pay cash!!!

got the spicy mojave with a regular dog instead of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>. it was delicious and the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were out of this world.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are my favorite <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! it's nice to be able to grab one in vegas during late night. it's pretty comparable to the original one in hollywood. same great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, same great chili, same great kraut, same great fries. 

i do wish that they had the celebrity names associated to the one in vegas to help me order! i have no clue what comes on mine, but i know i like the rosie o'donnell. i had to guess/try to make it up... chilli, sour kraut...not sure what else? 

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were also delicious and very reminiscent of the great ones at the la location. 

the patio is right on the strip in front of planet hollywood and is a great place to people watch no matter the time of day!

wow, has it really been 5 years since my last review at pink's??  well, other than satisfy my craving for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, nothing's really changed from my last experience here except for the prices which have increased since then.

chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> -- http://bit.ly/1fssnto
mustard, relish, lettuce & tomatoes
the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good but it was basically a salad on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  because it's on their classic dog side of the menu, the price wasn't too bad but still pricey though for what i got.  i guess i probably should've ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (http://bit.ly/1jikjji) again because at least it has more of a 'wow' factor.

for convenience on being right on the strip, i like pink's.  but i think i'd rather get my gourmet <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fix off the strip at buldogis or even at g<mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> ramsay burgr.

my bf and i made a foodie bucket list and i had come across pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was a must add! we got here a little before they closed on a friday night. it is located outside the miracle mile in planet hollywood on the las vegas strip. 
as we waited in line their were a fair amount of people in front. the older gentlemen in front of us willingly gave us some advice. he said the pink's in la is tastier but it is very good here as well, also if you get one dog it's plenty. wow! i'm telling my bf this guy has got me looking forward to this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it's been long overdue since i've even eaten one.
so we ordered two <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> add jalape\u00f1os please! yum. the wait was not long at all such a plus especially when we are acting and feeling like we haven't eaten for days. we grabbed a seat on their patio outside, great view. the bellagio and cosmo are across the street so the view was beautiful. if you're lucky you can see the water show. took my first bite and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was skinny.. i was expecting something meatier i guess? tasted like a typical <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with jalape\u00f1os. no wow just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with accessories. i was fairly disappointed but i definitely still ate it, it's still a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! haha we looked at each other after we finished and laughed saying "i could definitely eat another one" the man who said one would be enough wasn't! we didn't get another because it was mediocre and it was almost $8 a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. overall my experience was good but the quality, taste and price.. very disappointing.

hubby and i hit this spot after walking the strip. the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was delicious. would definitely come again. didn't get a drink this time or fries but i will get the next time we visit.

i can't believe i live in los angeles and my first time was at the vegas location. i tried the polish pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and it was absolutely delicious. it's a small store with a seating area for ~20 people. the prices are fair for the strip and the portions are big. i usually never crave <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but it's been less than a week since i tried pink's and i already want to try the los angeles location!

i was a in the mood for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> while on my stay, and made a stop at pinks. delicious <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with bacon! only complaint is seating sucks! not the cleanest outside either. on the pricer side i've ever paid for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but over all good eats.

disgusting!!!! 

that's all i can say. i was dying for some pinks in la and happened to run into this location. i ordered the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the chicago and hoped it tasted the same. boy was i wrong!

the sausage did not taste the same as the ones in la. i ended up feeling sick after eating it. 

listen to the reviews folks so you don't end up like me with a bad stomach ache.

i wanted to see what the fuss was all about with pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.   

the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> at planet hollywood was   awesome.  it was just loaded with tomato,  cheese,chili, <mark>Sour Cream</mark> and onions. the chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was a difficult task just trying to keep it together while eating it.  it was good but nothing special! not really  worth the $8.50? it's on the strip so i'm not going to complain on the price.

so yeah, we spent about $16 on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and a drink .  sounds expensive, but now at least i got to experience what  pink's has to offer, just wish i knew what all the excitement was about  maybe next time i'll give their <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark> a try.  looks really yummy! 

it was alright!

every time i hit vegas, i go to pinks now. they take <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to another level. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are worth it, and the 3 <mark>Three Dog Night</mark> is my fav <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> selection they offer. street level seating mid strip. perfect location.

i had my hopes of trying pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for the longest time, and i finally tried it here at planet hollywood's race & sports book. 

ooooooo... what a disappointment!

it was just a small little stand with one worker who looked like he didn't want to be there!

i ordered a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> combo, which came with chips, that cost $5.95. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> combo was $6.95. it just tasted like a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, except that it had a nice "snap" to it (which made me give the place an extra star!). other than that, nothing special about it. the chili tasted like crap on it, probably because it was old and in the container all day! ewww! actually, i bet all the food they served there was old! ekkkk! =o

i had asked the guy working there when they will be opening the actual official stand, and he said he wasn't sure. however, they will be opening one near the hawaiian tropic entrance of planet hollywood. sooo..look out! hopefully by that time, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> will be better...

way overpriced for some tiny dogs, but they're pretty good. i haven't eaten the one in los angeles yet, so i need to give that a try. once i go to la, i will definitely update this review. 

getting it to go is such a mess!! we had no choice but to and the huge stack of napkins totally helped. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> basically exploded in the bag and it was messy for sure.

come to pinks for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, not the fries or <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. they are soo greasy that i felt like a tub of lard eating just one ring!

i was super excited that this past weekend, i got to have pinks in las vegas. it's there people's, but it's located on the outside corner of planet hollywood

pros: 
-pinks's was vegas out,,,,super bright pink signs
-didn't even have to wait in line
-quick food for vegas
- yummy bacon
-order of fries is automatically seasoned, yumo!

cons:
-it's too hot to eat outside in vegas during summer, we took our food into the planet hollywood mall and ate at the tables near fat tuesday's
-canned mushrooms
-didn't like the taste of the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> here 
-scaled down menu from the original

***so i still haven't found the right dog for me at pink's la or lv, but i'd definitely give it a another shot**

but honestly....i still love my sf mission bacon wrapped <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> from the carts)  and costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (super duper cheap) way better.

this place is meh times twenty. i've had a better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from the refrigerator section at the grocery store. 

i would definitely skip this place all together. although all the glitz and glam of the pinks restaurant sign and ambiance is nice, it is so not worth digesting this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

i ordered the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> and the bf ordered the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. both were forgettable and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> did not have a lot of flavor, such a bummer. the total of two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and one large drink was $20, so not worth it. 

i am guessing this is not the pink's of la, because that pink's has a much better reputation than this two star joint.

ok it was like 107 degrees in vegas when i visited and pinks only offer outdoor seating. 

sucky seating aside, the food is way overrated.  i mean like $6 for a nothing special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>... that's ridics even for vegas.  my <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was bitter, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself is skinny, and tastes like any dog you can get in the deli section of safeway.  

i will not eat here again.

it was pretty exciting to try pink's for the very first time. but my sis said this location is $3-$4 more per item compared to the la location. not only that, but the menu is shorter and the specials are not the same. the good thing is, there's no crazy hour wait like in la. 

had the vegas strip <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, served with chili, mustard, guacamole and jalapenos. very tasty, but a bit on the heavy side. especially in 100+ degree weather since there's only outdoor seating. sis had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, which was pretty good too. gotta love chili! had a bite of the <mark>Pastrami Burrito</mark>. now that was just weird. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrimi, chili, cheese and onions. odd combo and taste. pass. lastly, their fries were very good. seasoned and crispy, just the way i like it. 

after combo-ing my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it came out to like $12! wow. that's some expensive <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i couldn't even finish. not because it was big, but it was just too difficult to eat in that hot weather.

pink's is one of those over-hyped places and since this location is in vegas, also super over-priced! it was located right outside the planet hollywood hotel and wasn't hard to find with its bright, pink name etched on the glass. at least there was no line at all when we got there. only outdoor seating so refrain from getting anything too spicy in the humid weather.

it was $6.75 for my bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>...not really worth it especially when the ones at the original pink's in la cost almost half that. it was topped with bacon, tomato, cheese, and mustard since i didn't want onions on mine. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uqb9ks7lzesghltmuunmea?select=3fcshb9yqxmpuyvnn8fyxa) the bacon was nice and crispy but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was tiny and wasn't anything special. the ones from costco are way bigger! 

my bun was also flimsy and broke in half after 2 bites. it could have used much more chili and the cheese wasn't melted enough. it was still a tasty meal overall but totally not worth the price tag.

i visited this pinks at about 2am after drinking alll day. for some reason a burger with coleslaw and mustard sounded amazing. too bad the cole slaw at pinks is soooo gross. it has almost no flavor and its just not good. the slaw is chopped up all funky...not uniformish...i hated it. needed salt and a lil sugar...it was like mayo salad vomit.

the burger patty was fine. my friends got turkey <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and i tried that...it was good.

the fried something we had...i think it was <mark>French Fries</mark> were good. 

the whole set up of this place is a narrow hallway...you can barely read the menu. its about 4ft between the wall and the counter. then there is an assembly line of cooks and at the end is a soda fountain.

i guess its a good place to go cause its open late and they have a lot of options.

i love their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>! its really nothing special but this location beats the la location with a 5 minute wait versus 90 minutes. it is in the back of the planet hollywood. the only thing i don't like about this location is you can only eat outside and it sucks during the summer.

went to pink's on the weekend of oct 2nd.  after drinking on an empty stomach, my two friends and i decided to go to pink's before meeting up with the rest of our friends at a club.  i'm not sure what it is about my group of friends but we like to have a few drinks before an intermission of (greasy but quick) food.  this can either be good or bad when it comes to writing reviews.  

we were starving and needed food asap.  we actually took a cab to ph for the sole purpose of getting pink's (instead of just eating something in the vicinity of our first spot or the next drinking spot) because after 2 nights of eating at expensive restaurants, clubs, and losing money at the tables - we wanted to eat something noteworthy but cheap.  

according to my friend who is born/raised socal, it is not as good as the original in cali.  i figured this was a mind-over-matter slash original-is-always-better-duhhh situation.  we ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, fries, and beer.   my other friend (a newyorker) and i thought it was good but agreed it wasn't awesome.  considering the acclamation pink's receives from born and bred la-ers, i changed my assumption and decided it probably is better at the original stand in la.  i remember thinking it wasn't as amazing of an experience as i was hoping to get - and was a bit disappointed by the lack of "snap" in <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself.  also, it was a bit... much.  i have a feeling <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had better snap to it before it got doused in the chili.   

that being said, i did enjoy my experience there.  it was exactly what i was looking for at that moment.  we were buzzed and looking to eat something extremely unhealthy but tasty - and that's exactly what we got.

i'd definitely try it again because for some reason, i think it was just an off night.  and we had some strange concoction of drinks before going there so all of this might be completely in my head.

i had the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> without onions and was a little disappointed that the chili did not contain beans.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> were nice and crispy.  i made the mistake of eating outside on a cold december day, so my food cooled off quickly; i think it may have been better warm.  overall, i thought the food was good, but not worthy of all the hype.

i had the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> (figured i should counter all the grease and calories with the lettuce, tomato, and relish that comes on this dog), almost like a mini salad on top of my <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>! it was ok except for the fact that my bun completely fell apart, thus defeating the purpose of eating a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my friend had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, which i had a bite of and really enjoyed. the bacon added just the right amount of salty goodness. the fries here were really tasty, and although we didn't order <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, almost every other table around us had them so i'm guessing they're popular. 

what is nice about this place is its location on the strip and the outdoor seating. a great place to people-watch and enjoy the weather. as a sun-starved seattleite, it was nice to be able to get some vitamin d and uv rays in since most of our vegas cavorting usually happens at night.

if you want yummy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries, or just some hangover food that hits the spot, i'd recommend. if you're a tourist in vegas and are trying to experience pink's in the city of sin, this surely isn't it. too clean, too friendly, too flashy. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and dirtiness, and hour-long wait in line that you'll find at the original pink's in la is what makes it special, for better or for worse.

i go every time i go for a trek up and down the strip and will continue to do so.

the reason i'm only giving three stars is that although the service is good, and the place is clean, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> aren't bad, they're not all that great either.  mainly i like the place for the variety.

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> by itself can't hold up to a properly done nathans, but it's nowhere near as bad as a bar s.

the rueben dog is good, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself gets lost in the reuben part, which isn't bad, but i'd like to taste <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> if it's there.

now, what makes pinks (la anyways) famous is the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  i recently had the bacon chili <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>.  the bacon was nice if undercooked, but that's about it.  the cheese and onions got lost in the chili which was pretty dang boring.  it's not spicy, it's not flavourful.  it tastes kind of like bean powder was mixed with ground beef, gravy, and a dash of tabasco.  not anything special.

if a place is famous for something, it should be good, that's why they're famous.  so it was very disappointing to discover it tastes like something out of a <mark>Bud</mark> can.

this pink's serves up tasty dogs for sure - but i suppose it's all about the toppings. i opted for the cheesy-grilled mush/onion-<mark>Bacon</mark> goodness of the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (i guess a new creation just for this las vegas location) which was exactly what i'd expect a polish piled with melted cheese, grilled stuff, and good bacon to taste like. 

my only qualm is the outdoor-only seating where you see large hordes of asian families hovering around the deck heaters (perhaps this was simply a product of being here around christmastime), and the pricing - which is a little more than i'd expect out of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (considering for the price i could have a pretty decent lunch at a many a sit-down restaurant).

i havent had the original pinks in la, but the people i was with wouldnt stop raving about it so we tried it here in vegas. i came away pretty unimpressed. the toppings were matched very well and there were a lot of interesting combinations. however, i tried the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself (i got a polish) and it had no flavor to it. i guess they have good toppings but their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> have no flavor? this was the biggest disappointment, especially for paying a good 7-10 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i'd much rather have a costco <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.

this place was fun and conveniently located, and the food is fine but not at all special.  i had a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the chili was not good quality and the cheese was liquid cheese served with a ladle.  same goes for the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  it was kind of fun to have <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for lunch but they are no better than <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you'd get anywhere else.  if you really feel like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> or are looking for something fast in that area then this might be a good pick for you, but otherwise look elsewhere.

the pink's in southern california is another one of my bookmarked businesses. and again the franchise opened another location in las vegas. 

located right on the busy las vegas blvd strip and in the planet hollywood resort, there are no indoor seating, but plenty of outdoor seating. a great view of the strip and the bellagio hotel located across the street. 

i had one of their unique hot-dogs-"<mark>Three Dog Night</mark>". for $8.25, i get three skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wrapped with bacon and chlli, cheese and chopped red onions in a flour tortilla. this gourmet <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is featured on triple-d in so-cal and guy fieri considered this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, "money". but my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is nowhere as good as his, where my slices of bacon was "undercooked" and not crispy. i still prefer the <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> cart on mission st in san francisco any given day. 

the only positive thing about the small <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place is that i get to see the fountain show at the bellagio while eating my subpar snack. 

i'll still go to the pink's in southern california and check out other items though.

<mark>Three Dog Night</mark>: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/t0uw6vwwfo3el29wbodamq?select=zpkgzbo64jo7u91bf6exsa

what do you do when your friend is on a winning streak at the craps table? you go outside and eat some pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! that and the fact that we had a coupon you couldn't go wrong. 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were decent. being from nyc we're not used to have so much stuff loaded onto <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. had a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a reuben. quite tasty indeed, but nothing to brag about. filling? yes. it didn't taste like rubber <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and it wasn't a dirty water dog, but hell why not? try it if you're in vegas, use the coupon people!

i had no idea there was a pinks here! but alas, on our walk towards the mgm, we found it.  bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> for me please.

the good thing is that pinks is a nice break from the plethora of buffets on the strip.  just try to avoid it in bad weather.  outdoor seating is the only seating, and the only available heat is space heater.

but after being surrounded by $$$ buffets and restaurants, its nice to know that there are some cheaper reliable  eats around

i'm not a huge fan of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to begin with... but i heard a lot about this place.  my friends hyped it up and made it sound like it is the best thing to eat on the strip.  blah.

i can't speak for the other dogs, but i had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and i wasn't too impressed.  the guacamole looked like it came straight out of a tube i could have purchased at the 99 cent store.  i expected real guacamole since i was paying about 8 bucks for a freakin' <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  (you do realize that you can get a big <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> at costco for less than $2... and it comes with a drink, right?  just wanted to remind you)

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> was so bland.  the chili was very bland.  i asked for <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> over my <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> (think in n out) and the onions it actually came with was raw.  disappointed.  i usually love fries... <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>... and this place was very whomp whomp whomp.

i wouldn't eat here again.  i tried it once and thats all i need to know that i don't like it.

i"ve heard a lot about pink's and was hoping not to be let down when i happened there in january.  and thank goodness, it was pretty good.   i had the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and it was actually pretty tasty.  not what i'd call cheap ( i think it was $5.50 when i went), but given it's location and the novelty, i expected that.   there wasn't much of a line, thank goodness, as it's a pretty small place.   there's a seating area outside on the sidewalk of the las vegas strip and that allows for a pretty nice view while eating.

i was getting a little hungry in the afternoon after walking so much and decided to get a quick bite to eat at pink's. the key word here is decided to get a quick bite to eat. when we jumped in line, there were only 10 other people in front of us but it took nearly 30 minutes just to get up to the counter to order. this place is freakin' slow! while we were waiting in line for 30 minutes the line grew to epic proportions... easily like 50+ people behind us in line. i hate to think what they had to wait at the end just to order.

i ended up ordering a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with a side of fries (it only took me 45 seconds from pulling up to the counter to order to leaving the line and not the average of 3 minutes to order per person. it isn't that hard.). the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was good... slightly above average for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

the problem with pink's is the wait time to order to taste ratio. its good to try once but it definitely isn't worth the wait. the second thing is the seating area outside is very very small. if you come at a busy time, you might have to hover until you find a place to sit. it didn't happen with me, but i can see it happening.

ooooommmmg.  at first i didn't want to eat here because i thought it was just another <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i'm glad i tried it.  one thing you have to remember when going to this place is this is going to cost you when you get back home.  at least an extra hour on the treadmill.  this place is super fat and i hate to admit it, but i like it.  

i had the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> and shared it with my friend weez because i would be in a food comma still. in the burrito it had two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, bacon, chili and cheese. i wanted another one, but good thing the line got  hella long. i would be complaining all day on how fat i got on this vacation. 

overall a good place for something oily and greasy after a night of partying.  and i suggest ordering the burritos because all the other dogs look to messy to eat.

for lunch i wanted to try pink's--finally.  i heard that their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were very good and decided to try for myself.  there are a few things to keep in mind when it comes to pink's--size and cost. i'll explain in a minute.

just to let everyone know, pink's it outside of planet hollywood/miracle mile shops facing the boulevard.  i walked around for awhile till i found the sign in the building and realized it was outside.  anyway, there wasn't a line and their seating is all outside, so i went in to take a look at their menu.

the menu is simple with pre-made options for you and even burgers if you aren't into their dogs. at almost 10 dollars a dog it was pretty pricey, but i expected that from a famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> eaterie.  they even have their special dogs from celebrities on a flyer at the entrance and near the menu, so check those out, too.

i went for a <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>--<mark>Sour Cream</mark>, tomatoes, onions and relish--and my husband ate their classic <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with onions.  we grabbed a water and fountain drink for a total of 25 dollars and moved on down to the pick up area. when i saw our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i freaked out.  i love toppings, but really?  really?  this was definitely a fork and knife dog.

i love eating my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> by hand.  it's just the way that it should be, but at pink's it's difficult to do so.  too many toppings on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> cause the flavor of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> to be lost, so i scraped everything off on one half to get down to what matters--that fried dog.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is good with a slight snap to it, but it's not an amazing.  i ate the rest with my utensils, feeling as if i violated some ethical <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> code by not eating with my hands.

if you want to try <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, buy a plain one and ask for toppings on the side if you need them, that way you can really taste what a pink's dog is all about.  if you want something really good, their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was decent.

overall <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was decent and i can at least say that i've tried it once. would i fight my way down there through traffic again for it?  nope.  but it's something you have to try once so you can say that you have.

although this place is tiny and the line may be long, it is worth the cramped wait. maybe it was just so satisfying because i was starving after walking the strip, but i thought their <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was amazing. sure its just your regular long <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with toppings, but for some reason it just hit the spot in the perfect way. i thought it was super fresh, the chili was perfect and the cheese was nicely melted and gooey. i left the mustard off.. that didn't sound appealing but all in all i enjoyed the food and eating on their little patio in the sunshine.

i tried the popular <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>. both were pretty good but extremely messy. the guadalajara had too much <mark>Sour Cream</mark> on it. the fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were awesome - definitely complimented the meal. my friends tried some other dogs, they were wrapped up in soft tortillas and stuff. they had mixed reviews but i would suggest sticking to a regular bun. service was pretty quick and they have a small outdoor section to sit. i think they open late enough, one night we were starving and drunk or something and needed something like this to hit the spot, unfortunately it was closed already.

after checking in and settling down in our planet hollywood room, anchalee was starving for something simple. we hadn't eaten anything since our breakfast at firewood grill inside sfo at about 10 am, and now it was around 3:30 pm. the first eatery that caught her eye was pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> located outside planet hollywood but still around the premises because she was thinking of top dog in berkeley. you really couldn't miss it with it's big pink sign. 

there was a super extensive menu of dogs, burgers, burritos, soda and alcoholic beverages, sides, and desserts. we chose only one <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to share, a naked polish, since we weren't looking for all the fix-ins. can you really justify a $6 <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>? and that's before tax too. maybe it was possibly for the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> size and since we were in a tourist attraction city, but i wouldn't want to pay this price on a daily basis. if it included a drink as a meal, then maybe that's a deal. yes, the polish was spicy, juicy, and hot. but there wasn't anything special about the bun. 

after consuming this expensive snack, i thought to myself i can't wait to get back to the bay area so i can really be spoiled and eat a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from top dog for $3.25 each. 

family owned since 1939, it's always worth a try for something new with a little flair!

just another place trying to make money just off the name.. let's just say.. i would not go back to this location... after eating at the one in la... i don't even know how they can even call themselves pinks... they should just call themselves - just another <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place.   very disappointed and i got a stomach ache after eating a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>...

lousy location,no place to sit inside,just a bunch of chairs outside the
the front.
that's fine on a nice day ,but vegas gets very hot in the summer and cold in the winter.
today it was 50 ,windy and overcast and the last thing i wanted to do was sit and freeze my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.
what were they thinking,this is not a dairy queen where you sit in your car and sip a malt and eat a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>,so what's up with local?

i really wanted to see what the hype was all about with pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i have to say it can be good depending on what you order.  

the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> really blew me away.  it was just loaded with bacon, cheese, mushrooms, and onions.  it was a complete task just trying to keep it together while eating it.  and somewhere under all that mess was a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  it was really good!  worth the $8.50?  well, it's on the strip so i'm not going to knock it on price.

i also ordered the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark>.  this one didn't really blow me away, but it was also a task to keep this one together. still good though, but it tasted like something i could've had at nathan's.   price was a little cheaper though at $7.50.

so yeah, i spent about $16 on two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  sounds crazy i know, but now at least have a taste of what pink's has to offer.  maybe next time i'll give their pastrami <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> a shot.  looks really heavy! 

it was a-ok!
