on my last day in vegas, i went on a search for this pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> as i was told by my girlfriend that their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are suppose to be really good.  i guess it is more than a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it's an experience.  well...experience is the right word for it.  they not only have regular dogs, but they have specialty dogs as well with everything imaginable on top.

first...the entrance to pinks is from the sidewalk on the strip.  i was parked in the back parking garage, so coming from the backside of the miracle mile, i was lost.  i thought pinks was inside or would have an entrance from the inside.  they do not.  i walked around for about 20 min. trying to find it before i realized it was outside.

looking over the menu i just didn't want to have an old fashioned <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i wanted to try one of their special dogs.  i ordered up a <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with cheese sauce, mushrooms, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and bacon.  they have a list of other dogs as well for anything you are craving.  my order arrived and i was ready to eat.  

well...it was an experience that's for sure!  trying to eat this huge dog with all the toppings gave a new meaning to messy!  i had to finish with a fork because it was just too much!

while the prices of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are a bit high ($8 for my ph dog), it's a good place to try a specialty dog while you are in vegas.  would i try it again?  possibly...

i'm an la native and my first experience at pinks was in las vegas, go figure. lol

on a sunday afternoon in the middle of july, the boyfriend's friend decided he wanted to eat at pinks, so pinks we went.
pinks as you may know is located just outside of planet hollywood.
very small with a small outdoor seating section, which i did not enjoy too much because it was about 110 degrees outside.

boyfriend mentioned that the price was a little more expensive than the la location.
we stood in line for about 15 minutes out in the sun. 
boyfriend ordered a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that had pastrami, jalapeno, and guacamole ( i forgot the name). he enjoyed it 
i ordered the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> which had chili and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>. it was good but nothing too special, i guess i should have ordered one of their specialties.
we also ordered the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> which were yummmy! greasy and big! =p
not bad, but not great. i guess i'll give it another try, but at the la location instead. i wouldn't go back to the las vegas location though, because of where it's located and the fact that the price is higher than the la location.

date/time: sunday ~ 1:30pm
occasion: lunch
party of:  taken to-go
ordered: their version of the "mulholland drive" dog - 12" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, and mushrooms
location: super small, outdoor seating only so it's deadly during the summer, very clean
total incl gratuity: ~$8.00 per <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>

omigoodness!  could it get any more unhealthy?  i ate a 12" long sausage with every possible fattening topping but it was so worth it!  to top it off, we had friends pick it up and bring it poolside to us so there we were eating a 12" weener that was probably a day's worth of calories in our bikinis...so sexy huh? ;)  but again...oh so good.  pinks is very good...a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with any which kind of topping you can imagine.  all of the toppings are fresh and make the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> so tasty.  i've heard from quite a few people that the la one is so much better so i'll have to make my way down there and try theirs soon.  but this one did it's job and satisfied our tummies! mmmm....<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>....

i forgot the name of my order, but i do remember what was in it!  <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> and bacon!  sounded like an amazing combination on paper.  mushrooms, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and bacon??  some of my favorite things!  the reality of it however did not blow me away.  it was a good late night snack for a hungry gal beginning to sober up, but in all honesty i wish it'd been better, especially for the $8.50 i paid for it.

i've heard a lot about this place and i think i was expecting too much from the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. honestly, they didn't taste special to me at all. it was a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but definitely not worth the hype. we ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which came with 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, guacamole, jalapenos, chili cheese, mustard and onions. we also got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which was a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> that came with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushroom, bacon and cheese. both tasted decent. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were mediocre. it was worth a shot but i don't plan on visiting this place again.

thoroughly over-rated!

7.50$ for a greasy <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, covered in "chili" that looks like a pile of poo-poo & tastes accordingly (( this stuff looked synthetic - im talking taco bell might be better)

the sausage was okay but it was super salty and greasy, the bun was completely soggy (think wonderbread) & the chilli was honestly repulsive (i scooped as much as possible off before eating)

the relish and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> were the only things that saved the day.

i would seriously pick the  costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>/<mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> over this stuff any day!

i don't know what they we're thinking with this pink's. most if not all <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> offered in hollywood have been replaced or renamed for vegas. i was so confused. 

either way, i went with the desert named one, sonora or what have you. it came loaded in a fry dolly. bun, dog, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and jalape\u00f1os. i think i got it all, honestly j could have forgot something. there was so much junk on it that i couldn't pick it up and ha to cradle it with the fry holder. 

it was a huge mess that didn't taste amazing but got the job done. i was hungover as usual and this was a good fix. throw a cold beer in, and i was good to go. 

i won't return, it's a tourist spot that doesn't need to be there. pack up shop and move to hollywood where you could alleviate the long lines at the flagship joint.

for a celebrity <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> craze..... it's good! 

their #1 is the bacon chili cheese: topped with onions, tomatoes, chili, cheese and bacon... not really my cup of tea.

their #2 is the planet hollywood (fitting, considering their located @ ph) and it's pretty bomb! <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, cheese and bacon! 

the best compliment they offer i'd have to say is the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>:)

their downfall, hence the 2 stars: their staff and lack of customer service!!!

seriously... 

#1: you sell <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!! not diamonds! i guess a smile and a skosh of patience would be a stretch, no?
#2: you are the cashier!!! if you're gonna have that kind of impatient demeanor, you think it'd be more fitting to stock up inventory in the back or something right???

wow.

wow! best. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. ever!

i forget the name of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i ordered but it was a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, cheese, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and mushrooms (i think it was the ph <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i could be wrong).. a-freakin'-mazing! toppings over load! there were lots of <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and mushrooms which i much appreciated because most places are so skimpy with the toppings. the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was fat and juicy, just the way i like them ;)
boyfriend got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> with just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrami and mustard - i don't like mustard so i didn't get to try a bite but he said it was good and i'll trust him on that. i can't imagine it being anything amazing like mine though because it just seems so plain!

can't say to much for the service because you wait in line, walk up, order and pick up your food at the next spot so there isn't too much interaction with the employees. but i can say the girl who took my order was very friendly and patience because i still wasn't sure of what i wanted and i didn't feel rushed by her at all.

someone please open a pink's in the bay!!!

i was looking forward to trying this place out all weekend!

after having drinks all day and night, i really wanted something bad.. real bad for me..

i decided to order a <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>.  this had bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> on top of a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  let me tell ya, it was exactly what i was craving.  it was a bit on the salty side though.  i was already dehydrated enough, the bacon was real salty... and i love salty things ;)  other than that, i've never had a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> so yummy and so big!  i couldn't finish it.

the wait wasn't too bad when we came and actually getting our dogs didn't take long either.  i liked the environment, it was fun and exciting.

i'll probably come back here when i have a huge appetite and i haven't done my make-up.  by the end of eating your dog, you've wiped off all the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> that's gotten on your face and your freshly put on make-up!

3.5 stars again.  i don't know how i ended up here, but i did!  got <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark> and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> this time.  not the best (i'm a veggie though), but pretty damn good, and it's quick and filling!

note: for meat-eaters... every time i go here, i hear someone say to their friend "get everything on it"

we are a little spoiled living in chicago, because we have every cuisine here!  however, something as simple as a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> should not be that difficult, but i have had some from other places and trust me they were a fail. we tried pinks while in las vegas i had a turkey <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mayo, mustard, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, and cheese. ( i forgive them for asking me if i want ketchup, i live in chicago we dont do ketchup on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>). i have to admit it was a pleasant surprise, and i am kinda bummed out that i didnt make it to pinks one more time before leaving lv but i am definately a fan!

went to my first pink's of any kind today. heading into the first bite, i definitely did have high expectations, mainly because i was hungry, and also because the prices looked pretty darn high, even after accounting for the recent groupon deal. however, keep in mind that this in in the heart of the las vegas strip, so really you'd almost expect it to be pricey. it's not fair to compare this to costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on price.

when i tried my friend's <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, my eyes, taste <mark>Bud</mark>, and probably everything else just lit up. yeah, hunger is the best sauce or whatever, but every component of that dog - bun, sausage, chili, and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> - was really delicious and made me wish that i had chosen it. instead, i had gone with the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which was also quite tasty with bacon and some sort of enhanced 'shrooms. i also loved the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, which is fatter than the normal wiener, and the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> went surprisingly well with the rest of the ingredients.

we also shared some deluxe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which had a crapload of toppings on them. in hindsight, if i had known how loaded the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> would be, i would've ordered normal fries for about half the price because my friend was pretty much evacuating his toppings onto the fries. oh well, live and learn.

anyway, i've seen the other reviews, and i'm sure it doesn't match everything that people like about the original pink's - which i still hope to go to some day - but it's still good eating. not considering the price, the only problem i have is that i'd rather go to earl of sandwich, which is right next door and which i love to death, so i might not really see this place much at all in the future. oh well, it was yummy knowing you.

for all the hype and love this place gets, it really isn't good. in fact, it was gross. i'd rather go to mcdonalds, at least bad food is cheap there. 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, the actual meat part of it tasted acceptable, but not good. and they were too skinny. skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are for suckers. go big or go home. if i get a dog, i want it to be mostly meat inside the bun and all the other toppings pouring out of the top of it. thats a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. a skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> covered in onions is as dissatisfying as, well a skinny <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> covered in onions. the "grilled" onions had clearly only been acquainted with the grill top for a few seconds before hoping on to the long twig that was my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and didn't have any of that yummy caramelized taste that real <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> have. the pastrami was plain and dry. call me picky but isn't pastrami supposed to taste like something other than newspaper? i've never had pastrami this disgusting. and i've had a lot of pastrami in my time. you can make yourself a better dog for a 5th of the price by going to the deli section at your local grocery store. this was like an imitation that reminds you of a real <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, if a real <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were a gross, tasteless and pathetic lump of turd.

the only thing keeping this from being a 1 star review was that they sell booze. and i was able to finish half of my friend's giant margarita and get enough of a brain freeze to forget how gross and skinny that <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was.

i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!  it is my go-to, guilty pleasure when i am hungry in between meals.  trying to find a good one in vegas use to be very tough until i found pink's right outside planet hollywood.  you can pretty much have any style dog with any toppings your heart desires.  i had an all beef dog loaded with sauerkraut, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and peppers and plenty of mustard.  it was delish!  my only complaint here is that the people taking your order are rude and seem rushed.  the seating is horrible.  we sat outside and pigeons constantly invade your space which is very annoying.  i actually saw idiots feeding them which only encourages them to stick around.  in addition to this, the place was unclean which really turns me off.  i will still stop here on future visits but will get my dog to go.

i had the ph <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was pretty good.  it's loaded w/ bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and some mushrooms.  the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> kinda masked the taste of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, i think next time i'll get it w/ just a light amount of cheese.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself is pretty huge too (to the point it's almost difficult to eat lol).  the price tag is reasonable, at $9 i felt this was a decent deal.

my <mark>Bud</mark> ordered some weird stuff that had <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wrapped in tortillas or actual burritos.  i'd pass on this weird stuff as it didn't look good.  if you are coming to pinks then order a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, don't order this weird stuff.  that's like ordering a burger at a taco joint lol. 

tip-
-grab a fat tuesday just in the same shopping plaza of ph!  
-pass on getting the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> (rating 2/5).  they were so sweet they tasted horrible
-eating only availabe in the outdoor patio.  so if it's in the middle of the day i probably wouldn't eat here.  just come here for late night eats

after seeing so many television programs about pink's and how amazing it is, i had to try it when i was in vegas.  i ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> in a bun with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, bacon, and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.  the onions and mushrooms were scarce and barely grilled. the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> was just the normal <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> you get anywhere else.  there were about 5 strips of crispy bacon, but that didn't seem to justify the price of $8.99.  the sausage wasn't even particularly amazing either.  

i also didn't like how cramped <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and overall space was.  only two parties can stand in line before people must wait outside in the 100+ degree weather.  while the seating area did have fans, they were so powerful that they were more bothersome than pleasant - my napkins kept flying away and my hair flew in my face!

i'm glad i checked it off of my places to try, but i wouldn't go back again.  i'd much rather spend $1.50 at costco and get a soda as well!

so this place is awesome.  don't come here looking for something healthy -- come here to splurge and indulge to your hearts content.  

i ordered  the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which had <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> & mushrooms, a pancetta-like bacon that was out of this world, all smothered in <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.  this was divine.  of course, i could barely finish half of it.  but it was worth every penny and every calorie.  

my friend ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, which had 2 dogs in one bun, mustard, onions, chili, <mark>American Cheese</mark>, guacamole and jalape\u00f1os.  she said it was just as amazing.  

and of course, we had to get chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  

the ambiance was fun - we sat on the patio and got to people watch.  it's right in the middle of the vegas strip, so it's a great location.  the cashier was friendly and helpful, the food took maybe 5 minutes to prepare.  it was just a great experience.  if/when i go back to vegas, i will definitely come again!  maybe this time i'll use it as hangover food though.... ;)

pink's is entering its 73rd year in business. admittedly, when comparing prices with the original los angeles venue, the vegas spot appears much more expensive. predictable.

not really seeing a deathly spicy option (not saying that i was gonna find one), i got whatever could be interpreted as spicy to some people. <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> ($8.49) was my choice. yeah, you read that right. it was gonna basically be $9 with tax for a damn <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, pickled jalapenos, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, guacamole, and tomatoes.

it looked and tasted like your basic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> bun here. with the larger <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> and an abundance of toppings, it really needed one of those large gourmet buns to even give me a shot to pick it up. fork and knife would have to do.

flavor-wise, it did the job. it's basically as good as i could have expected this to be. great snap from the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> felt like it came from a container. the veggies and the guacamole tasted fresh. my issue is simply the price. there's no way this poor panda would even want to pay around $9 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, even if edible gold was attached to this sucker. besides, i'd take the edible gold and try to extract monetary value from it anyway.

i look at the yelp reviews for the los angeles pink's, and it's around a three-star average, same as the vegas spot. any complaints are likely directed at the price or the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> not living up to the hype. the line's also longer in l.a., so that probably also affects the reviewer's rating. still, it makes me wonder if the los angeles spot is better.

pink's was good for the experience. i can't complain much about the food other than not being able to pick it up. but i also don't want my wallet to have a reason to riot again.

so we went there to soak up some alcohol like everyone else on a friday night after a hard night of clubbing. the service was prompt and the food hot. hense the 2 stars. 

however it is worth noting that as a chicagoan i have high expectations for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (and pizza of course). so when i walk in and saw chicago style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the menu i got psyched! wrong!

my friend pointed out that it actually said "chicago style polish." now if you're from the chi you know our polishes are called "maxwell street polishes" and if you're a lil older you may even know them as "jew town polishes" but not chicago style. but whatever. so my <mark>Bud</mark> orders one for shits and giggles. ugh!

he gets the thing and it's got lettuce, tomato, and relish (not even neon green). the eff? no celery salt? no peppers? no mustard? no <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>? blasphemy! 

my polish was underwhelming too. i got grilled oinions and mustard on mine. it's worth noting however that the onions were chopped not grilled in slices. gross! 

so does pinks do the job? yes. would i go back when i go to vegas? sure i guess. but please for the love of beans take chicago off you menu if you can't get it right. k? thanks!

ok. i don't know how much better than average these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are. buns are standard. we ate the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which had the potential to be a super guilty, but worth-it experience, but it was just that - standard ingredients of a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, and bacon with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>. you can probably just load it up like that at home and make it just as good, or better. maybe i was just expecting more with the hype.

after an 8 hour flight & another hour for the shuttle to drive me to my hotel not to mention going to the airport 2 hours before departure, i can barely contain my hunger...you know how the airlines does not provide decent meals anymore...they just provide a snack of pretzel & peanuts with your soda...

as soon as i arrive in my hotel, my friend came over & went out for some late night snack.  it was almost 11:00 pm so we walked down the strip and notice this small pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stall right before the entrance of the planet hollywood, has a small seating area of around a dozen or less tables & decided to give it a try.  

i am not really a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan but  the menu makes me want to try it...besides, bellagio is right across where you can enjoy the dancing waters. we both had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which consists of <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, bacon& cheese. quite expensive for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> paid around $20.00 but hey this is vegas... you can add whatever condiment you want from the counter...ketchup or mustard or both, fries & soda...it was very filling & enjoyed it so much.  this much i can say...the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a lot longer than the bun....would i try it again..definitely!!!
i got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. it was polish with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and sauted mushrooms, it was awesome. and cheap too.

note: maybe i shouldn't review pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, because i don't eat meat and buns, and i count calories so i can't add more toppings or sauces except veggie stuffs. 

i was very happy that they have a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at planet hollywood! there was no line and not crowded! i would never wait in line for 3 hours in hollywood location! so i got to try world famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! very good location outside miracle mile, walking distance from our hotel cosmopolitan.

very cute place decorated in pink color, there is a wall full of celebrities photos. i was glad they had veggie and turkey <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

a solid 3.5 star, $40 for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, one fries, one <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>, one <mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark> with souvenir cup. 

veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Chopped Tomato</mark>: not much flavor, but it was not bad with mustard sauce and tomatoes 
<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mushrooms and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>: fairly delicious 
fries: not bad
corn dog: good 

<mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark>: yummy

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were good, but not great, veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> needed to wait a bit longer to get my order, other orders were fast. i guess we should've ordered pink's secret recipe chilly on top, that would make our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> more tasty, or add more toppings and sauces. it is a bit pricey for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> though, but it's famous so it's ok i guess. 

i didn't think the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were great, but they were not bad either. i like this fast food place a lot because of the cute decor, and outdoor seats, good view and people watching on the strip, there were some cute little birds walking around, they were fun to watch. so we will go back again for snacks or quick bite. :)

i had my hopes of trying pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for the longest time, and i finally tried it here at planet hollywood's race & sports book. 

ooooooo... what a disappointment!

it was just a small little stand with one worker who looked like he didn't want to be there!

i ordered a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> combo, which came with chips, that cost $5.95. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> combo was $6.95. it just tasted like a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, except that it had a nice "snap" to it (which made me give the place an extra star!). other than that, nothing special about it. the chili tasted like crap on it, probably because it was old and in the container all day! ewww! actually, i bet all the food they served there was old! ekkkk! =o

i had asked the guy working there when they will be opening the actual official stand, and he said he wasn't sure. however, they will be opening one near the hawaiian tropic entrance of planet hollywood. sooo..look out! hopefully by that time, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> will be better...

decent. if you've been to the original la location, prepare to be somewhat disappointed. 

food: meh. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> seemed precooked, the buns were plain, and the mushrooms looked canned. the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> was damn near $8 alone. i had to ask for a side of <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, because the ph dog here only comes with a slice of what looked like kraft cheese. the prices were at least $2 more than the la location, but i guess its understandable since its las vegas. the fries weren't freshly prepared like the la location either. and to top it off, they didn't have grape crush soda or yoo-hoo like the la location. 

service: the cashier chicks were nice. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and sides were served up/made in assembly line unlike the personal attention you get from one person at the la location. 

overall, it was just meh. i'd rather drive 4 hours, then wait in line for another hour to have an authentic pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i probably won't come back here unless they somehow manage to replicate everything that the la location offers. this place seemed like the "mcdonalds" version of pink's. the only good thing is that they accept credit cards, while the la location is only accepts cash.

way overpriced for some tiny dogs, but they're pretty good. i haven't eaten the one in los angeles yet, so i need to give that a try. once i go to la, i will definitely update this review. 

getting it to go is such a mess!! we had no choice but to and the huge stack of napkins totally helped. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> basically exploded in the bag and it was messy for sure.

come to pinks for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, not the fries or <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. they are soo greasy that i felt like a tub of lard eating just one ring!

what?!  pink's in vegas??

i was so excited to see that they opened a pink's which is located at planet hollywood, just outside and facing the strip.  to my surprise, there wasn't a huge 1 hour line.  i also saw that they didn't have the extensive menu that they have in their original west hollywood location. 

 i had heard so many great things about this place that i had to check it out.  i had a dog with their famous chili, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, onions and jalape\u00f1os.   just like they brag, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> does have a nice snap to it and flavor.  and they steam their buns.  next to a fenway park frank, these were pretty damn good and would definitely go back!

tip #1: can't find your favorite pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>?  just ask and have them customize your favorite creation.

this place is meh times twenty. i've had a better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from the refrigerator section at the grocery store. 

i would definitely skip this place all together. although all the glitz and glam of the pinks restaurant sign and ambiance is nice, it is so not worth digesting this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

i ordered the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> and the bf ordered the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. both were forgettable and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> did not have a lot of flavor, such a bummer. the total of two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and one large drink was $20, so not worth it. 

i am guessing this is not the pink's of la, because that pink's has a much better reputation than this two star joint.

ok it was like 107 degrees in vegas when i visited and pinks only offer outdoor seating. 

sucky seating aside, the food is way overrated.  i mean like $6 for a nothing special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>... that's ridics even for vegas.  my <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was bitter, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself is skinny, and tastes like any dog you can get in the deli section of safeway.  

i will not eat here again.

it was pretty exciting to try pink's for the very first time. but my sis said this location is $3-$4 more per item compared to the la location. not only that, but the menu is shorter and the specials are not the same. the good thing is, there's no crazy hour wait like in la. 

had the vegas strip <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, served with chili, mustard, guacamole and jalapenos. very tasty, but a bit on the heavy side. especially in 100+ degree weather since there's only outdoor seating. sis had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, which was pretty good too. gotta love chili! had a bite of the <mark>Pastrami Burrito</mark>. now that was just weird. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrimi, chili, cheese and onions. odd combo and taste. pass. lastly, their fries were very good. seasoned and crispy, just the way i like it. 

after combo-ing my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it came out to like $12! wow. that's some expensive <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i couldn't even finish. not because it was big, but it was just too difficult to eat in that hot weather.

pink's is one of those over-hyped places and since this location is in vegas, also super over-priced! it was located right outside the planet hollywood hotel and wasn't hard to find with its bright, pink name etched on the glass. at least there was no line at all when we got there. only outdoor seating so refrain from getting anything too spicy in the humid weather.

it was $6.75 for my bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>...not really worth it especially when the ones at the original pink's in la cost almost half that. it was topped with bacon, tomato, cheese, and mustard since i didn't want onions on mine. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uqb9ks7lzesghltmuunmea?select=3fcshb9yqxmpuyvnn8fyxa) the bacon was nice and crispy but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was tiny and wasn't anything special. the ones from costco are way bigger! 

my bun was also flimsy and broke in half after 2 bites. it could have used much more chili and the cheese wasn't melted enough. it was still a tasty meal overall but totally not worth the price tag.

i visited this pinks at about 2am after drinking alll day. for some reason a burger with coleslaw and mustard sounded amazing. too bad the cole slaw at pinks is soooo gross. it has almost no flavor and its just not good. the slaw is chopped up all funky...not uniformish...i hated it. needed salt and a lil sugar...it was like mayo salad vomit.

the burger patty was fine. my friends got turkey <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and i tried that...it was good.

the fried something we had...i think it was <mark>French Fries</mark> were good. 

the whole set up of this place is a narrow hallway...you can barely read the menu. its about 4ft between the wall and the counter. then there is an assembly line of cooks and at the end is a soda fountain.

i guess its a good place to go cause its open late and they have a lot of options.

i love their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>! its really nothing special but this location beats the la location with a 5 minute wait versus 90 minutes. it is in the back of the planet hollywood. the only thing i don't like about this location is you can only eat outside and it sucks during the summer.

went to pink's on the weekend of oct 2nd.  after drinking on an empty stomach, my two friends and i decided to go to pink's before meeting up with the rest of our friends at a club.  i'm not sure what it is about my group of friends but we like to have a few drinks before an intermission of (greasy but quick) food.  this can either be good or bad when it comes to writing reviews.  

we were starving and needed food asap.  we actually took a cab to ph for the sole purpose of getting pink's (instead of just eating something in the vicinity of our first spot or the next drinking spot) because after 2 nights of eating at expensive restaurants, clubs, and losing money at the tables - we wanted to eat something noteworthy but cheap.  

according to my friend who is born/raised socal, it is not as good as the original in cali.  i figured this was a mind-over-matter slash original-is-always-better-duhhh situation.  we ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, fries, and beer.   my other friend (a newyorker) and i thought it was good but agreed it wasn't awesome.  considering the acclamation pink's receives from born and bred la-ers, i changed my assumption and decided it probably is better at the original stand in la.  i remember thinking it wasn't as amazing of an experience as i was hoping to get - and was a bit disappointed by the lack of "snap" in <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself.  also, it was a bit... much.  i have a feeling <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had better snap to it before it got doused in the chili.   

that being said, i did enjoy my experience there.  it was exactly what i was looking for at that moment.  we were buzzed and looking to eat something extremely unhealthy but tasty - and that's exactly what we got.

i'd definitely try it again because for some reason, i think it was just an off night.  and we had some strange concoction of drinks before going there so all of this might be completely in my head.

i had the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> without onions and was a little disappointed that the chili did not contain beans.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> were nice and crispy.  i made the mistake of eating outside on a cold december day, so my food cooled off quickly; i think it may have been better warm.  overall, i thought the food was good, but not worthy of all the hype.

i had the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> (figured i should counter all the grease and calories with the lettuce, tomato, and relish that comes on this dog), almost like a mini salad on top of my <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>! it was ok except for the fact that my bun completely fell apart, thus defeating the purpose of eating a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my friend had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, which i had a bite of and really enjoyed. the bacon added just the right amount of salty goodness. the fries here were really tasty, and although we didn't order <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, almost every other table around us had them so i'm guessing they're popular. 

what is nice about this place is its location on the strip and the outdoor seating. a great place to people-watch and enjoy the weather. as a sun-starved seattleite, it was nice to be able to get some vitamin d and uv rays in since most of our vegas cavorting usually happens at night.

if you want yummy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries, or just some hangover food that hits the spot, i'd recommend. if you're a tourist in vegas and are trying to experience pink's in the city of sin, this surely isn't it. too clean, too friendly, too flashy. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and dirtiness, and hour-long wait in line that you'll find at the original pink's in la is what makes it special, for better or for worse.

i go every time i go for a trek up and down the strip and will continue to do so.

the reason i'm only giving three stars is that although the service is good, and the place is clean, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> aren't bad, they're not all that great either.  mainly i like the place for the variety.

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> by itself can't hold up to a properly done nathans, but it's nowhere near as bad as a bar s.

the rueben dog is good, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself gets lost in the reuben part, which isn't bad, but i'd like to taste <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> if it's there.

now, what makes pinks (la anyways) famous is the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  i recently had the bacon chili <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>.  the bacon was nice if undercooked, but that's about it.  the cheese and onions got lost in the chili which was pretty dang boring.  it's not spicy, it's not flavourful.  it tastes kind of like bean powder was mixed with ground beef, gravy, and a dash of tabasco.  not anything special.

if a place is famous for something, it should be good, that's why they're famous.  so it was very disappointing to discover it tastes like something out of a <mark>Bud</mark> can.

this place was fun and conveniently located, and the food is fine but not at all special.  i had a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the chili was not good quality and the cheese was liquid cheese served with a ladle.  same goes for the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  it was kind of fun to have <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for lunch but they are no better than <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you'd get anywhere else.  if you really feel like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> or are looking for something fast in that area then this might be a good pick for you, but otherwise look elsewhere.

what do you do when your friend is on a winning streak at the craps table? you go outside and eat some pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! that and the fact that we had a coupon you couldn't go wrong. 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were decent. being from nyc we're not used to have so much stuff loaded onto <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. had a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a reuben. quite tasty indeed, but nothing to brag about. filling? yes. it didn't taste like rubber <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and it wasn't a dirty water dog, but hell why not? try it if you're in vegas, use the coupon people!

dude, it's pink's...in vegas. my two favorite things in the world. ok, i really don't feel that way. but if i was a surfer dude from redondo beach out with my <mark>Bud</mark> for a vegas weekend, this would certainly be my dining destination of choice. since i'm not, i guess i can be a little more discriminating. but dude, it's pink's. well not quite pink's. just a reasonable facsimile in an apt setting, planet hollywood. 

jamie w. and i really wanted some dogs after strolling through the sterile city center complex which has none of the kitsch that really is vegas. luckily, pink's has kitsch to spare in its patio setting outside the hotel entrance. the menu looked familiar. we decided to each get a $4.75 giant 12-inch jalapeno dog with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> and chili, and share a $6.50 "planet hollywood" dog, which consisted of a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, bacon and cheese (see photos). oh did i mention the fries, too? nice and tasty they were. 

indigestion thy name is pink's. the jalapeno dog has that snap to the wiener that i don't care for much. i prefer a meatier dog to the tooth, and the mustard was way overwhelming, but chili, cheese and diced onions are bulletproof on a dog as far as i'm concerned. the "planet hollywood" dog has quite a pile of toppings to maneuver in your mouth starting with the bacon strips lording over the sausage already drowning in melted cheese. the mushrooms seemed almost incidental to the creation, but they were good. hell, it was all good in a bad, bad way. 

food - 3 stars....quite an abundance of toppings on those dogs but not quite the pink's i remember in la 
ambiance - 2 stars...hell, it's just a patio...in pink 
service - 2.5 stars...just keep moving the line and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> will eventually be there 
total - 3 stars...a middling experience based on a distant memory of the pink's in la

i had no idea there was a pinks here! but alas, on our walk towards the mgm, we found it.  bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> for me please.

the good thing is that pinks is a nice break from the plethora of buffets on the strip.  just try to avoid it in bad weather.  outdoor seating is the only seating, and the only available heat is space heater.

but after being surrounded by $$$ buffets and restaurants, its nice to know that there are some cheaper reliable  eats around

i"ve heard a lot about pink's and was hoping not to be let down when i happened there in january.  and thank goodness, it was pretty good.   i had the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and it was actually pretty tasty.  not what i'd call cheap ( i think it was $5.50 when i went), but given it's location and the novelty, i expected that.   there wasn't much of a line, thank goodness, as it's a pretty small place.   there's a seating area outside on the sidewalk of the las vegas strip and that allows for a pretty nice view while eating.

i was getting a little hungry in the afternoon after walking so much and decided to get a quick bite to eat at pink's. the key word here is decided to get a quick bite to eat. when we jumped in line, there were only 10 other people in front of us but it took nearly 30 minutes just to get up to the counter to order. this place is freakin' slow! while we were waiting in line for 30 minutes the line grew to epic proportions... easily like 50+ people behind us in line. i hate to think what they had to wait at the end just to order.

i ended up ordering a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with a side of fries (it only took me 45 seconds from pulling up to the counter to order to leaving the line and not the average of 3 minutes to order per person. it isn't that hard.). the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was good... slightly above average for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

the problem with pink's is the wait time to order to taste ratio. its good to try once but it definitely isn't worth the wait. the second thing is the seating area outside is very very small. if you come at a busy time, you might have to hover until you find a place to sit. it didn't happen with me, but i can see it happening.

for lunch i wanted to try pink's--finally.  i heard that their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were very good and decided to try for myself.  there are a few things to keep in mind when it comes to pink's--size and cost. i'll explain in a minute.

just to let everyone know, pink's it outside of planet hollywood/miracle mile shops facing the boulevard.  i walked around for awhile till i found the sign in the building and realized it was outside.  anyway, there wasn't a line and their seating is all outside, so i went in to take a look at their menu.

the menu is simple with pre-made options for you and even burgers if you aren't into their dogs. at almost 10 dollars a dog it was pretty pricey, but i expected that from a famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> eaterie.  they even have their special dogs from celebrities on a flyer at the entrance and near the menu, so check those out, too.

i went for a <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>--<mark>Sour Cream</mark>, tomatoes, onions and relish--and my husband ate their classic <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with onions.  we grabbed a water and fountain drink for a total of 25 dollars and moved on down to the pick up area. when i saw our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i freaked out.  i love toppings, but really?  really?  this was definitely a fork and knife dog.

i love eating my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> by hand.  it's just the way that it should be, but at pink's it's difficult to do so.  too many toppings on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> cause the flavor of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> to be lost, so i scraped everything off on one half to get down to what matters--that fried dog.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is good with a slight snap to it, but it's not an amazing.  i ate the rest with my utensils, feeling as if i violated some ethical <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> code by not eating with my hands.

if you want to try <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, buy a plain one and ask for toppings on the side if you need them, that way you can really taste what a pink's dog is all about.  if you want something really good, their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was decent.

overall <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was decent and i can at least say that i've tried it once. would i fight my way down there through traffic again for it?  nope.  but it's something you have to try once so you can say that you have.

although this place is tiny and the line may be long, it is worth the cramped wait. maybe it was just so satisfying because i was starving after walking the strip, but i thought their <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was amazing. sure its just your regular long <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with toppings, but for some reason it just hit the spot in the perfect way. i thought it was super fresh, the chili was perfect and the cheese was nicely melted and gooey. i left the mustard off.. that didn't sound appealing but all in all i enjoyed the food and eating on their little patio in the sunshine.

i tried the popular <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>. both were pretty good but extremely messy. the guadalajara had too much <mark>Sour Cream</mark> on it. the fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were awesome - definitely complimented the meal. my friends tried some other dogs, they were wrapped up in soft tortillas and stuff. they had mixed reviews but i would suggest sticking to a regular bun. service was pretty quick and they have a small outdoor section to sit. i think they open late enough, one night we were starving and drunk or something and needed something like this to hit the spot, unfortunately it was closed already.

just another place trying to make money just off the name.. let's just say.. i would not go back to this location... after eating at the one in la... i don't even know how they can even call themselves pinks... they should just call themselves - just another <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place.   very disappointed and i got a stomach ache after eating a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>...

lousy location,no place to sit inside,just a bunch of chairs outside the
the front.
that's fine on a nice day ,but vegas gets very hot in the summer and cold in the winter.
today it was 50 ,windy and overcast and the last thing i wanted to do was sit and freeze my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.
what were they thinking,this is not a dairy queen where you sit in your car and sip a malt and eat a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>,so what's up with local?

being a huge travel channel fan, i have often seen pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the shows featured on there. luckily it was right in my hotel, planet hollywood. i was able to try the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (minus the mustard & onions), fries, and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. the fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were really good and the chili on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had great flavor to it!

minus 2 stars for how slow the line moves and the higher than usual prices (but i guess it's expected since it is right on the strip).

this place is all the wait of the la location, none of the taste.  10 minutes to get a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> that was 90% chili and 10% of what tasted like slim jims for $8ish?  urgh!   talk about a disappointment.

stopped here for lunch after hearing all the hype about the la location.

after waiting in a bit of a line, we ordered and snagged a table in the shade. as a pale irish east coaster, it was almost a deal breaker that there was no inside seating since i fry to a crisp in the sun. so that's where one star went.

i had a holly madison naked dog, which is basically a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> overloaded with ketchup, and it was great. i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with casing so they snap when you bite into them, so i loved pink's dogs. my husband at the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and said it was great. <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were solid, too.

the only downside is that it's super pricey, even by strip standards as far as i'm concerned. that's where the other star went. but it was a fun place for lunch, nonetheless!

after hearing so much hype about the pink's in la, i could not wait to finally try their famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> when i was in vegas. the line, was what i expected it to be.. long. what made the wait seem 10x longer was the fact that the actual place is so small that once about 5 people are inside, the rest of the line is waiting outside in the scorching heat. in a way i was glad that there was a line so that my party and i would have time to browse the menu. i also noticed their had a few special celebrity <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, which certain celebrities conned, obviously. there were <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> by holly madison and kim kardashian, and a few others too. after a few minutes, i decided on the swiss mushroom <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, which was a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, mayo, and of course, mushrooms. my mom got the chili cheese and <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> while my dad played it safer with just the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. i must say that i was definitely not impressed with any of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> we ordered. i am a fan of mayo but the amount of mayo on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was just way too much for my liking. the mushrooms were almost flavorless and the cheese was not even melted; it was as if it was just placed on top of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for decoration. although my parents' chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were pretty similar, besides the bacon on my mom's, they were nothing special at all. i think i would have enjoyed a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from top dog in berkeley or even a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> from wienerschnitzel.. would have saved us a few dollars, too. i don't know about ya'll but $7-8 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> topped with basic kitchen ingredients just doesn't seem right. maybe the la location is better? but will i ever know? nope, because i doubt i'll go outta my way to try another one of their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

date/time: sunday ~ 1:30pm
occasion: lunch
party of:  taken to-go
ordered: their version of the "mulholland drive" dog - 12" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, and mushrooms
location: super small, outdoor seating only so it's deadly during the summer, very clean
total incl gratuity: ~$8.00 per <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>

omigoodness!  could it get any more unhealthy?  i ate a 12" long sausage with every possible fattening topping but it was so worth it!  to top it off, we had friends pick it up and bring it poolside to us so there we were eating a 12" weener that was probably a day's worth of calories in our bikinis...so sexy huh? ;)  but again...oh so good.  pinks is very good...a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with any which kind of topping you can imagine.  all of the toppings are fresh and make the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> so tasty.  i've heard from quite a few people that the la one is so much better so i'll have to make my way down there and try theirs soon.  but this one did it's job and satisfied our tummies! mmmm....<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>....

wanting for many years to visit the hollywood location, i jumped at the chance to finally taste one of these famous dogs albeit in the planet hollywood in las vegas. it probably isn't the same experience, but hey, it was a pretty good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it's located right on the strip, outside of the planet hollywood hotel and casino. there is a gated off area outside to sit and eat that is cooled by mist fans. it was still hot, but i was enjoying my dog too much to care.

i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. it was a mouth watering experience with the popping <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> casing, to the beefy flavor, the addition of chili, and the paramount additive that is crispy bacon. the crusty sweet <mark>Onion Ring</mark> put it all over the top. honestly on this trip, this was probably the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i had. the other being from nathan's in ny ny (http://www.yelp.com/biz/nathans-famous-hot-dogs-las-vegas), but i'm sure it was a result of the fashion in which it was prepared (i.e. griddle which is best vs hot rollers).

yeah, i didn't see any hollywood stars but who cares. i was there for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was really good.

giving this spot 4 stars would only be submitting to the hype. i liked it...don't get me wrong, but it didn't really give me a foodgasm. wifey ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and i ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>. <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> consisted of dos dogs, guac, mustard, cheese, onions, a mound of chili and topped w/ 'penos all stuffed in a single bun. good stuff, but a little over the top. we were both satisfied, but not in a craving way. the thing that stood out the most was the snap and the juiciness as you bite into the "pink" weiner (that doesn't sound right, but oh well... ). 

for the crazy decked out <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> experience alone...it's worth it! good luck figuring out how to eat one of these monstrosities.

it's kind of sad how i live in l.a. and never tried pink's down here but yet i go and eat at the pink's in vegas. yeahhh, well i was on vacation thats why haha. anywho, my boyfriend and i wanted to do a little shopping at miracle mile shops and eat some lunch before our drive back home to l.a.. so i forgot they just opened up pink's right outside the shops and all the times/things i hear about pink's in l.a. i was like why not, im here and im not gonna have time to eat it in l.a. anytime soon.

the food was good actually, made me full. we ordered, <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, kim kardashion dog, and i think my bf ordered some <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>...but it cost a lot honestly well yea i know that was a lot food but it was  30bucks for lunch -____- but i would def. recommend the kim k dog, delicious!

come on pinks vegas! no hollywood menu? i went to order my usual spicy polish with chili and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> and i looked like a chump when she told me we don't have that. on the upside it prompted me to try something different and it was easily the shortest wait for pinks i have ever had. pastrami and swiss <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was smashing! not quite as cool as pinks in hollywood and i doubt brad pitt would ever get kidnapped in front of this place, but it's still a killer dog.

my friend and i both got sick after eating their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.. not recommended!

we went to las vegas for my 30th birthday bash and my sister told me they had a pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> there in vegas like da one in hollywood and so i had to try one before i left....my friend, husband and i were on a mission to find it...we asked security at the new york new york hotel where pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was at and he directed us to hard rock hotel...so we take a cab to the hotel we get there...only to find out that its pink's tacos and not <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>...i was soo pissed but i still wanted to get there! we take a cab back n the guy tells us its right on the strip by planet hollywood lol....that made me more mad! so we get to pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> finally at 2am! i order the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which has 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on one bun, chili, cheese, <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, avocado, onions, jalape\u00f1os mustard n keptchup! omg it was delish! i love how da <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a crunch sorta like a hot link....my husbands <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was delish too! 

overall it was delish just like i had imagined! love me some pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i will most def come here again when i am in vegas!

sooo walking down the strip at 3 in the afternoon drunk off our asses not even 3 hours after landing, 2 friends and myself stumbled across pinks and decided to grab a bite and just sit down for a bit. i had seen and heard of the pinks in la, but never had the chance to wait and stand in the long line. the one in vegas, however, had no line whatsoever, but now i know why. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and when i got the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, the bun was a little too small for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. the bread was already soggy from the chili and it had a little too much oil dripping everywhere. to be honest, i kind of think pinks is overhyped, but maybe the one in la is alot better...i think i'll just stick to costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

my bf and i had been walking the strip and were tired and thirsty and hungry and about done for the day. we saw pinks while crossing over from aria/crystals. i was really trying to be good that day so we decided if we were going to eat @ pink's we needed to split one. we had been to the location in la and wasted our entire day waiting in line for over 3 hrs . by that time it was already dark and it was time to go home. dang it. so since we enjoyed pinks (somewhat) in la we decided to get something new. we went w/ the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. nothing fancy or speciality. omg either that was the best bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> i've ever had or i was starving. wait.. that was the 1st and only bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> i've ever had.  it was really good... i'd def. order again but nxt time i'd get something with <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> or italian sausage. ;)

i was walking down the strip in 98 degrees heat at 1 pm and look up found pink's!! i've been to the famous one in la melrose/labrea original before. hoping that i can relived it again as i experienced the one in la, i went in and order the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a soda. i pay about $10 bucks, oh well it's vegas!! i proceeded to sit in the sweltering heat and ate my <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and soda while just watching the free walking people show. it was ok, not the same here in vegas. pink's in la seem to taste better....hummm maybe the heat got to me!! or was it 106 degree instead!!!

this place is the shizzle!  i was craving a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> especially after drinking a yard stick from fat tuesday.  so my friends and i head over here and to my surprise, there were only 4 people in line!  
my friend tells me the kim kardashian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> looks good and she was right!  the kim kardashian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with cheese, bacon and mushrooms.  ohh my gawd!  it was frickin awesome!   the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was juicy with nice snap.  the bacon was off the hook.  and the cheese just enough to get everything wet.  
now in my drunk state of mind, i'm thinking i can eat like a champ, so i also order a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with no mustard and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>!  what the heck was i thinking!  thank god my friends were there to eat half my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and half the fries.  
either way, everything they had was sooo good!  definitely coming back here next time i'm in vegas.

after 2 bites, i threw my <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> out.   seek out another place selling a quality dog (like hebrew national or even nathan's) instead of this.  nice view from the outdoor patio though.

i forgot the name of my order, but i do remember what was in it!  <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> and bacon!  sounded like an amazing combination on paper.  mushrooms, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and bacon??  some of my favorite things!  the reality of it however did not blow me away.  it was a good late night snack for a hungry gal beginning to sober up, but in all honesty i wish it'd been better, especially for the $8.50 i paid for it.

after working up an appetite wandering up and down the strip and in the planet hollywood shops, my friends and i decided pinks would be the perfect place to grab a quick lunch. coincidently, we also happened to each be wearing pink (not planned!) so it seemed even more fitting. 

i ordered the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mushrooms and swiss. my friend ordered a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and another ordered the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. we also ordered a side of fries and rings to share. 

food came out quickly and i thought my dog was delicious. the fries were good but got cold quickly...most likely because it was cold outside where we were sitting, but still. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were ginormous and tasty. 

lunch came out to a bit under $10 per person which i don't think is bad. i would come back.

what more could i ask for? <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> mmmm. chili mmmmm. crispy fries mmmmm. and piled high with all its glory oozing out of the now invisible boat it comes in- awesome.  oh i also had a side of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> which was damn good.

i knew i should've trusted fellow yelpers. even though pink's didn't get very good reviews i still went there and tried one of their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. we tried their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and were very disappointed. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had no flavor at all. it tasted like nothing, if that's even possible. the chili was just okay. nothing that would enhance <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>'s flavor, but it didn't make is taste any worse. not only was it lacking flavor, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was also quite expensive. $8 for one!  wouldn't recommend or visit this place in the future. my advice, just skip this place and go somewhere else.

my house people told me that i gained weight. who's to blame?
i didn't go to many other food places in vegas. who's to blame?

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!

i spent 4 days in vegas, and pinks fed my stomach 3 times in 4 days.
day 1:
chilli <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (me)
mushroom <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

coleslaw

* the coleslaw is a no, but whatever, i love you still, pinks!

i had heard about the pink's in so cal and i had always wanted to try it. when i saw there was one in vegas, i was excited to check it out. i was disappointed, to say the least. i ordered the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>, which costed me $6.50. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> tasted rubbery to me and there wasn't nearly enough <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> on it. the moments where i got <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, mushrooms, and <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were really good but there weren't very many of them. they put way too many mushrooms and not enough cheese. if it had been better proportioned i may have enjoyed it more. i would probably still eat here again, but try something different next time. i heard the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> is to die for.

pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was pretty good! ive never had it before so i wanted to try out their original best one and according to the staff, the most popular one ended up being their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. the beef was made well and the size was good enough. i didn't like how the bread was ripping apart and the whole dog was unbalanced. 

this place is nice to eat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at especially for west coast dogs. i'd come back to eat more!

after a night of excessive drinking...what would be better for breakfast than a giant <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> smothered in salty ooze?

i got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. polish. <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>. onions. mushrooms. bacon. bacon. omg. wut?

i came. i saw. i left 2 inches of dog left....  next time i shall do less extravagantly.

p.s. don't go shopping and try on tight clothes afterwards.

after all the hype i've heard about pink's, it does not live up to it's raves. maybe the la joint is better so i may give it a second chance when i'm in la, but don't try pink's in vegas.
i got the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and my friend got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. the chili on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was very questionable, kinda like elementary school lunch chili what the hell kinda meat is in here but i don't care because i'm 7? kinda chili. mushy and questionable. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself? i think i've tasted better microwaving ones from the grocery store. it's bland, and just soft.
didn't try my friend's pastrami <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but he said it just tasted like what it looks like. we also got <mark>Onion Ring</mark>-- after a few of them, you might want to food coma.

i am all for greasy, fat food, but pink's does not do it for me.

i don't know what they we're thinking with this pink's. most if not all <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> offered in hollywood have been replaced or renamed for vegas. i was so confused. 

either way, i went with the desert named one, sonora or what have you. it came loaded in a fry dolly. bun, dog, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and jalape\u00f1os. i think i got it all, honestly j could have forgot something. there was so much junk on it that i couldn't pick it up and ha to cradle it with the fry holder. 

it was a huge mess that didn't taste amazing but got the job done. i was hungover as usual and this was a good fix. throw a cold beer in, and i was good to go. 

i won't return, it's a tourist spot that doesn't need to be there. pack up shop and move to hollywood where you could alleviate the long lines at the flagship joint.

i have wanted to try pink's for many years......i have tried a few occasions in la, but whenever i go there is always a huge line.

so, when my babe and i wanted a quick afternoon snack, off to pink's 
we went...and only a five minutes wait.

we shared a bacon, chili, <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.......not the best dog that i ever had...but very filling and yummy none the less.  the patio seating is cool a place to eat your dog and people watch on lv blvd.

it was my first time in vegas and after walking around the strip all day long, my friends and i decided to stop by pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i was told this is a well known <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place in la and really good. when i saw the menu, the prices did not impress me, for that it was quite expensive! i guess you can't really complain. it is las vegas after all. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with fries and i have to say it was really good and tasty. the chili had beef chunks in it and complimented the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> really well. every bite was filled with the saucy chili and beef with the delicious <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i am craving this as i write this review. i'm from norcal and there just isn't any good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> places here. i will for sure come back for more next time i'm in town!

meh is a spot-on description for pink's in las vegas.

i had heard such great things about pink's in la that we decided to try it for lunch one day on our recent vegas trip.  maybe you have to be drunk to really appreciate these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i was less than impressed.  on the plus side, there are some interesting combinations on the menu, but the execution was so average.  my husband had a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> which was mediocre at best- the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a good snap to it, but the taste wasn't anything to write home about and i've had better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (vienna and koegel's in the midwest).  i had about 2 bites of my polish (i can't remember the name of it, but it had guacamole, hot peppers, etc. which was fine) and again, was less than impressed with the meat.  i guess for a truly great <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, i'll stick to ballparks, who seem to get it right.  i'd take a wrigley field polish over a pink's any day of the week.

i heard a lot of hype about pink's so i was expecting some awesome <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i was hugely disappointed.
