sooo walking down the strip at 3 in the afternoon drunk off our asses not even 3 hours after landing, 2 friends and myself stumbled across pinks and decided to grab a bite and just sit down for a bit. i had seen and heard of the pinks in la, but never had the chance to wait and stand in the long line. the one in vegas, however, had no line whatsoever, but now i know why. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and when i got the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, the bun was a little too small for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. the bread was already soggy from the chili and it had a little too much oil dripping everywhere. to be honest, i kind of think pinks is overhyped, but maybe the one in la is alot better...i think i'll just stick to costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

my bf and i had been walking the strip and were tired and thirsty and hungry and about done for the day. we saw pinks while crossing over from aria/crystals. i was really trying to be good that day so we decided if we were going to eat @ pink's we needed to split one. we had been to the location in la and wasted our entire day waiting in line for over 3 hrs . by that time it was already dark and it was time to go home. dang it. so since we enjoyed pinks (somewhat) in la we decided to get something new. we went w/ the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. nothing fancy or speciality. omg either that was the best bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> i've ever had or i was starving. wait.. that was the 1st and only bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> i've ever had.  it was really good... i'd def. order again but nxt time i'd get something with <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> or italian sausage. ;)

i was walking down the strip in 98 degrees heat at 1 pm and look up found pink's!! i've been to the famous one in la melrose/labrea original before. hoping that i can relived it again as i experienced the one in la, i went in and order the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a soda. i pay about $10 bucks, oh well it's vegas!! i proceeded to sit in the sweltering heat and ate my <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and soda while just watching the free walking people show. it was ok, not the same here in vegas. pink's in la seem to taste better....hummm maybe the heat got to me!! or was it 106 degree instead!!!

this place is the shizzle!  i was craving a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> especially after drinking a yard stick from fat tuesday.  so my friends and i head over here and to my surprise, there were only 4 people in line!  
my friend tells me the kim kardashian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> looks good and she was right!  the kim kardashian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with cheese, bacon and mushrooms.  ohh my gawd!  it was frickin awesome!   the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was juicy with nice snap.  the bacon was off the hook.  and the cheese just enough to get everything wet.  
now in my drunk state of mind, i'm thinking i can eat like a champ, so i also order a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with no mustard and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>!  what the heck was i thinking!  thank god my friends were there to eat half my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and half the fries.  
either way, everything they had was sooo good!  definitely coming back here next time i'm in vegas.

after 2 bites, i threw my <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> out.   seek out another place selling a quality dog (like hebrew national or even nathan's) instead of this.  nice view from the outdoor patio though.

after working up an appetite wandering up and down the strip and in the planet hollywood shops, my friends and i decided pinks would be the perfect place to grab a quick lunch. coincidently, we also happened to each be wearing pink (not planned!) so it seemed even more fitting. 

i ordered the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mushrooms and swiss. my friend ordered a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and another ordered the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. we also ordered a side of fries and rings to share. 

food came out quickly and i thought my dog was delicious. the fries were good but got cold quickly...most likely because it was cold outside where we were sitting, but still. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were ginormous and tasty. 

lunch came out to a bit under $10 per person which i don't think is bad. i would come back.

i've heard a lot about this place and i think i was expecting too much from the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. honestly, they didn't taste special to me at all. it was a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but definitely not worth the hype. we ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which came with 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, guacamole, jalapenos, chili cheese, mustard and onions. we also got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which was a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> that came with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushroom, bacon and cheese. both tasted decent. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were mediocre. it was worth a shot but i don't plan on visiting this place again.

i knew i should've trusted fellow yelpers. even though pink's didn't get very good reviews i still went there and tried one of their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. we tried their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and were very disappointed. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had no flavor at all. it tasted like nothing, if that's even possible. the chili was just okay. nothing that would enhance <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>'s flavor, but it didn't make is taste any worse. not only was it lacking flavor, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was also quite expensive. $8 for one!  wouldn't recommend or visit this place in the future. my advice, just skip this place and go somewhere else.

my house people told me that i gained weight. who's to blame?
i didn't go to many other food places in vegas. who's to blame?

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!

i spent 4 days in vegas, and pinks fed my stomach 3 times in 4 days.
day 1:
chilli <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (me)
mushroom <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 2:
<mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (my friend)
<mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> (me)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 4: 
2 <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (me& my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>
coleslaw

* the coleslaw is a no, but whatever, i love you still, pinks!

i had heard about the pink's in so cal and i had always wanted to try it. when i saw there was one in vegas, i was excited to check it out. i was disappointed, to say the least. i ordered the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>, which costed me $6.50. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> tasted rubbery to me and there wasn't nearly enough <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> on it. the moments where i got <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, mushrooms, and <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were really good but there weren't very many of them. they put way too many mushrooms and not enough cheese. if it had been better proportioned i may have enjoyed it more. i would probably still eat here again, but try something different next time. i heard the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> is to die for.

pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was pretty good! ive never had it before so i wanted to try out their original best one and according to the staff, the most popular one ended up being their <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. the beef was made well and the size was good enough. i didn't like how the bread was ripping apart and the whole dog was unbalanced. 

this place is nice to eat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at especially for west coast dogs. i'd come back to eat more!

after a night of excessive drinking...what would be better for breakfast than a giant <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> smothered in salty ooze?

i got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. polish. <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>. onions. mushrooms. bacon. bacon. omg. wut?

i came. i saw. i left 2 inches of dog left....  next time i shall do less extravagantly.

p.s. don't go shopping and try on tight clothes afterwards.

after all the hype i've heard about pink's, it does not live up to it's raves. maybe the la joint is better so i may give it a second chance when i'm in la, but don't try pink's in vegas.
i got the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and my friend got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. the chili on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was very questionable, kinda like elementary school lunch chili what the hell kinda meat is in here but i don't care because i'm 7? kinda chili. mushy and questionable. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself? i think i've tasted better microwaving ones from the grocery store. it's bland, and just soft.
didn't try my friend's pastrami <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but he said it just tasted like what it looks like. we also got <mark>Onion Ring</mark>-- after a few of them, you might want to food coma.

i am all for greasy, fat food, but pink's does not do it for me.

i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  that is a fact.  personally one of the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in my opinion is a costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  practically every time i go to costco, on my way out i have to buy a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i've even purchased their refrigerated <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to make at home - not the same as the ones they make there - i think because of the buns.  but i digress...

i was in vegas and having heard of pinks being a southern california favorite, i realized these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> needed to be sampled.  first of all, my challenge was finding the place.  i knew it was inside planet hollywood.  upon walking in, i explored the mall, the food area, and even saw a big sign with an arrow pointing towards the casino/mall exit.  but pinks was nowhere to be found.  well, turns out (after asking someone), it is in the front of the casino.  ahhh.  it was one of those things - most vegas places on the strip, you never really walk out in front of the casinos.  they are always designed to suck you in and never let you leave.  

anyway, after finding pinks i ordered a <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> and their standard footlong dog.  i should note that pinks has a ton of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> - their menu is quite extensive.  the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> was much thicker compared to the long and skinny footlong.  both were ok.  they had been steamed.  toppings were pretty basic.  no sport peppers on the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, which i guess i can't complain about too much because we aren't in chicago.  buns were soft and tasted fresh.  

overall not an amazing <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> like i had hoped for (still like that costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> better), but certainty a very decent dog for vegas.  maybe if i make it down to la someday, i'll try the original.

pink's was one of the cheapest meals we had in vegas! $26 for three people was a nice change of pace from spending triple & quadruple that at other eateries. 

this was my first time eating at this vegas location but i'd been to the original so cal one a few times. i ordered my usual: a veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> covered in chili cheese & onions. completely messy & totally heavy in the stomach; exactly what junk food should be. my companions ordered <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. 

even though i don't eat meat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i like that i don't have to be excluded from dining at pink's with people who do because they serve <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. brownie points for that. pink's food is kind of 'eh' but it's fun to eat outside, under heating lamps & surrounded by lights on the strip.

i have wanted to try pink's for many years......i have tried a few occasions in la, but whenever i go there is always a huge line.

so, when my babe and i wanted a quick afternoon snack, off to pink's 
we went...and only a five minutes wait.

we shared a bacon, chili, <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.......not the best dog that i ever had...but very filling and yummy none the less.  the patio seating is cool a place to eat your dog and people watch on lv blvd.

so this was my first time having pink's, and we were totally excited. i ordered something with pastrami and cheese, husband ordered one with chili and bacon, and also coleslaw and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.  our dogs weren't too impressive. hubz said his chili was too thick, and my <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> wasn't as extravagant as i thought it would be.  <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were good and the coleslaw was alright.  staff was friendly, and we got our food fairly quick.  only seating area to eat is outside, but luckily they had heaters. glad i got to try it, but doubt we will plan on coming back. 

btw you have to park in the planet hollywood garage if you're going to drive, then walk through the casino to the outside.

it was my first time in vegas and after walking around the strip all day long, my friends and i decided to stop by pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i was told this is a well known <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place in la and really good. when i saw the menu, the prices did not impress me, for that it was quite expensive! i guess you can't really complain. it is las vegas after all. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with fries and i have to say it was really good and tasty. the chili had beef chunks in it and complimented the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> really well. every bite was filled with the saucy chili and beef with the delicious <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i am craving this as i write this review. i'm from norcal and there just isn't any good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> places here. i will for sure come back for more next time i'm in town!

meh is a spot-on description for pink's in las vegas.

i had heard such great things about pink's in la that we decided to try it for lunch one day on our recent vegas trip.  maybe you have to be drunk to really appreciate these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i was less than impressed.  on the plus side, there are some interesting combinations on the menu, but the execution was so average.  my husband had a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> which was mediocre at best- the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a good snap to it, but the taste wasn't anything to write home about and i've had better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (vienna and koegel's in the midwest).  i had about 2 bites of my polish (i can't remember the name of it, but it had guacamole, hot peppers, etc. which was fine) and again, was less than impressed with the meat.  i guess for a truly great <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, i'll stick to ballparks, who seem to get it right.  i'd take a wrigley field polish over a pink's any day of the week.

i heard a lot of hype about pink's so i was expecting some awesome <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i was hugely disappointed.

my sister and i shared the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>, the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a side of <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.  i was surprised that our order came out looking like regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and buns (that you'd buy from any grocery store) slathered in everyday condiments.  i totally agree with the other reviews that there was really nothing special about the food here.

the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> was disgustingly coated in mayo.  i like mayo but not to the point where that's all you taste with every bite.

the bacon chili cheese tasted no better than something i could have ordered at wienerschnitzel...super salty and the chili tasted nasty like it was "fresh" out of the can.

of all the things we ordered, the best thing was probably the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> but there wasn't anything extraordinary about those either.

honestly, this place is no different than any other fast food joint except that it's highly overrated.  we actually came here after several rounds of mojitos and even then it still didn't taste any good.

wow! best. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. ever!

i forget the name of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i ordered but it was a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, cheese, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and mushrooms (i think it was the ph <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i could be wrong).. a-freakin'-mazing! toppings over load! there were lots of <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> and mushrooms which i much appreciated because most places are so skimpy with the toppings. the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was fat and juicy, just the way i like them ;)
boyfriend got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> with just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrami and mustard - i don't like mustard so i didn't get to try a bite but he said it was good and i'll trust him on that. i can't imagine it being anything amazing like mine though because it just seems so plain!

can't say to much for the service because you wait in line, walk up, order and pick up your food at the next spot so there isn't too much interaction with the employees. but i can say the girl who took my order was very friendly and patience because i still wasn't sure of what i wanted and i didn't feel rushed by her at all.

someone please open a pink's in the bay!!!

i was looking forward to trying this place out all weekend!

after having drinks all day and night, i really wanted something bad.. real bad for me..

i decided to order a <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>.  this had bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> on top of a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  let me tell ya, it was exactly what i was craving.  it was a bit on the salty side though.  i was already dehydrated enough, the bacon was real salty... and i love salty things ;)  other than that, i've never had a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> so yummy and so big!  i couldn't finish it.

the wait wasn't too bad when we came and actually getting our dogs didn't take long either.  i liked the environment, it was fun and exciting.

i'll probably come back here when i have a huge appetite and i haven't done my make-up.  by the end of eating your dog, you've wiped off all the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> that's gotten on your face and your freshly put on make-up!

not much of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan, though their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were in between awesome and a-ok thus three stars. i believe it's more hyped on the celeb advertisement.

overall, the place is cool especially those <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> :)

dear pink's,

  i hate you.  i had one in la and it was ok but i was hoping for better...i'm not sure why i thought it would be better.  i think it's similar to when you see a mcd's ad and you hope your burger looks like the ad but it's the same pile of crap every time.

  the chili was bland and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was not as good as nathan's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

  i'm pretty sure the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> meal looked the same entering and exiting my body!

i go here every time we are in vegas.  this time we got a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> (which is my fave), <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>, and the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> with 2 orders of fries and onions rings for 4 people.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were enough for 4 people to share.  i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was pretty big.  they have outside seating.  they probably have like 6 or 7 tables out there.  
i think on fridays and saturdays they close at 0300 which is good for a early morning snack.  each <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is like under $9 which isnt bad.  they accept credit cards and cash.

yum! we hit up pink's on our first night in vegas. sure, it was 30 bucks for a couple of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and some fries but it's vegas. i had a dog smothered in chili, cheese, onions, mustard and jalapenos. boyfriend had the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. coming from central texas, we expect yumminess when it comes to <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausage. pink's did not disappoint. sure the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was topped with all sorts of delicious stuff but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself was also quite tasty. good stuff!

there's a major difference between eating here after a margarita and eating here before a margarita. i can vouch that eating here after a margarita tastes significantly better.

being sheltered for all my life, i never heard of pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wasn't aware of its popularity until i got here. combined with my love for chili, we ended up ordering chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, nacho chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and the mel b <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

the wait time for it is really short too and it's a really good place to sit underneath their vapor after a party marathon on the strip. i think this place has to be visited on your trip to vegas but i might be incredibly biased by the chili aspect. although the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> are their selling point and i could go on and on about my love for chili, i really thought the winners were the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mustard, cheese, and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>.

i wanted to "like" this place more, but nothing says "no thank you" more than sysco products.

brief summary
-- spin off location from the original pink's in hollywood
-- located on the lv strip & only has outdoor seating
-- not for the cheap of heart
-- say no to the chili or say yes to the toilet
-- bring your own ketchup // condiments

i've seen pink's featured on food network before. so when my friends suggested we go there for lunch, i was down!

luckily we got here right before the huge lunch rush. you can imagine the line getting very long during a busy hour on the lv strip.

--- our order ---
** pinks lemonade (no alcohol) -- it was delicious, get it!

** <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> & <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> -- pass, the chili is definitely the east coast style that is mostly just greasy meat/beef. the cheese didn't taste real, must have been some "sysco" cheese matter. this stuff stuck to my ribs and made me want to "yack" later that night. my tummy was hurting. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was good, i ended up just eating it alone. 

** chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> -- i ate these before <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and they were mostly good because i was so hungry. again the chili is just greasy meat, not really the ranch style chili (if that's what you like).

my biggest complaint about pink's is that they only have sysco ketchup which is very disgusting. it doesn't even taste like tomatoes or ketchup, it just looks like it. on top of that, it's more of a thick paste then a sauce. i seriously wish i could have gotten some heinz!

this place got a 1 star bump for my friend's polish with pastrami that i tasted. although, it was kind of dry and in need of mustard, the flavors were there and it was juicy and hot.

i won't be back here any time soon, but i hope to try the original in hollywood!

i feel like a traitor because i have not tried the one in la (and i'm from la!), but decided to try this in vegas.

i had the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. it looked really good after ordering, but i think the taste was lacking for my expectation. everyone always talks about how great pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are in la, butttt i was kind of expecting to be disappointed when i realized that pink's in vegas was not as obvious of a spot, and there were also not many people ordering. i mean, i guess vegas has hundreds of other eateries besides <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i'm guessing the one in la is better, and i think my next try will be home and not vegas. ):

one word: disgraceful. this rendition of pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was nothing comparable to the one in los angeles. i came here after a long walk on a hot day visiting places on the strip and i was utterly disgusted with my order. i had gotten the <mark>Mushroom Swiss Dog</mark> with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, mushrooms and mayo. first of all, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wiener itself was ordinary, almost as if i bought the pack of ten from a grocery store along with grocery store <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> buns. the mushrooms tasted like rubber canned mushrooms that should be stamped inedible. not only that, but a large dollop of mayo on top of this mess made me want to gag. i immediately regretted my order as i saw it and was even more sad to see $7 go to waste. however, i did really enjoy the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, but only temporarily. the mixture of fake beef and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> did not bode well for any of my friends and i would not recommend coming here when there are plenty of other great places on the strip. yelpers, beware.. false franchising!!

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in las vegas are unique and taste pretty decent.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are large and have decent toppings.  i agree with other reviews that this joint offers crappy toppings for you to put on, which implies to me that they are not always using top ingredients for these top dollar dogs.

this is a place for me to say i ate at, but not something i would go to more than once or twice a year max.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> come with basic long dogs or a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.  the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> is nice and big and tastes pretty good.  i would suggest skipping the "<mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>" as it lacks from what a i would call a true chicago style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> was pretty good as was the majove dog.

overall an a-ok place to eat a fancy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but not something you want to eat at often or more than once a year.  be prepared for a pricey experience with somewhat questionable topping quality.

not that great. had some for myself this time around, and what you see is what you basically get. nothing out of the ordinary, so i dont get what the fuss is all about. i forgot what it was called specifically, but i ordered the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. maybe it was because i felt like shit on the day my friends and i ate here, but the taste got pretty nasty after a few bites. most of us ended up not finishing our food. 

on a brighter note, their <mark>Strawberry Daiquiri</mark> is deliccccccious! the best i'vee had in vegas, hands down. the only thing i would recommend is to freeze it up a little more, mine was kind of watery. taste wise tho, i would have one everyday if i could!

ho hum. i've been to the original in la and this place does not live up to the quality of the mother ship. i had a few mini <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> at johnny small's made with pink's dogs that gave me the taste to try this place,

indifferent staff, pricey dogs, and not so clean space.

had a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> on a nice stale bun. i'll stick to johnny small's or wait for trips to la.

i always heard about pink's & finally got the chance to try it for the first time :)

at first, i was going to be boring & order a regular <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. but since it was my first time, might as well try a specialty!

my friend & i decided to order 2 different specialty dogs & split it so we could have 2 kinds. we ordered the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> & <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> was a bit on the lighter side (compared to the other specialty dogs). i'm not a big bacon person (which was on the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>), but it was quite appetizing. however, it was huge & it fills you up really quick. 

seating is outside under umbrellas. it was kinda nice since it was a shaded area.

customer service was good.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good, but not sure if i'd spend  that much on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> again. worth a try though!

2 of our friends kept raving about this place. so, we came here after we landed and checked in. my sister and i got the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and our friend got 2 <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and fries.

bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> - the chili tasted too mushy, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a good snap to it.
fries -- they were ok.

overall, we weren't wowed by it, but i would return to try something else in the future.

expensive for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>? yess the quality is super top notch tho. they have some exotic toppings. i tried the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and wowwwww so flavorful. omg and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself? it has a great snap to it when you bite into it. the casing is the best i ever seen. i never heard a perfect snap in a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> before until i tried pink's. 

i would give this 5 stars but for the pricey dog, i have to subtract a star.

the seating is outdoors, very limited, under very high powered fans with mist. not really ideal for eating.

husband wanted the lord of the rings dog which was no longer on the menu but they made it for him anyway. so that was nice. i ordered the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. both tasty enough.

i think the price was around $7 for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and $3 for the drinks. 

we split an order of <mark>Onion Ring</mark> with the parents. they are the thick cut rings and the batter was a bit on the sweet side.

overall decent experience for the price but i suspect there are better dogs to be had in chicago.

moderately priced for vegas <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but they're huge!  i think my friend had the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> with chili, and i was eyeing it the whole time.  you can't go wrong with a holy trinity blessed polish: mustard, onions, and sweet relish.

sit back, relax, and enjoy your meal with a cocktail while you stare off into city center and all the twinkling lights around you.  just order a naked polish at 1 in the morning and all is right in your world...

i have been a huge fan of pinks ever since i set foot on brea in la 10+ years ago. i've been to the ph location twice, and it's just not the same. they dont have the spicy <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, which is a must. i had the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> both times here, and i forget each time...they dont make my stomach feel good afterwards. but at the time you're eating it, it's too good to care.

not as many options as the original la stand but also doesn't come with the long line.  the best part about this joint is you can order from inside the ph sports book.  now you can call seat backs, place a bet, and get a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> before the timeouts over.  what could be more fitting than a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> while watching sports?

for the pink newbs:

dog - good meaty flavor with a nice snap to it
chili - delicious rich taste and a smooth texture

make whatever combination of toppings you like mine is

bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, all the fixins, plus sauerkraut.  get a fork its gonna be messy.

a little pricey for a dog but good taste, easy eats, no wait, and convenient if your in the ph sports book.

here goes one of those reviews where i wish i did not have to write. 

i was ecstatic to find out pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is open in vegas. i remembered ordering chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> which turned out horrible. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself tasted like rubber and very chewy. i was disappointed because i really love eating <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. why can't they be good like  the one in la where the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was super scrumptious?

one of the few places that i've been to that actually lived up to the hype. it was soo good, i came here twice. i got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. if it is your first time i suggest you try the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>. i also tried the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, this thing is a beast. you seriously need 3 people to finish the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. definitely a spot to hit up for a quick eat.

definitely delicious. i thought they had waiter service but nope. guess it keeps the prices down. its moderately priced and they have lots of different <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i had the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with mustard. it had a snap to it. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were fresh and not hard and just delicious. unless your extremely hungry stick to just one dog.

i'm from l.a., but i was short on time and was starving to death at the miracle mile shops. i figured... pink's, you can never go wrong. it's my favorite <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint where i'm from. wow they really over-priced these things, and i even snuck a peak out back and they don't use high, or even good quality products here. i mean their ketchup packets are even generic, they couldn't spring for heinz? come on, pinks. anyway, my bf and i decided to play it safe, and cheap because their normal <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> that go for $3 in l.a. are $6! madness! it was ok, but the chili just wasn't as flavorful and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didn't have any snap. the topping were piled on pretty good, but i just didn't think they were fantastic. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, on the other hand, were really good, and freshly made to perfection. the inside is very small, and the outside has about 15 tables, which are kept pretty clean. staff is so-so. they're fast and effective but none of them really looked that happy to be working that night. i would never come back here, because i would much rather go to the l.a. location.

the frozen drinks were appealing to the eyes but not the palate.  the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> were appealing to neither.

we were in a vegas awhile back and just had to try pink's - it was great, they are having fun with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (so many cool toppings to choose from) ... had the chili-<mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  the chili was surprisingly flavorful.  the fries were great too.  it's a fun place to find some good food.;

ehhh.

not sure what all the hype was about.  i guess i had to find out the hard and expensive way that coming here wasn't really worth my time.

these <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are boiled-something i can get at a baseball game.  i prefer a grilled <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that has char-marks and some snap to it when you bite in.  

i ordered the basic <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>; the toppings overpowered the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, there was so much going with this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i couldn't even enjoy it.  i actually ended up eating it with a fork n knife because the massive amounts of toppings tore the bun apart.  that seriously detracts from any <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> experience. 

it was $8 for one <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and a bottle of water.  

do yourself a favor and spend that $8 next door at earl of sandwich...you'll thank me later. 

and remember...its just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!

we ordered the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, the brooklyn <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. we weren't impressed with the food at all. it was very bland and very disappointing.

i love pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in all incarnations, and this one was no different. i thought the prices were reasonable for las vegas, and i enjoyed my <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. the only problem was that the menu seemed abridged from others i've seen, like their weho location and their truck at the orange county fair.

i never thought i'd spend $30 for 3 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but here i am standing at the pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> shop with my jaw dropped at the cash register in vegas. all i could think while i was waiting is that these damn dogs better be fantastic. 

in about 10 minutes my number was called. i got the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (two dogs in one bun) and <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. i tried a bite of all three and none of them wowed me. <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> was topped with cheap <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, onions, bland guac and tomatoes. there wasn't a spice factor in there at all. the vegas strip was similar to the spicy except that it was two dogs, chili  and had jalapenos, i thought this blended together better but still wasn't "omg this is the best $8 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever put in my mouth" type of good. 

overall, i was full but not satisfied.

pink's is located near ph towers so i was finally able to see what the hype was all about!!! it's really small inside, there's no seating area inside, but they have a small patio, so if you come here on a cold/windy night like i did, i'd suggest to take your food to go!

since it was my first time, i asked the girl working there what she'd recommend! she recommended the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, which was definitely one of my favorite! it was huge! the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was also good! i was starving after an hour and a  half of walking the strip and going in and out of casinos, so i was able to finish my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with some chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>!!! the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> will cost you a little over five dollars! but one order is a lot!

why did i go for the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>? i don't like <mark>American Cheese</mark> (it's for hillbillies) and....i don't like chili unless it's in a bowl served by my mother....
sooo....i scraped everything off and i enjoyed the after taste of chili on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

disa opted for the <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark>....(or the heart attack dog) lol but she enjoyed it i believe it was topped with pastrami.

all in all i shouldn't have went crazy....

it's really expensive.....two dogs two drinks was about $20....i'm from chicago...if <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> isn't $1.95....i'm looking for the gold flakes!

i got the groupon ($7 for $15 at pinks) so i took the family. overall the food is great, i had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, knife and fork needed! husband had thepastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> burger, my daughter got the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>, it is huge and very messy. my other daughter got the nacho <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.
the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> them selves are big, very good flavor and a nice snap. the chili is bean free and wonderful on <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, not spicy just good flavor, & how can you go wrong added bacon to anything?? we shared fries very good thin crisp shoesting style and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, nice batter but not as crisp as i would like

pink's is a fun place to eat strip side and people watch. i will warn you its pricey, i added a souvenir cup (the small one $13.50) so after the groupon my check was still $42

after the concert and drinking all that beer, a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> would have hit the spot.  i roll up to pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> expecting a great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> experience and a meal to quiet that growling in my belly...  it wasn't.
it was actually very disgusting.  and some how...2 <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, 1 order of fries, and 2 <mark>Gatorade</mark> cost me $23!  if i went to sonic, it would have been about half that price and taste 5x better.
i got the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> about 4 minutes after my order was completed.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didn't even taste like they were cooked completely, and the chili...well that was the most disgusting part...  the chili tasted like it was just squeezed out of whatever bag it came from and put directly on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  it was pasty and gritty, and was barely warmed up.  and the taste of the chili....well it tasted disgusting!
the fries were okay.  at least they were cooked.  they server those skinny, little, shoe-string fries btw like at steak & shake.
also, no person who worked for the casino had any idea where this place was.  we literally had to just wander around until we found it on our own.
i will never ever go back and try that place again.

i've had pink's in la and ph. the most amazing <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> i dont get anything else...their chili is mouth watering.

my only problem is i wish the vegas location was in a better spot. it's really hard to get to unless your staying in one of the surrounding hotels. maybe that's why they don't have 100+ people in line? it's a little pricy too but well worth it if i was in the area.

after exploring the strip thus far, i noticed a familiar la sign..but in the middle of the strip in vegas at planet hollywood..no way! unlike the la location this place was not so crowded. i knew i had to verify if this was the real deal pinks or not. no way better to test my curiosity than to grab my favorite pinks items, the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. as i was placing my order, i noticed the menu was somewhat different. when i got my food, it looked as delicious as the original in la, but definitely did not taste the same. needless to say of course the hollywood theme hotel would want one of la's famous eateries in their establishment. though it is flattering to bestow such honor upon pinks, the quality of the classic pinks was not there. it is cool to see this out in vegas and they serve alcohol and collectible pinks cups, but it just isn't the same.

i was staying at the cosmo across the street and needed some quick food to fuel the gambling so walk over to pink's. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> i had was delicious and the patio on the strip watching the three card monte game was great. i was trying to figure who was in on the game (the shill, i believe it's called). great fun. great food for what it is.

i'm a big fan of pink's, being from the la area so i was happy to try out the one here in vegas.  i came here with my family and luckily we were able to take advantage of the groupon deal a couple of weeks before.  all 3 of us opted for the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, except i had it with a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> instead of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are loaded with toppings.  the casing around <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> has a nice snap when you bite into it and tastes just as good as the pink's in la.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> are shoestring fries which i happen to looove.  i'm not a fan of fat fries, so these were perfect and crispy.  i'm not sure if the make their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> but those are also fantastic, just the right amount of breading and cooked perfectly.  it was chilly out so i also ordered a <mark>Hot Chocolate</mark> only to find the gal behind the counted mixing up a pouch of the powdered stuff with water.... boo! oh well, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were what we came for and they sure did hit the spot. 

also, you can get a naked dog and add ketchup, mustard, onions, relish and pickles for no charge... yum!

great value for the money.  the outdoor seating can be problematic if it is windy, but the food is decent, and the prices are reasonable, especially considering the location on the strip.

i've tried the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, the brooklyn <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>, chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> so far, and would recommend any of them.

after eating at pink's la twice on a trip a few months ago, i was ecstatic to eat at their vegas location.  hey who am i kidding, i was beyond ecstatic, excited more like it truth be told.

location:  pink's las vegas is one of the numerous eateries at the miracle mile shops at the planet hollywood hotel and casino.  please note that pink's is not located within the miracle mile shops.  the entrance and entire eatery can be accessed only externally from the shops themselves.  if you know where earl of sandwich is located, walk directly to the nearest doors that exit to las vegas blvd and there you will find <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> mecca.

i noticed that 2 things were exactly the same at this location:  the menu, of course, and the line!  the wait time was nowhere near that of the la location, but i really didn't expect that many people to be waiting to be quite honest.

food:  my friend and i both decided to order a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> each and shared a side of fries with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.  

price:  price$ are slightly higher than la......this is vega$ after all.

seating:  all available seating, like the la location, is first come first serve and is all outdoors.  some tables have a covering provided while others do not.

awesome: one of the best things about this location is that.....credit cards, namely visa, mc, and amex are accepted!!  

bottom line:  i'll absolutely be back on a future trip to vegas!

pink's is located right outside the planet hollywood hotel & casino. small inside, however large patio outside. if you haven't tried a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you have to if you're in vegas. it's fast and easy, but not the cheapest. but is anything is vegas cheap?

everything is made to order which is nice; i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with a side of <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. the bacon was crisp, the chili was nice and meaty, but the cheese seemed like liquid <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>...however, the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were fresh. 

my friend's tried the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and they enjoyed that as well.

probably one of the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever eaten.  i had the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and the bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  the line was long, but went fast and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> were served quickly as well.  i'd recommend this place to all my friends when they go to las vegas.

a: im not a pinks fan in general
b: the og one on melrose gets way too ass packed and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> aren't worth the wait. 
c: the universal citywalk one is better b/c suddenly <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are proportionate to the wait (its usually a short line and the prices aren't super high despite being at citywalk) 
and last and probably least.....
d: here there is a longish line and......different quality dogs and no spicy <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>? no spicy polish??? one of their classic top selling dogs??? i wouldnt bother...

i have been to pinks a few times in los angeles but this is my first time here in vegas. compared to back home, which is in la, i think i'll choose the one in la. but since my boyfriend never had pinks in either location, i decided to pop his pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> cherry. whoa that sounded a little inappropriate lol. but here goes:

my boyfriend ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which is loaded with bacon, cheese, mushroom, and err did i mention bacon?! and i ordered the pastrami britain dog which is just a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> and pastrami. holy moly, the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> is monstrous compared to my <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. if you put then next to each other, it looks like umm you know what evolving. boy becomes a man. haha. since the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> and the bacon overload was too much for the buns, it looked quite messy. well, with two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, a side of fries, and a coke... our total was $18. bull!

pros:
-short line... fast food
-addicting fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>
-good portion... very filling for me especially the fries
-opens late so it's good for after clubbing or unless you're a fatty like me and wants to have a midnight dinner err snack..
-they sell jello shots here

cons:
-even though the line is short, it's so boring. i like that rush of excitement where you see people all hyped up about it order a ton of food and end up not finishing it
-very greasy... made my buns soggy 
-overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i can get at costco for only $1.50 with a free drink
-outdoor seatings only
-my boyfriend wasnt satisfied so it made me look bad. i have to take him to the one in la

never quite had the patience to stand in line in la for this place - tried 2x and gave up before the line even curved towards the front. sorry, but i'll only wait in line for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>'s in chicago. we're in vegas, there's a pink's here (right in front of the planet hollywood hotel), there was no line, and i figured it was worth a shot. i had the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> - <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself was very good - well spiced, no "weird bits", and nice snap. the chili tasted fine, but the texture was gluey and kind of unappetizing. i ended up taking most of it off the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. husband had the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. great flavor, but the skin was a bit tough. the fries were great though. overall, 3 stars. would come back if in the mood for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but not a destination place.

went to my first pink's of any kind today. heading into the first bite, i definitely did have high expectations, mainly because i was hungry, and also because the prices looked pretty darn high, even after accounting for the recent groupon deal. however, keep in mind that this in in the heart of the las vegas strip, so really you'd almost expect it to be pricey. it's not fair to compare this to costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on price.

when i tried my friend's <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, my eyes, taste <mark>Bud</mark>, and probably everything else just lit up. yeah, hunger is the best sauce or whatever, but every component of that dog - bun, sausage, chili, and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> - was really delicious and made me wish that i had chosen it. instead, i had gone with the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which was also quite tasty with bacon and some sort of enhanced 'shrooms. i also loved the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, which is fatter than the normal wiener, and the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> went surprisingly well with the rest of the ingredients.

we also shared some deluxe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which had a crapload of toppings on them. in hindsight, if i had known how loaded the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> would be, i would've ordered normal fries for about half the price because my friend was pretty much evacuating his toppings onto the fries. oh well, live and learn.

anyway, i've seen the other reviews, and i'm sure it doesn't match everything that people like about the original pink's - which i still hope to go to some day - but it's still good eating. not considering the price, the only problem i have is that i'd rather go to earl of sandwich, which is right next door and which i love to death, so i might not really see this place much at all in the future. oh well, it was yummy knowing you.

this should probably be a 3.5 star review - but since you can't do that, and i can't give pink's a 4 star review, i'm going with the 3. i ended up ordering a chili-<mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a dog with mustard, sauerkraut and relish. although not the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had, i do have to say that they were probably the most filled <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i've ever had. there was almost a bowl full of chili on the chili-<mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and a pot full of kraut on the other dog. so if you're hungry, i would definitely go here. i had to eat both of my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (didn't finish them..lol..) with a fork and knife - there is that much stuff on them. if you aren't starving, do yourself a favor and order one <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. also, if you want to have fries - you can split an order amongst 3 people - they're huge. but, size doesn't always equate to quality, and the quality of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is just a little lacking (not much though).

i've always heard about pink's while living in colorado and i actually discovered it by watching the travel channel best eats show. the location in atlanta is the prime location for pink's but the one out here in vegas is on point as well! i had my very first experience 5 days ago and ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and and corona to wash it down. needless to say i smashed it! lol but it was so much food i didn't know where to begin and take my first bite. whatever you do bite high and at an angle or it'll be all over the place. then bite low at an angle on the 2nd bite, and repeat! my new favorite place to get a quick bite :-)

the variety of toppings you can have on your <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is pretty amazing (i.e. the different types you can get)....bacon on top, pastrami, etc... weird.... but not too shabby. i wasn't adventurous to try the ones with bacon on them, but adventurous to try a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> instead of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. haha $7 for a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and i thought it was not bad at all. the portion was decent, lots of mayo (which i love) and they did not skimp on the mushrooms. i have to say though, if the mushrooms were grilled, it would've received more stars for me because non-<mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark> just don't taste the same. 

however, if you just want a quick bite to carry you onto your next activity, this is not a bad stop.

while playing tourist this weekend, we decided to try pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and see what the buzz was about (and we had a groupon, so that helped influence the decision).

the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> was huge.  holy crap, i wasn't really expecting that large of a dog, but i guess that is why they are $7+.

everything was fresh and pretty good.  not super great to make me want to go back immediately, but wouldn't turn it down if someone in town wanted me to stop in with them.

pink's serves a good dog. but with all the hype i expected more. the toppings are unique and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are good sized, but at $8/$9 a pop they should be. thanks to groupon, the wife and i have been here twice in the last month. both times we waddled away very content. we had a variety of dogs, <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, and even a pastrami/<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> burrito. all very good. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are thick and crunchy. i'm a great fan of windy city beefs-n-dogs on lake mead, so i'm not sure if i will be back, but it was fun trying pink's out.

first off, this is nothing like the pinks in la. i've been living in san diego for a year now, after having lived in la and i miss pinks. so when i was in vegas and saw pinks on the strip i got really excited. as soon as i walked in, i should have known. this place is everything pink and looks like a retro 50's diner. this caught me off guard considering the real pinks is basically a rundown bungalow covered in photographs and the only thing that's actually pink is the sign out front. next was the menu. i didn't recognize a single 'special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>'. the original pinks special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> either have a la themed name or are named after a celebrity. the pinks in las vegas has special dogs named with a las vegas theme. so i had to ask the girl at the front counter if they knew which dogs were renamed and which dog was the martha stewart dog. she had a list behind the counter that listed which special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were renamed but she told me that most of their special dogs were not their own creations, not renamed dogs from the original location. uhhhh... ok. so basically this pinks is a completely different restaurant with the name pinks slapped on.

now for the food. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (with a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> subbed for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>) with mustard and a side of fries, totally $13 and some odd cents. i waited a few minutes and my order number was called. i went to retrieve my food and got really confused as soon as i saw the <mark>French Fries</mark> which are nothing like the la pinks <mark>French Fries</mark>. i made a comment to the person who gave me my food about it looking nothing like food from the original pinks, and a woman, also from la, walked up behind me and said the same. 

so was the food good? yeah, it was decent. but not worth the 13 bucks i spent on it. the shoe-string fries were nothing like the cajun fries (that the la pinks serves) i was expecting but the were good nonetheless. worth the $5.99 i paid for them? no. but that's what you get for eating on the strip. the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was pretty good and the chili was... not so flavorful. but overall i'm glad i tried it.

the verdict: if you're on the strip near planet hollywood and craving <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, this is probably the best you'll find. however, if you're a lover of the original pinks and have your heart set on your usual order, don't come here. you'll leave with a craving that wasn't curbed, disappointed, and with a wallet that weighs less than when you walked in.

call me cheap, but without a deal, i would not have come to pink's on my own account, knowing it's hyped, mediocre, and over-priced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. luckily, i used a groupon deal that allowed me to try pink's at an affordable price.

the stand is located outside the miracle mile shops, with no access from the planet hollywood casino. we learned that the hard way. -_-

i ordered the brooklyn pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. i like keeping my dogs plain, and dressed with mustard. so i enjoyed this dog, but would have liked it even more if the pastrami came out hot, rather than lukewarm.

i also sampled some of the bf's <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark> (2 dogs, bacon, chili, cheese, onions). we ordered <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> without onions, but it came out standard, so he brought it back to have it re-made. the cook was nice about it, probably because there was hardly a line at 4 pm, and served up a new one within 3 minutes, spit-free! it was interesting... glad we tried, but wouldn't order it again. it is also best eaten with the wrapper, because the burrito drips chili grease... yum!

with our $15 groupon, we had to fork out a whopping $0.52. overall, $7.52... i would not mind paying that price, but $15.52 is a bit steep for 2 dogs. i'd rather use that money to buy 2 sammiches from earl's inside. i'll be back once i get my hands on another deal!

i had the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> for ~11 with a 10% off coupon. 

- love the chili! enjoyed that there were no big beans. 
- fries were crispy, thin and addicting. 
- dog is juicy. great flavor. 
- expensive, but understandable. popular. taste is justified but price is slightly too much even with a discount.
- seating stinks. smokers. 

^___^!!

meh. i've experienced better... exactly what i was thinking!

after all the hype i've heard about the famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in la, i seriously thought i would have been blown away by the experience... maybe its because of the hype that shot my expectations through the roof, but wouldn't you think with all the hype, it should at least make me want to come back for more? 

but i'm the kind of girl that always gives a place the benefit of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, perhaps i ordered something not-so-amazing on the menu -- the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark>, i honestly thought this was a pretty good choice!! equipped with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrami, mustard, <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> & sauerkraut... i mean its not the fattiest of the bunch, but lets be honest the scorching hot weather was taking a negative toll on my appetite. regardless of my choice, i had the chance to have a bite of a few others -- the planet hollywood, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>... nothing really sang to me ya know? in other words, i was hoping for more, something more memorable and amazing rather than just a meal to fill me up. i think i'll give the la pink's a chance, but if that doesn't change my mind, who knows what will.

great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!  their reputation preceded them because i've heard about how famous pink's is in los angeles and i was happy to see that there was one so close to the bellagio.

i went with a friend of mind around noon.  pinks is right in front of planet hollywood adjacent to the street.  the wait when we got there was only a few minutes but since it was 105 degrees, it was a little uncomfortable.

i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, a drink, and the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  the total came out to be just under $17 which is a little steep, but i guess it is to be expected in las vegas.  

when the food came, i immediately thought, "how am i supposed to fit this in my mouth." (insert that's what she said joke)   there was a normal sized <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> underneath a mountain of bacon, tomatoes, onions, and chili.  i literally could not pick it up unless i risked having all the insides falling off of my plate.  i had to grab a knife and fork to tackle the foot long an inch at a time.  it tasted fantastic and i could feel my eyes getting heavier immediately from the food induced coma the meat from the chili was putting me in.

after i finished my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> filled with 3 slices of bacon goodness, i was very stuffed.  i'm usually one with a decent size appetite but the high fatty food filled me up quick. ...and then there were the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> to deal with.  it looked as though the workers used a bucket to pour on the chili since there was so much of it and i knew immediately that i had to take it to go and offer it as communal fries.  the few bites i could squeeze into my already full stomach were delicious.  the texture and the size of the fries were crispy and thinner than traditional fries but it worked.  

its definitely worth a try and i would totally go to pink's again.

just ate there a few days ago. not really a <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> that i love, but they have crazy toppings . the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was good.

pink's is pink's
a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>
i got the chi style dog
this was not an og chi dog
i have been to chi
<mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> not have lettuce on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, they put a whole pickle (not relish) and they add a whole chili pepper
this did not happen
did i eat it?
yes
3 stars (absolutely no wait)

this is not chicago
this is las vegas
that is not the eiffel tower
nor is that the empire state building

so it's not a real <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, it's a replica.....like everything in vegas.

this bad review is my fault.  i am a terrible person, but i came here and ordered a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> with gauc.  before i lose 100% credibility as a meat eater, i have to say that i had been in vegas for days already eating nothing but greasy greasy food...burgers fries and alcohol.  i don't think i had pooped since i got to vegas...i'm serious, and the thought of trying a delicious <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> would probably make me puke.

it i were to go right now, i would have gotten the biggest meatiest delicious thing there.  but i have to review my guac <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>.

i've eaten a fair share of <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark> and dogs, so that being said it wasn't bad.  my issue was that the consistency was off, not super off like terrible, but i've had better.  the guac was not that good.  it wasn't like chipotle or home made, but it was some like green spread that was thin and kind of looked like bird shit honestly.  taste wise, it wasn't bad though.  i ate it and stole pastrami off my boyfriends for more flavor.  so, if you're in vegas feeling as i was, try to get a salad with bacon instead of a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> at pinks.

came here on a friday morning, may 11, 2012.

$6 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is not bad when you see how much they really stack on the condiments (chili, onions, tomatoes)... and that it's vegas.  i never had one at the original location in hollywood, so i can't tell you how they compare, if they're any different at all.  the pink's at planet hollywood, though, i'll say i'm a fan of.  the cole slaw was mediocre, but it did make me feel healthier for balancing out the grease i ingested.

the complaints about the firmness of the bun are spot-on -- you will need a fork to eat your <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.

glancing along the right side of the page reveals a lot of 2- and 3-star reviews and i think it's largely due to unmet expectations.  let me enlighten you: come if you want something quick and greasy to fill up with, and don't want to stand in line at earl's.

(no, i did not mention stellar service, nor did i mention cute decor).

worth making a trek to if you're on the opposite side of the strip?  (30-minute cab on summer weekends?)  no way!  unless you're craving a decent <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  if i'm in the area, this is another spot on my go-to list.
