i was very happy that they have a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at planet hollywood! there was no line and not crowded! i would never wait in line for 3 hours in hollywood location! so i got to try world famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! very good location outside miracle mile, walking distance from our hotel cosmopolitan.

very cute place decorated in pink color, there is a wall full of celebrities photos. i was glad they had veggie and turkey <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

a solid 3.5 star, $40 for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, one fries, one <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>, one <mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark> with souvenir cup. 

veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Chopped Tomato</mark>: not much flavor, but it was not bad with mustard sauce and tomatoes 
<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mushrooms and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>: fairly delicious 
fries: not bad
corn dog: good 

<mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark>: yummy

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were good, but not great, veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> needed to wait a bit longer to get my order, other orders were fast. i guess we should've ordered pink's secret recipe chilly on top, that would make our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> more tasty, or add more toppings and sauces. it is a bit pricey for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> though, but it's famous so it's ok i guess. 

i didn't think the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were great, but they were not bad either. i like this fast food place a lot because of the cute decor, and outdoor seats, good view and people watching on the strip, there were some cute little birds walking around, they were fun to watch. so we will go back again for snacks or quick bite. :)

"it's a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>."
"but it's from pink''s!"
"it's. a. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>." 

i ordered the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>, and while i enjoyed it, was it really worth the $6? probably not, considering it's just a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it's basically like paying $2 for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and $4 for the famous name. and if it's not even the original hollywood stand, what's the point? definition of a tourist trap. 

i suppose i would recommend everyone to try it once, and don't try to be healthy. lather on the <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, cheese, chili, ect because if you're going to wait an obscene amount of time for a $6-$8 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you might as well go all out. it might help if you were a little tipsy as well to cushion the realization of the resources you are exhausting for minimal nutritional value. hey, it's vegas. luckily for myself, i barely beat the lunch rush, was able to walk up and order, and got my dog in just a few minutes. but the line a few minutes later was crazy! unfortunately for me though, it was also december and freezing outside. none of your $6 goes toward any indoor seating. 

i've always believed las vegas embodies the best and worst things about america, all in one place. such as greasy, overpriced "famous" food. case in point.

pinks... you've done it again. i told you, i can't see you anymore. it's too good. your too good...

instead of trying to get the craziest <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the menu, i decided to go with <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> which was amazing. (it wasn't the alcohol talking either, it was sober by that time already!) 
i just checked the online menu but doesn't seem to exist on the main site. it might be a special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> just at the vegas pinks (can anyone at the la pinks confirm this?)

it had onions, relish, sauerkraut and diced tomatoes over a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> smothered with the perfect amount of <mark>Sour Cream</mark>. it is highly recommended. 
i gave pinks lower than 5 stars in the past. this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> just brought it up to a 5! 

please try <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>!

missing a few small features from the original in la, but close enough. the guadalahara dog is always killer. if you dont know how good <mark>Sour Cream</mark> is on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you better find out and pass on the word! the original does not serve vegas crap like corn dog bites or even fountain drinks, only cans and bottles of root beer. but guess they has to make some changes for lv. but overall food was great, but i wish my sister could have experienced it the same way i did in cali. incase your having trouble finding it, its right next to pbr bar on the ground level of ph facing the strip. outdoor misters on the patio.

we came here since we had the groupon for 5 jello shots.  i got the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, my jello shots, and we split some fries smothered in chili, cheese sauce, <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, onions, and tomato.  the chili is really freakin good!  i loved my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  and the fries were amazing!  the portion was huge, plenty split between three people.  the jello shots came in grape, berry, and lime.  they were so gross!  probably because they were 13% alcohol.  i did not enjoy them but had to do it anyways.

pink's is... okay.

overpriced? definitely.
filling? not so much.

even though you get a plethora of toppings, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> meat is very thin and not satisfying. it's like any <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you can buy at the grocery store and cook yourself. same thing for the bun, i swore i've had the same cheap ones from safeway and they didn't even bother to toast it.

i ordered the showgirl, which came with bacon, <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, tomatoes, onions, and some relish. the bacon was pretty bad, super thin and way too salty. and halfway through eating it, a pigeon took a huge dump on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. luckily they were nice about it and willing to replace my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>... but they really need to put umbrellas over all their tables. 

i'd skip this place and go for in-n-out.

omg so this place is better than words can even describe! i know i had no business ending up here last weekend but i'm sure glad i did! i've always wanted to try this place out! after a long night of having fun and gambling a group of my friends stumbled across this place! sometimes there are certain foods that taste even better when your drunk and this place happens to be one if them! i ordered the vegas style <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> and added <mark>Sour Cream</mark>! a bit messy and kind of expensive for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> meal but it was worth every penny spent :-) the fact that they offer a huge variety of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> styles means i will be returning until i've tried all the ones i'd like to try!

i wanted to see what the fuss was all about with pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.   

the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> at planet hollywood was   awesome.  it was just loaded with tomato,  cheese,chili, <mark>Sour Cream</mark> and onions. the chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was a difficult task just trying to keep it together while eating it.  it was good but nothing special! not really  worth the $8.50? it's on the strip so i'm not going to complain on the price.

so yeah, we spent about $16 on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and a drink .  sounds expensive, but now at least i got to experience what  pink's has to offer, just wish i knew what all the excitement was about  maybe next time i'll give their <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark> a try.  looks really yummy! 

it was alright!

dish_name: Mustard, Ketchup, Raw Onions, Bbq Sauce, Jalapenos & Pickles

text:
i visited this pinks at about 2am after drinking alll day. for some reason a burger with coleslaw and mustard sounded amazing. too bad the cole slaw at pinks is soooo gross. it has almost no flavor and its just not good. the slaw is chopped up all funky...not uniformish...i hated it. needed salt and a lil sugar...it was like mayo salad vomit.

the burger patty was fine. my friends got turkey <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and i tried that...it was good.

the fried something we had...i think it was <mark>French Fries</mark> were good. 

the whole set up of this place is a narrow hallway...you can barely read the menu. its about 4ft between the wall and the counter. then there is an assembly line of cooks and at the end is a soda fountain.

i guess its a good place to go cause its open late and they have a lot of options.

i came to the strip to hang out with some friends i haven't seen in a while. since i live in la, i know pink's and introduced them to it and they love it. some of those friends have since moved away from la and are deprived of the pink's that they have come to love. well upon hearing that there was one in vegas, one of my friends was so happy because she was totally anticipating it and hyping it to her husband. 

well we found it outside on the strip by p.f. chang's at the planet hollywood casino. there was no line. not a good sign, but we thought that the pink's name that we know and love in la would suffice so no worries. 

we all ordered our dogs and sides of <mark>French Fries</mark> and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. the orders came back rather quickly and we proceeded out to the patio to sit and eat. 

so how was it? not very good. the toppings were cold and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was limp and just didn't ooze of the flavor and kick that the la spot has. it's also more expensive here even without the wait. and one of my friends wanted a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> she had in la, but they changed the names to fit the vegas theme and lacked the same kick in la. and the husband? he was less than impressed with the place. we ended up being belligerent and threw the fries at each other rather than eat it. 

all in all, disappointed with the experience in vegas. again, the nonexistent line should have been a clue. not impressed. they really have to overhaul the place to make it match la's! my friends and i gladly wait in line and are satisfied in la. here, not so much. disappointed to say the least.

i had the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> without onions and was a little disappointed that the chili did not contain beans.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> were nice and crispy.  i made the mistake of eating outside on a cold december day, so my food cooled off quickly; i think it may have been better warm.  overall, i thought the food was good, but not worthy of all the hype.

we were at planet hollywood and really wanted to try out pink's.. i decided on a classic <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with raw onions, ketchup & mustard. the boyfriend got this crazy concoction of 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in a tortilla, chili, cheese, bacon, onions and we got some <mark>French Fries</mark> to share. the <mark>French Fries</mark> were really good! the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good as well but i think i prefer nathans. the boyfriend really liked his weird meal, i took a bite and thought it was interesting. the chili was really good and i don't really even like chili. 

they only have outdoor seating which was fine since it was cool outside but would probably suck in the summertime. 

if you like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> give it a shot!

i go here every time we are in vegas.  this time we got a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> (which is my fave), <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>, and the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> with 2 orders of fries and onions rings for 4 people.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were enough for 4 people to share.  i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was pretty big.  they have outside seating.  they probably have like 6 or 7 tables out there.  
i think on fridays and saturdays they close at 0300 which is good for a early morning snack.  each <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is like under $9 which isnt bad.  they accept credit cards and cash.

their <mark>French Fries</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are amazing! extremely crunchy and crispy, really on point. i enjoy their coleslaw but i can also understand why others wouldnt. 

oh yeah, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>..they are decent, perfectly salted.

i'm a big fan of pink's, being from the la area so i was happy to try out the one here in vegas.  i came here with my family and luckily we were able to take advantage of the groupon deal a couple of weeks before.  all 3 of us opted for the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, except i had it with a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> instead of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are loaded with toppings.  the casing around <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> has a nice snap when you bite into it and tastes just as good as the pink's in la.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> are shoestring fries which i happen to looove.  i'm not a fan of fat fries, so these were perfect and crispy.  i'm not sure if the make their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> but those are also fantastic, just the right amount of breading and cooked perfectly.  it was chilly out so i also ordered a <mark>Hot Chocolate</mark> only to find the gal behind the counted mixing up a pouch of the powdered stuff with water.... boo! oh well, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were what we came for and they sure did hit the spot. 

also, you can get a naked dog and add ketchup, mustard, onions, relish and pickles for no charge... yum!

it's pink's. it's fast. it's cheap food on the strip.

there was absolutely no line when we walked in on a tuesday night for pre-clubbing eats. it does however make me wonder why the one back in la always has a long line?

i like that their menu specifies that their <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark> is vegan. it's $6.79. it's decent. i added guacamole to mine: http://su.pr/96msdn

$1.79 is a lot for guacamole. but i feel like the burger would've sucked without it.

i bet it would taste even better with <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark> but i would have to pay another $1.49 to add that.

i guess it's kinda cool that they serve jello shots. even though vegan me didn't have one, my friends paid $20 for six shots and it came with free <mark>French Fries</mark>: http://su.pr/5talb6

first off, this is nothing like the pinks in la. i've been living in san diego for a year now, after having lived in la and i miss pinks. so when i was in vegas and saw pinks on the strip i got really excited. as soon as i walked in, i should have known. this place is everything pink and looks like a retro 50's diner. this caught me off guard considering the real pinks is basically a rundown bungalow covered in photographs and the only thing that's actually pink is the sign out front. next was the menu. i didn't recognize a single 'special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>'. the original pinks special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> either have a la themed name or are named after a celebrity. the pinks in las vegas has special dogs named with a las vegas theme. so i had to ask the girl at the front counter if they knew which dogs were renamed and which dog was the martha stewart dog. she had a list behind the counter that listed which special <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were renamed but she told me that most of their special dogs were not their own creations, not renamed dogs from the original location. uhhhh... ok. so basically this pinks is a completely different restaurant with the name pinks slapped on.

now for the food. i ordered a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (with a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> subbed for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>) with mustard and a side of fries, totally $13 and some odd cents. i waited a few minutes and my order number was called. i went to retrieve my food and got really confused as soon as i saw the <mark>French Fries</mark> which are nothing like the la pinks <mark>French Fries</mark>. i made a comment to the person who gave me my food about it looking nothing like food from the original pinks, and a woman, also from la, walked up behind me and said the same. 

so was the food good? yeah, it was decent. but not worth the 13 bucks i spent on it. the shoe-string fries were nothing like the cajun fries (that the la pinks serves) i was expecting but the were good nonetheless. worth the $5.99 i paid for them? no. but that's what you get for eating on the strip. the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was pretty good and the chili was... not so flavorful. but overall i'm glad i tried it.

the verdict: if you're on the strip near planet hollywood and craving <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, this is probably the best you'll find. however, if you're a lover of the original pinks and have your heart set on your usual order, don't come here. you'll leave with a craving that wasn't curbed, disappointed, and with a wallet that weighs less than when you walked in.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> filling my dirty vegas fantasies. just kidding! not really. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are my guilty pleasure and when i'm wasted on the strip, i can't resist.  they have so many different choices and mine is the showgirl. so good and they top those babies off well! also, the <mark>French Fries</mark> are on point. they're thin and perfectly crispy. add some cheese and you're in heaven.

do get their <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, which showcases all the ingredients you can load up on for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to scream supreme!

this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> spot is conveniently located near walgreens, semi-corner of planet hollywood - on the outside.  the staff brings <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> out when ready.

their <mark>French Fries</mark> were fried and textured delightfully. 

if you are craving for some <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, this spot is the place to be!

luckily we did not have to see a kardashian there. ;^) 

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are extra long, and skinnier than a chicago-dog guy is used to eating. 

the meat is very tasty, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> have a good, crisp casing that makes each bite "pop" when you break the casing. 

the menu contains a huge list of "celebrity" dogs, one assumes that each is catered to the taste of the given celeb. these combinations range from "sounds good" to "absurd". 

i like my dogs two ways, if it is a <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> then it's "through the garden". any other dog i like with just yellow mustard and sweet relish.  

since the pink's dogs are made to have tons of ingredients heaped on them, the bun is oversized, providing twice the amount of bread than you need for the relatively skinny little dog hidden underneath. 

my dog came with about a cup (4 oz) of relish on it!! i scraped off most of it and then ate what was a very tasty dog. 

the <mark>French Fries</mark> are perfect - they had a nice crispy exterior with a wonderful almost creamy interior, perfectly cooked and a nice big serving - enough for two.  great potato flavor and not greasy. they are a nice size, about 3/8" square, which also helps the perfect cook and flavor. 

the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. wow.  the best i have ever eaten - and i don't say that lightly! they remind me of my grandfathers rings he served at carnivals in the 60s when he had a corn dog wagon he took around to fairs. 

the batter appears to be some sort of beer batter, and it is crunchy and crisp and melts in your mouth. the onions are sweet and perfectly cooked, tender....perfect. 

i hate it when you get an <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and take a bite only to pull out half of an undercooked onion that flops down on your chin, splashing hot grease and water on your shirt. not going to happen at pinks! 

the serving size on the rings was again more than enough to share for two. 

i am going with a 3 star, just because the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> should be the star here, and it really is not - the sides are some of the best you are going to find, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are tasty. 

price wise, it is a little high for a dog and fry place, but the location i went to is vegas and, well, you know. 

very enjoyable, casual place to stop and people watch on the strip just outside of planet hollywood.

way overpriced for some tiny dogs, but they're pretty good. i haven't eaten the one in los angeles yet, so i need to give that a try. once i go to la, i will definitely update this review. 

getting it to go is such a mess!! we had no choice but to and the huge stack of napkins totally helped. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> basically exploded in the bag and it was messy for sure.

come to pinks for <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, not the fries or <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. they are soo greasy that i felt like a tub of lard eating just one ring!

i had lunch here monday with several friends.

<mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>: 3.5/5
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>: 3.5/5
service: 3.5/5
ambience: 2/5

definitely not the awesome experience that i had with the pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i tried in la.  the place in planet hollywood is of course cleaner and newer.  but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i ordered (with pastrami, <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> and mustard) was nothing special.  what i thought was surprisingly good were their <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.

my friends that i went to eat with all had similar reactions. (one ordered the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>-based dog, which he said was overcooked and dried).

maybe it is new and they are still trying to get up to speed, but just under $8 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! not including any beverage, that is totally not worth going back to try again, no matter how much i miss the pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from la.

i do not normally eat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i love a good bratwurst or italian sausage.

between the four of us we had four <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausage dishes, plus a burger, the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, and chili-fries.

we expected the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausages to be of great quality, but we found them to be lacking in flavor.     i would have given the restaurant 1 star, but bumped them up to two stars for the following:
- the bacon on my planet hollywood was amazing (but everything else in it was blah)
- the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were very tasty (the chili-<mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> on the other hand were not).
- when they messed up our order, they quickly corrected it and additionally let us keep the sausage plate that we hadn't ordered.
- my friends said that unlike <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, the burger was actually quite tasty

for me, i think the sausages that one finds at an outdoor fair have much better taste/quality than what i found at pinks.   

i recalled the meals being much better at the one in l.a......was that  because after waiting an hour in line in the cold in l.a. anything they served me would have tasted good?   i don't know, but i know i won't be returning to the vegas pink's.

i had the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> (figured i should counter all the grease and calories with the lettuce, tomato, and relish that comes on this dog), almost like a mini salad on top of my <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>! it was ok except for the fact that my bun completely fell apart, thus defeating the purpose of eating a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. my friend had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, which i had a bite of and really enjoyed. the bacon added just the right amount of salty goodness. the fries here were really tasty, and although we didn't order <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, almost every other table around us had them so i'm guessing they're popular. 

what is nice about this place is its location on the strip and the outdoor seating. a great place to people-watch and enjoy the weather. as a sun-starved seattleite, it was nice to be able to get some vitamin d and uv rays in since most of our vegas cavorting usually happens at night.

if you want yummy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries, or just some hangover food that hits the spot, i'd recommend. if you're a tourist in vegas and are trying to experience pink's in the city of sin, this surely isn't it. too clean, too friendly, too flashy. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and dirtiness, and hour-long wait in line that you'll find at the original pink's in la is what makes it special, for better or for worse.

perhaps i can't write a completely accurate review because i was sharing a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and hamburger with a lame person who only wanted <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and sauteed mushrooms on the burger  (seriously?? no effing beef chili, no cheese, no nothing!?  jesus).  but just based off the actual <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and hamburger, they weren't great. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wasn't the juicy, thick tube of meat i was anticipating.  instead, it was a thin, dry, floppy thing that looked like one of those balloons you tie into animals.  

the hamburger wasn't much better - pretty overcooked.  the fries, however, were decent - crispy, fresh and hot.  i didn't get the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, but they looked like they could have been pretty good too.

for the price of $9-$11 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it may be steep. but hey its vegas!!!

id at least try it once and be sure to get the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.

best part is - people watching. tables on patio on the strip.

i guess i march to the beat of my own drummer because i for one really like pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!  i've gone here a couple of times and i can't go wrong ordering their naked dog (plain/no toppings) and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.  slather on some ketchup and mustard on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and dip my beer battered <mark>Onion Ring</mark> into some <mark>Ranch Dressing</mark> and i'm good to go!  

fyi there is a menu inside next to the cash register listing a few items that i suppose they only sell at their vegas location.  i believe that they are the mel b, kim kardashian, and holly madison dogs.  (i might be forgetting one.)  they have less going on than the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that are listed on the main menu, and had i known at the time about those <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i might have given one of them a try.  it would be a great idea to put them on the main menu so that everyone waiting in line can see.  after you've spent minutes finally deciding on one <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you don't want to have to re-think your decision after seeing this menu and therefore then holding up the line!

p.s. i spy carnita in one of the pictures of pink's.

i tried the popular <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>. both were pretty good but extremely messy. the guadalajara had too much <mark>Sour Cream</mark> on it. the fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were awesome - definitely complimented the meal. my friends tried some other dogs, they were wrapped up in soft tortillas and stuff. they had mixed reviews but i would suggest sticking to a regular bun. service was pretty quick and they have a small outdoor section to sit. i think they open late enough, one night we were starving and drunk or something and needed something like this to hit the spot, unfortunately it was closed already.

the guy pushing his <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stand probably makes better dogs than this place. it just had too much going on and seemed like they were trying too hard. call me old fashioned but i didn't care too much for these "gourmet" dogs. also, their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were way too greasy and burnt for my liking.

being a huge travel channel fan, i have often seen pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the shows featured on there. luckily it was right in my hotel, planet hollywood. i was able to try the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (minus the mustard & onions), fries, and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. the fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were really good and the chili on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had great flavor to it!

minus 2 stars for how slow the line moves and the higher than usual prices (but i guess it's expected since it is right on the strip).

stopped here for lunch after hearing all the hype about the la location.

after waiting in a bit of a line, we ordered and snagged a table in the shade. as a pale irish east coaster, it was almost a deal breaker that there was no inside seating since i fry to a crisp in the sun. so that's where one star went.

i had a holly madison naked dog, which is basically a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> overloaded with ketchup, and it was great. i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with casing so they snap when you bite into them, so i loved pink's dogs. my husband at the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and said it was great. <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were solid, too.

the only downside is that it's super pricey, even by strip standards as far as i'm concerned. that's where the other star went. but it was a fun place for lunch, nonetheless!

i'm an la native and my first experience at pinks was in las vegas, go figure. lol

on a sunday afternoon in the middle of july, the boyfriend's friend decided he wanted to eat at pinks, so pinks we went.
pinks as you may know is located just outside of planet hollywood.
very small with a small outdoor seating section, which i did not enjoy too much because it was about 110 degrees outside.

boyfriend mentioned that the price was a little more expensive than the la location.
we stood in line for about 15 minutes out in the sun. 
boyfriend ordered a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that had pastrami, jalapeno, and guacamole ( i forgot the name). he enjoyed it 
i ordered the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> which had chili and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>. it was good but nothing too special, i guess i should have ordered one of their specialties.
we also ordered the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> which were yummmy! greasy and big! =p
not bad, but not great. i guess i'll give it another try, but at the la location instead. i wouldn't go back to the las vegas location though, because of where it's located and the fact that the price is higher than the la location.

wanting for many years to visit the hollywood location, i jumped at the chance to finally taste one of these famous dogs albeit in the planet hollywood in las vegas. it probably isn't the same experience, but hey, it was a pretty good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. it's located right on the strip, outside of the planet hollywood hotel and casino. there is a gated off area outside to sit and eat that is cooled by mist fans. it was still hot, but i was enjoying my dog too much to care.

i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. it was a mouth watering experience with the popping <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> casing, to the beefy flavor, the addition of chili, and the paramount additive that is crispy bacon. the crusty sweet <mark>Onion Ring</mark> put it all over the top. honestly on this trip, this was probably the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i had. the other being from nathan's in ny ny (http://www.yelp.com/biz/nathans-famous-hot-dogs-las-vegas), but i'm sure it was a result of the fashion in which it was prepared (i.e. griddle which is best vs hot rollers).

yeah, i didn't see any hollywood stars but who cares. i was there for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was really good.

i've been here twice now (the second time hoping that it would be better) but of course, it wasn't any better the second time around. firstly, the pink's in la is wayyyyy better. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were semi-cold. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was only decent. i ordered the mushroom swiss and the mushrooms were rubbery and cold. the second time i ordered the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (?) it was much better but still only ok. overall, don't expect la pink's quality and if there is a huge line, it's definitely not worth the wait.

it's kind of sad how i live in l.a. and never tried pink's down here but yet i go and eat at the pink's in vegas. yeahhh, well i was on vacation thats why haha. anywho, my boyfriend and i wanted to do a little shopping at miracle mile shops and eat some lunch before our drive back home to l.a.. so i forgot they just opened up pink's right outside the shops and all the times/things i hear about pink's in l.a. i was like why not, im here and im not gonna have time to eat it in l.a. anytime soon.

the food was good actually, made me full. we ordered, <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, kim kardashion dog, and i think my bf ordered some <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>...but it cost a lot honestly well yea i know that was a lot food but it was  30bucks for lunch -____- but i would def. recommend the kim k dog, delicious!

i don't meat, but i still came here. really, i don't miss eating meat, but i do miss a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> + bun combo! so we came here, also because of the cheap prices. 

ended up getting the only veggie option - <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. was cooked to order, but pretty good - got tomatoes, ketchup, mustard, lettuce for my toppings. only downside was that the bread was a bit too flimsy for my liking - when i eat a dog, i want some solid bread that can withstand any amount of toppings! costed about $6 or so. i'd like to know what it was made out of, actually... texture-wise, it was very <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

bummer that <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> don't come with a side... and i wasn't about to spend $4 just to have some <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. but a friend did get the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which they described as covered with "low grade meat" but delicious "once you're drunk enough." speaking of drunk - on the weekends they are open late - about 3 am or so - so a perfect place for the drunk munchies! 

what else? $20 for a bucket of 5 beers, you mix and match.

this place is ridiculous. 

my boyfriend and i usually order this, then take it to the mall or to our hotel room and eat it there, because the outdoor seating is sooooo gross and it tends to be windy. 

i love their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. one order of these, and i'm set for that meal. but i always feel the need to get their dogs too! i feel like i can't win! chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> or a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, oh the dilemma. i get into a mini panic attack because i can't choose. and then i end up getting both, and regret eating whatever i had eaten first, because now i can't eat as much as i could of the second one.

you get to order and receive your order fairly quickly. makes it hard to make a decision, and you end up making really stupid ones like ordering way more than you can eat because you don't want to hold up the line, but you can't decide between <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> or the fries or the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. 

i'm glad i don't live near one of these. i would visit it every day.

we stopped at pinks to grab a quick bite and a much needed adult beverage. i got <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a huge margarita in a huge pink <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> cup 42oz i believe. the rings were fab. really big order for a small price. now that margarita was no joke!!! can u say over pour......not that its a bad thing......we sat outside an people watched while we caught a nice lil buzz. good times w the girls!

after working up an appetite wandering up and down the strip and in the planet hollywood shops, my friends and i decided pinks would be the perfect place to grab a quick lunch. coincidently, we also happened to each be wearing pink (not planned!) so it seemed even more fitting. 

i ordered the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mushrooms and swiss. my friend ordered a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and another ordered the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. we also ordered a side of fries and rings to share. 

food came out quickly and i thought my dog was delicious. the fries were good but got cold quickly...most likely because it was cold outside where we were sitting, but still. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were ginormous and tasty. 

lunch came out to a bit under $10 per person which i don't think is bad. i would come back.

my house people told me that i gained weight. who's to blame?
i didn't go to many other food places in vegas. who's to blame?

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!

i spent 4 days in vegas, and pinks fed my stomach 3 times in 4 days.
day 1:
chilli <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (me)
mushroom <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> (my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 2:
<mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> (my friend)
<mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> (me)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>

day 4: 
2 <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (me& my friend)
<mark>Onion Ring</mark>
coleslaw

* the coleslaw is a no, but whatever, i love you still, pinks!

after all the hype i've heard about pink's, it does not live up to it's raves. maybe the la joint is better so i may give it a second chance when i'm in la, but don't try pink's in vegas.
i got the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, and my friend got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. the chili on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was very questionable, kinda like elementary school lunch chili what the hell kinda meat is in here but i don't care because i'm 7? kinda chili. mushy and questionable. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself? i think i've tasted better microwaving ones from the grocery store. it's bland, and just soft.
didn't try my friend's pastrami <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but he said it just tasted like what it looks like. we also got <mark>Onion Ring</mark>-- after a few of them, you might want to food coma.

i am all for greasy, fat food, but pink's does not do it for me.

so this was my first time having pink's, and we were totally excited. i ordered something with pastrami and cheese, husband ordered one with chili and bacon, and also coleslaw and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.  our dogs weren't too impressive. hubz said his chili was too thick, and my <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> wasn't as extravagant as i thought it would be.  <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were good and the coleslaw was alright.  staff was friendly, and we got our food fairly quick.  only seating area to eat is outside, but luckily they had heaters. glad i got to try it, but doubt we will plan on coming back. 

btw you have to park in the planet hollywood garage if you're going to drive, then walk through the casino to the outside.

for a celebrity <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> craze..... it's good! 

their #1 is the bacon chili cheese: topped with onions, tomatoes, chili, cheese and bacon... not really my cup of tea.

their #2 is the planet hollywood (fitting, considering their located @ ph) and it's pretty bomb! <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushrooms, cheese and bacon! 

the best compliment they offer i'd have to say is the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>:)

their downfall, hence the 2 stars: their staff and lack of customer service!!!

seriously... 

#1: you sell <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!!! not diamonds! i guess a smile and a skosh of patience would be a stretch, no?
#2: you are the cashier!!! if you're gonna have that kind of impatient demeanor, you think it'd be more fitting to stock up inventory in the back or something right???

wow.

i heard a lot of hype about pink's so i was expecting some awesome <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i was hugely disappointed.

my sister and i shared the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>, the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a side of <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.  i was surprised that our order came out looking like regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and buns (that you'd buy from any grocery store) slathered in everyday condiments.  i totally agree with the other reviews that there was really nothing special about the food here.

the mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> was disgustingly coated in mayo.  i like mayo but not to the point where that's all you taste with every bite.

the bacon chili cheese tasted no better than something i could have ordered at wienerschnitzel...super salty and the chili tasted nasty like it was "fresh" out of the can.

of all the things we ordered, the best thing was probably the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> but there wasn't anything extraordinary about those either.

honestly, this place is no different than any other fast food joint except that it's highly overrated.  we actually came here after several rounds of mojitos and even then it still didn't taste any good.

i don't even really like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that much! i'm no <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> expert, so here's my take - 

we needed lunch and this place was convenient. like others, i'd seen the pink's in la in tv before, so we stopped. 

i had the mel b dog and my dining companion had the vegas strip. my dog was 1 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> sauce, guac, <mark>Sour Cream</mark>, tomatoes and onions. sounds interesting and not very good, but i was on vacation, i had to try something different. i really enjoyed it! 

my dining companion's was 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with cheese, chili. guac, and onions. he liked as well. in fact, he told me i can't put the picture of him eating it online! 

in addition we shared <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, water and a beer. the bill with everything was $29. 

the food was decent, it was quick and tasty. the only thing i didn't care for was it warm out, not hot and the only seating was outside. it was breezy, but i eat quick so we were in and out. try it for something quick, but don't expect greatness.

these are good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but two people can definitely split one dog.  if you get two, you won't be able to finish them.

the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are really good.

there are only ketchup packets and not a pump so make sure you grab a bunch.  also, you have to ask the people behind the counter for a little cup to squeeze all the ketchup packets into.  so weird.

this place is all right.
i have never seen such a diverse menu compromised of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.
i got the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> burrito which had three <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and filled with cheese and other stuff. it was pretty yummy.
the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are really good too. i think it's a little pricey for a hot-dog specialty joint, but this place is worth trying once
 in your lifetime.

i go here every time we are in vegas.  this time we got a mushroom <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> (which is my fave), <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, <mark>Guadalajara Dog</mark>, and the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> with 2 orders of fries and onions rings for 4 people.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were enough for 4 people to share.  i had the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was pretty big.  they have outside seating.  they probably have like 6 or 7 tables out there.  
i think on fridays and saturdays they close at 0300 which is good for a early morning snack.  each <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is like under $9 which isnt bad.  they accept credit cards and cash.

pink's is a humongo staple in la...and every time i'm outside the place i swear off poppin my pink's cherry because of that ridonculous line. but you can't get away from the buzz...you hear about them online, from friends, and it's practically a celebrity hotspot. 

well being the sceptic that i need to be to thrive, i figured it may be a lot of empty hype. i mean a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>'s a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i thought. and i couldn't have been wronger. (yeah. it's a word now ;)

sure, i can't tell a lie...there were only 2-3 people ahead and yet we waited in line for probly 25 minutes. and yeah, for 2 simple styled <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and an <mark>Onion Ring</mark> after all was said & done (including tax & a small tip), it was almost 20 dollars. and the cashier was very knowlegeable, but moved at the speed of a dmv employee..they all did.


but i quickly found out that their food is the real deal holyfield. no empty hype. so damn good. no, i think they put crack in there.

their <mark>French Fries</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are amazing! extremely crunchy and crispy, really on point. i enjoy their coleslaw but i can also understand why others wouldnt. 

oh yeah, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>..they are decent, perfectly salted.

good for some drunk food! would say it is expensive but everything in vegas is expensive. can't really complain but enjoyed everything i tried.... <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>:)

the seating is outdoors, very limited, under very high powered fans with mist. not really ideal for eating.

husband wanted the lord of the rings dog which was no longer on the menu but they made it for him anyway. so that was nice. i ordered the chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. both tasty enough.

i think the price was around $7 for the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and $3 for the drinks. 

we split an order of <mark>Onion Ring</mark> with the parents. they are the thick cut rings and the batter was a bit on the sweet side.

overall decent experience for the price but i suspect there are better dogs to be had in chicago.

definitely delicious. i thought they had waiter service but nope. guess it keeps the prices down. its moderately priced and they have lots of different <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i had the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with mustard. it had a snap to it. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were fresh and not hard and just delicious. unless your extremely hungry stick to just one dog.

i'm from l.a., but i was short on time and was starving to death at the miracle mile shops. i figured... pink's, you can never go wrong. it's my favorite <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint where i'm from. wow they really over-priced these things, and i even snuck a peak out back and they don't use high, or even good quality products here. i mean their ketchup packets are even generic, they couldn't spring for heinz? come on, pinks. anyway, my bf and i decided to play it safe, and cheap because their normal <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> that go for $3 in l.a. are $6! madness! it was ok, but the chili just wasn't as flavorful and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didn't have any snap. the topping were piled on pretty good, but i just didn't think they were fantastic. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, on the other hand, were really good, and freshly made to perfection. the inside is very small, and the outside has about 15 tables, which are kept pretty clean. staff is so-so. they're fast and effective but none of them really looked that happy to be working that night. i would never come back here, because i would much rather go to the l.a. location.

i got the groupon ($7 for $15 at pinks) so i took the family. overall the food is great, i had the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, knife and fork needed! husband had thepastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> burger, my daughter got the <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>, it is huge and very messy. my other daughter got the nacho <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.
the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> them selves are big, very good flavor and a nice snap. the chili is bean free and wonderful on <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, not spicy just good flavor, & how can you go wrong added bacon to anything?? we shared fries very good thin crisp shoesting style and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, nice batter but not as crisp as i would like

pink's is a fun place to eat strip side and people watch. i will warn you its pricey, i added a souvenir cup (the small one $13.50) so after the groupon my check was still $42

i'm a big fan of pink's, being from the la area so i was happy to try out the one here in vegas.  i came here with my family and luckily we were able to take advantage of the groupon deal a couple of weeks before.  all 3 of us opted for the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, except i had it with a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> instead of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are loaded with toppings.  the casing around <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> has a nice snap when you bite into it and tastes just as good as the pink's in la.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> are shoestring fries which i happen to looove.  i'm not a fan of fat fries, so these were perfect and crispy.  i'm not sure if the make their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> but those are also fantastic, just the right amount of breading and cooked perfectly.  it was chilly out so i also ordered a <mark>Hot Chocolate</mark> only to find the gal behind the counted mixing up a pouch of the powdered stuff with water.... boo! oh well, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were what we came for and they sure did hit the spot. 

also, you can get a naked dog and add ketchup, mustard, onions, relish and pickles for no charge... yum!

great value for the money.  the outdoor seating can be problematic if it is windy, but the food is decent, and the prices are reasonable, especially considering the location on the strip.

i've tried the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, the brooklyn <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>, chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> so far, and would recommend any of them.

pink's is located right outside the planet hollywood hotel & casino. small inside, however large patio outside. if you haven't tried a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, you have to if you're in vegas. it's fast and easy, but not the cheapest. but is anything is vegas cheap?

everything is made to order which is nice; i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with a side of <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. the bacon was crisp, the chili was nice and meaty, but the cheese seemed like liquid <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>...however, the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were fresh. 

my friend's tried the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and they enjoyed that as well.

very expensive for over processed food. i don't mind paying good money for good food but this was not good. the mushrooms were canned, <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were frozen and the cheese sauce was like cheez-whiz. if pinks is the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> of the stars, they have pretty low standards. we won't be back.

i have been to pinks a few times in los angeles but this is my first time here in vegas. compared to back home, which is in la, i think i'll choose the one in la. but since my boyfriend never had pinks in either location, i decided to pop his pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> cherry. whoa that sounded a little inappropriate lol. but here goes:

my boyfriend ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which is loaded with bacon, cheese, mushroom, and err did i mention bacon?! and i ordered the pastrami britain dog which is just a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> and pastrami. holy moly, the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> is monstrous compared to my <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>. if you put then next to each other, it looks like umm you know what evolving. boy becomes a man. haha. since the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> and the bacon overload was too much for the buns, it looked quite messy. well, with two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, a side of fries, and a coke... our total was $18. bull!

pros:
-short line... fast food
-addicting fries and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>
-good portion... very filling for me especially the fries
-opens late so it's good for after clubbing or unless you're a fatty like me and wants to have a midnight dinner err snack..
-they sell jello shots here

cons:
-even though the line is short, it's so boring. i like that rush of excitement where you see people all hyped up about it order a ton of food and end up not finishing it
-very greasy... made my buns soggy 
-overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that i can get at costco for only $1.50 with a free drink
-outdoor seatings only
-my boyfriend wasnt satisfied so it made me look bad. i have to take him to the one in la

in my experience, finding a decent <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> when you don't eat red meat or pork is pretty tough.  i had all but given up on the idea of enjoying a sloppy dog... that is, until i went to pink's.  

i had friends in town who were massively hungover, so they chose pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> as their pick-me-up spot.  i usually just order a side dish (hello, fried food) at this type of joint, but then something caught my eye.  a quarter-pound turkey <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>??  could it be???

i took the chance, and ordered the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> with a simple dressing of ketchup and relish.  i keep it classic.  and what they served looked more like a kielbasa or bratwurst, it was so big.  thick, juicy, and great flavor.  success!  

long story longer, i will definitely be visiting pink's again.  great location, great atmosphere (outside seating), and great food.  the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> rocked as well.  bravo, pink's!

i've been wanting to try this for a while after seeing it on a food network special.  while in vegas, this was my first and last meal.  the first meal was a classic dog with chili, mustard, onions, and tomatoes (possibly cheese too but i can't remember for sure).  the last meal of my trip was a life saver after a very long night out.  i got the <mark>Western Guacamole Burger</mark> (with a scoop of chili on top).  it was a amazing, the chili had great flavor and the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> with guacamole were a nice touch as well.

was out in vegas for a quick and cheap getaway and  did the casino thing and took plenty of pics but now it was time for lunch after walking the strip and taking in sites.i had a groupon coupon for pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i think it for $15.00 off my purchase and for me it won't take me long .a chillidog,<mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a powerade-large for all the walking.first bite was that snap in <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> that reminds me of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> in nyc off the push carts in midtown or on fordham rd in the bronx days,<mark>Onion Ring</mark> were crisp and hot and the powerade well i needed it.sat outside on the patio and watched the people on the strip go by and as they watched me digg into my meal.had a good talk with the staff and you get that loud "welcome to pinks" when you enter <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>.wish they had one near me..**,

pink's serves a good dog. but with all the hype i expected more. the toppings are unique and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are good sized, but at $8/$9 a pop they should be. thanks to groupon, the wife and i have been here twice in the last month. both times we waddled away very content. we had a variety of dogs, <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, and even a pastrami/<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> burrito. all very good. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are thick and crunchy. i'm a great fan of windy city beefs-n-dogs on lake mead, so i'm not sure if i will be back, but it was fun trying pink's out.

expensive for just plain old <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. upon arriving in vegas on my previous trip, this was my first stop with my friends for lunch. since my friend's mom had made spam musubis for the plane ride, i didn't really have enough room to be too adventurous when i ate here. i ended up just getting a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with bbq sauce. however, my one friend got a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with bacon and onions while another friend of mine got the bacon burrito. the bacon burrito was not bad, but it was oily. the oil was literally dripping out of the wrapping. i'm not afraid of oil, but for some reason this made me feel kinda gross. although my first experience here at pink's wasn't a bad one, i don't think i will be returning. the price is a little too much (i think it was like $5 for <mark>Onion Ring</mark>? ... uhhh, i'll pass) and the food isn't extremely amazing - i would be more satisfied with a $1.50 costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that comes with a drink.

good place to stop after walking all day on the strip. the line is long, and it's outside, but it seemed to move pretty quickly while we waited. 

the food was good. i can't remember the name of the one i had but it was fully packed with guacamole, tomatoes, jalape\u00f1os, and cheese. i ate it with a fork and knife. <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are huge and on point. the seating area is outside and perfect for people watching. 

their soda of choice is pepsi. boo. regardless, this place is worth a try when you are visiting.

i had the ph <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was pretty good.  it's loaded w/ bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and some mushrooms.  the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> kinda masked the taste of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, i think next time i'll get it w/ just a light amount of cheese.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself is pretty huge too (to the point it's almost difficult to eat lol).  the price tag is reasonable, at $9 i felt this was a decent deal.

my <mark>Bud</mark> ordered some weird stuff that had <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wrapped in tortillas or actual burritos.  i'd pass on this weird stuff as it didn't look good.  if you are coming to pinks then order a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, don't order this weird stuff.  that's like ordering a burger at a taco joint lol. 

tip-
-grab a fat tuesday just in the same shopping plaza of ph!  
-pass on getting the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> (rating 2/5).  they were so sweet they tasted horrible
-eating only availabe in the outdoor patio.  so if it's in the middle of the day i probably wouldn't eat here.  just come here for late night eats

i had the ph dog and must have used 100 napkins. it was good but very difficult to eat and messy. i thought the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were average but good. nothing to really write home about. i think next time i will go with a basic dog so i can eat it with my hands like you are suppose to eat a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

i guess it was all the hype surrounding this place is one of the reasons for disappointment. the casing on the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was inedible so couldn't finish it, the chili was awful and made the bun soggy, the cheese usually buffers this. i like biting into a plump juicy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, this was not. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were good.  
the line was long but moved right along and there wasn't a lot of seating the people seemed to leave in good increments so the tables opened up. 

so if you like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> don't go here. if all you want are some <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a soda then by all means go..

i just did not have a great experience.  i didn't like the flavor of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (good snap, though) or chili.  the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were pretty good.  the prices were crazy-high.

i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> so when a friend told me about pinks i had to try this place.   they offer many different style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> standard, kelly style and vegetarian.  i tried the standard <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with chilli, onions and mustard....wow! this combo was incredible!. the chilli was very tasty mixed with meat and beans it really made the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> taste out of this world. if you like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you must try this place, the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> are pretty damn good also.  a message for my connecticut yelpers in new britain.....capital lunch who??.....i'm serious!

i had never been to pink's before, but had a groupon that was running out, and so we ventured out for dinner on a late thursday night to beat the deadline.  no problem, right?  by all appearances, it was just an unremarkable thursday night.  

so off to planet hollywood we went.  but when we pulled up to valet parking behind three stretch limos, and no valet was in sight, something seemed off.  then i saw that we were about six blocks from the valet stand, again with no valet in view.  so, off to self-parking we went, with uniformed police everywhere, to find a parking spot.  at length we found one--the only one.  something unusual was definitely going on.

so, diane and i walked from the parking garage into the miracle mile shops, and walked and walked.  as we finally reached the entrance to planet hollywood on the other side of the shopping promenade, 9 uniformed sheriff's deputies were assembled together, and fashionably suited males and well-dressed females were everywhere.  about then i realized that we had left the groupon in the car.  oh, well (sigh).  i decided that i wasn't going to walk all the way back and return again just to save a mere $5!  so, we continued on and out the main doors until we finally saw pink's facing las vegas boulevard, and examined the vast menu on the wall before making our selections.

this story does end well.  i really enjoyed my brooklyn pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with pickles, onions, mustard, and sauerkraut added, on a soft old country bun.  it included a generous amount of tender pastrami, and although the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was thin, it was long and had a very nice snap to it when one bit into the casing.  beer-battered <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and nicely salted shoestring fries were both good and tasty.  and i liked the mild <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> sauce for dipping my fries, while diane enjoyed <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>.  to my surprise, one single <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> sufficed to quell my appetite.  and, there were free refills of lemonade and all other available soft drinks.  

the place is nothing fancy, seating is all outside, and there is only counter service.  but staff members were friendly and helpful.  we had a nice view of the strip before us, but it was a mite cold and windy at 10:47 p.m.  heat lamps were present, but not in service.  hard driving music overhead added to the casual ambiance.  so, we finished our food, walked all the way back to the car, and left the parking lot as we were directed out by at least 6 police officers.  just as we were turning onto tropicana avenue, diane asked the last officer if she knew what was going on at planet hollywood, and was told, "soul train awards!"

now i'm sort of glad that i still have my groupon for pink's, which, as luck would have it, does not really expire for another month.  for, it means that i can return again soon to enjoy another tasty classic dog!

i went for lunch the other day and had a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with bacon and maybe it's just me but it was $13.27 for that and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a small soda which i thought was a little high.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself was good and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were good, but a small portion.  the chilli etc was just fair and net net i think it was a little over priced for the money.

i love watching food shows, including throwdown with bobby flay. i remembered a few years ago that he visited the (original?) pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in los angeles, ca and thinking that if i ever got a chance to try their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, i would make sure to do so. 

i was generally disappointed with the overall experience; however, some of the positive aspects of the visit was fast, friendly service (though i went at about 11:30am before a major lunch rush), and hot fresh food. 

i ordered the chicago polish <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and i'm not entirely sure what i expected, but was disappointed because when i go out to eat, i at least hope to have food that would be difficult or impossible for me to replicate at home. i have had better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in my own back yard. 

as a side i had the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, which were hot and crispy, but didn't have an exciting or flavorful batter worth noting. 

another unfortunate part of the experience was the annoying little birds that were very unafraid of people and kept landing on the table/nearby chairs expecting a free handout. 

i won't be going to this location again, but i'd be open to trying pinks again, only in la.

i've never been to a pink's before but had to stop in because it's supposed to be famous and good. :-) i went in for a relatively early lunch.

you order at the counter, wait for your food to come up, and eat outside, overlooking the strip. there are notices asking people to not feed the birds, and i noticed the birds are a real problem. one actually got on my table and started making moves towards my lunch. i tried to wave it away, and it actually pecked me. o_o so be aware that birds are an issue, particularly if you're alone.

i got a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with mustard and onions and some <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were right out of the fryer and good. the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was good. i ate it with a fork--knives didn't seem to be available for some reason?

anyway, the food was good, but i don't think it was worth the price i paid. in other words, i paid something like $16 for what i felt was maybe $8 worth of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. it was good, but jeez, the price.

i remember liking the pink's in la much more as i was growing up... these dogs were nothing special, the buns tasted stale, and the chilli on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> had way too much cinnamon...   the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were bland and tasteless like all other frozen <mark>Onion Ring</mark> out there.

i am disappoint. i miss la for yet another reason.

i loved my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, it was awesome with a great flavor. 

the only reason i give it a 4 star is the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were watery and obviously frozen.

i was really excited to try pink's but it was not what i expected. while the meal was good, it did not amaze. i guess my expectations were a bit high for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> joint but i was expecting something more unique.

i ordered the polish pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with sauerkraut and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> on the side. as mentioned, good but normal and bit salty. i felt that i could just buy a polish at costco and add the same items to it myself so it really wasn't worth the price. i really did enjoy the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> though.

wish they had some indoor seating options because it was pretty hot outside even with a shaded table right in front of the fan. a bit entertaining to watch people come out to the seating area and the fan would attack their napkins the instant they stepped out. unfortunately that means a ton of napkins littered all over - big no no

i was a little disappointed..... i was there at an off hour, but that sadly meant the food was a bit off as well. don't get me wrong the brooklyn <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had great flavor, and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> had a nice crunch, but it was luke warm, and compared to the temp outside it was kind of like eating leftovers. same with the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.... good flavor, but would of been better hot.
i'd go again but make sure the food is served hot

i love a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and pink's did not disappoint!  i ordered the nacho <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and a side of <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.  the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were just so-so... but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was awesome... great chili!  thinking i'll try the fries next time.

almost as good as the pink's in la.... almost.
the pink's in <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> not have cake, like the original pink's los angeles. and for the record the cake is made from scratch, not a box; according to my dad. who isn't skinny, and knows a thing or two about cake. but that doesn't matter, because there is no cake at the pink's in vegas.

i don't know why people are questioning the price? these are not the same <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> as costco! pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> are better, overall. higher quality meat, casing, larger in size, and with toppings. pink's is not in the miracle mile shops, they are on the front of the ph, with patio seating on the strip. so no. $5-10 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> loaded with toppings and bacon isn't a lot. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at serendipity 3 at caesar's is $15.

and if you ask politely, they will do half fries / half <mark>Onion Ring</mark>.

i had heard about the famous location in holywood, so i had my wife try it.. she wasn't very impressed, but i had a bite too and it was pretty decent. typical <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> if that's what you want. <mark>Onion Ring</mark> looked like they would have been really good. cool people watching on the strip though!

to my fellow yelpers this place deserves more than 3 stars. 

one star for the variety of their menu, raging from sauerkraut to bbq sauce. 

another star for the urgency of preparing my order in a fashionable manner. 

a star for the quality of their food. i received pinks special and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>,  there <mark>Onion Ring</mark> where amazing along with there gourmet <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

and the final star goes to the location, you will have a nice view of the cosmopolitan and lots of lights, i was looking around the whole time. checking out the scenery! 

and being a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> enthusiast, this place is 4/5 for me. defiantly worth your time and money.

good chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> super quick. the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were so-so. when you're comparing things like buffets at other hotels ($30 and $40 - yikes!) this place is a winner.

my mom and i both enjoyed it. we each ordered a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> and split a fry and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. it was pretty good. we got to sit outside, eat, and people watch. we are not big fans of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> of any type so we probably won't be back. but we're glad we tried it.

this place was delicious! we had the reuben and one that was served with bacon but i can't remember the name. we also split regular fries, <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. everything was very delicious! my only complaint is that there is only seating outside. as you know, vegas is hot, hot, hot. i would definitely come back here the next time i'm here!

way too much money for what you get my husband got the <mark>Pastrami Burrito</mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and a drink.  i could have made the burrito at home with hormel chili some pastrami from the deli and <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and tortillas.  sorry just not worth all the hype.  the location is great if you want to buy alcoholic drinks for the walk down strip.

during my trip in las vegas. i finally made it to famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!! 
my friends and i walked past about several times before we actually decided to go and get it. the line could be a bit discouraging. but i'm here...why not try it right?
i had <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark> with the works and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. it was so tasty and delicious. hands down the best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> i have had ever. i know i'm not a meat person and haven't had that many <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i knew this was going to be special when there was lettuce.
we had a seat and eat on the patio watching people walking around. it was nice out and laid back location.  
i'm telling you now..this place is definitely worth visiting and you have to try it once.

despite all the reviews, you see this place on food network so i wanted to give it a try...
but i regret it and it was my only meal that i did not enjoy on our trip.

on yelp, there's a free <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> offer.
somewhere on the details, it should tell you the hours... basically there's restriction on the offer which i cannot find. maybe it's on the full site, not on the mobile site.  anyways, this was a let down for us too since we were just looking into snacking here with the offer, instead of eating a full meal.

i ordered the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.
it was better than their regular dogs, which looks very unfilling. their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were okay but it was also spicy onions... like the onions weren't cooked all the way through... the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were okay.

overall, average <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stand... nothing special.

great <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>.bigger than the bun...<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good too. <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were great as well.a bunch of different combinations to have a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with

we weren't hungry, but were tired do passing by this place and not at least splitting a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> ... well that's over with.  we'll be back too.  <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were the size of hand cuffs, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was absolutely delicious.  

we split a bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, it was overflowing with chili and crisp bacon.  next time in vegas will definitely be back.

they have <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> and <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark>.
