Turkey Dog</mark> (maybe that was my mistake) and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. the fries were the best part of the meal - i hate, i mean i hate gray, boiled looking <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> -- gosh i wish it was grilled i guess i should've asked but being from l.a. this place is suppose to be the best so i figured i'd leave it all in their hands....it was a let down and i won't be going back.

this place is pretty good, nothing too amazing though. it's more expensive than the la pink's and not as tasty, but i expected as much eating in vegas. ordered a <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (2 dogs, jalpenos, cheese, onions) which came out pretty quickly with chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. it's a lot of food though. an order of chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> is enough to feed one or even two people. seating is outside and with the wind it's a bit annoying but you get to see all the weirdos down the street and sometimes cool performers.
today for lunch i had the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> & i loved it!!! the chili didn't taste gross or cheap. very good quality!
great chili-<mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, but beware if you sit outside of hungry pigeons and people yelling crazy comments on the strip!

disclaimer: i'm not a huge <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan but this place may very well change that. i decided to try it based on what i've heard about the la location and i'm happy i did. it was delicious, the menu was a bit intimating as there are waaaayyy to many choices for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i guess any <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> lover would love that right? well i went the safe route and got a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and an order of <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> to share. it was glutinous but delicious and i'm sure i worked it off by staying up walking the strip most of the night...but who cares about that!! vegas is all about indulgence and you'll do exactly that at this spot. if you decide to eat in the outdoor eating area beware of the pigeons, they love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> too!

everytime we passed pinks, we told ourselves that we were going to try it, we finally did. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were ok, they were a bit dry....it's probably due to having <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> out for too long or over cooked. it almost taste like rubber. on the other hand their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were really really good! they were very well loaded!

pink's has always been a favorite spot. so when we took a spontaneous vegas trip, this past weekend, pink's was on our to do list. 

i'm a vegetarian so i always look forward to getting a veggie <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>. this time, however, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was throw together and was very unappealing. my husband spent some quality in the bathroom after his <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were pretty decent though. 

possible scam**** when we were paying for our food - prior to even tasting it - there was an error with processing my husband's credit card. we paid cash instead. my husband received an alert from his bank verifying that he just tried to make a purchase. we were visiting from san diego. he never used that card again but since we walked out of pink's, there were a total of 12 fraudulent charges totaling more than $700. i don't know if there is a connection or if there was a phishing device on their reader but it's awfully suspicious. pay cash!!!

got the spicy mojave with a regular dog instead of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>. it was delicious and the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were out of this world.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are my favorite <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! it's nice to be able to grab one in vegas during late night. it's pretty comparable to the original one in hollywood. same great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, same great chili, same great kraut, same great fries. 

i do wish that they had the celebrity names associated to the one in vegas to help me order! i have no clue what comes on mine, but i know i like the rosie o'donnell. i had to guess/try to make it up... chilli, sour kraut...not sure what else? 

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were also delicious and very reminiscent of the great ones at the la location. 

the patio is right on the strip in front of planet hollywood and is a great place to people watch no matter the time of day!

i wanted to see what the fuss was all about with pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.   

the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> at planet hollywood was   awesome.  it was just loaded with tomato,  cheese,chili, <mark>Sour Cream</mark> and onions. the chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was a difficult task just trying to keep it together while eating it.  it was good but nothing special! not really  worth the $8.50? it's on the strip so i'm not going to complain on the price.

so yeah, we spent about $16 on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and a drink .  sounds expensive, but now at least i got to experience what  pink's has to offer, just wish i knew what all the excitement was about  maybe next time i'll give their <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark> a try.  looks really yummy! 

it was alright!

every time i hit vegas, i go to pinks now. they take <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to another level. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are worth it, and the 3 <mark>Three Dog Night</mark> is my fav <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> selection they offer. street level seating mid strip. perfect location.

i came to the strip to hang out with some friends i haven't seen in a while. since i live in la, i know pink's and introduced them to it and they love it. some of those friends have since moved away from la and are deprived of the pink's that they have come to love. well upon hearing that there was one in vegas, one of my friends was so happy because she was totally anticipating it and hyping it to her husband. 

well we found it outside on the strip by p.f. chang's at the planet hollywood casino. there was no line. not a good sign, but we thought that the pink's name that we know and love in la would suffice so no worries. 

we all ordered our dogs and sides of <mark>French Fries</mark> and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. the orders came back rather quickly and we proceeded out to the patio to sit and eat. 

so how was it? not very good. the toppings were cold and the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was limp and just didn't ooze of the flavor and kick that the la spot has. it's also more expensive here even without the wait. and one of my friends wanted a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> she had in la, but they changed the names to fit the vegas theme and lacked the same kick in la. and the husband? he was less than impressed with the place. we ended up being belligerent and threw the fries at each other rather than eat it. 

all in all, disappointed with the experience in vegas. again, the nonexistent line should have been a clue. not impressed. they really have to overhaul the place to make it match la's! my friends and i gladly wait in line and are satisfied in la. here, not so much. disappointed to say the least.

i do feel the need to paint a little picture before writing this review... its monday morning, last day in vegas, ish needs too go down. bottle of gentlemen jack - killed by 1030am. 4 rounds of flip cup for shots donezo by noon. the day is now set for ultimate triumph or complete utter disaster. 

walking down the strip, i had seen pinks the day before. i had no clue that pinks had expanded from la and was stoked! when we got in, i had to ask if it was the same and homeboy at the counter said "yeah, its exactly the same but we just charge a lot more." i laughed and asked where he was from.... 408... gotta love the bay!! 

i ordered a las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>: 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, chili, cheese, guac, onions, mustard, jalapeno. 
a friend order some kind of bacon, cheese chili craziness dog. wow 
to top it all off, we split some <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. 

ok - i get that its really pricey for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but i was so full that it didn't matter. when it comes down to it, 9 bucks isnt that bad if you end up satisfied it is?

the perfect end to an awesome weekend in lv.

i do not normally eat <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but i love a good bratwurst or italian sausage.

between the four of us we had four <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausage dishes, plus a burger, the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>, and chili-fries.

we expected the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausages to be of great quality, but we found them to be lacking in flavor.     i would have given the restaurant 1 star, but bumped them up to two stars for the following:
- the bacon on my planet hollywood was amazing (but everything else in it was blah)
- the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were very tasty (the chili-<mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> on the other hand were not).
- when they messed up our order, they quickly corrected it and additionally let us keep the sausage plate that we hadn't ordered.
- my friends said that unlike <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, the burger was actually quite tasty

for me, i think the sausages that one finds at an outdoor fair have much better taste/quality than what i found at pinks.   

i recalled the meals being much better at the one in l.a......was that  because after waiting an hour in line in the cold in l.a. anything they served me would have tasted good?   i don't know, but i know i won't be returning to the vegas pink's.

this place was fun and conveniently located, and the food is fine but not at all special.  i had a <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the chili was not good quality and the cheese was liquid cheese served with a ladle.  same goes for the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  it was kind of fun to have <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for lunch but they are no better than <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> you'd get anywhere else.  if you really feel like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> or are looking for something fast in that area then this might be a good pick for you, but otherwise look elsewhere.

this review is for the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> only.

even though i am in love with the idea of chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, the idea is usually far more appealing than the real thing. in my view, chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are kind of like internet dating: the hottie in the picture is nothing like the nottie in person.

same thing with chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. too often the chili is too wet and loaded with beans and runny cheese sauce, so the fries turn soggy and the pathetic pile in front of you ends up looking like something that just came out of your mouth, not something that should go in your mouth. but not at pink's! here the fries stay firm and crisp, the chili is mostly meat, the cheese is judiciously applied, and the portion is just enough to hit the hunger spot without making you want to retch or go into a food coma.

truth be told, these fries are about as perfect as they come.

i had no idea there was a pinks here! but alas, on our walk towards the mgm, we found it.  bacon <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> for me please.

the good thing is that pinks is a nice break from the plethora of buffets on the strip.  just try to avoid it in bad weather.  outdoor seating is the only seating, and the only available heat is space heater.

but after being surrounded by $$$ buffets and restaurants, its nice to know that there are some cheaper reliable  eats around

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was just kind of eh. since the place is so talked about, and has thousands of reviews for it's original cali location, i have to admit; i was expecting a dog that would blow my mind. i didn't quite get that. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was decent, but was way too loaded with toppings so it had to be eaten with a knife and fork. kind of just turned into a mess of bread, beef, and mustard that frustrated more than satisfied. 

on the other hand, the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were pretty good... but paying $30 bucks for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, 2 drinks and an order of fries isn't worth it for what you get. it's basically fast food for sit down restaurant prices... which is ass-backwards. it'll probably hit the spot if you're really hungry like we were, but sadly i can't recommend pinks. 2/5.

i'm not a huge fan of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to begin with... but i heard a lot about this place.  my friends hyped it up and made it sound like it is the best thing to eat on the strip.  blah.

i can't speak for the other dogs, but i had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and i wasn't too impressed.  the guacamole looked like it came straight out of a tube i could have purchased at the 99 cent store.  i expected real guacamole since i was paying about 8 bucks for a freakin' <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  (you do realize that you can get a big <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> at costco for less than $2... and it comes with a drink, right?  just wanted to remind you)

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> was so bland.  the chili was very bland.  i asked for <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> over my <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> (think in n out) and the onions it actually came with was raw.  disappointed.  i usually love fries... <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>... and this place was very whomp whomp whomp.

i wouldn't eat here again.  i tried it once and thats all i need to know that i don't like it.

i think every time i go to vegas now i will be looking forward to my pink weiner! man i love my weiners and this is one of the best i've had! how can you go wrong with bacon, mushrooms, and gooey fake cheddar cheese on top of a weiner! man oh man! ohh i know what can make it even better, their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> to rinse it down. 3lbs added to my waistline, made loosing at the roulette table a little easier to swallow.

i couldn't believe it!  pink's on the las vegas strip?  how have i not noticed this before on my other visits?  i thought pink's was strictly a l.a. phenomenon.  well, finally, i was going to have my chance to try them.  

so, maybe i just didn't order correctly.  i had their <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> which came with chili, finely chopped vidalia onions, and liberal use of american style mustard.  the bun was not particularly substantial, so there was no way to eat the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in the traditional way.  resorting to using a plastic knife and fork, i took my first bite.  really?  the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> was just okay.  the chili was a touch deplorable, and while i enjoyed the sweetness from the onions, i thought the mustard a little too heavy handed.  for similar reasons, my order of <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were less than remarkable.  but there was one saving grace.  i tried natasha's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and thought it was pretty tasty.  apparently i just failed to order what they are famous for.  the ambience is good though being centrally located on the strip with plentiful outdoor seating.

i can only base this as my level of satisfaction with what i consumed and not as a comparison to any other <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> place, seeing as how i normally despise the things and keep them out of my life and mouth.
now that i have put my disclaimer out there.... holy chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. i love this place.
hungover and starving, my boyfriend saw this place and demanded we go. i pouted internally... again, not a huge <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> gal. i saw they had chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> though. ok, game on. boyfriend decided on a monstrosity of two dogs, chili, cheese, onions, guacamole and jalapenos (while the name escapes me, the memory does not). boyfriend has this annoying habit of shoving a bite of whatever he is eating into my face and pleading with me to try it. history repeats itself, so i indulge him. so happy i did! all the toppings made a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> not only bearable for me, but soooooo delish! we ended up just sharing everything.... a dog and an order of fries can go between two people easily.
headed back to vegas in november.... this place is a repeat.

i have tried this place twice now and i think it is great. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are giant and the toppings are plentiful. the first trip me and my boyfriend ordered chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> which were huge, we both got <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and topped them with the chili and cheese from the fries, there was more than enough! the place was only open a couple weeks and had a special where you could get a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and beer for like $8 i think. the second trip they didn't have the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and beer special so we were kind of disappointed. i would give them 5 stars if they brought back the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>/beer combo. overall, great tasting dogs!

first time had a pink <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  i got me a chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> for $16.  i'm not sure if its was worth it but <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was good.  
sorry i had to use fork and knife, i din't want any cheese and chili dripping all over me.
this was a cute place to grab something quick. good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. gotta love there drinks in the pink souvenir cups!

i got the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> because i wanted something not to pricey and nothing i couldn't finish. they don't have any indoor seating so you have to sit outside, which i found a small table in the corner away from the drunks of las vegas. only problem is, the rap music is sooo loud. that's all they played was rap music. me and a friend sat in silence because we couldn't hear each other when we would try to talk. 

the fries were good, but a little on the greesy side. the price of the fries were good, only being 5 dollars. next time, i would like to try a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but maybe take it to go, since the music would drive me crazy.

strangely enough, i didn't come here for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, as my friend and i were lured by the huge plastic cup that was about a yard long.  we filled it up with some pink lemonade and vodka and proceeded to go to town with it.

i also picked up some chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> which were sufficient enough to hold the vodka we were drinking for the rest of the night.

i should try the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> next time, though.

i don't meat, but i still came here. really, i don't miss eating meat, but i do miss a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> + bun combo! so we came here, also because of the cheap prices. 

ended up getting the only veggie option - <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark>. was cooked to order, but pretty good - got tomatoes, ketchup, mustard, lettuce for my toppings. only downside was that the bread was a bit too flimsy for my liking - when i eat a dog, i want some solid bread that can withstand any amount of toppings! costed about $6 or so. i'd like to know what it was made out of, actually... texture-wise, it was very <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

bummer that <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> don't come with a side... and i wasn't about to spend $4 just to have some <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. but a friend did get the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which they described as covered with "low grade meat" but delicious "once you're drunk enough." speaking of drunk - on the weekends they are open late - about 3 am or so - so a perfect place for the drunk munchies! 

what else? $20 for a bucket of 5 beers, you mix and match.

this place is ridiculous. 

my boyfriend and i usually order this, then take it to the mall or to our hotel room and eat it there, because the outdoor seating is sooooo gross and it tends to be windy. 

i love their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. one order of these, and i'm set for that meal. but i always feel the need to get their dogs too! i feel like i can't win! chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> or a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, oh the dilemma. i get into a mini panic attack because i can't choose. and then i end up getting both, and regret eating whatever i had eaten first, because now i can't eat as much as i could of the second one.

you get to order and receive your order fairly quickly. makes it hard to make a decision, and you end up making really stupid ones like ordering way more than you can eat because you don't want to hold up the line, but you can't decide between <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> or the fries or the <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. 

i'm glad i don't live near one of these. i would visit it every day.

this place is the shizzle!  i was craving a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> especially after drinking a yard stick from fat tuesday.  so my friends and i head over here and to my surprise, there were only 4 people in line!  
my friend tells me the kim kardashian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> looks good and she was right!  the kim kardashian <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> with cheese, bacon and mushrooms.  ohh my gawd!  it was frickin awesome!   the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> was juicy with nice snap.  the bacon was off the hook.  and the cheese just enough to get everything wet.  
now in my drunk state of mind, i'm thinking i can eat like a champ, so i also order a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> with no mustard and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>!  what the heck was i thinking!  thank god my friends were there to eat half my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and half the fries.  
either way, everything they had was sooo good!  definitely coming back here next time i'm in vegas.

all i have to say is i would come here for just the bacon. it is so freaking good. i of course got <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> that would come with the most bacon. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was good but the bacon was the best part. i think i might have clogged up my arteries just a little bit after eating that <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.
the location is cool because it's right in front of the strip and you can sit and just look at the strip, but it's not fun to be sitting out there when it's super windy and hot. service was good and quick. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were pretty awesome too!

still not an all-around <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> fan. still a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> lover. and yes, the chili-<mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are still like heaven to me this last time around.

i gave it four stars because well, i'm not a huge fan of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> anyway. husband however loves them. while i didn't think the actual flavor of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was anything to rave about...but the skin snapping on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, even drenched in the quite tasty chili, that was nice.
the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were well worth the calories (and sadly, stomachache that followed from eating too much!)...and the service was super fast and friendly. i like the outside seating, especially with the big heaters to offset the chilly vegas evening.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are just okay to me.

they have about 20 different <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> combos. i ended up ordering two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and a side of chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. i must say the chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are the best i've ever had. next time i'm visiting vegas, i'm definitely getting their chilli fries. other then that, i wouldn't get all excited over the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. they taste like any other <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with more of a selection of toppings. i don't see anything special with that. their actual shop is tiny and the walk way is very narrow. the seating area has about 15 or less tables, so if you came at a busy time, good luck sitting.

one star for the quick service

two stars for thie great tasting chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.

i've heard a lot about this place and i think i was expecting too much from the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. honestly, they didn't taste special to me at all. it was a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but definitely not worth the hype. we ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which came with 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, guacamole, jalapenos, chili cheese, mustard and onions. we also got the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> which was a <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark> that came with <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, mushroom, bacon and cheese. both tasted decent. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were mediocre. it was worth a shot but i don't plan on visiting this place again.

hella expensive <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! but it is on the strip so what do you expect. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were okay. i ordered the planet hollywood <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> which was good but it had a lot of cheese. i got it because i like bacon so if you like bacon this is a good <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for you! just tell them to go light on the cheese unless you like cheese. the chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were also good and big enough for two people.

this place gets a lot of hype. it doesn't pay off, but it is a must on the tourist list. the original place is in los angeles, which of course is better. this vegas one has more vegas themed dogs i guess you can say. i like my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> simple with everything on it. if i were to go here i'd say get something with chili on it. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are good. the fries stay crispy even with the chili on it. be prepared to get messy when eating here.

i've waited for the pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> for more than an hour in la. i saw there wasn't a line here for lunch and decided to give this place another try... it's alright. i mean, i did enjoy the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> more without the 1.5 hours of hype beforehand. 

i don't remember the exact names of all these dogs... but i got a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that was topped with relish, onions & and tomatoes, topped w/<mark>Sour Cream</mark>.  i feel a bit ashamed to say this was pretty good. aside from the fact there was <mark>Sour Cream</mark> which may throw people off, it really put the taste together. my boyfriend had the sausage with pastrami, bacon, and cheese drizzled on top. that was a bit too heavy for him. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are definitely better than the sausages and i really enjoyed the the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.


sadly, i think this is one of those places you will definitely enjoy when you're drunk outta your mind.

i think this place is better than the location in la. yes the food is twice as much but you get a much much better view while dining. two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, two drinks and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> = $35.

i had gone to la last year and was pretty bummed i didnt get to visit the famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  so naturally, i was pretty excited when i realized they had a pink's in planet hollywood, where i was staying.

<mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>: awesome
i had <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and i forgot the name of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> my boyfriend had, but i liked his better even though they were both yummy. his had jalapenos, all i remember. sorry guys! lol. my only complaint is that they put too much of the condiments on to the point where it took me a few minutes to strategize my game plan on how to actually eat the thing :)

i definitely recommend a trip to pink's!

not sure what all the hype is all about. their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were better than the actual <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i'd rather eat a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> from costco.

there's a major difference between eating here after a margarita and eating here before a margarita. i can vouch that eating here after a margarita tastes significantly better.

being sheltered for all my life, i never heard of pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wasn't aware of its popularity until i got here. combined with my love for chili, we ended up ordering chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, nacho chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and the mel b <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

the wait time for it is really short too and it's a really good place to sit underneath their vapor after a party marathon on the strip. i think this place has to be visited on your trip to vegas but i might be incredibly biased by the chili aspect. although the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> are their selling point and i could go on and on about my love for chili, i really thought the winners were the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mustard, cheese, and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>.

i wanted to "like" this place more, but nothing says "no thank you" more than sysco products.

brief summary
-- spin off location from the original pink's in hollywood
-- located on the lv strip & only has outdoor seating
-- not for the cheap of heart
-- say no to the chili or say yes to the toilet
-- bring your own ketchup // condiments

i've seen pink's featured on food network before. so when my friends suggested we go there for lunch, i was down!

luckily we got here right before the huge lunch rush. you can imagine the line getting very long during a busy hour on the lv strip.

--- our order ---
** pinks lemonade (no alcohol) -- it was delicious, get it!

** <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> & <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> -- pass, the chili is definitely the east coast style that is mostly just greasy meat/beef. the cheese didn't taste real, must have been some "sysco" cheese matter. this stuff stuck to my ribs and made me want to "yack" later that night. my tummy was hurting. <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> was good, i ended up just eating it alone. 

** chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> -- i ate these before <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> and they were mostly good because i was so hungry. again the chili is just greasy meat, not really the ranch style chili (if that's what you like).

my biggest complaint about pink's is that they only have sysco ketchup which is very disgusting. it doesn't even taste like tomatoes or ketchup, it just looks like it. on top of that, it's more of a thick paste then a sauce. i seriously wish i could have gotten some heinz!

this place got a 1 star bump for my friend's polish with pastrami that i tasted. although, it was kind of dry and in need of mustard, the flavors were there and it was juicy and hot.

i won't be back here any time soon, but i hope to try the original in hollywood!

one word: disgraceful. this rendition of pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was nothing comparable to the one in los angeles. i came here after a long walk on a hot day visiting places on the strip and i was utterly disgusted with my order. i had gotten the <mark>Mushroom Swiss Dog</mark> with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, mushrooms and mayo. first of all, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wiener itself was ordinary, almost as if i bought the pack of ten from a grocery store along with grocery store <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> buns. the mushrooms tasted like rubber canned mushrooms that should be stamped inedible. not only that, but a large dollop of mayo on top of this mess made me want to gag. i immediately regretted my order as i saw it and was even more sad to see $7 go to waste. however, i did really enjoy the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, but only temporarily. the mixture of fake beef and <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> did not bode well for any of my friends and i would not recommend coming here when there are plenty of other great places on the strip. yelpers, beware.. false franchising!!

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are awesome!!! i was able to read the menu clearly despite the agonizing heat and knew exactly what i was ordering unlike my husband who claims blurred vision for getting a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> instead of a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. best tasting dog i've had. the chili was great. as far as the outside only dinning, it was saved by the misters that hang just a few inches above the patron's heads. i would have preferred to eat inside because, let's face it; a mister is just a giant fan (so napkins are flying) with water spraying out at you. the water wasn't the problem, the wind current was. i was dry before i finished my <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> because it was still super hot out. totally worth a few trips back!

went here last night. got my usual chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. i don't like crazy things on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. just the usuals-- as in all the usuals. haha ketchup, mustard, saukraut(?), tomatoes and bacon-- oh and relish! definitely have to eat these babies with a knife and fork. don't forget the napkins!
chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> here are delicious. i love their chili. it's a little 'mushier' i guess you can say than other places, but i like it... although my tummy always feels a little funny after. kinda over priced, but it's vegas. what isn't overpriced?

i have been a huge fan of pinks ever since i set foot on brea in la 10+ years ago. i've been to the ph location twice, and it's just not the same. they dont have the spicy <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, which is a must. i had the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> both times here, and i forget each time...they dont make my stomach feel good afterwards. but at the time you're eating it, it's too good to care.

one of the few places that i've been to that actually lived up to the hype. it was soo good, i came here twice. i got the <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>. if it is your first time i suggest you try the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>. i also tried the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, this thing is a beast. you seriously need 3 people to finish the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. definitely a spot to hit up for a quick eat.

nom! i love pinks! especially their spicy sausages, they are extremely flavorful and are happily spicy.

but one of the main reasons why i love pinks is because of its location, it is located right outside of miracle mile so you can enjoy a one mile stroll and work up an appetite before you gorge yourself on <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and sausages. but make sure you take an extra stroll at the forum shops before hand so you can enjoy the delectable chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. they are super yummy, and if you get in a decent work out during your shopping run you won't even feel that guilty about it.

a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> is a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. and at pinks, it's a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with a bunch of stuff thrown onto it. so whatever artery clogging toppings you want, they got. good hangover food, but it's not the best. chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were pretty tasty because they were crispy fries and i love crispy fries. 

it's vegas and everything is over priced, that's a fact so i can't complain about the pricing. 

outside seating was nice with 75 degree weather and you get the nice company of birds hanging out.

maybe it's because it's not the original pinks. but we weren't too hungry, but saw that there was no line so we decided to try it.

we ordered a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>... to see if the hype was dog or toppings. also ordered the chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.

chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were disgusting. it was like dog meat. heavy. the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> was also bland. fries were extra crunchy...

<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wasn't too bad, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are broiled, something i could get down in sj at mark's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!

good place to check out if you like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and are near the miracle mile. food is cheaper than most sit down restaurants in town. <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were good, but you might consider going with some of the "classics" as the rest of the other dogs can be a little overwhelming and really messy. i highly recommend the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, they were by far the best thing we ordered, very crispy, tasty chili and quality <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.

we ordered the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, the brooklyn <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark> and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. we weren't impressed with the food at all. it was very bland and very disappointing.

i absolutely love their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! super delish! i went here twice. their <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are good, but their chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> weren't. i didn't have the urge to finish it. wished there was a pink's in the bay area. oh well! guess i'm going to have to go to la or vegas in the meantime.

pinks, i expected more from you! 
i stood in lines 2 hours for you in la and thought you were a little better than average. then i come to las vegas to try you again with barley any lines, and you were not great to me at all! i am totally breaking up with you. 

i tried <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> and chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. both were okay and had nothing special about them. this place is small, expensive for what you get, and seating is only outside. this place is truly overrated.

something isn't the same with pink's here vs la, i know the names are different - i stood there searching for my martha steward dog.  anyway, ordered the show girl and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  fries were really good but my show girl wasn't the same as la... maybe it's the waiting in line for over an hour and it just tastes better because you earned it...hmmm well 3 stars because there's barely anywhere to eat your dog, the outside patio has a couple of tables and then you kinda just look like a bum

pink's is located near ph towers so i was finally able to see what the hype was all about!!! it's really small inside, there's no seating area inside, but they have a small patio, so if you come here on a cold/windy night like i did, i'd suggest to take your food to go!

since it was my first time, i asked the girl working there what she'd recommend! she recommended the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, which was definitely one of my favorite! it was huge! the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> was also good! i was starving after an hour and a  half of walking the strip and going in and out of casinos, so i was able to finish my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with some chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>!!! the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> will cost you a little over five dollars! but one order is a lot!

the food here is served in huge portions. it's also good, but greasy. the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> taste really good and the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are good because of the cheese sauce used instead of shredded cheese. it's a good place to eat if you're on the strip and want something not pretentious. it's all normal fast food with huge portions and tastes good.

really excited to finally try pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, certainly a visit i'll never forget. i can't even remember which dogs we ordered but it was all just ok not as great as i thought it would be. my dog consisted of two dogs with guacamole, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and onions. my fiance's was jalapenos, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, guac, and tomato,  threw in some chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> too. i also ordered an alcoholic drink lemonade slushy but it was just filling and not strong at all. so the reason i will never forget this place is because we stopped here before we made our way back home to riverside. as soon as we hit the road my tummy started growling and hurting alot. we reached a rest stop on the 15 fwy and i ran as fast as i could and then all hell broke loose! i'd never experienced anything like it. i felt so weak after and we had such a long way to go, do you know how scary it was to drive for hours and not know when the next restroom stop would come. we bought lots of pepto bismol and thankfully no accidents occurred lol. i know this story is really embarrassing but i just want to warn others , stock up on some pepto and if you do eat here don't do it before a 4 hour drive home hahaha.

after exploring the strip thus far, i noticed a familiar la sign..but in the middle of the strip in vegas at planet hollywood..no way! unlike the la location this place was not so crowded. i knew i had to verify if this was the real deal pinks or not. no way better to test my curiosity than to grab my favorite pinks items, the <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. as i was placing my order, i noticed the menu was somewhat different. when i got my food, it looked as delicious as the original in la, but definitely did not taste the same. needless to say of course the hollywood theme hotel would want one of la's famous eateries in their establishment. though it is flattering to bestow such honor upon pinks, the quality of the classic pinks was not there. it is cool to see this out in vegas and they serve alcohol and collectible pinks cups, but it just isn't the same.

great value for the money.  the outdoor seating can be problematic if it is windy, but the food is decent, and the prices are reasonable, especially considering the location on the strip.

i've tried the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>, the brooklyn <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark>, chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, and <mark>Onion Ring</mark> so far, and would recommend any of them.

went to my first pink's of any kind today. heading into the first bite, i definitely did have high expectations, mainly because i was hungry, and also because the prices looked pretty darn high, even after accounting for the recent groupon deal. however, keep in mind that this in in the heart of the las vegas strip, so really you'd almost expect it to be pricey. it's not fair to compare this to costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on price.

when i tried my friend's <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, my eyes, taste <mark>Bud</mark>, and probably everything else just lit up. yeah, hunger is the best sauce or whatever, but every component of that dog - bun, sausage, chili, and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> - was really delicious and made me wish that i had chosen it. instead, i had gone with the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which was also quite tasty with bacon and some sort of enhanced 'shrooms. i also loved the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, which is fatter than the normal wiener, and the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> went surprisingly well with the rest of the ingredients.

we also shared some deluxe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which had a crapload of toppings on them. in hindsight, if i had known how loaded the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> would be, i would've ordered normal fries for about half the price because my friend was pretty much evacuating his toppings onto the fries. oh well, live and learn.

anyway, i've seen the other reviews, and i'm sure it doesn't match everything that people like about the original pink's - which i still hope to go to some day - but it's still good eating. not considering the price, the only problem i have is that i'd rather go to earl of sandwich, which is right next door and which i love to death, so i might not really see this place much at all in the future. oh well, it was yummy knowing you.

you know what? this place is just as disappointing as the one in la, minus the waiting time.

let's start with the fries. thin, too crispy, hallow. it's like mcd's fries but hallowed out. and the cheese they throw on for the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> is disgusting nacho-cheese type shit that comes from a huge industrial container type thing. it's gross.

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are less than stellar. they don't taste anything better than what i can buy at a supermarket. let's talk toppings. just as bad. why are my mushrooms cold, wet, and straight out of a can? canned mushrooms are disgusting. especially when they're still wet. my swiss is not even half melted.

you get one point for being fast, and decently cheap. and you open until 1am. guys, don't come here. go inside planet hollywood, turn the corner, and visit earl of sandwiches. they're open 24hrs.

in my experience, finding a decent <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> when you don't eat red meat or pork is pretty tough.  i had all but given up on the idea of enjoying a sloppy dog... that is, until i went to pink's.  

i had friends in town who were massively hungover, so they chose pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> as their pick-me-up spot.  i usually just order a side dish (hello, fried food) at this type of joint, but then something caught my eye.  a quarter-pound turkey <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>??  could it be???

i took the chance, and ordered the <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> with a simple dressing of ketchup and relish.  i keep it classic.  and what they served looked more like a kielbasa or bratwurst, it was so big.  thick, juicy, and great flavor.  success!  

long story longer, i will definitely be visiting pink's again.  great location, great atmosphere (outside seating), and great food.  the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> rocked as well.  bravo, pink's!

i had the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> and the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> for ~11 with a 10% off coupon. 

- love the chili! enjoyed that there were no big beans. 
- fries were crispy, thin and addicting. 
- dog is juicy. great flavor. 
- expensive, but understandable. popular. taste is justified but price is slightly too much even with a discount.
- seating stinks. smokers. 

^___^!!

meh. i've experienced better... exactly what i was thinking!

after all the hype i've heard about the famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> in la, i seriously thought i would have been blown away by the experience... maybe its because of the hype that shot my expectations through the roof, but wouldn't you think with all the hype, it should at least make me want to come back for more? 

but i'm the kind of girl that always gives a place the benefit of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>, perhaps i ordered something not-so-amazing on the menu -- the <mark>Pastrami Reuben Dog</mark>, i honestly thought this was a pretty good choice!! equipped with <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, pastrami, mustard, <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> & sauerkraut... i mean its not the fattiest of the bunch, but lets be honest the scorching hot weather was taking a negative toll on my appetite. regardless of my choice, i had the chance to have a bite of a few others -- the planet hollywood, the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>... nothing really sang to me ya know? in other words, i was hoping for more, something more memorable and amazing rather than just a meal to fill me up. i think i'll give the la pink's a chance, but if that doesn't change my mind, who knows what will.

i love this place!!! i wouldn't eat it three times a day, though!

food: amazing! the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> here aren't your average dogs, one will get you good! i had the ph dog and the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> on my last visit and i barely finished the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and made a tiny dent on the fries! their hod dogs are no joke and are loaded with the goods! my boyfriend tried the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> burrito and that thing had three <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and a bunch of other stuff wrapped in a tortilla! took him a while to finish it!

drinks: just because the place is called pinks and they come in pink cups does not mean they're light. they're good enough to get you a good buzz and the jello shots should be called jello bullets because they're so strong!

service: maybe i'm just lucky, but out of all of the times i've been here, i've always had great customer service! the cashier is always friendly and the food always comes right away. i never really have to wait too long. 

this place is highly recommended and also a place where i have to stop by every time i'm in vegas!

great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>!  their reputation preceded them because i've heard about how famous pink's is in los angeles and i was happy to see that there was one so close to the bellagio.

i went with a friend of mind around noon.  pinks is right in front of planet hollywood adjacent to the street.  the wait when we got there was only a few minutes but since it was 105 degrees, it was a little uncomfortable.

i ordered the bacon <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, a drink, and the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  the total came out to be just under $17 which is a little steep, but i guess it is to be expected in las vegas.  

when the food came, i immediately thought, "how am i supposed to fit this in my mouth." (insert that's what she said joke)   there was a normal sized <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> underneath a mountain of bacon, tomatoes, onions, and chili.  i literally could not pick it up unless i risked having all the insides falling off of my plate.  i had to grab a knife and fork to tackle the foot long an inch at a time.  it tasted fantastic and i could feel my eyes getting heavier immediately from the food induced coma the meat from the chili was putting me in.

after i finished my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> filled with 3 slices of bacon goodness, i was very stuffed.  i'm usually one with a decent size appetite but the high fatty food filled me up quick. ...and then there were the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> to deal with.  it looked as though the workers used a bucket to pour on the chili since there was so much of it and i knew immediately that i had to take it to go and offer it as communal fries.  the few bites i could squeeze into my already full stomach were delicious.  the texture and the size of the fries were crispy and thinner than traditional fries but it worked.  

its definitely worth a try and i would totally go to pink's again.

service: 3/5
food: 3/5
cleanliness: 2/5
price: 2/5 - so disappointing for the price.

when i came here, it was my second time in vegas, and i gotta admit. vegas has wonderful food! i mean, everything i've tried eating in vegas was supes yummy...but here... ukkk, seriously?...

first of all there was way too much hype about this place and when i finally got here i was disappointed with the food and service. first all, the lady that took my order was alright, no smile, no hi, no "how are you doing?", just "what would you like?". mmmm negative. 

i get my burrito <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, and it tastes worst then weinersnitchel...great..

i try the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> one of my friends ordered and that tasted wayyy better then the actual dish they should be known for. let me tell you. the fries here are pretty good. i like skinny and crispy fries and pink's fries were bomb.

the actual cleanliness of the place? it's foggy/steamy when you step in. the kitchen is pretty much connected on a small strip-like building and the cashier is taking orders from the kitchen...and the only walk way you get is the walkway out to the patio where you eat/dine... if you find that clean, then i applaud to you.

pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>
nomnomnom is what comes to mind when i am in vegas and staying on the strip. when i need to get my grub on, and only want to pay a low price pinks is your spot. 

this is probably the place to go to when your craving a great priced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> or my personal favorite chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> that is about $8, but my lord do you get bang with your buck cause the quantity is ridiculous.  you definitely find yourself full when trying to conquer this mountain.

since their style of customer service is made to order and quick, this is a great location when your on the go cause their have an option of getting your food togo.

with great prices since your in vegas, and great quantities, while having great taste all pilates the same time you can't go wrong when you try pinks. one warning though if your looking for healthy, look somewhere else. with they style of food you definitely can help your hangover you might of gotten when you woke up. definitely try this place next time you're on the strip.

couldn't wait to try this place. my friends love it. me on the other hand could careless for the overpriced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i had <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark>. it was alright definitely not worth the $. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were better than <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> but that's not good enough for me to go back. i'm giving it 1 star because the employees are very nice!

i love <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but this is just too much in just a slender bun. it's not even a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> anymore when you have to cut it with a knife and eat it with a fork since it's too much stuff going on trying to fit in your mouth.
the shoe strings chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are really good.

so this place is awesome.  don't come here looking for something healthy -- come here to splurge and indulge to your hearts content.  

i ordered  the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which had <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> & mushrooms, a pancetta-like bacon that was out of this world, all smothered in <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>.  this was divine.  of course, i could barely finish half of it.  but it was worth every penny and every calorie.  

my friend ordered the <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, which had 2 dogs in one bun, mustard, onions, chili, <mark>American Cheese</mark>, guacamole and jalape\u00f1os.  she said it was just as amazing.  

and of course, we had to get chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.  

the ambiance was fun - we sat on the patio and got to people watch.  it's right in the middle of the vegas strip, so it's a great location.  the cashier was friendly and helpful, the food took maybe 5 minutes to prepare.  it was just a great experience.  if/when i go back to vegas, i will definitely come again!  maybe this time i'll use it as hangover food though.... ;)

second best <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on earth (first spot belongs to pink's in los angeles).

can't beat the taste of the original <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  loaded <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> was a new experience for us. gut wrenching and delicious.

for the longest time, two places have sat at the top fo my vegas to try list - craftsteak...and pink's.  yep, i know.  quite possibly the only time those two will ever be #1 and #2 on the same list.  for anything.  ever.

unlike earl of sandwich, which had its usual, ridiculous line going on, nary a person could be found at the at counter at pink's.  perfect for us since we just wanted a quick lunch before our flight...and because we probably took 10 minutes to figure out what to get from their giant menu board (it took me so long, i swear they all started to sound the same...).  although it wasn't one of the sexier options, i ordered the polish pastrami swiss <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> ($8.49), and tried some for the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> ($6.79) that my friend had ordered for our group to share.  

topped with pastrami, <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>, and mustard (forgot to add on the sour kraut), the polish wasn't bad but hardly exciting (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pinks-hot-dogs-las-vegas-2?select=ii0a_yyiuqlfkwpttnfima#2cd3mm114u75fre4_z9ong).  while the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark> itself was fine (who knew it went so well with <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark>?), the shreds of pastrami were really dry and a bit salty.  the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were guiltfully tasty though (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pinks-hot-dogs-las-vegas-2?select=ii0a_yyiuqlfkwpttnfima#zcy7utuimph17rzsk5ttga).  not so much for the cheese sauce (because it's, you know, cheese sauce), but because their chili is surprisingly decent!  plus...who doesn't love some good <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>?

all in all, i'd come back if i needed something relatively quick and simple, as well as to try some of the more unique and "exotic" combinations (stomach ache on a plane?  ummm...no).  pink's is probably one of the better bets around based on convenience alone, but at about $8 a pop, they do an even better job of making me appreciate costco's $1.50 polish and a drink that much more.

in all honesty, there is no reason to visit pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. no reason if you are a tourist, i can assure you, wherever you are from, you have better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. and especially if you are local, there is no reason at all when you have buldogi's on two different sides of town. 

the quality of <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is sub-par and the toppings are nothing to brag about either. and the price, holy cow! nothing merits the price tag, which by the way cannot be found on their website. i also trie dthe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which were ok, but then, buldogi's makes their chili in house so there's really no comparison.

skip <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>! they're horrible! i mean, terrible! the chili was definitely delicious, so if you're really stuck on going here, grab the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and please save yourself the money and skip <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark>. i've never been so adamant on telling someone to skip something as i am about this! the bun was stale, <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> itself was bad- it had that pop when you take your first bite, and though i know that is the goal of some places that serve dogs, i know that's not the goal for pinks and i'm pretty sure it poped because it was way overly old and over cooked. i'm sad to have to give a place with such a great reputation in la such a bad review, but clearly they sold themselves out when coming to vegas and just got dollar signs in their eyes without making sure the quality followed with them. i seriously have had much better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at the movie theater. i couldn't even finish my over-priced <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> because it was that bad. i know i sound like a snob, but i'm not, i promise. i was hungry after having a long day of walking and beers and all i wanted was a delicious juicy <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and this was very disappointing. i keep going on but it was that bad. good luck to you if you ignore this and still get a dog, i pray i just caught them on a really really off and bad day, but from what i understand, i'm not too far off from what others were saying.sorry friends!

the restaurant is located right outside planet hollywood on the strip.

 i immediately noticed the outdoor patio. great spot to people watch. i tried the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, the polish and chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. they were all pretty good but nothing great. price wise, i guess it's cheaper compared to the rest of the area.

the whole time i was eating i just felt like they just missed the mark of the original. but maybe they didn't? is it possible that  the foods the same but the subtraction of los angeles detracts from the experience? i'm not quite sure.  a very improbable thing occurs when someone catches lightning in bottle. an even less probable thing is attempted when people try to catch the same lightning in a different bottle, in a different city.

should've went to nathans!

i visited pinks 4th of july.. i was staying at planet hollywood so it was very convenient not too mention all the hooplah about it made me of course want to try it out for myself. this price is overpriced .. the chili on <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is very bland... i don't know.. gave me heartburn or indigestion after.. the worse = ((

 even ordered the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> which included bacon and tomatoes etc.. it was all just an overpriced wreck
oh and the cheese was like a <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> sauce or something.. like the orange kind that comes out of a big can.. no bueno!

like the other reviews said.. keep walking.. so not worth the $20 for a huge wienie and some chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>...lol

i've had <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> .i've had chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. i've had <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>. not all at once, naturally.

but i also thought i had bulimia.

turns out, i just had pink's. 

great way to quickly hate yourself.

i came here for dinner last saturday before watching a movie at the regal on the other side of the casino.  i'm from la and have been to the original pinks, so my initial feelings were a bit mixed, but i decided to give a go.    

we had about an hour before our movie started so we figured we had plenty of time to enjoy our meal.  a nice bonus of this location was that we were able to sit around the edge of the restaurant and watch college football in the sports betting area.  i was hoping that my rival college team would lose, but i guess that is what i get for wishing ill on a team...even my rivals.

if there were half stars i would have given pink's 3.5, but i rounded down for a couple reasons.  one of reasons was that the speed of service left a bit to be desired.  it was a pretty busy saturday night and they only had two people working (one in the kitchen and one at the register) so service was slow.  there was a part of me that thought the menu items were a little over priced...but i rounded down more for the slow service

now to the important part, the food:

the las vegas <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> - came with cheese, chili, jalapenos, guacamole and two <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  this was definitely the better of the two dogs we tried.  it was a little less than $7.  really though how can you not like chill and cheese on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>...everything else was just a bonus.

the spicy mojave (with sauerkraut) - the extra sauerkraut definitely saved this <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  it just didn't seem like much without it, especially for almost $7.  

chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> - i think this was the highlight of the meal.  there was a great portion of chili and cheese.  and the fries were perfect.  they were a little thicker on than a pencil, crispy outside soft inside.

if you are looking for some comfort fast food while watching a game...or many games at once...this could be a fun spot for you to hit.

this is nothing like pink's in hollywood. it doesn't compare. chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were not good. my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with bacon and tomatoes was just bacon pieces on top. it wasn't bad but it wasn't good. i wouldn't come here again. i rather wait 30 minutes in line in hollywood any day

big fancy sign with the name "pink's" on it? looks like i'm in the right place! not gonna lie, i've heard about this place many times before but i never knew where it was. turns out, my friends were talking about the one in la, but whatevs, i'm not gonna pass on my chance to try pink's famous <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.

anyways, you're greeted by this enormous menu once you walk in the front door, but feel free to step to the side and look at a normal sized menu if <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is too crowded. 

personally, i think that the prices are a little overpriced but it's nice to order a "high end" <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with a handful of toppings after a night of drinking. i've only been here twice and i can't seem to recall what i ordered on my first visit but i can say that the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are really good and they definitely put a lot of thought into the different combinations. 

& as a fan of chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, how could i pass on the deluxe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> for a good portion of my wallet (costs the same if not more than a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>). i mean, it's pretty good, but probably not worth the cost.

overall, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are pretty good here but i just wish that it was a little cheaper (i guess it's okay since it's vegas). i can't wait to try the one in la!

i am a fan of the regular <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>. but when we ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark> and <mark>The Spicy Mojave Dog</mark> we were really disappointed. a waste of money basically, i wouldn't order those again and the sausage was too hard. also, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are very expensive. but it's vegas i guess, what else can i expect. the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were very good too. as a suggestion, just stick to the original dog, the others are below average

nasty i like <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> but this was just awful i have been waiting forever to try this and was so disappointed it's over priced and i could go to tj for a better <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and there 1$ something extra for <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark> were canned mushrooms and i couldn't even finish it but if ur hungry and here i did enjoy there chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> save ur self the seven dollars and walk away

so i haven't had pink's in years. i figured this would be the perfect chance to put some food in my system after too much day drinking. you know me, i go hard. so i order chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> that has chili, pastrami, guacamole, mustard, jalapenos, and onions. i remember this meal costing me a good $20.

i sit down to chow down and to my surprise, i am wildly disappointed with every part of the meal. every individual component was flavorless, and not even a marriage of all of them created anything enjoyable. i ending up eat half of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and fries because i really grew tired of the flavor.

i don't know if it's pink's or this location but that sucked.

i discovered this place on my friend's instagram, but i thought that i'd never try it because a norcal girl like me wouldn't be in socal too often. however, to my luck, it was fate that my vegas trip brought me here to dine with my girlfriends for a bite. we ordered the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark>, and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>.

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were super crispy and fresh, and definitely one of the best fries i've ever tasted. they were gone instantly among the four of us. i split the las <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> with my friend since it had two dogs inside of it, and i never thought i'd be eating guacamole on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> until that day. it was delicious! i have no other words to describe it, but both guacamole and chili were great additions to my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. i haven't tried the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, but my friends gushed about how great it tasted.

the prices may be expensive for something like a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, but you're paying for the presentation and quality of the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> combinations, which are all pretty amazing.

this place was delicious! we had the reuben and one that was served with bacon but i can't remember the name. we also split regular fries, <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark>Onion Ring</mark>. everything was very delicious! my only complaint is that there is only seating outside. as you know, vegas is hot, hot, hot. i would definitely come back here the next time i'm here!

finally got to try their food.

 i ordered chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, they were really good & hot.  i burned my tongue because it smelled so good i couldn't wait.  chili isn't too spicy. just right. if you love spicy, you'll be disappointed.  i believe it was $6.79. boyfriend had 10 <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark> & a "big man" dog. he said it was perfect.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> even snapped because of the skin.  it had tomatoes & onions.  no picture because he really chowed it down. 

great service.  thanks much.

i love pinks!! i come to vegas every couple of months and always have to make sure i stop and get a pinks <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. yeah... .most people complain about the price on here...but hey... the only thing that is much cheaper on the strip is mcdonalds! i paid about 6 for a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was great! they have fantastic chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> too! between my boyfriend and i we usually spend about 30 dollars when we go. the service is great too!

best chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> i've ever had. the sauce was perfection topped with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>. soooo freaking good. i was scarfing them down. the alcoholic drinks were a bit pricey but it's vegas so live a little. glad i was able to stop and try the world famous pinks. i was even able to even catch a street show.

despite all the reviews, you see this place on food network so i wanted to give it a try...
but i regret it and it was my only meal that i did not enjoy on our trip.

on yelp, there's a free <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> offer.
somewhere on the details, it should tell you the hours... basically there's restriction on the offer which i cannot find. maybe it's on the full site, not on the mobile site.  anyways, this was a let down for us too since we were just looking into snacking here with the offer, instead of eating a full meal.

i ordered the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>.
it was better than their regular dogs, which looks very unfilling. their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> were okay but it was also spicy onions... like the onions weren't cooked all the way through... the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were okay.

overall, average <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> stand... nothing special.

wow what a let down. for a day of fun, as las vegas locals, we valet'd at paris and walked over to pink's - there was no line and nobody eating at all. i ordered a <mark>Plain Veggie Dog (Soy) or 1/4 Lb. Turkey Dog</mark> (maybe that was my mistake) and <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. the fries were the best part of the meal - i hate, i mean i hate gray, boiled looking <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> -- gosh i wish it was grilled i guess i should've asked but being from l.a. this place is suppose to be the best so i figured i'd leave it all in their hands....it was a let down and i won't be going back.

this place is pretty good, nothing too amazing though. it's more expensive than the la pink's and not as tasty, but i expected as much eating in vegas. ordered a <mark>Vegas Strip Dog</mark> (2 dogs, jalpenos, cheese, onions) which came out pretty quickly with chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>. it's a lot of food though. an order of chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> is enough to feed one or even two people. seating is outside and with the wind it's a bit annoying but you get to see all the weirdos down the street and sometimes cool performers.
today for lunch i had the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> & i loved it!!! the chili didn't taste gross or cheap. very good quality!
great chili-<mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, but beware if you sit outside of hungry pigeons and people yelling crazy comments on the strip!
