possible scam**** when we were paying for our food - prior to even tasting it - there was an error with processing my husband's credit card. we paid cash instead. my husband received an alert from his bank verifying that he just tried to make a purchase. we were visiting from san diego. he never used that card again but since we walked out of pink's, there were a total of 12 fraudulent charges totaling more than $700. i don't know if there is a connection or if there was a phishing device on their reader but it's awfully suspicious. pay cash!!!

got the spicy mojave with a regular dog instead of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>. it was delicious and the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were out of this world.

pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> are my favorite <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! it's nice to be able to grab one in vegas during late night. it's pretty comparable to the original one in hollywood. same great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, same great chili, same great kraut, same great fries. 

i do wish that they had the celebrity names associated to the one in vegas to help me order! i have no clue what comes on mine, but i know i like the rosie o'donnell. i had to guess/try to make it up... chilli, sour kraut...not sure what else? 

the <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> were also delicious and very reminiscent of the great ones at the la location. 

the patio is right on the strip in front of planet hollywood and is a great place to people watch no matter the time of day!

i wanted to see what the fuss was all about with pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.   

the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> at planet hollywood was   awesome.  it was just loaded with tomato,  cheese,chili, <mark>Sour Cream</mark> and onions. the chili cheese <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> was a difficult task just trying to keep it together while eating it.  it was good but nothing special! not really  worth the $8.50? it's on the strip so i'm not going to complain on the price.

so yeah, we spent about $16 on a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, chilli <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> and a drink .  sounds expensive, but now at least i got to experience what  pink's has to offer, just wish i knew what all the excitement was about  maybe next time i'll give their <mark>Veggie Burger (Vegan)</mark> a try.  looks really yummy! 

it was alright!

every time i hit vegas, i go to pinks now. they take <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> to another level. the chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark> are worth it, and the 3 <mark>Three Dog Night</mark> is my fav <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> selection they offer. street level seating mid strip. perfect location.

note: maybe i shouldn't review pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, because i don't eat meat and buns, and i count calories so i can't add more toppings or sauces except veggie stuffs. 

i was very happy that they have a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at planet hollywood! there was no line and not crowded! i would never wait in line for 3 hours in hollywood location! so i got to try world famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! very good location outside miracle mile, walking distance from our hotel cosmopolitan.

very cute place decorated in pink color, there is a wall full of celebrities photos. i was glad they had veggie and turkey <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>. 

a solid 3.5 star, $40 for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, one fries, one <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>, one <mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark> with souvenir cup. 

veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with <mark>Chopped Tomato</mark>: not much flavor, but it was not bad with mustard sauce and tomatoes 
<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mushrooms and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>: fairly delicious 
fries: not bad
corn dog: good 

<mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark>: yummy

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were good, but not great, veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> needed to wait a bit longer to get my order, other orders were fast. i guess we should've ordered pink's secret recipe chilly on top, that would make our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> more tasty, or add more toppings and sauces. it is a bit pricey for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> though, but it's famous so it's ok i guess. 

i didn't think the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were great, but they were not bad either. i like this fast food place a lot because of the cute decor, and outdoor seats, good view and people watching on the strip, there were some cute little birds walking around, they were fun to watch. so we will go back again for snacks or quick bite. :)

after the concert and drinking all that beer, a <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark> would have hit the spot.  i roll up to pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> expecting a great <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> experience and a meal to quiet that growling in my belly...  it wasn't.
it was actually very disgusting.  and some how...2 <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, 1 order of fries, and 2 <mark>Gatorade</mark> cost me $23!  if i went to sonic, it would have been about half that price and taste 5x better.
i got the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> about 4 minutes after my order was completed.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> didn't even taste like they were cooked completely, and the chili...well that was the most disgusting part...  the chili tasted like it was just squeezed out of whatever bag it came from and put directly on my <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>.  it was pasty and gritty, and was barely warmed up.  and the taste of the chili....well it tasted disgusting!
the fries were okay.  at least they were cooked.  they server those skinny, little, shoe-string fries btw like at steak & shake.
also, no person who worked for the casino had any idea where this place was.  we literally had to just wander around until we found it on our own.
i will never ever go back and try that place again.

i'm a big fan of pink's, being from the la area so i was happy to try out the one here in vegas.  i came here with my family and luckily we were able to take advantage of the groupon deal a couple of weeks before.  all 3 of us opted for the <mark>Chicago <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark>, except i had it with a regular <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> instead of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>.  <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> are loaded with toppings.  the casing around <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> has a nice snap when you bite into it and tastes just as good as the pink's in la.  the <mark>French Fries</mark> are shoestring fries which i happen to looove.  i'm not a fan of fat fries, so these were perfect and crispy.  i'm not sure if the make their <mark>Onion Ring</mark> but those are also fantastic, just the right amount of breading and cooked perfectly.  it was chilly out so i also ordered a <mark>Hot Chocolate</mark> only to find the gal behind the counted mixing up a pouch of the powdered stuff with water.... boo! oh well, the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were what we came for and they sure did hit the spot. 

also, you can get a naked dog and add ketchup, mustard, onions, relish and pickles for no charge... yum!

note: maybe i shouldn't review pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, because i don't eat meat and buns, and i count calories so i can't add more toppings or sauces except veggie stuffs. 

i was very happy that they have a pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> at planet hollywood! there was no line and not crowded! i would never wait in line for 3 hours in hollywood location! so i got to try world famous pink's <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>! very good location outside miracle mile, walking distance from our hotel cosmopolitan.

a solid 3.5 star, $40 for 2 <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, one fries, one <mark>Mini Corn Dogs</mark>, one <mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark> with souvenir cup.

<mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> with mushrooms and <mark>Sour Cream</mark>: fairly delicious 
fries: not bad
corn dog: good 

<mark>Pink's Lemonade</mark>: yummy

the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were good, but not great, veggie <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> needed to wait a bit longer to get my order, other orders were fast. i guess we should've ordered pink's secret recipe chilly on top, that would make our <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> more tasty, or add more toppings and sauces. it is a bit pricey for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> though, but it's famous so it's ok i guess. 

i didn't think the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> were great, but they were not bad either. i like this fast food place a lot because of the cute decor, and outdoor seats, good view and people watching on the strip, there were some cute little birds walking around, they were fun to watch. so we will go back again for snacks or quick bite. :)
<mark>Margarita</mark> to go! come here grab your yard stick to-go and proceed to explore the rest of the vegas strip drink in hand!

not that great. had some for myself this time around, and what you see is what you basically get. nothing out of the ordinary, so i dont get what the fuss is all about. i forgot what it was called specifically, but i ordered the <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark>. maybe it was because i felt like shit on the day my friends and i ate here, but the taste got pretty nasty after a few bites. most of us ended up not finishing our food. 

on a brighter note, their <mark>Strawberry Daiquiri</mark> is deliccccccious! the best i'vee had in vegas, hands down. the only thing i would recommend is to freeze it up a little more, mine was kind of watery. taste wise tho, i would have one everyday if i could!

so i've never been to the pink's in la.  i'm not a big fan of <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, so waiting in line for an hour + does not sound enticing at all.

no lines at the one in vegas!  that and not wanting to eat two hours at a buffet led us to pink's.  located right next to the miracle mile @ planet hollywood, this place only has outdoor seating, under giant umbrellas.  it would have been nicer if it wasn't 100+ degrees that day, but i digress.

$17.30 gets you a spicy mojave and a planet hollywood (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uqb9ks7lzesghltmuunmea?select=ku-m_3hod0dxaty6-8yqnq).  warning, the spicy mojave is not for the weak.  those jalapenos can kick your taste <mark>Bud</mark> in the butt!

i go every time i go for a trek up and down the strip and will continue to do so.

the reason i'm only giving three stars is that although the service is good, and the place is clean, and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> aren't bad, they're not all that great either.  mainly i like the place for the variety.

<mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> by itself can't hold up to a properly done nathans, but it's nowhere near as bad as a bar s.

the rueben dog is good, but the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself gets lost in the reuben part, which isn't bad, but i'd like to taste <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> if it's there.

now, what makes pinks (la anyways) famous is the <mark><mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>.  i recently had the bacon chili <mark><mark>Poli Bacon Burrito Dog</mark></mark>.  the bacon was nice if undercooked, but that's about it.  the cheese and onions got lost in the chili which was pretty dang boring.  it's not spicy, it's not flavourful.  it tastes kind of like bean powder was mixed with ground beef, gravy, and a dash of tabasco.  not anything special.

if a place is famous for something, it should be good, that's why they're famous.  so it was very disappointing to discover it tastes like something out of a <mark>Bud</mark> can.

dude, it's pink's...in vegas. my two favorite things in the world. ok, i really don't feel that way. but if i was a surfer dude from redondo beach out with my <mark>Bud</mark> for a vegas weekend, this would certainly be my dining destination of choice. since i'm not, i guess i can be a little more discriminating. but dude, it's pink's. well not quite pink's. just a reasonable facsimile in an apt setting, planet hollywood. 

jamie w. and i really wanted some dogs after strolling through the sterile city center complex which has none of the kitsch that really is vegas. luckily, pink's has kitsch to spare in its patio setting outside the hotel entrance. the menu looked familiar. we decided to each get a $4.75 giant 12-inch jalapeno dog with <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> and chili, and share a $6.50 "planet hollywood" dog, which consisted of a <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Grilled Mushroom</mark>, bacon and cheese (see photos). oh did i mention the fries, too? nice and tasty they were. 

indigestion thy name is pink's. the jalapeno dog has that snap to the wiener that i don't care for much. i prefer a meatier dog to the tooth, and the mustard was way overwhelming, but chili, cheese and diced onions are bulletproof on a dog as far as i'm concerned. the "planet hollywood" dog has quite a pile of toppings to maneuver in your mouth starting with the bacon strips lording over the sausage already drowning in melted cheese. the mushrooms seemed almost incidental to the creation, but they were good. hell, it was all good in a bad, bad way. 

food - 3 stars....quite an abundance of toppings on those dogs but not quite the pink's i remember in la 
ambiance - 2 stars...hell, it's just a patio...in pink 
service - 2.5 stars...just keep moving the line and <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> will eventually be there 
total - 3 stars...a middling experience based on a distant memory of the pink's in la

it's like comparing <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and hamburgers!!! i lived in so-cal for a while and was lucky enough to be dating a young lady who went to school off of lebrea and sunset and just down the street was pinks. " the real pinks"  you would wait in line for an hour to get a dog but it was worth it. this sad rendition of pinks let me down.

a good dog is hard to find no matter where you look. since i lucky enough to have the original maybe it is just a bias opinion, but when you say light mustard on a dog and it tastes like <mark>The Showgirl Dog</mark> is stuffed with mustard it just does not fly with me.   maybe it has a lot to do with the fact that i waited in line for about the same amount of time i did in sunny california and i was expecting the same amazing culinary experience.... can i call a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> a culinary experience?

this is turning into a rant of sorts, so i am calling this review... the food was not good, not worth the price, and not worth the experience, so in this case there is no saving grace for this pinks in my eye!! 

i guess if you have a craving for a dog and there is no sams club near by this might be an option.. enjoy at your own risk, and apologize to your taste <mark>Bud</mark> ahead of time.

if you are hungry in vegas, and are trying to eat on a <mark>Bud</mark>, go here. it is right by he planet hollywood miracle mile shops entry on the strip, and also conveniently located next to another great place earl of sandwich.

went to my first pink's of any kind today. heading into the first bite, i definitely did have high expectations, mainly because i was hungry, and also because the prices looked pretty darn high, even after accounting for the recent groupon deal. however, keep in mind that this in in the heart of the las vegas strip, so really you'd almost expect it to be pricey. it's not fair to compare this to costco <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on price.

when i tried my friend's <mark><mark><mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> <mark>Polish <mark>Bacon Chili <mark>Polish <mark>Brooklyn Pastrami <mark>Swiss Cheese</mark> Dog</mark></mark></mark></mark></mark></mark>, my eyes, taste <mark>Bud</mark>, and probably everything else just lit up. yeah, hunger is the best sauce or whatever, but every component of that dog - bun, sausage, chili, and <mark>Grilled Onion</mark> - was really delicious and made me wish that i had chosen it. instead, i had gone with the <mark>Planet Hollywood Dog</mark>, which was also quite tasty with bacon and some sort of enhanced 'shrooms. i also loved the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, which is fatter than the normal wiener, and the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> went surprisingly well with the rest of the ingredients.

we also shared some deluxe chili <mark><mark><mark>Deluxe Chili Cheese Fries</mark></mark></mark>, which had a crapload of toppings on them. in hindsight, if i had known how loaded the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> would be, i would've ordered normal fries for about half the price because my friend was pretty much evacuating his toppings onto the fries. oh well, live and learn.

anyway, i've seen the other reviews, and i'm sure it doesn't match everything that people like about the original pink's - which i still hope to go to some day - but it's still good eating. not considering the price, the only problem i have is that i'd rather go to earl of sandwich, which is right next door and which i love to death, so i might not really see this place much at all in the future. oh well, it was yummy knowing you.

i had the ph <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> and it was pretty good.  it's loaded w/ bacon, <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>, <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark>, and some mushrooms.  the <mark>Nacho Cheese</mark> kinda masked the taste of the <mark>Plain Polish Sausage</mark>, i think next time i'll get it w/ just a light amount of cheese.  the <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> itself is pretty huge too (to the point it's almost difficult to eat lol).  the price tag is reasonable, at $9 i felt this was a decent deal.

my <mark>Bud</mark> ordered some weird stuff that had <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> wrapped in tortillas or actual burritos.  i'd pass on this weird stuff as it didn't look good.  if you are coming to pinks then order a <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark>, don't order this weird stuff.  that's like ordering a burger at a taco joint lol. 

tip-
-grab a fat tuesday just in the same shopping plaza of ph!  
-pass on getting the <mark>Onion Ring</mark> (rating 2/5).  they were so sweet they tasted horrible
-eating only availabe in the outdoor patio.  so if it's in the middle of the day i probably wouldn't eat here.  just come here for late night eats

so we went there to soak up some alcohol like everyone else on a friday night after a hard night of clubbing. the service was prompt and the food hot. hense the 2 stars. 

however it is worth noting that as a chicagoan i have high expectations for <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> (and pizza of course). so when i walk in and saw chicago style <mark>Plain Hot Dog</mark> on the menu i got psyched! wrong!

my friend pointed out that it actually said "chicago style polish." now if you're from the chi you know our polishes are called "maxwell street polishes" and if you're a lil older you may even know them as "jew town polishes" but not chicago style. but whatever. so my <mark>Bud</mark> orders one for shits and giggles. ugh!

he gets the thing and it's got lettuce, tomato, and relish (not even neon green). the eff? no celery salt? no peppers? no mustard? no <mark>Grilled Onion</mark>? blasphemy! 

my polish was underwhelming too. i got grilled oinions and mustard on mine. it's worth noting however that the onions were chopped not grilled in slices. gross! 

so does pinks do the job? yes. would i go back when i go to vegas? sure i guess. but please for the love of beans take chicago off you menu if you can't get it right. k? thanks!
